review_pros: Abercrombie & Fitch provides an ideal workplace for recent graduates with aggressive career ambitions who are yet reluctant to surrender the familiarity and atmosphere of college.  The workplace is vibrant and frenetic, with high emphasis placed on individual responsibility, reactive strategy, cross-disciplinary teamwork, and brand integrity.  Most of the employees at corporate are well-educated, energetic, and--of course--quite good-looking.  Although workload varies on department and discipline, weekend work is rare.  Some opportunity for travel is available.  Finally, I must commend the Merchant Training program, which introduces new employees to the general structure of the business and gradually immerses them such that they can hit the ground running when they finally arrive at their desks.
review_cons:
A&F practices incessant brand immersion, which has its number of flaws.  Many of these are superficial: the A&F soundtrack plays throughout campus without pause, the entrance reeks of Fierce, everyone (except the designers) dresses completely in Abercrombie.  But some are not: conversation rarely extends beyond the subject of Abercrombie, all of the corporate employees spend time (read: party like frat stars) exclusively with one another, campus directs all attention inwards rather than out.  In other words, A&F breeds isolation, which can be detrimental both to personal and career perspective.

The other major problem is faulty relations between the business arm of the company and the creative side.
review_advice_mgmt: Generally, management at A&F is very strong.  Strategy at the highest level takes few risks--sometimes even when opportunity knocks.  Lack of brand differentiation leads to rampant cannibalization.

review_title: Great for single, ambitious leaders willing to relocate for quick promotions
review_pros: GREAT health and 401k benefits, cool and fun place of employment
review_cons: random work hours, difficulty in taking personal days, vacation days are only seasonal, constant recruiting must be done to compensate for the high employee turnover rate, pay is unsatisfactory
review_advice_mgmt: The company does a great job in communicating how to run the business from home office using direct store contact and the 'trickle down theory' from top management.

review_pros: For a regular sales person, the job is easy with little pressure. They are also flexible with hours and its easy to request time off. 30% discount on clothes 50% on select items each season.
review_cons: Bad pay, but what you can you really expect. Little room for growth unless youve finished your college degree and even then pay is still bad.
review_advice_mgmt: Overall they are doing a good job. Company is doing quite well. They need to expand their style of clothing across their brands.

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch strong retailer - great place to work!
review_pros: Creative,  fast paced environment that constantly pushes their employees.  The employees are smart and competitive people.  hey are all very passionate with their work and the company. They all have a lot of pride in what they do and the product that they deliver.  This company has a very entrepreneurial spirit and there are no limits to what they can do.  They have a great leader who is a visionary that can inspire them and push them to do their job better everyday.
review_cons: Constant changes in what they do, which is what makes them successful, they never settle. Long hours, stressful.  Hard to have work, life balance.
review_advice_mgmt: Need to give feedback to employees and make more time to truly train people and retain them.

review_title: can be great but isn't necessarily so
review_pros: advancement.  discount.  great people at the peer level.
review_cons: unrealistic view of day to day life in a store.  labor hrs not consistent with expectation.  pay not competitive.
review_advice_mgmt: the store does not need to be in all markets.  needs to be more coherence in senior management when assigning tasks to store level.  hr should know what visual is planning, floorsets during the peak of holiday should be rescheduled.  why not set during 2nd or 3rd busiest week to take the stress off instead of setting during busiest week of year.  you can still capitalize on peak season without increased burn out.  look at  you voluntary terms for post holiday for proof.

review_title: don't want college life to end? come work at abercrombie & fitch! (just don't work there for more than 2 years)
review_pros: relaxed atmosphere, very social, given responsibilities right away. district managers get a jeep, a gas card, and a phone!
review_cons: low pay and long hours, retail schedule (that means weekends and holidays), discrimination still rampant, no matter what they settlements of HR documents say. relocation often required. loud music. home office directives often do not reflect real store experiences...
review_advice_mgmt: remember that your employees are working for minimum wage... what are you doing to make them want to come to work every day and leave satisfied? develop your managers to make them want to take your job...

review_title: You'll love it here if you live to work, but not if you work to live.
review_pros: The pay is very good, the company is reputable and the opportunities for growth are promising.  They make a big deal about promotions (which happen frequently here - typically you get promoted after your first year) and promote you in front of the entire company.  There is a cool and "casual" work atmosphere (cool buildings, campus, cafe, and you get to wear jeans/tshirts every day).  During the summer they put razor scooters around campus (like.. 300 of them!!) so you can quickly get from one building to another.  I take one for a quick spin on a stressful day just to calm down :).  Oh, and, generous employee discount on store merchandise :).
review_cons: There is a very disporportionate work/life balance.  Here, work always comes first.  Jobs here (at Home Office) are definitely not hourly jobs, so be prepared to work from 9am til 8pm...9pm... 10pm... 11pm... midnight... during certain times of the year.  It can be a very stressful work environment with a "this NEEDS to get done... YESTERDAY" mentality and pressure.  The music.  Good god - turn off that distractingly terrible music!!  This may be just a personal opinion of mine that counts as a downside... but... working for a company that has values/promotes things that I don't agree with (such as designing clothing for the abercrombie KIDS store with the mindset that the kid is 17 years old when clearly the customer is like, 10.)
review_advice_mgmt: Give POSITIVE feedback and encouragement to employees!  A negative/hopeless atmosphere does not promote creativity or a willingness to work hard.  Please support the work/life balance thing just a LIIIITTLE bit... please?  Life is about living... not about working.

review_pros: Co-Workers, hands down. The associates are the best looking and also make the day go by faster. Your fellow managers , you would want to get along with, as they will help you get the work done and pick up where you left off. Teamwork is KEY to running a store! The fact that you actually can SAY you work at ANF....How many people can say that they actually work for one of the best, if not the best retailer in the nation? Their business model and cult-like following is unparallel.
review_cons: The pay sucks. Hands down. Also, there are blackout dates when you can and cannot take days off. Expect to have no life, as the different positions require you to work certain days, as dictated by Home Office and "The Program"
review_advice_mgmt: Allow more flexibility and take into account that young people want to have lives outside of work.

review_title: Great entry level training opportunity but mid level management leadership is lacking
review_pros: this company offers a great entry-level training opportunity for those interested in retail, merchandising, or product management. you get to interact with all teams within the product life cycle like design, tech, concept, planning, etc...it also gives a very good glimpse of all aspects of the business - you have visibility to not only internal development but also vendor production overseas; daily interaction with vendors is a must in ensuring product delivery is timely and efficient. the people at the company are great to work with - everyone is young, nice, and social - a great adjustment for young people looking for a fun exciting place to work
review_cons: columbus ohio is not the best city to live in and for a majority of the people who choose to leave the company, this is one of the biggest reasons. in addition, since abercrombie & fitch is such a frontrunner in the retail market targeting tweens=>young adults, the work life balance is not so great. standards are set very high and oftentimes there is not efficient management in making sure that employees get out at appropriate times. even though it is stressed that employees need to maintain this balance, the constant changes made by CEO and heads of departments makes this practically impossible. In addition, promotions are very subjective and dependent on areas/managers, etc, leading to uncertainty and decrease in morale when employees are expecting promotions.
review_advice_mgmt: I wish mid level management had much better training in leadership and team building. perhaps this is due to the fact that ANF does not give much weight to an MBA...much of mid level management has trickled up from entry-level positions. Many are unaware of important aspects of leadership such as task delegation, clear communication of expectations, and consistent feedback. Instead, many managers are mired in micromanagement of employees and unrealistic expectations of colleagues.

review_pros: Abercrombie is a great place to work if you were going to be buying the clothes anyway, which make the employee discount rather handy.  The environment is fun and engaging yet can be hectic at times depending on the number of customers in the store.
review_cons: Abercrombie & Fitch, Hollister Co, abercrombie, and Ruehl 925 are always continuously hiring.  This causes there to be few shifts available to Models (those that work on the sales floor) and Impacters (those that work in the stock room).  They also pay minimum wage and raises are extremely rare.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire when you need to, keep your employees happy and give them the option of working the amount of hours they want and then fill in the gaps with new employees.

review_title: A&F is being very different in management style... but is it going to change to like other big box garment retail?
review_pros: Beautiful campus, people are young and energetic.   People are demanding but straight forward (could be pros or cons).  Most people are good and honest.  Open door policy and leave your title at your desk are some of the thing I really like.
review_cons:
things change rapidly and the turn over a little bit too quick.  Lack of experienced and good middle management when you needed them most for the day to day operations.  A lot of people sitting in the middle management has a lot of mis-understanding in process and don't understand things in good detail level.  
Things are being too political and respect of chain of command is more important than to get the job done.   Becaz of inexperience middle management, lack of experience leadership always lead to in-confidence behaviors.
review_advice_mgmt:
Things are changing too rapidly in A&F and a lot of SOPs, IT system process are still in building phase.  It should have someone very knowledgable to help on those building process instead of rely on the person's title.
Years ago, A&F is a very powerful brands and being separated from those "OLD Fashion" management style and being very proud of those open door, being extremly honest, leave your title at door policies... but now it turns to the way very bureaucratic and like those big corp.   (At least in my division).  Now, it is time for the Senior leadership to re-think what makes A&F stand up in the retail world and deliver those amazing results to the world.

review_pros: Great people and a mostly fun environment.  If you can handle craziness, drama, and criticism with a smile on your face you'll love the company. If you're overly sensitive, you won't.
review_cons: The pay is pretty low without a ton of opportunity for raises.  Alot of management power trips because its their first job out of college and they think its great.  If your down for fifty hour mandatory work weeks with half time for overtime then management here is for you, but if your looking for a second job thats usually a good time than a part time position works out decently.
review_advice_mgmt: Educate lower levels of management and yourselves on effective and efficient managing.

review_title: If you can stand the terrible music and low pay, you'll get to meet a lot of cool people and have a very low stress job
review_pros: Working at Abercombie and Fitch, you have the opportunity to meet a lot of attractive, fun people. Company parties are common, and are usually really fun. Co-workers go out after work and become friends. The job is easy- you don't have to do much other than greet people and fold clothes. The managers don't expect much of you so its a really low-stress job. You can pretty much pick your own schedule, although everyone has to be "available" for X number of hours each week. Overall, the job was a good experience, very relaxed, and i met people I am still friends with.
review_cons: Pay is low- usually minimum wage. Hours are slim- most employees only work 20-25 hours per week. The music is absolutely terrible and gets annoying in a hurry. The same CD plays for about a month (sent over from Corporate) and its only about 2 hours long- so in a 6 hour shift you here the same songs 3 times each at a really, really high volume. "Call-Ins" are common, where they tell you you may have to work on X day, call in an hour before your shift and we will let you know. You have to block out your whole day and then see what they tell you.
review_advice_mgmt: First and foremost, switch up the music occasionally. Second, compensate your employees better.

review_pros: If you have a bachelors degree and are "easy on the eye's" the company is willing to hire and train you extensively. After 3 months your title changes from "Manager- in - training"to assistant manager. About 5 to 7 months later you become a "store manager". So advancement happens rappidly. The pay differs upon each advancement due to the level and location of the store.
review_cons: The pay could be better. You start off with 13.90 an hour and work no less than 45 hours a week.
review_advice_mgmt: n/a

review_title: A steady paycheck if you don't mind retail hours
review_pros: This job provides a steady paycheck with good job security.  Although I have seen some people loose this job, if you are at all competent, and show up for work every day, this is a solid option.
review_cons: The main problem most people have with this job are the hours.  You typically will not have consecutive days off, and will frequently work weekends.  If you work a closing shift, you will be in the store until 11pm or later.  This is unacceptable for some, but honestly it is true of almost any retail job, so it is not a real criticism of A&F in particular.
review_advice_mgmt: Upper management wants this to be a lifestyle, but it is just a job.

review_title: Great experience  and fun when you get shifts!
review_pros:
Fun,upbeat and nice employer's and employees and a great experience in the retail world. If your young and want a great experience  with friendly employee's that work along side you and a easy but fast-paced work environment with ever changing roles each day,
then this is a great place to start! The club style modern music and college atmosphere make this store a fun and exciting place to work. And there always looking to hire so your chances to get hired are fairly high. To me if you want a great retail experience but the big retail stores seem to be to much for you Abercrombie & Fitch is a great place to start and grow!
review_cons: If working part-time shifts can be few because of so many employees and if you don't have a college degree getting a management position is rare. If you don't like people and don't like clothes, folding, organizing, cleaning or handling money and a fast paced environment then this isn't for you!
review_advice_mgmt: More commendation and more shifts

review_title: A and F two years and out
review_pros: It can be fun at times. There are no old people that work there. There are young people that work there. You can dress in awesome clothes at great discounts. It is high energy low shrink. You get to meet Colden and Wakely. The marketing is very expensive they spend a lot of money on those things.
review_cons: You can't work more than fifty hours a week. You have to watch out for booster groups and thieves and youth that steal. Some of the "models" actually think that they are really models and just hang out and do not fold a g.d. thing and then complain about not geting hours
review_advice_mgmt: keep being super cool!!!!

review_title: Great place to work but poor sr. leadership and competence.4
review_pros: Cool & casual environment to work in.  You get to work with passionate people.  The compensation is fair to high compared with other retailers.
review_cons: Poor senior leadership and competence outside of the CEO.  The leadership team does not have very much accountability.  Many are simply "yes men/women" to the CEO.
review_advice_mgmt: Have more accountability in the sr. levels.  Be more transparent on internal issues.  Ensure that invdividuals in sr. positions really deserve to be there.  Leadership should be tied to promotions.  Employee moral should be a factor in judging management capabilities.

review_title: Fun as a summer job, that's about it.
review_pros: The coworkers are fun and interesting. The atmosphere is great, not much work to actually do, mostly hanging around. Talking with customers who happen to be similar age is a positive, it's basically like a high school party most of the time. Working in the mall can be fun during high school, make new friends.
review_cons: Hours are very inconsistent, managers play favorites and did not treat everyone with same respect. Staying after to clean up and organize the store when that's precisely the job of the night shift is very frustrating. Dealing with kids during back to school season can get very tiresome.
review_advice_mgmt: More responsible store managers, treating all employees the same. More flexibility and hours to work if requested or needed. Less ego from mangers.

review_title: Abercrombie does more things right than wrong
review_pros: People really live out the values of humility, commitment, and team.  Everyone is supportive of each other and are willing to go out of their way to help you out to be successful.  It is very fast paced, but it is also a very fun environment to work in.
review_cons: There is so much going on at such a fast pace that it's hard to stay coordinated on various initiatives.  Everyone tries so hard to do the right thing to please Mike Jeffries that sometimes they lose sight of what really makes sense for the business as a whole.
review_advice_mgmt: Listen to those on the lower rungs of the organizational ladder, seriously consider them, then act on it.

review_pros: small discount, requires college degree for management-- still a lot of dumb people though.
review_cons: being on your feet for 10 hrs a day, which actually caused me to have surgery due to their requirement of wearing flip-flops.  HARD work.  ridiculous rules.
review_advice_mgmt: treat your employees like humans and not work horses

review_title: Abercrombie can work for you, especially if you love to smile and wave!
review_pros: Great pay. Relaxed enviornment. Casual work attire encouraged. A lot of young people. High energy.
review_cons: This is a tough question to answer because I think my response would be drastically different if I had worked for a different department. I think Abercrombie, overall, is a pretty good place to work. However, the department I worked for, Security, was poorly managed. Our department had little work to do - probably fairly typical for a security job. What leftover time our managers had...who knows what they did with it. It certainly was never spent giving the employees at the bottom of the ladder any reassurance that they had a route for advancement. Moreover, the managers in my department seemed to often make decisions based on high school-like in-group out-group popularity contests. What might be a slap on the wrist for a senior manager's favorite, could easily mean a write-up or termination for someone else.
review_advice_mgmt: Remember to work in the interest of those "below" you. Build and maintain relationships that are based on how you'd like to be treated if you were in other people's shoes.

review_title: An excellent company with uncompromisable standards
review_pros: The best reasons to work at Abercrombie & Fitch is the opportunity to work in an incredibly inclusive atmosphere, the attention to detail everyone strives for, and the demand for excellence. The salaries are competitive and the benefits package is, by far, the most extensive for the industry. They also offer a 401k plan with a an excellent company match.
review_cons: The downsides of working for Abercrombie & Fitch are occasionally the hours become exceesive, especially around the holidays and there's a great deal of office politics involved on occassion.
review_advice_mgmt: None. The Senior Management has an excellent grasp of what employees desire and accomodate most reasonable requests.

review_title: Fast advancement if you don't mind a bad salary and relocating constantly
review_pros: Abercrombie and Fitch is a fun environment. There is also fast advancement. You will learn core management skills and how to multi-task to manage large volume operations. If you enjoy moving, you will be able to do a lot of it. Relocation is paid for and you do have some say in where you go. You will work with young people (21-30) as far as other store managers and your district manager. If you like to always be busy, you'll enjoy this position. Its nice to make your own schedule and you get leave the store a lot to recruit.
review_cons: There are a lot of hours involved. You will not be a stranger to 60 hour work weeks when need be. YOu do not have a balance between social life and work. This company hasn't learned how to respect this. You will feel guilty when you're not there and they don't do a lot to make you ever feel like you're doing a good job. They manage by always making you feel like your work isn't good enough to make you work harder and longer. Basically to wrap up you should get ready for  low compensation, large turnover and no consistency,
review_advice_mgmt: More professional work environment, hire more sophisticated management,

review_pros: The atmosphere in the store is definitely fun. Most of the workers are pretty cool and time flies when you're in good company.  The music is also upbeat, modern, and chill, with a few good classics (remixed to techno beats) thrown into the mix.  I also like the dim lighting and good interior design - it makes you feel like you're in a high-end place.
review_cons: Minimum wage, dumbass managers, bad hours. They pretty much just use the high school and college kids that they hire to attract other young people to buy overpriced, bad quality clothes.  Management is very unorganized and is inconsistent with schedules. A & F also moves the managers around a lot. I worked there for about a year, and the store went through like 10 different managers in that time period.  Most of them like to goof around more than run a good business.  They show no respect for the brand reps and abuse their positions.
review_advice_mgmt: Get organized and be more consisitent.

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch The Worst Company Ever
review_pros: The environment appears to be very friendly at first, but then you start to realize that the managers as well as the coporate office are very unfair to African American workers. Especially to me. The way the company runs its business is not fair to all workers and seems like their is racial issues towards black workers. The Abercromie and Fitch Store located in Columbus, Georgia (the whole company) needs to be under serious investigation. i am employeed with Abercrombie & Fitch and because of the company not providing me with proper information, i have not been to work in two almost three months. Overall because of DISCRIMINATION issues.
review_cons: The company itself is one big lie, and you will not be respected just kicked to the side and forgotten about like everything is your fault, but it's not your fault.
review_advice_mgmt: Abercrombie & Fitch needs to make a better decision on how to run a business , treat employees fair or go out of business.

review_title: Great if you have no bills.
review_pros: Very flexible schedule. Works around school and other jobs very well.  Always gives you time off when you request it.
review_cons: Hardly ever get any hours. They have so many employees for one store so the most anyone gets is 20 hours a week, if they're lucky. Some people have gotten as little as four.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't hire so many people. Give everyone at least 20 hours a week and only 1 call in shift per week.

review_title: A great place for entry-level grads looking to extend their college years
review_pros:
As an entry-level college graduate, you are given the opportunity to make an immediate impact and are giving a lot of responsibility.  My experience at A&F has been sink or swim--I wasn't formally trained in any kind of training program and was basically left to my own devices to learn my role and responsibilities.   There is a lot of turnover at A&F, with people leaving the company very often and with internal placements.  I had three managers within my first year, and given that I was still new in my role it was difficult to learn when I had to simultaneously teach my new manager what he was supposed to be evaluating me on.  Also, I am fortunate to work with a lot of really smart people.  They take your ideas seriously and treat you with respect as a young employee, which is something I do not think you would get at most other companies when you come in out of college.

Another great reason to work at A&F is the lifestyle at Home Office.  There is an on-campus gym with fitness classes and everything, so if your hours are flexible (not on the product side) you can go work out and take a fitness class or get in a workout during your lunch hour.  

It is definitely a unique environment with a collegiate, youthful feel.  If you are coming out of college and are looking to extend that lifestyle a few more years, A&F would be the place for you.
review_cons:
The collegiate atmosphere can be detrimental as well--often times professionalism is left to be desired.  It is not uncommon for employees to show up after a late night out, and not even try to disguise it, but also to share the prior night's events with the team (including their supervisors--it wouldn't surprise anyone if their supervisor had joined them).  It is not uncommon for employees to call in sick because of drinking.  People say in jest "A&F takes college binge drinkers and turns them into alcoholics" but it is often true.  There have been weeks where I've gone out for 5 nights in a workweek, relying on Red Bull and Excedrin to get me through the day.

Another downside is that HR doesn't seem to have it's act together when it comes to promotions.  They are struggling to find a fair way to give promotions in an economy where the company no longer has more money than they know what to do with.  This adjustment has been difficult company-wide, as the relentless focus on quality is so ingrained in every aspect of the business that most departments will spare no expense to make sure that Mike is happy.  There seems to be a resistance to change, and this stems partially from the arrogance of many seasoned A&F directors who were the drivers of the company years ago when it was still ruling the retail world with an iron fist.  I think this is also reflected in our merchandise--it's the customers' fault for not recognizing good merchandise, and not the fault of the teams who are responsible for producing it.
review_advice_mgmt: Senior management needs to start thinking more on a total company level, instead of each leader believing that their respective department is the most important department in the company.  Once senior managers and directors begin to realize this, they will be able to work cooperatively together to drive efficiencies and push results.  Often times common sense goes out the window....like having a spring preview floorset in the heart of winter.  Or having sizes that only fit toddlers or tweens with eating disorders.  There is a difference between being aspirational and being unrealistic, and at the end of the day, you are a clothing company that is trying to make money, not some kind of retail dictator trying to sell a lifestyle.  Many people at A&F forget this.

review_title: A great place to work if you don't let the bad eggs get to you
review_pros: Its a great job when you want to have fun and remain youthful.  It is as serious as you take it...If you do a good job and you are aspirational you will succeed.  The people are amazing I have met so many wonderful friends and professional contacts.  When you work at Abercrombie & Fitch you know that you are part of something that is growing and offers you room to grow within the company.  I agree with the policies and the expectations the company has for their stores it is very hard to obtain them sometimes but the challenge is what makes the job so interesting.
review_cons: It is very frustrating when you watch people who get promoted when they do not deserve you just have to suck it up and know that your time will come as long as you continue doing good work that is consistent.  The hours are sometimes a killer but the company does not offer a lot of flexibility in when you can take your vacation time.  There are no paid holidays for upper management you receive a comp day and no compensation.  There is no bonus structure for store managers and General managers where you can actually make something extra you get  a salary and that's it.  It does not feel like retail until you are in the busy seasons such as back to school and also the Christmas season when you are working 6 day work week and also doing overnight shifts from 9pm to 5am.
review_advice_mgmt: Create a system that promotes a better work life balance and pay attention to who you are putting in charge of districts.

review_title: Standing around in one room for hours
review_pros: It is very flexible for a student.  You can work as little as one day a week, and the job requires very little skill.  You just have to look good.
review_cons: low pay, incompetent management, poor communication, cranky managers, unorganized....My job was to stand in a room for hours, sometimes without a break.  you pretty much have to whine and complain to get one!  Sometimes when my shift ended they would beg me to stay longer because they were understaffed (so many people wouldn't show up).  On my days off I was harassed with phone calls, telling me to come into work. (managers even got clever and called from cell phones).  They tell you how you are allowed to do your makeup and what color and cut you can wear your hair (i'm sorry but hair cut and color are a personal choice)  I wanted to put low lights in my blonde hair and they said no.  Everything is so focused on your appearance.  Some people weren't allowed to work in certain areas because they didn't look good enough.  And most of the managers were really unorganized and immature.  They require a bachelor's degree for management, but it can be any degree.  We had managers who majored in dance (no experience or training in communication or managing people), and we even had one with a fake degree (he bought it online).  it's just so stupid.
review_advice_mgmt: Improve the pay of the associates...higher pay would decrease turnover and people may actually care about the job more.  They want good looking and energetic people, but they can't get that with the low pay they are offering. organization, and communication between employees and managers needs to be approved.

review_pros: Good name to put on your resume. If you can last here a year that says a lot.
review_cons: No work life balance. Managers with little experience. Lack of mentorship. Unfair promotion practices. If you want to work from 8am-7pm at the bare minimum go ahead and work there!!!
review_advice_mgmt: Be open to suggestions and mentor your assistants. Don't just treat them like a set of hands. Don't believe every word your  "stellar associate" is feeding you. Most likely they are kissing up to get a promotion.

review_pros: Working for Abercrombie and Fitch has several perks.  The atmosphere is laid back and fun, while fast paced and competitive at the same time.  Being an in-store employee gives you an advantage to advance within the company either through management or opportunities at our Home Office.  I feel associates have the ability to make the most of their position and can aligned themselves for advancement in the company.  Additionally, the generous discount also is another great reason to work for the company.  In-store management salaries have increased slightly as well.  I admire the organization and standards the company puts forth in everything from the daily management program to guidelines such as the look policy.
review_cons: The downsides of Abercrombie & Fitch are mostly from negative publicity and poor reputation.  Abercrombie's professionalism has been questioned and discredited in several ways because of this.  I feel as if Abercrombie salaries may be shadowed by other retail company's competitive salaries.  Another disappointment is to see lower volume stores in smaller cities not uphold the standards and expectations which the company desires.  I do not understand how District Managers can look at their stores and be okay with this.  The unlevel playing field across the country in-stores allows others to feed off the company pay roll with no prestige or integrity.
review_advice_mgmt: My senior management has always given me appropriate feed back.  However as mentioned before, I have worked in a lower volume store where the atmosphere is unprofessional and the cliques between managers/associates (fraternization policy violation in itself) is obvious.  Again, higher level managers should be monitering their stores more closely.

review_pros: It's an easy job and you meet a lot of attractive people. You stand around folding clothes and greeting customers, looking out for shop lifters. The atmosphere is totally relaxed unless it's during the holiday seasons. They offer flexible hours so you can keep another job that pays more. basically I would recommend this job to college kids who already wear their clothes and need a little money on the side.
review_cons: The music gets so repetitive and the customers can be so unpleasant at times. They give you little pay and most of it goes to buying their clothes. The managers just walk around and don't really care about you. They treat you like you're easy to replace (and you are), and they are incompetent most times.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more than minimum wage!

review_pros: pay not that bad and it being young crowd
review_cons: hours are terrible, may have to work holidays such as new years eve/day, christmas eve, plus you may have to work LOTSS of extra hours.  If the stuff is not completed they make you stay until its done or you get destroyed with unmotivational criticism for not finishing.  Theres no motivational support!!
review_advice_mgmt: appreciate the staffs work!

review_pros: Young and energetic, this place is very casual. Filled with mostly kind and friendly coworkers. Open space. Fairly good pay sometimes--though a lot is expected and required of you. It can be fun and exciting to watch your work go from concept to the floor. Although it's contrived, it's also nice to be working with other creative people, a lot of which have a similar background. It's also fun to learn how to put things together in a cohesive way so that they look good and are functional. There are also free tampons which is cool, and the soups are all pretty great at the cafe.
review_cons: Being in Columbus Ohio is really not fun. It's isolated, cold and it lacks depth and culture. It's kind of cult-ish and clicky, people have their friends and opinions and it can get a little silly. It's hard to keep dealing with new merchants and helping them understand their place and how to function with them and be a useful tool. There is a lot of really inappropriate behavior here that is so unprofessional. I feel like I get harassed every day and that I am judged and sometimes it even gets violent--not to mention mean and disgusting. Sometimes I fear what my manager will say and do next. There are a lot of actual tantrums like a child, it's scary.
review_advice_mgmt:
Listen to everyone and reward experience. Do not turn good ideas away and trust that your workers are educated and already know the in's and out of their job.

Be professional and stop hurting and treating your employees abusively. Being disrespectful and degrading is not okay. Do not tear people down just so you can be the one to reward and lift them up again--as some sort of "savior", it's tiring and transparent. Do not reveal your insecurities, everyone will hate you.

review_pros: Lots of responsibility in Merchandising! Compensation is amazing and career growth is rapid compared to almost all other retailers. The ability to work closely with Mike is a huge perk and wonderful learning opportunity. Work environment is very open and challenging with top talent recruited from across the country. The "buying" role and "product development" role are combined here, so merchants are very hands-on with their product and the numbers.
review_cons: Hours are definitely long (60+ hrs/week for some depts.) and a lot is expected out of you. Can get grueling if you aren't passionate about the product.  There is a pressure to perform and be the best, which may not be for everyone.
review_advice_mgmt: Training/On-boarding is comprehensive. Leadership training has been an appreciated aspect of continuing development.

review_pros: Great discounts....thats it. Good looking people work there which is also a plus. Mostly low pay and tough hours. While working there you will get the chance to meet some great people. Mostly the managers are fairly nice and the regional managers are fairly easy to get along with.
review_cons: Low pay, a lot of hours, have to deal with kids. Many times the store is like a mini soap opera. A lot of drama going on withth employees. They enjoy hooking up with one another so be careful of that. Scheduling also gets tough with the vast amounts of college students.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more people friendly. Compensate managers much better

review_title: What doesn't kill you makes you stronger.
review_pros: Stimulating environment, always a challenge and never a dull moment.  The sky is the limit if you're the right kind of personality type (agressive/passionate) if you're in Product Development.  Campus is in a beautiful setting.   Great compensation and benefits.  If you're not the Type A personality, but you prove yourself a valuable asset, they're good about finding the right fit for you.  I see moves within the company often.
review_cons: Long hours for those working in product development.   Last minute changes and unclear or conflicting design direction have been issues in some areas.
review_advice_mgmt: At the end of the day, we all go home and have some kind of life.   Please continue to move toward ensuring that everyone has work/life balance.

review_title: Great advancement opportunities towards upper management if you can handle the road to get there...
review_pros:
The best reasons to work for the company are:
1. The people. Especially if you've just graduated college, you'll be working with people mostly between the ages of 18-23, so it's nice working with everyone in your age group. All the people I've worked with have been great, and I've made many friends through the company.
2. Being cross-trained in multiple areas. As a manager you develop skills such as sales, leadership, multi-tasking, problem solving, and gain human resource experience from recruiting, interviewing and training. 
3. Advancement opportunities. Especially if you're willing to relocate, you can be promoted relatively quickly. There are also many home office opportunities beyond working in the stores if you're willing to move to Ohio.
review_cons:
The downsides of working for the company are:
1. Quality of life. The hours can be rough, particularly if the store is open late. At least once a week I have to close and then open the next day, which doesn't allow me to get 8 hours of sleep in between. You always work 5 days a week, even when there are holidays. It just counts as one of your two days off (i.e. Thanksgiving). The weeks when you are allowed to use vacation days are very limited, and I always feel like I'm upsetting my boss if I ever use a sick day. I rarely get a weekend day off. 
2. Ethics. Recruiting and hiring people based mostly on appearance when it's retail, not the entertainment industry, doesn't always feel so great.
3. Restrictions on relationships outside of work. Most companies promote employee bonding and offer many opportunities for it outside of the workplace. This company, however, has a non-fraternization policy restricting employees from doing anything outside of work with any employee that is above or below your specific position. It's one of the most common reasons why people are fired, if they get caught.
review_advice_mgmt: The turnover rate is so high with lower level management because of the poor quality of life, sub-standard pay, and the motivation to perform well lapses when positive reinforcement is virtually non-existent. Upper level management only focuses on reaming you for what's wrong with the store, employees, etc. which makes it hard to ever feel good about your job.

review_pros: The people are awesome. Everyone is very kind and friendly.
review_cons: Long hours, but you get paid so its okay. Other than that. Nothing
review_advice_mgmt: Encourage your workers. Know that they are there and when they do something well, tell them how much you appreciate them.

review_pros: Working at Abercrombie & Fitch is a great opportunity to learn more about the retail business, even aspects that I didn't know existed. If you work hard and want more responsibility, it is definitely yours for the taking. Many teams make presentations to the CEO, getting his feedback immediately on projects, and a chance to pick his brain over what is being done. There is potential for travel, and if you loved college, the work environment is well-suited for you. Most employees are very friendly and kind, and will help you with whatever you need.
review_cons: There is a serious lack of work/life balance, which led to feeling guilt over leaving for doctor's appointments or taking personal time. The constant pumping music and smell of the cologne was somewhat distracting and overwhelming, and it was difficult to not feel trapped in an A&F bubble where everyone lives, breathes and sleeps the brand. The other thing I would comment on is the lack of professionalism - conversation around the office and the behavior of employees sometimes leaves a lot to be desired.
review_advice_mgmt: Recognize the need for work/life balance - sometimes to do their best work, people need to take time away from work. If you want respect from your employees, show respect to them.

review_title: Life at Abercrombie is bitter-sweet, but better than the competition.
review_pros:
Abercrombie & Fitch is a great company to work for if you are looking for your first job outside of college. Management positions require a 4-year degree (any major) and little or no retail management experience. You will need to bring your good looks, sense of Abercrombie style (do not dress in other clothing for the interview), cool (or "aspirational") attitude, and intense desire to succeed in the workplace everyday. 

The company has a turnover rate among management of 99% - goal is 75%. It is said that there are definite advancement opportunities, and if you take the turnover statistic, you'll realize that you don't have to be the smartest or most qualified - you just need to be tough enough to be the last one left.

Health, dental, and vision insurance (recently added Q4 2008) is top-notch.

You will learn to become comfortable engaging any person in conversation. You will learn to manage a part-time team of 50+ store employees and adhere to strict deadlines. Employees receive a weekly visit from their District Manager and a quarterly visit from their Regional Manager. District Managers provide store-level management with constant feedback; which depending on your DM's personality will be very aggressive and tough, or will be very intelligent and straight-forward.

Working for Abercrombie will show college grads what it means to work hard and have fun at the same time.
review_cons:
Abercrombie & Fitch is lead in a top-down manner by a very driven man - CEO Mike Jefferies. Abercrombie & Fitch is his genius - and the policies and standards that are enforces have all been directly approved by him. A downside is that you will be forced by abide by the company's very strict "Look Policy" - meaning it governs more than how you 'dress', but also how you 'look.' All clothing must be styled a specific way, in certain colors, of the brand, and hairstyles, makeup, and nails also have restrictions. Great discounts are offered (40% Abercrombie, 30% Hollister - 'AAA' 50% discounts on specific outfits a week after seasonal floorsets), but you will be buying a few work outfits. Employees can, and are, disciplined and terminated for disobeying the "Look Policy."

As you invest more time in the company, you will begin to feel disconnected from the rest of the business world. I have seen many managers (store level and district managers) leave the company and struggle to adjust to the real world. Store management activities do not require that you calculate metrics - only two metrics are used on a regular basis (Sales Per Employee Hour & Shrink). Store Management is very automated and dumbed-down compared to other companies. You will be given daily tasks to complete with very in-depth instructions and deadlines. 

In many ways working for Abercrombie will also show college grads what it means to work hard, not smart. 

Store management compensation may seem low for a fresh college graduate, but compensation levels have risen in past years in order to become very competitive among specialty retailers.
review_advice_mgmt: I would recommend that senior management rethink the way the company shares ideas and information within the company. Their are many improvements and efficiencies that store managers are aware of that are not being implemented quickly enough. Perhaps store-level management could pass on ideas through District-Managers, who could act as gatekeepers. It seems that home office has become more disconnected from stores in recent years as automation has improved.

review_pros: This is a flexible and Fun position.  The medical benefits were good and inexpensive. Great people to work with.  The scheduling was very flexible.
review_cons: The management structure is constantly changing.  Corporate office is located in Columbus, OH and the further you get from there, the less significant you are.  They lack significant technological tools(email) and info is highly compartmentalized.  The pay was adequate for the level of responsibility but growth opportunities were rare and salary increases were insignificant.
review_advice_mgmt: Corporate employees are often rude and or unhelpful when contacted for routine issues/events. There is an attitude that non corporate employees are inferior.

review_title: Stabbed in the back at ANF
review_pros:
Your Friends think it's "cool".
Pay is good, at least in Loss Prevention
review_cons: Be ready to play "Survivor".  Promotions and even keeping your job depends on how "buddy-buddy" you are with your managers.  It has NOTHING to do with how well you perform or produce results.  If you get on the bad side of someone above you, maybe because they're doing something they shouldn't be doing, (RLPM trying to vio;ate HR frat policies, for example) and you report them to HR, get ready to be fired.  The upper echelons of management are all part of the "original" clique, and they protect each other pretty well.
review_advice_mgmt: Your world will come crashing down someday, just wait and see.

review_title: Working at AnF is an overall fun first job, or a job for students in college, looking for some extra cash.
review_pros: It is a fun place to work or a first job as a sales associate. You can take off whenever you like as long as you let them know in advance. You get a great discount on the company's clothes. They are very flexible with schedualing around your other work scheduales if you have another job or something else you need to do. Management is very nice, and you can go to them with any type of question. You can make this simple clothing store job, a fun one, just by having a great and positive personality. It is a great first job to have.
review_cons: The pay is very little, and in order to be a manager of a store, you must have a four year degree. Many other clothing stores do not require this, and by the time you get your degree, you will be looking for a job in your major rather than wanting to work as a manager at a retail store. The breaks are very short, and you can only wear three different colors (blue, white, or grey), along with jeans only, and flip flops, it makes it hard when you have to buy only those three colors, when you might not even like them, and it gets hard in the summer when it is really hot and you have to wear jeans.
review_advice_mgmt: I would suggest that they switch back to allowing employees wear any color and any type of bottoms as long as they are from the company. I also sugggest that they give employees who have worked for a long time...a better raise

review_pros: No real reason.  Perhaps as a starting job so that people may have a resume.  They will hire almost anyone since they have such bad conditions for workers that they probably have people coming and going very often.
review_cons: I can't think of many things about it that aren't a downside.  The terrible music is looped over and over, and the cologne there smells terrible.  I am very much a fragrance lover myself but the fragrance at A&F is just bad.  So the environment itself is weak.  The pay is awful, though I believe they have raised it since I worked there to 7.25 which is still next to nothing.  Their clothes are just plain and boring, but that is only my opinion, so the discounts didn't help me, but they are there for those who would use them.  Break was extremely short (I think 15 minutes paid or 30 unpaid for 4 hours of work.  I can't remember).  All in all one of the worst experiences I've had.
review_advice_mgmt: Get a new job.

review_title: It is only for ppl in High School.
review_pros: Everyone who works there is attrative, it's one of the requriements or you wont get hired.  It's nice because more of the ppl shopping at the store treat you like dirty afterwards you can make fun of the customers with your coworkers
review_cons: The pay is at the bottom of the barrel and personnal life is not separated at work.  Every one is talking about what happened over the weekend and when ppl have parties they invite more of the ppl at the store.  That is nice but when it is on a weekday and some of the ppl come to work hung over it's annoying.
review_advice_mgmt: At the store i worked at she was good.  He understood the problems and really put actions to effect to make a change.

review_pros: Good discounts and cool young people to work with.  The company has a cool image and there are a lot of opportunities for growth if you can stick it out through 12 hour days.
review_cons: Compensation is below other retail stores, look policy is strict and everybody will look down on you of you dont wear their clothes to work even though you dont have to.  Upper management only cares about the look of part time employees and not about any kinds of skills or abilities.  Its basically impossible to get fired if you are the image they are looking for, even though you cant fold a shirt.
review_advice_mgmt: Upper management needs to realize that kids making only $7.15 per hour working one or two days a week cant afford to go by the ever changing look policy which includes $70 polos and $95 pairs of jeans.

review_title: The most work and worst hours for the least amount of money.
review_pros: Not having to wear "work clothes".  It's rare you can have a full time job in which you are not only allowed to, but required to wear flip flops to work.  The laid back atmosphere of the store can be very enjoyable.
review_cons: Working for a company whose expectations are only achievable in an ideal utopian situation.  Expectations remain the same regardless of the volume of sales and the amount of hours given weekly by home office.  The stores are not designed to be practical in any form.  Hiring is done purely on looks, despite what they may claim.  You are typically the first and last people to leave the mall each day.  When you realize most mall management pay is similar you will quickly become bitter about this fact.
review_advice_mgmt: Understand that the standards they require each store to uphold were not tested in a real world environment.  All of the standards are decided based upon the home office stores in Ohio.  These stores are not open to the general public and are essentially museums.  Just because a standard is achievable in a home office store does not mean it will be in a store in a real mall with real people who could care less about how you want to fold your shirts.

review_title: Abercrombie and Fitch: Manager in Training
review_pros: Abercrombie and Fitch is a very flexible company that works well with their employees. They understand that people have previous obligations and help to work around your schedule. Managers are nice and usually close to you in age so you have a lot in common.  Very good work environment and employees are nice.
review_cons: Some days they make you work very long hours when they are short on hours. On the other hand there will be times when you don't work at all because they are over hours. Customers can sometimes be a pain because they try to get money taken off or return things that you cannot.
review_advice_mgmt: Make sure employees are not stealing.

review_title: Fun place to work juat out of college!
review_pros: Abercrombie is a great job right out of college. It's fun laid-back and just a cool place to be. Most stores aren't crazy busy so you have a lot of down time just to chill and get to know your models and part time impacters. Also A & F hires great looking people so it makes it even more fun. Career opportunities are pretty great with most people getting promoted within 6-8 months.  You learn alot about time mangement running a bussiness and recruiting. It also makes you more confindent when meeting new people. And of corse you get an awesome discount.
review_cons: The hours, the company only wants you to  to work a max of 42.5 hours a week, but on your daily program they give you 50-65 hours worth of work to do in such a sort period of time. The company also strives for perfection and nothing is ever good enough. Also if you aren't super great looking you will not get promoted as fast as great looking people.  Which sucks when you are an awesome manager but not so great looking. Overall it just reminds me of a high school populaty contest if you aren't cool you don't  get promoted.
review_advice_mgmt: Just grow up

review_title: Work at hollister if you want to make easy money, and listen to music while you do it.
review_pros: Basically the hours are nice, the job is very easy, and its a nice work environment.
review_cons: minimum wage, raises given out verrrry rarely. A
review_advice_mgmt: some are great some are very dumb. You dont really have to deal with them all time as they usually just tell you what to do and then have other things to do.

review_title: An honest opinion of what it was like to work for the Crombie
review_pros: great resume builder. great entry level job for someone looking for management experience without prior experience. easy to move up but have to fit theire image
review_cons: very low pay for requirements to land job: 4 yr degree. Very clicky and egostical company which streeses zero emphasis on customer service but 90% on image and brand. No bonuses, education reimbiurstments or benefits, just basic medical and almost minimum wage pay for huge amounts of responsibility.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop showing favoritism and go into the stores and speak with all the associates to get an idea of how the business is being run. stop with the lame tag lines and dress requirments and actually focus on the customer, who may be waiting in a very long line or standing around waiting for a dressing room.

review_title: Great place to work while in school!!
review_pros: Abercrombie and Fitch was a great company to be affiliated with. It is a company to work with while in college because of the fact that they worked around my busy schedule I had with being a full time student, as well as balancing my  extracurricular activities. There were several occasions of promotion from within the stores...from being a model to becoming a manager. There is a friendly culture at A & F. Your collegues can become some of your good friends. It is a pleasant environment, and I would recommend that others apply.
review_cons: There was miscommunication between managers and associates, however everything was resolved in a timely manner. It seemed that I had to pay more for the clothes I had to wear while working, than what I actually earned working there.
review_advice_mgmt: Overall, I feel that Senior Management is doing a decent job running the corporation, and making changes when necessary.

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch...fast promotion but do you really learn anything beside the fact that your good looking?
review_pros: quick promotion, youthful company, awesome benefits
review_cons: hiring based on appearance, long in store hours, have to work with HS aged part-timers
review_advice_mgmt: to remember what is it like to work in stores, remember what it is like to work night and weekends

review_pros: at first it was a pretty good place to work, i was hired after ANF fired their contract maintenance crew so they were desperate for cleaners.  but after they saw that their little experiment worked they started to tighten the knot, they started by lowering the salary rate for newer workers, then when we got our (10-35 cent and hour )increase, they began to cut an hour a day from work. after that they started cutting days. this year, know one is getting a salary increase do to the economy, yet they continue to hire new people for all departments.
review_cons: i heard that a few years ago ANF lost a law suit cause of racism. they store's 95% managerial staff is white. the cleaning crew is 95% Hispanic, followed by african americans. they hold little to no respect for the cleaning staff. look at us as sub-standard workers.  the senior management shows no care for the workers, if someone is sick and calls out on a schedule work day they get a write-up, even if they bring a doctors note. there is no chance for growth no chance for full time, no chance for salary increase. excellent performance is rewarded with more work.  every week they seem to be tightening up the screws to force us out. Once a month mike jeffries comes to the store. and everyone is force to hide and leave the floor so he doesnt see us. this is no lie or exaggeration, this can be confirm by all employees, he doesnt take the time to meet the back bone of the company. only meets/greets the high ranking members.
review_advice_mgmt: just because a person cleans toilets and picks up trash doesn't make him an illiterate fool. cleaning the store is a vital part of the day to day role of the store.

review_title: Great place to learn and grow
review_pros: As a manager this job is what you make it.  It can be a blast and laid back, or it can control your life.  I have enjoyed my time with the company and have had a ton of fun but still take it seriously.  It is a fun and fast paced environment.  You gain a lot of knowledge and confidence very quickly with this company.  There is always something new to learn and there is always a challenge.  The people are amazing, all the way from the part time associates up to home office.
review_cons: The pay is rather low and turn over is high.  I feel that more people would take the job more seriously if they were simply paid more.  The fun does make up a lot for the low pay, but there is a point where you feel unmotivated to makes sales or to continue to work hard if you aren't getting compensated for it or feeling under-valued.
review_advice_mgmt: A little respect and praise can go a long way in the way you treat your managers.  Although turn over is high, honestly the biggest complaint great managers have is pay.  We would be willing to work harder longer, and more productively if the pay were competitive.  Appreciate how hard these people work to run this company.  People are motivated by two things... pay and praise/feedback - we need more of both!

review_title: General light review for store model
review_pros: When you work there, you get excellent clothes folding experience.  It is also very fun to say that you wirk there.  Another reason is that there are many fun people there.  It is nice to get the store discounts and it is also nice being there only dress code is there product.
review_cons: They are incredibly anal about there clothes.  They must be folded perfectly.  Like perfectly.  When I worked thee we had to make the size stickers on the shirts line up exactly on every shirt.  We also had to make sure the moose on the shirts were in the exact same position as the others were too.
review_advice_mgmt: Longer Breaks

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch, a good entry level job...
review_pros: The work environment is very young and the poeple you work with are a lot of fun.  You also have some of the obvious benefits such as the discount on clothes.
review_cons: lso, although they tell you there is room to move up in the company quickly, unless you have extra cash and no student loans and are willing to move, your ability to be flexible enough to make those advancements is very limited.
review_advice_mgmt: Look to advance workers on the basis of work performance, education levels, and potential.  Yea you can have a great worker who's major was political science but how will they help a company as they move up in management and then to home office in comparison to someone with an MBA or business degree??

review_title: Good place to work as a high school student
review_pros: They have very flexible hours, and can work as few as five hours a week if you want.  You can basically say I'm available on this day at this time, and that is when they will schedule you.  The discounts on clothes are also nice becasue it's really expensive otherwise.
review_cons: Managers have very little respect for their employees and you are expected to dress and look a certain way.  You are expected to stand in the room you are assigned to, and if you leave and go to another area of the store even to help a customer you can get written up.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat emplyoees better.

review_title: Working as a manager at Abercrombie
review_pros: Promotions from within, the opportunity to work with fun, young people, comfortable work attire, great benefits.
review_cons: The standard the company sets for the stores is so high that it is impossible to reach on a day to day basis in the hours that are given, As a manager you are expected to complete a significant amount of tasks in a short amount of time, all the while running the business and having the store folded down to perfection every night. Instead of openly saying that this isn't always possible, the company pushes it like it is. Also, like most retail jobs, the hours can be grueling. Managers don't leave the store until 11 p.m. more than one night a week.
review_advice_mgmt: Please remember what it was like when you were at the bottom of the chain.

review_pros: Fun atmosphere, great people to work with. Benefits are amazing! I have met some amazing people and formed lasting friendships. This company has great business sense and trains employees better than any other retailer I've worked for. Def know how to run a business.
review_cons: Pay is awful compared to the amount of work you are required to do. You have to basically judge others on how good looking they are and if you don't have a good looking staff you mine as well forget a promotion. Everyone is out for themsleves and could care less about the hard work you put in. If you like being judgmental and shallow this is the job for you!!
review_advice_mgmt: PAY MORE!! We make you guys look good and run your business like you want, so why not pay accordingly!!! I would love to continue with this company if I didn't live pay check to paycheck! Understand your managers have college degrees for a reason!!

review_pros: Easy high school job but other than that, don't waste your time. Nobody takes this job seriously, therefofre leading to poor customer service.
review_cons: Management, disrespect to employees and customers. Discrimination on who they hire.
review_advice_mgmt: Be fair when it comes to raises

review_title: Abercrombie is a great place to work while in college and right after because they hire up from within and pay well.
review_pros: Ive worked at Abercrombie & Fitch as a seasonal, store model, impact, and cashier in NYC and in other cities and the best reasons to work there are the pay, the discounts, and the little perks that anyone who has worked at a flagship store knows about. compared with its competitors Abercrombie pays more, for less work, and gives much more recognition for a job well done. This company makes you feel like your in a special club by encouraging employees to go to college and keeping them on when they graduate as MITs(managers in training). Also they only cast store models in their catalog and on the bags.
review_cons: Depending on what your position is and where your store is Abercrombie can be a lot of work. In New York, for example, being an impact is hard work. you walk around refolding clothes that people distroy almost as you fix them and sometimes you have to work in the stock room which is a glorified cellar in NYC the flagship store. what they have you do is as people buy items of clothes records are taken of whats been purchased and these lists (USRs) are what impact members use to walk around the stock room looking for the same items that have just been purchased buy the customer to ensure the sales floor is always stocked.
review_advice_mgmt: I would advice senior management to do 2 things. First, to create uniformity within the store to ensure everyone knows exactly what they are supposed to be doing. managers should all have the same answers to questions and should not contradict themselves or each other. secondly i would encourage senior managers to understand the rules of the company as they are applied in the day to day activities of store employees and not only from a behind the desk point of view. working at Abercrombie isn't hard a hard thing to figure out but conflicting instructions creates chaos in the workplace.

review_pros: You recieve a 30% discount.
review_cons: A lot of high school kids, which can be a positive if you are still in high school, however if you are over 20 years old, you probably don't want to be in that environment.
review_advice_mgmt: I don't feel that they take their job seriously.

review_pros: Working at A & F is not the worst. Don't get me wrong, the pay is not great... it's actually below average.  But at least they work with your availability.  I worked there for a year and only once or twice did they schedule me out of my availability and one of those days was Black Friday.  If I needed time off I would just put it in the system and they would honor it.  The discount was 30% off (i think) but you could not use it on sale items.  At the beginning of each season you get 3-4 50% on certain colors.  Also, if you close the store you really do not do anything because they have an overnight team and a cleaning crew.
review_cons: The pay is below average and they expect you to buy their clothes constantly.  Every season they change the colors you can wear so you're constantly having to buy clothes...even if you hate the colors.  There was a time when they would make you call in to see if you had to work and you had to call within an hour of the "start" time.  This is really annoying because it doesn't allow you to make plans for the day.  The managers are constantly pushing the tag line which is ridiculous...most people got annoyed with me saying "Have you tried our great fitting jeans?!" within 3 seconds of them walking in.
review_advice_mgmt: Be realistic.  Customers don't want to be harassed.  Some even complain to us about it.

review_title: I would not recommend this company upon my worst enemy
review_pros:
You work for a company that others consider to be "hip"
The title of your position is "model"
review_cons:
Pay is minimum wage and almost no chance of getting a raise
No hours - I got 4 hours a week if I was lucky
Call-in shifts (about 2-3 a week) - you have to call in an hour before a shift you are scheduled for, only for them to tell you that they don't need you
Having to wear their clothes in only certain colors and styles, which both change often so you are constantly having to buy new clothes from them
All the restrictions on how you must look - from your hair, makeup, nails, weight, clothing, etc.
Managers' attitudes and lack of respect for employees and customers
review_advice_mgmt:
Pay more (but I know that will never happen)
Lower prices (which I also know will never happen)
Less strict look policy
Respect your employees
From being on the inside of this company for a few years now, I can see why there is so much controversy around it. I can see it going out of business soon because of their horrible policies.

review_pros: i think it's great to meet outgoing people. the people are for the most part friendly and they will help with being new to the company. the work is mundane and repetative, but you can make it fun if your co-workers are cool.
review_cons: the work gets boring if you do the same thing for 4 hours at a time. the music is deafening sometimes. it's hard to hear people that speak softly and i almost have to yell to answer them.
review_advice_mgmt: just be more polite to people that are under you sometimes we're seen as lower beings and just so much the bottom of the food chain that our opinions and feelings don't matter. that shouldn't be the case and if it were our moral would always be low.

review_pros:
A&F fun factor highly depends on co-workers. Sometimes they're really cool and friendly, other times their snobby. You get a 30% discount on all full-priced Abercrombie stores (not Hollister or any other name). 

Depending on store size and manager, you get a lot of mobility and freedom to chill and hang out. If you need someone to cover your shift last minute, you can call off of a phone list. So many people work there that it's usually pretty easy to do.
review_cons: The work can be tedious and boring. Managers don't always give you a lot of shifts. There are so many people working there that it's hard to put everyone on the schedule. It depends on how much they like you. I've heard of people working 4 hours a week. Or less.
review_advice_mgmt: Salary increase!

review_pros: 30% employee discount and 50% discount on certain items at specific times of the year. Fun to meet new and interesting people. Good music.
review_cons: Incompetent managers, no room for promotions, horrible pay. Being a model includes dealing with bratty kids and their annoying mothers, boosters, tag switchers, and getting drenched in clouds of perfume. Customers complain way too much, and expect models to change store policies when we don't have the power to do so. Also, models have to clean the bathrooms every week. Models = janitors. Gross.
review_advice_mgmt: Get a new job because you're horrible at this one. Or take that stick out of your rear and remember that you aren't that special.

review_pros: Depending on who you work with you can have a great time. Same goes for who you report to. They can make or break your career.
review_cons: The downsides are: the pay isn't competitive with simalar companies, promotions are mostly based on looks and not experience and stores do do not recieve enough resources
review_advice_mgmt: Value your people over profits

review_title: You will work hard and learn fast.
review_pros: Managers move up in the company very fast.   You are given the opportunity to run your own store at a very young age.  There are international opportunities for store managers and upper management.  The company has finally created a structured Manager in Training program for new managers.  The company requires a 4 year college degree to work as management.  The benefits package is good.
review_cons: Recruiting "great looking" people is your number 1 priority.  You are given a lot of responsibility and are not properly compensated for it.   It is not as easy as they tell you to get into corporate after working in stores.  The turnover rate is very high.  The clothing is expensive and the discount is so so.  Depending on what area you live in the theft rate is very high and customers are awful.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more open with store managers.

review_title: good place to work if you are willing to bust your butt
review_pros: It is an extremely fast paced company where you can get promoted quickly. Great Benefits. A decent place to work if you are really needing a jobs-especially fresh out of school.
review_cons: Although to get promoted quiquickly  you must bust your butt, work many overtime hours and follow some ridiculous brand polices to get far. Your life becomes overtaken by work when you become a store manager and usually they expect the un attainable to be done.
review_advice_mgmt: Listen to your managers. Don't promise promotions and then not give them. You need to make the associate feel their work is appreciated.

review_title: It was a good highshool job
review_pros: I had a great time working at Hollister. The managers are pretty cool and you really don't have to do much work except fold clothes. The company is ran pretty well and there is room to move up.
review_cons: The pay is minimum wage. In high school it was ok because I lived at home and had no bills but I could never imagine working there now.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep it up! You guys are doing a great job! i loved working at Hollister and wish that I could do it again and again!

review_pros: Great culture.  Most people are fun to work with.  When thingsare good going to work can be fun, but some of th bs is a bit too much.
review_cons: It is very political and promotions to the upper levels of departments doesn't have much to do with performance.  Management has sort of lost their vision in the current economic condition, so at any given time the whole strategy of the company may change, and make all your hard work on the old strategy go to waste.  I imagine this can be a good place to work when things are good, but not now.
review_advice_mgmt: Pick a strategy and go with it.  You seem to be drowing in the recession, and it makes it hard to be an entry level employee when everyday you hear conflicting messages/strategies/goals from above.

review_title: okay place to work when your young or for a first job
review_pros: 30% discount on clothes, lots of fun and outgoing people you get to meet, and overall it can be a fun place to work depending on managment moods.....
review_cons: you cannot be a manager if you do not have a BA,  pay is min. wage they only do a $.25 raise once a year,  their traning system is terrible I would have to show new managers how to do things, hearing customers complain about the music (believe us we know its really loud and we cant do anything about it!) and the horrible tag lines
review_advice_mgmt: let the each individual store control the music the way they want it especially when its not a busy store were the who hear the complaining 500 times a day.... get rid of the embarrassing tag lines(all of them) we feel like you want us to make fools of ourselves (saying check out our sexy shorts to someone whole is old enough to be my grandmother is embarrassing!)

review_pros: get to wear jeans and a t-shirt, get to work with good looking people who are around eighteen to twenty two
review_cons: have to work in a mall, very unprofessional, treat employees like employees not people, folding clothes all day every day sucks
review_advice_mgmt: treat empolyees like people not just employees,  could recruit the quality of people expected from this brand if did not pay the models minimum wage when other stores pay more

review_pros: It was a great summer job. The people there were really nice and fun. It's a great place for teens and young adults in school to work.
review_cons: When trying to apply for a different job, A&F seems to not help me at all. I've had a lot of interviews ask me about their customer service policy and tell me how horrible it is. When trying to compensate, they don't really listen. It is quite loud and spending 5-6 hours there can prove difficult.
review_advice_mgmt: Consider leading the employees better. I had one manager stay on the floor, and it was always that one. Try to mix it up and show the employees that the managers are the same as them.

review_pros: Everyone's attractive, everyone is happy, we're always dancing, laughing and having a good time. We go out together, and we have a blast. At work, we listen to great music and go home smelling amazing. The look policy is strict, but comming from years of uniforms at school, I don't really see it as a big deal at all, every company has the right to promote their image how they choose, right? Also, the idea that they don't hire african-americans is completely rediculous. I'm african american, and I work with plenty of minorities. I've heard other people say that working at A & F is like being back in highschool. Not really, but who would care if it was? I liked highschool.
