Basically, your average A & F store is a bunch of young, happy, carefree people having a great time in a great place while looking great. It's the perfect college campus compressed into a 50'x50' box with a conoe hanging from the ceiling.
review_cons: If you don't already buy their clothes, you're going to have a problem replacing your whole wardobe, it isn't required, and no one will presure you to, but you're going to feel a bit odd wearing other clothes when you're surrounded by A & F clothing on forms, and tables, and models. The discounts are great, (I hear that we get 50% off of certain things, but I don't really know), but dressing for work is still expensive if you don't already have a good supply of their clothes in your closet. All in all, I love my job, I just wish we had a bigger discount on the clothes.
review_advice_mgmt: The only thing I would change about A & F is the way information is distributed to new hires. I had a lot of questions about the look, but not much was explained to me, and I wasn't really informed about the AAA discount either. I was never really informed of exactly what they wanted from a "model", and the associate handbook only goes so far, so I've really just been learning by observation and guess work.

review_title: Good Job for a high schooler
review_pros: Clothes are very expensive so it is nice to to get a discount on clothes. The environment is also kind of a cool place to work.
review_cons: Clothes are too expensive for you to buy on your "salary". They want you to dress similiar to their style of clothing.  The environment can get annoying after a while.  The smell, lighting and loud music gets old to you.  Not enough hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire less impacters.  Too many impacters work in one store. therefore its hard to get hours when you need them

review_title: Prepare to compromise your moral and ethical character
review_pros: Great benefits and perks. From a District Manager standpoint, work-life balance is average. Big discount on company merchandise. Great insurance package.
review_cons: Morally, this is a horrible place to work. Hiring and promotions are based on appearance, and not job performance. The company has antiquated technology and extremely poor communication.
review_advice_mgmt: This is difficult because the main problems are associated with the culture of the company. If the company was more traditional in some of their practices, then retention and job satisfaction would not be so low.

review_pros: A&F is a great place to kick off a career in retail management.  If you fit the requirements of a manager and continue to represent yourself with current fashions and keep up your appearance, while progressing a leader in the store you are on a career fast track!  If you are an MIT or AM and can continue to live at home that would be in your best interest salary wise.
review_cons: If you do not keep up your appearance, it may hinder promotions down the road...afterall it is the FASHION INDUSTRY!  The problem is that the salary doesn't always allow for this.  The company has very high standards for everything and rarely you will receive positive feedback.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep up your appearance, live at home and be willing to relocate in the future.

review_pros: social setting, fun environment, youthful,
review_cons: you MUST be good looking... or else! Poor compensation, promo was typically a popularity contest,  negatives always out shadow the positives in terms of how you are viewed, work ethic not valued, results were again, image based, instead of severance packages, they will put together a HR designed work performance notice to fire you(thats how cheap they are)
review_advice_mgmt: brown nose your boss. start working out and tanning. Geez... thats sad

review_pros: Great benefits, meet cool people, you can move up quickly if you have the look, put the time in, and can talk the talk.  this job is all about how you carry yourself when conversing with upper management and if you have the look that the company wants to market.  if you have both things, you are on the fast-track to promotions.  in reality, not alot of companies have District and Regional Managers all in their late 20's..
review_cons: Crazy schedules, company gives you no hours to staff your stores, causing a very stressful environment, too meticulous about what people look like, average to below-average retail pay until you get past store manager position.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop letting a 90 year old man run the company, drop your expectations for store management if you are going to drop the resources and hours they are given to run their stores.  only so much is possible with what you give.  show more appreciation, pay a little better, maybe you will see less turnover.

review_pros: fun place to work where you can wear jeans and t-shirt all day long
review_cons: the hours and pay are not very good.  you have to work late nights and weekends
review_advice_mgmt: unless someone above you is promoted you will not be promoted no matter how qualified they tell you, you are

review_pros: i guess its money you didn't have before right? i made some pretty cool friends there too, but that might be all i've gotten from that experience
review_cons: everything.  managers play favorites hardcore and the "favorites" can be so cliquey and rude as though they're not making close to minimum wage like the rest of us.  hard to get hours, but really, it's not like they amount to much anyway.
review_advice_mgmt: realize that its just a part time job for most of us so just because we're not "rah rah abercrombie & fitch" doesn't mean we're not worthy. if you want it to be more than that, pay more or at least give us more hours.

review_title: Pretty good job for a high school student
review_pros: Money that you didn't have before, decent discount on my favorite clothes, steady hours, pretty good work environment.   I was overall very satisfied with working at Abercrombie.
review_cons: managers play favorites which can really be unnerving, associates are not allowed to wear makeup or jewelery, the loud music in the store can give you awful headaches.
review_advice_mgmt: My advice would be to recognize a hard worker, not necessarily because they look good in the brand, but rather because of their energy, commitment, and reliability.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
review_pros: Young fast paced atmosphere. At times can be a very fun place to work. It does have it's down falls though..
review_cons: High turn over rate, average pay considering responsibilities and hours worked. Promotion rate was slow plus you are limited to where you can work.
review_advice_mgmt: If you decide to take a dive into this field be ready for a sometimes fun place to work but the work can be very redundant and unrewarding.

review_title: Be prepared to feel superficial and dirty!
employee_job: Shallow Brand Asks You to Follow ITS Lead
review_pros: Fun people, light-hearted atmosphere, ease of transferring your position to other store locations around the city or around the country, very casual work attire, flexibility in scheduling
review_cons: If you were not already aware, this is the most vain company in our country-- and managers are required to buy into that.  Senior management puts major weight in its manager's ability to recruit and retain good-looking associates.  Managers are forced to view potential associates through that lens at all times, and for me and many others, we ultimately couldn't handle it anymore.  I was told not to even consider those applicants who had braces, those we perceived were too big to fit into our jeans (which are already quite small!), those with acne, and a few other superficial details. The company also places no value on customer service (well, only in situations where it is used as a decoy to address potential theft situations), so customers are often quite angry and no realistic system is in place to help calm the situations and help customers, so managers are just asked to deal with bitchy customers and send them away unhappy, which gets old very fast.  Home Office (company headquarters) doesn't even post it's phone for customer complaints or customer service needs.  Managers just give out a business card with an email address.  All manager's jobs are evaluated based through very ridiculous standards which include: the District Manager's weekly audit, the Regional Manager's audit (which happens about every 4 months), Secret Shoppers' scores from their biweekly store visits, and the occasional internal audit by an employee of Home Office.  While these things often reflect the overall condition of a store.  They rarely, if ever, reflect the exact efforts of individuals working for the store.  A manager can work themselves to death doing an excellent job for months, and then still be told their are doing crappy work, because a part-time high school employee forgot to greet a secret shopper, or because the District Manager thought a rack of clothes looked messy, or because a Regional Manager found dust behind the microwave.
review_advice_mgmt: Create realistic standards by which you can judge your managers-- standards that focus on one's ability to manage a retail business and generate sales-- not standards that judge one's ability to buy into your shady mentality.  Supplement your efforts to create a strong brand identity with efforts to give the customer a great in-store experience.

review_title: Not the best place to work at.
review_pros:
-30% discount on clothing
- A lot of activity in the store at all times
- light work load
review_cons:
-Work can be extremely boring in the front rooms
-Many workers which means that you don't get a lot of hours (sometimes 10hrs/week)
-Night shifts can extend to midnight sometimes when there is a lot of store activity during the day
-Nothing to do most of the time which means that you have to act like your working or refold perfectly fine shirts
- Call-ins are the most annoying thing you will encounter. workers have to call their managers 2 hours before scheduled call-ins to see if they have work on that day.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire more qualified managers.

review_title: Use You and Then They Throw You Away
review_pros: Gives young people a chance to get some job experience.
review_cons:
Only employ people who meet a certain look or appearance.  

They use most employees as a means to draw in new customers. New pretty/attractive associates draw in customers of the opposite sex.  When the associate does not seem to be a draw, they no longer schedule hours.  At that point, they simply let the associate go without any formal lay-off process.  This happened to an acquaintance of mine and I find this company to be a complete disgrace in the way it treats its most valuable resource.
review_advice_mgmt: A company's most important asset is its personnel.  Try treating yours with some dignity and respect.  Otherwise, I see your company going completely under within a few years.

review_pros: Fast paced. Fun work enviornment. Lots of experience with sales and stock room management. Always easy to be trained since there are lots of managers around. Good discounts on clothes. Easy to make friends.
review_cons: Don't always offer a lot of hours for each person.  And they have call in shifts, often.  Meaning you might not get hours every week.
review_advice_mgmt: I would tell them to hire less people and give the employees more hours. Would make it easier to get hours and be better trained.

review_pros: Abercrombie is a flexible company to work for if you are a part time associate. You pretty much make your own schedule. If you are a person looking for quick "change" and know you are not that reliable as far as coming to work on time and having to work hard, then you may enjoy this job. You just stand there and fold.
review_cons: The company pays its employees minimum wage which is why the employees don't care too much for the company. You get a pay check every two weeks and still probably couldn't afford a regular priced shirt and jeans with your whole paycheck. They give you very little hours. Working for this company you'd probably be better off if you were still in high school and live with your parents and just looking for gas and lunch money because that is all you will probably be able to afford.
review_advice_mgmt: It is hard for you to make sure that your employees will do a good job under you because they do not get paid anything and feel that they would be losing nothing even if they were to lose this job.

review_title: Quick easy job, nothing to consider long term
review_pros: The work isnt brain surgery; you fold, you greet, you ring customers.  I met some people I considered to be really good friends and fun to work with.  You basically decide your schedule, although sometimes they will put you on your unavailable time that they THINK you can work anyway, usually without asking.
review_cons: Minimum wage and probably a snobby clientell.  Your assignment is usually based off of how good of friends you are with the manager.  The managers are also dealing with an insane amount of stress from their store and their upper mgmt so theyre free to frequently take their anger out on you.
review_advice_mgmt: They simply dont respect their employees, to rise up in the company its a battle which involves a pyramid like scheme to get others to work under you.  Change it.

review_title: if you can land the job. go for it.
review_pros: minimum wage but job only needs minumum effort. you can go i completely hungover and it dosent even matter. its a really good job for a college student because you can decide your own schedule and take as many days off as you want.
review_cons: very picky on appearance. plus you must wear the clothes to work everyday and theyre quite expensive.. and prices are on the rise. and i think i have some hearing loss from the loudness of the music...
review_advice_mgmt: all of the managers i have ever had were really cool and easy to get along with. they did their jobs without being moody control freaks.

review_title: they don't give you enough hours
review_pros:
easy.
a complete idiot could do it
review_cons:
not enough hours
stinky cologne sprayed every 15 minutes
not told what job responsibilities are
dissapointing pay
review_advice_mgmt: Let people know you all don't give many hours a week BEFORE you hire them!....bitches

review_title: Hard work does not pay off.
review_pros: The few pros of this job include the discount, wearing jeans every day, and management experience. The company also gives you more than enough tools to effectively, and legally, discriminate based on looks alone.
review_cons:
This job should only be taken as an absolute last resort. I would recommend cleaning up after animals before recommending this job. 

Although you are required to have a four year degree to even apply for this position, the truth is they would hire an idiot if only they were physically attractive. The entire job including personal advancement is based on identifying good looking candidates to work part time. As an assistant manager, you are also placed under a microscope of shallowness for job advancement. There is only a decent chance of moving up if you are what Abercrombie considers to be good looking. 

If you take this job, never expect praise. This company preaches positive reinforcement, however it is never employed by upper management. There is plenty between part-timers and their direct supervisors. Upper-management however, perhaps due to stress or maybe out of ego, never direct praise towards anyone but themselves.

The cons go on.....there are too many to list. Take my advice--steer clear of this company.
review_advice_mgmt: Abercrombie and Fitch preaches about a fun, engaging, rewarding environment for their management staff. It does not exist. There is an chasm between the upper management working out of homeoffice and the management in stores. This needs to change. The only way this is going to happen is if the company becomes a bit more realistic with its standards of merchandise and employees.

review_pros:
- Store management experience looks good on a resume no matter how horrible the company is
- casual work attire
- Can be very rewarding under certain conditions
review_cons:
- Company is failing. MJ refuses to admit that he may be wrong or adjust his business strategy for the changes in the economy. While other retailers are slashing prices and increasing customer service A&F is cutting hours and putting more pressure on the already overworked store level management.
-People are considered to be this company's "greatest asset" but are generally treated like garbage. Managers are moved all over the country depending on where the greatest need is which is generally the northeast due high turnover due to the high cost of living and incredibly low pay. If you turn down transfers you end up being blacklisted and prevented from future promotions.
-TERRIBLE PAY. When you love your job pay is not much of a factor and for me that as true for several years. After a while, you realize that your yearly salary is easily made in your store on one good saturday in June. A&F's pay is definitely not competitive by any stretch of the imagination.
- Very little work-life balance. Company has a culture of ridiculous expectations and doesn't really care how you make them happen as long as you come in on hours. Since you are the only employee in the store whose hours don't count it usually means that the store manager works an incredible amount of hours every week just to keep up.
review_advice_mgmt: Quit while you are ahead. As long as A&F continues to treat it's employees so poorly it will never be successful in this new economy. Continue to expand internationally.

review_pros: Only Pro was that I met really nice people who also worked there
review_cons: Horrbile hours, horrible pay. Had to look like and have the same style as the Hollister "poster image"
review_advice_mgmt: Don't be so judgmental

review_title: Not a bad place to work
review_pros: They're extremely flexible with your schedule.  They work around your availabilty and even when you close its not that bad because you have an overnight team that comes in to fold down the store.
review_cons: the pay is below average compared to other retail stores.  Also, it tends to be like a clique sometimes.  Staying in the "look" can eat away at your paychecks, especially if you don't work alot of hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire less people so that the reps you have now can get decent hours.

review_pros: The great thing about Abercrombie is the discount. Everyone works there because it easy and you get a discount.
review_cons: They give you very minimal hours and treat employees as replaceable. As long as you go into it with the mentality that it's a part-time and you are expendable, you'll be fine. Don't put in more than you can get out.
review_advice_mgmt: You could really reduce your employee training costs, if you treated them better. This would reduce your turnover... but with the profit A&F is making, they probably don't care.

review_pros:
discount on clothes, if you like the clothing.
the people that work there 
looks good on resume
review_cons:
expected to work 40 hrs
claims its a salary job, but its really hourly
have to use own vehicle, money and gas to recruit what they think are "beautiful people."
allthe money you make pretty much goes back to the company.
review_advice_mgmt: get a life... outside of AnF

review_title: Good place to start a career but not so good long term
review_pros: You get a lot of experience with this company its a great place to kick start a career. The hours are not as bad as you would think... it is retail... so you know going into its not a 9-5 monday through friday place. .. but were talking no more then 45 hr weeks
review_cons: The constant critique and lack of positive reinforcement gets extremely tiring and makes you feel like they would be better off without you, it makes you want to look for something different. The way they treat their employees is literally disgusting... your talking about high school and early college teenagers that are being judged daily on their appearances, I have watched way too many people cry over it, and its not worth the tears.
review_advice_mgmt: My advice is to allow people without degrees who want the job be managers, it would take some of the weight off of everyone else and please stop being so harsh on young kids, ie dont post an audit that says models dont have beautiful faces for the model to then see, keep your opinions to yourselves.

review_pros:
- Great culture, fun environment (very laidback)
- Flexible hours and management is fairly lenient with time-off
- Employee discount and other perks
- At least with my store, very organized
review_cons:
- Low pay
- Forced to wear specific colors or clothing that accurate represents A&F's image
- No benefits for part-time employees
review_advice_mgmt: Cool beans

review_pros:
Set schedule, Monday-Friday, with weekends off.
Mandatory schedule is for closing everyday, but it can be flexible if you have school or another job etc. (Good for college students or someone with a busy schedule)
review_cons:
No room for advancement opportunities. Only bachelor's graduates are eligible for management positions. Therefore no matter how much effort or time you put into this position, no matter how well you do or how great your reviews are, there are no opportunities to be promoted if you don't have a bachelor's. This is the single position in any store and is the backbone of the stockroom and impact system, yet there isn't much compensation for playing an important part.

This is the only other full-time position besides management but treated like a part-timer. Although we do as much work as management, our pay is nowhere close, don't get raises when they do, and have no chances to get promoted.
review_advice_mgmt: Create a better system on your promotion and hiring policies and maybe the turnover rate wouldn't as ridiculous as it is.

review_pros: My co-workers were nice most of the time, of course there is gossip all over the place. Not many pros, I guess the discounts were ok. The only reason I took the job is cause it was the first offered to me at the time.
review_cons: The worst part was probably the management, because they didn't know what they were doing at all. There is no room to move up except to Lead Stock, any other position you can't get without a bachelor's degree, which is a total joke.
review_advice_mgmt: Advice I would give is to put more emphasis on talent, dedication, and those who take pride in their accomplishments, rather than simply falling back on good looks. There are a lot of above average looking people who could handle managing the stores better than more attractive people who don't have a clue about management.

review_pros: Discounted clothes if you like a&f. Nice home office.
review_cons: No work life balance. Unfair Job bidding system. It is a cult like environment.
review_advice_mgmt: It is not diversity if everyone has to try to be the same. If you are going to have a strong company culture, don't make it so strong that it stifles individual creativity that can be a contribution to the business.

review_pros: Good benefits; fast promotion if you are lucky; GREAT people/friends in stores
review_cons: Almost everyone in management is on a power trip (especially district managers) and don't know how to manage people effectively; lowwwww pay; high-stress; recruiting pretty people in the stores is the only way to get ahead (I'm not joking)
review_advice_mgmt: The company wonders why it has 100% turnover in management... but ask any manager that has been in the stores more than a few months and they will tell you that A&F does not treat their employees with respect and appreciation. The home office campus is AWESOME, but working in stores is pretty much hell. Fast promotion is great, but most of the time people are not ready for it and cannot lead, train and develop effectively. I will say, however, that I do not regret my time at A&F simply because of all the great friends I made (other SMs and AMs), and also because what doesn't kill you makes you stronger... and I have a pretty strong resume because of my experience at A&F.

review_title: Assistant Manager at Abercrombie & Fitch brands
review_pros: Relaxed work environment, younger crowd, no formal apparel necessary, simple tasks, great benefits plan, simple interview
review_cons: Terrible hours, low salary, little freedom to make your own decisions,
review_advice_mgmt: Try not to make the day to day activities of the job so cookie cutter.  Every day there is a print out called "The Program" and it literally spells out exactly what to do every single day.  There is no sense of accomplishment because you are treated like a child and are told what to do for every situation.  I am confident managers would prefer more flexibility within their own stores.

review_title: Not a bad place to make some extra cash
review_pros: The work is extremely easy, folding clothes for hours is not difficult. No interaction with customers, very relaxed work place.
review_cons: Long hours, management often pressured associates to stay past their scheduled hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Make corporate jobs more apparent, most of these kids are in college and can ad some benefit to the corporate ideas if they are removed from the store front

review_title: A good place for a part timer
review_pros:
Decent discounts
Flexible scheduling
Good pay rates- started above min. wage, and I got a raise in 6 months
Overall fun place to work, as long as you like house/trance music
review_cons: You work practically every Friday and Saturday, so be prepared to sacrifice any social life until 10pm. Also, unless you have more than 6 months under your belt, be prepared for management to not even remember your name. Not that its a big deal, they will just call you by zone anyway.
review_advice_mgmt: Just because you primarily employ high school and college students does not mean you can treat them as faceless drones.

review_title: Not the company for anyone who wants a real career
review_pros: Generous discount on the clothing, cheap gym, good benefits, casual work environment, excellent cafeteria, columbus, oh has cheap cost of living, competitive salary
review_cons:
- Work/life balance is non-existent.  I worked upwards of 70 hours some weeks and it was expected, not appreciated.  Associates feel guilty for working less than a 12 hour day.  The company expects associates to put the company first, their own well-being last.

- Poor senior level management.  Those who are up top don't know how to make decisions and their inability to either make a decision within a deadline, or their inability to stand behind their decisions are ultimately costing the company dearly.  There is a reason why the company is experiencing, to quote a yahoo finance article "eroding profit margins" and it is because numerous changes to financial strategy and to the product assortment and an unfocused and shaky big picture strategy for the future of the company.  This all stems from the inexperienced and immature senior management in the company.

- Corporate culture.  The company prides itself on hiring "nice, young, funny, smart" people.  They expect the campus to be a "diva-free zone,"   Mike Jeffries should read the company creed again. He is neither nice, young, funny, or smart and he is the epitome of a diva.  The corporate culture is one of extreme elitism, based upon the notion that A&F is a "cool and sexy" brand and therefore, the associates who work there are also "cool and sexy."  This creates a corporate culture no better than the cattiest high-school.  Fraternization with co-workers is encouraged, meetings are often conducted like a fraternity or a sorority meeting including inappropriate side discussions and humor.
review_advice_mgmt: There is a reason why the company is suffering financial right now, it is because the associates are deeply unhappy and frustrated with the way the company is run.  Senior management needs to trust, appreciate, and nurture their teams so that they are able to contribute and be heard in meetings.  Product development should NOT be a merchant role, EVERY OTHER COMPANY has a production team so the merchandising team can focus on building a strong product assortment.  The split focus of merchandising an product development is just a cheap way for the company to combine 2 jobs into 1 to save money.  Trust the merchants, trust the designers, and hire people OTHER than college grads, maybe someone with a background in fashion and not just another pretty frat boy?  And to Mike and Chad, every change you make to the line has a financial repercussion and every change you make means dollars in the toilet and your associates have to stay that much later.

review_title: Fun place to hang out and get paid!
review_pros: Working at Abercrombie and  Fitch  was a blast and a learning and growing exprence.  You leaarn the basics of running any store recruiting hours payroll.
review_cons: 4 year degree required to be in management that you never use.  You can't think for your self . you don't really control any aspect of the business.
review_advice_mgmt: Comunicate

review_pros: The people, that's it. The relationships that I made while working at A&F were awesome. They pride themselves on hiring cool, fun-loving people.
review_cons: Value system is completely off. I still can't believe the importance that is placed on looks with this company. I was made to take pictures of my employees, so that my boss and his colleagues could talk about each other's staff (their LOOKS) on a conference call. I was to be disciplined if they did not approve five boys and five girls I had hired.
review_advice_mgmt: I realize A&F has high standards so that they can seperate themselves from the competition, but listen to your lower management, don' t scold them like little children, and take the approach that things are never good enough.

review_pros: You get to know a lot of people and these people are for the most part really friendly towards new people.
review_cons: The biggest downside to working for this company is that you make minimum wage and that they dont give raises.
review_advice_mgmt: Most of the managers that I have had have a lot of respect for their associates and really appreciate the work they do.

review_title: a horrible, but fun job if you're not looking to work much
review_pros:
it is a fun place to meet new friends
the atmosphere is really chill and relaxed
you don't have to work much if you don't want to
managers rarely keep an eye on you, so you can do anything you want
review_cons:
the discount was horrible
the pay was horrible
very little to no breaks
little hours
review_advice_mgmt: managers need to give us more breaks and train us more, because other employees training us sometimes its wrong and later we get criticized for it

review_pros: You may luck out with great coworkers and managers. A discount on clothing is always great. You never leave work smelling bad!
review_cons: My manager would give fewer hours to people she didn't like. Luckily she liked me so I got hours but I did feel bad for those who obviously wanted/needed to work more to make money but weren't getting the hours. Also, the call-ins (is that what they were called?) an hour before you "might" have to work wasn't fun.
review_advice_mgmt: Not really sure...

review_pros: fun co-workers, good benefits, strong promotional opportunities for top performers.
review_cons: terrible pay and hrs with unrealistic expectations.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat your lower level management with more respect.  Take half of the ceo's bonus from last year and you could have saved all of the jobs cut in 2009 for years.  Ceo took 20+ million dollar bonus from 2008 when stocks went from 75$ to 15$.  He was also given 4 MILLION stock shares! He runs a smart business and is a good CEO on the business side, but he sets a horrible example of corporate greed and spending (1 million$ spent on his 'corporate' jets gas in 2007). Start giving back Mike.

review_pros: i've worked here for about six months, and its good overall. The work environment is fun and fast paced. Managers are always helpful.
review_cons: The call ins were annoying. They almost never call you to work, but you have to plan around it. The pay is basically minimum wage. The length of the shifts were too short.
review_advice_mgmt: Raise the wages and give us more shifts and make them longer! Actually use us for the call ins or give us less of them!

review_title: I love working at Abercrombie & Fitch.  It's like a really big family.  It's very professional and laid back.
review_pros: Abercrombie & Fitch offers great benefits to their managers and managers in training.  They really give you room to grow within the company.
review_cons: They go through a lot of employees.  The associates are all 16 and 17 year olds that only get to work about 10 hours a week.
review_advice_mgmt: I'm not a huge fan of calling the sales associates "models".  It's very demeaning to people who don't have what we call "the look".  I understand the need to have attractive employees because of the fact that we don't advertise, but sometimes it is just too hurtful to the people that would like to apply, but can't get the chance.

review_pros: Very flexible with scheduling if you need this as a little job to make some extra money.
review_cons: Loud music. no room for growth or raises. management horrible with what they do. Focuses more on numbers than their employees.
review_advice_mgmt: Raises every 6 months especially when employees are great workers. Focus more on employees than numbers. This is why many employees leave within 3 months of working here.

review_pros: Very energetic place to work with some great people. High profile company that is attractive to the customers. Very loyle customers.
review_cons: Main criteria for promotional opportunites, many times depends on the associates physical appearance more than thier ability to run a good store or thier talent level.
review_advice_mgmt: The clothes are the same style of clothes that the company has been putting out for years. Mix it up a little more.

review_title: It's not the worst job in the world.
review_pros:
-Most of your co-workers are a blast to work with.
-Really flexible hours.
-Very casual atmosphere.
-The clothing discount.
-You can transfer from store to store.
review_cons:
-The pay sucks.
-No raises.
-No other benefits other than the merchandise discount.
-Look policy. You have to be wearing clothes from the brand you work at to get hours. Even though look policy clearly says that you don't have to buy A&F clothing, you really do.
-Most employees have no respect for good customer service.
review_advice_mgmt: Get rid of the distinction between impactors and models. The store would run much better if everyone knew how to do everything. A pay raise for the good employees wouldn't hurt either.

review_pros: The best part about this job are the people. Theyre the reason you end up leaving the company 2 years later than you should have. Discount is decent and management promotions happen pretty fast (assuming you meet the criteria)
review_cons: Promotions are based solely on physical appearance, so youre leadership abilities will go unrecognized. The "program" tells you how to run things. Pay is HORRIFIC and you cant make a career out of the company because they want young people in the stores. You also have to have a 4 year degree which will serve no purpose while there.
review_advice_mgmt: Promote based on management abilities! Fortunately I was able to be promoted up, but a lot of talented people were left out.

review_title: What's good is good, what is bad is very very bad.
review_pros:
- You meet a lot of people.
- They will hire you without any previous management experience and train you from the ground up. 
- Great medical benefits. 
- Decent clothing discount, however no discount on sale items.  
- Young, social environment.
review_cons:
Our store had about 80 employees and 3 full time managers (1 Store Manager and 2 Assistants).  The brand reps (sales associates) were paid minimum wage and were not given very many hours. My main problem with this was that training process was difficult for brand reps because they would forget how to do basic tasks like run the cash register since it had been a week since their last 5 hour shift.  That combined with the low pay created a high turnover of employees making management difficult.  I would have preferred to have fewer employees with higher wages who worked longer hours.  

Managers are salaried.  You are scheduled to work 45 hours per week with a 1 hour lunch break, so plan on being at work for at least 50 hours per week.  You are discouraged from working overtime, and if you do you get half hourly pay (that is less than minimum wage).  During the holidays you are expected to work a 6 day week, without bonus or extra pay.  

One of the more difficult tasks is the recruitment part.  You are required to recruit people that come into the store to work there.  Specifically, attractive people.  There is a very strong emphasis on appearance, so the company hires the most attractive people possible, even though they are not the best candidate for a position.
review_advice_mgmt: I understand that the company is using young inexperienced employees to keep the image of the company young and sexy, but it makes management very difficult and results in high turnover for both associates and management.  I would have stayed with the company if they had a better management model.

review_pros: You work with people your own age and the management team is laid-back most of the time. The work atmosphere can be fun as well
review_cons: The discount is horrible, only 20%, and you are strongly encouraged to where the brand. On a meager wage and limited work hours, this is almost impossible.
review_advice_mgmt: Increasing the store discount, hiring less incompetent workers, and creating a manageable space for employees to take breaks would help the impact team a lot.

review_pros: Discounts are pretty much the only general perk. Everything else doesnt hold a candle to getting paid seven dollars an hour. the people are pretty cool and customers are engaging.
review_cons: Management is poor and there is no opportunity to break from the stretch of seven dollars an hours. what is one to do?
review_advice_mgmt: Actually like your job and that will reflect down upon the rest of the staff and the general morale of the team

review_pros: decent discount, and added discounts with new season
review_cons: Employees are hired based on appearance., and where you work in the store is based upon it.  clothing is poor quality and not worth the higher price.  A & F zippers are notorious for breaking.  Managers are constantly moved from store to store, never any consistency.
review_advice_mgmt: regroup, there is a reason you are one of the most hated companies in America.  Clothing is poor quality for the price.

review_title: Snooty pointless job, gives me a headache...
review_pros:
15% clothes discount
you sometimes get paid to walk around and just act like a model, but it gets old quick
review_cons:
-annoying, loud trance music eventually will give you a headache.
-only allowed to wear certain colors of makeup and nailpolish
-overall bitchy, snooty atmosphere
-the pay sucks and there is pretty much no room for advancement within the company
review_advice_mgmt: turn the music down a tad, encourage leadership and a happier team.  offer stocks or more company advancement and more employee involvement

review_pros: Easy tasks, laid back environment, can be fun
review_cons: Minimum wage, raise only occurs annually, must have a bachelor's degree in order to receive any promotion within the company, only 5-10 hours scheduled a week
review_advice_mgmt: Sometimes upper level management expects too much out of its employees, for example they expect the store to look perfect ever after a busy weekend or holiday, which is nearly impossible with only 3 employees working. Also, hire less employees and give the ones with more experience the hours that they deserve.

review_pros: As an assistant you learn skills necessary for the working world at large.  There is rapid advancement opportunities as well.
review_cons: The amount of responsibility beyond the assistant position is immense.  Training for the position in terms of managing your assistants is non-existent.  All of your subordinates whether you are on shift are your responsibility.  The philosophy of the corporation is to push responsibility down hill, which can be exhausting.  The rapid advancement has a double edge.  Often times you are left with inadequate staffing to fill gaps due to promotion and turn over.
review_advice_mgmt: Develop means to hold district manager positions accountable.

review_title: Good starting point for new college grads
review_pros:
- Fun people to work with (at least at my location)
- Good starting point job for new college grads - MITs (manager in training) just need a bachelor's degree, I'd never worked retail before
review_cons:
- Got boring quickly - I only stayed for 2 months, and felt I'd already learned everything I could learn within the store. Gets to be very monotonous, same tasks over and over again.
- Horribly loud music!
- The work schedule was awful - Five 10 hour days, and I wouldn't know my schedule for the following week until Tuesday or Wednesday of the week before. The shifts bounced back and forth from early mornings to late nights, made keeping a social life pretty impossible.
review_advice_mgmt: Not sure what advice I would give! I did love my bosses and the people I worked with, but retail in itself was horribly boring for me. Not much you can do about that :)

review_pros: The people!! You will meet the most interesting people ever! Plus you get to wear ripped up jeans and flip flops to work.
review_cons: Way too much focus on recruiting. Favortism to the attractive workers. The pay kinda sucks and you really don't get raises. You need a four year degree to be a manager (it doesn't matter what your degree is in) and be attractive. Promotions seem to be based on who can recruit the most attractive people to "work" in the stores.
review_advice_mgmt: Abercrombie and Fitch and is a business and business survive on making money, not having hot people working in the store.

review_title: great company to work for to learn the retail industry
review_pros: Teaches you how to run an effective business and improves your work ethic
review_cons: difficult to move up in the company. unfair promotional strategies
review_advice_mgmt: encourage your employees more and give positive feedback regularly

review_pros:
Flexible hours
good to work here if you already wear the brand
work as little or as much as you want
review_cons:
shallow 
based on looks not talent
not so good if you want a full time job with lots of hours
have to work at least one friday or sat night
review_advice_mgmt: i was a brand rep. or model and a college student so there really wasn't any talk what so ever about advancement

review_title: An amazing experience because of what you go through on a day to day basis to reach the end goals.
review_pros: The people and recruiting is top-notch.  It's a fast pace work environment that helps you develop to handle stressful situations.
review_cons: Company goals are somewhat out of reach, and fast-pace life-style can burn people out quickly.
review_advice_mgmt:
Strong leaders even though most are a
 young work force

review_pros: Its an easy place to work where you can meet a lot of young people. The amount of employees they have working at any given time make it so that you can basically get any day off that you want. All in all its a great job to have during college for extra money.
review_cons: The pay is minimum wage, and it doesn't really ever get better than that. The managers are very touch and go as far as quality is concerned. What i mean is that sometimes a manager comes in and they are awesome to work with and know how to manage people. Other times the managers are completely clueless as to how delegating duties is suppose to work.
review_advice_mgmt: If you are a manager at Hollister the biggest piece of advice i would have is... Be friendly but understand its still a business that needs to be run, its work and you are not there to just hang out and do nothing.

review_pros: Very flexible with school schedule, never question requested time off,  great manager and co-workers, over all easy going place to be employed.  Great place to work when in high school or college.
review_cons: Low pay and no opportunities for promotion, some of my friends have been working there for 3 years and are still making minimum. Discount not that generous.  My manager is really nice but I think at other stores managers can be very rude and superficial.  Atmosphere is very teeny bopper so not a place for everyone.
review_advice_mgmt: To acknowledge hard working employees by giving them proper raises and wages. For head office to not be so flaky as well ( my manager has had interviews canceled on him a few times for potential positions in head office because head office "forgot").

review_pros: Great benefits, great HR experience, You are not confined to a desk, wear jeans to work, job security, good overall first job
review_cons: pay, opportunity to move up depends on willingness to relocate,the company expects a lot in a small amount of time and when you are depending on 18 year olds....
review_advice_mgmt: increase pay to reduce turnover

review_pros:
- Flexible Scheduling
- Great Discount/Clothing
- Relaxed enviornment
- Build retail skills that will last a lifetime
-  Potential to move up
review_cons:
- Lack of Hours in Down Season
- Can get very busy (popular store)
- Look policy (have to look a certain way, every shift)
review_advice_mgmt: Understand your employees needs, pay attention to the policies and set an example for your employees and they will respect you.

review_pros: 30% discount off of the clothes at Abercrombie & Fitch and Abercrombie Kids.  If you're in high school or college, you work with people that are your age.
review_cons: It is like high school.  Very gossipy and catty.  If you are serious about your job, this is not the place to work.
review_advice_mgmt: Show more respect to your employees.  At my store, the manages went out partying with some of the employees- and those employees usually got raises and more hours, which is not fair.

review_title: The people are the reason you stay so long
review_pros:
-great people
-fun environment
-lots of responsibility right out of school
-sophisticated systems in the stockroom unlike other retailers are a great learning tool
review_cons:
-inflexible schedule (lots and lots of blackout periods for vacations)
-extremely long hours with no overtime
-really bad discount (things are usually on sale for less than employee discount)
-District and Regional Managers rarely visit, don't spend enough time with people running the stores
-pushed to recruit on days off without pay
-opportunities for advancement are always talked about but rarely ever happen
review_advice_mgmt:
Be honest with your Store Management.
Can't rely on the same tired strategy you've been using for years, as poor sales are reflective of this.

review_pros: casual work environment, low cost of living in columbus, young energetic work force, tons of exposure and opportunity from day one.
review_cons: very young inexperience work force that is not focused on management or development.  columbus is a difficult city in which to live.
review_advice_mgmt: dissemination of communication is a HUGE concern.  Employees are not marching down the same path, and do not feel empowered to run their businesses.

review_title: I wouldn't recommend...was fun but is not a great career move.
review_pros: work is fun, most of the people are young and easy to get along with, you are promoted if you do well and have a great personality
review_cons:
you have to work 10 hour shifts and do not get overtime
salary is very low compared to other retailers
you do not get much feedback
review_advice_mgmt: management should value their employees. pay them a little more and work them less.

review_title: It is a low-paying part-time job.
review_pros: Easy role, fun people to work with, able to work as much or as little as you want (at least in my role)
review_cons: Terrible pay, no motivation to work, management seemed stuck in a rat race.
review_advice_mgmt: Find a way to motivate your middle managers.

review_title: People Manager is my technical job title.  Im in charge of creating schedules, hiring, training, and recruiting.
review_pros: It is a very fun atmosphere to work in, the staff is seemingly all great and energetic... Its a good environment.
review_cons: The hours are strenuous and the work is tough and not as rewarding as I had originally thought it would be.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't take angry customers personally.  Be prepared for long hours. One of my days off is Tuesday, and I close every Monday until at least 11pm, then have to be back at the store at 8am on Tuesday for management meeting (on my day off).

review_pros:
- Fun, outgoing enviroment
- Know whats expected of you, and detailed position
- Build solid long lasting relationships
- Good benefits 
- Comfortable work attire, even at higher management... jeans and shirt with flip flops or casual shoes
- Touch base with your District Manager once a week, rarely see higher rank though (+/-)
- Everything runs out of home office, so you always have or order what you need with fast turn around
review_cons:
- Pay is sub-par for having a four year degree
- Manage retail with 17 and 18 year old kids; remember high school? Same thing.
- Discount isn't that great, neither are the clothes
- Stressful quarterly floorsets and retail holiday, one overnight week a year for some positions
- Often poor communication and knowledge run through home office into stores
- Expected a lot of little jobs, with little time and reward to complete
- All about looks and recruiting
- Not enough man power to cover the size of the store, week ending hours are critiqued
review_advice_mgmt: 4 year degree, natural look, fashionable, outgoing, confident not cocky, respectful, aspirational, responsible, and able to manage others fairly. Otherwise, rather easy to pick up as you go.

review_pros: Was able to become a manager with a college education and no sales experience.
review_cons: Pay was very low, hours were long, had to work nights and weekends, wasnt able to take any time off in first 6 months
review_advice_mgmt: Loosen up vacation rescrictions and increase pay to make it more compairable to other entry level jobs

review_pros: The company provides excellent health care and benefits for its employees and most of my co workers were great people that I enjoyed working with.
review_cons: My experience with management has been very poor. I was intentionally mislead during my interview process and several other times during my career with A & F. The job itself is extremely monotonous and there is very little incentive to perform well. A & F touts performance based promotion from within; however, in my experience I have seen something much different. Promotions I have witnessed tend to go to people with seniority that have formed a bond with their superiors regardless of their performance. I strongly suggest that you speak at length with someone within the company before you take this position.
review_advice_mgmt: Become more flexible, accept feedback from employees. Be much more transparent. I was frequently moved from position to position without explanation. Certainly some of this was my fault for not requesting an explanation, but the company needs to focus on eliminating deceit and corruption.

review_pros:
Hours
People
The opportunity to be promoted from this position to a managerial level.  Most need a degree to do this, but a few employees working there I knew had been promoted from the Brand Rep position
review_cons:
Dealing with unruly customers
If you're manager thought he/she was running some sort of private equity firm and not a laid back, retail store with the music blasting, catered to tweens.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't change; it's all about the label when you're sitting in Mrs. Featherbottom's 3rd hour english period.

review_pros:
Fun place to work and very laid back environment 
Great first job to learn and gain management experience
Will develop your people skills by a million
Everyday has a daily checklist that allows you to monitor and keep up with what needs to be done. Which makes your job easier and eliminates the guessing
review_cons:
Not everyone is treated the same
Looks play a huge role in things
Expect to much to be done with little resources
Promotions not based on how a store is run, but rather the kids you have
Not a team atmosphere, everyone likes to make themselves look good
In a constant soap opera with young adults
Pay and bonuses not sufficient
review_advice_mgmt: Treat others how you would like to be treated! I had the opportunity to work under some great managers and district managers however not everyone is your friend when it boils down to it

review_pros: Discount, sometimes free clothes, energetic and interesting people, good sales experience, and flexible scheduling. Typically easy to transfer and work in different stores.
review_cons: Pay is low, hiring bias, music is often played too loud.
review_advice_mgmt: Go back to advertising the sales role as "brand representative," I feel the "model" title is misleading and obnoxious given that you have real models for the flagship stores. Employ the use of decibel readers and adjust the music volume accordingly, on average, part-time employees worked five hours straight and music levels in stores I worked at and visited were often too loud for that period of time (90db in one case).

review_pros: I met alot of people that I can say that are going to be in my life for the long run. Hours were ok. They usually scheduled you based on your availablility. Taking time off was easy and usually approved if you do it in a reasonable amount of time.
review_cons: Managers were immature, rude and played the favorites game. Respect and compassion were non-existant.
review_advice_mgmt: Recognize the hard work of your subbordinates. Treat them the way you would like to be treated and show them respect.

review_pros: Easy work and also the ability to use your discount to purchase items you would normally have to pay full price for.
review_cons: Long hours especially during 3 periods; the holidays always bring in large crowds who usually mess the store up quite well, inventory time involving counting every single article of clothing in the store, and floor sets involving moving every article of clothing on the store floor
review_advice_mgmt: No real advice to management, the turnover rate is high as the majority of employees are high school seniors and college students who view the job as an easy means to make spending money and don't plan on making a career out of the work.

review_pros: discount is nice, benefits are excellent and very reasonable cost to associate
review_cons: work life balance isn't good.  some people are very over worked while others can get away with doing almost nothing. some people have time to surf the web 75% of their day looking up news articles and at shoe sales. then there is the larger group who work very hard, have high expectations of their own and overwhelmed by assignments placed on them by management simply because they have a good work ethic.
review_advice_mgmt: just because you may not care about your work/life balance, don't think your associates feel the same. keep your associates informed of what is happening within the organization

review_pros:
-fantastic health benefits and depending on when you start, you can get 2 weeks of vacation your first year
-decent discount 
-they dont mind if you don't have previous management experience
-everyone starts at the same point (Manager-in-training) and then you get the opportunity to work your way up in the company.
-very structured (if you like that)
review_cons:
-if you dont like recruiting then you probably arent going to move anywhere in the company and is often even put ahead of customer service
-the senior management cares more about how attractive the people who work in your store are to your sales
-practically no work life balance
-the compensation is very low for what you are putting in
-very very very structured (if you dont' like that)
review_advice_mgmt: Please remember that we deserve to have a personal life too. Sales would increase if we kept our focus in the store and hiring competent employees instead of people that look like they could have walked out of the marketing.

review_pros: Shifts are short, lots of people work there so there are people to take your shifts if you have a conflict. Work is easy - folding clothes
review_cons: The loud music, retail is a bit boring in general, the "taglines' you have to say are a bit awkward.
review_advice_mgmt: Allow more opportunities for raises/promotions, and I would personally do further research into the taglines because some of them just make customers feel awkward.

review_pros: The discount is good and the job can be fun with the "right" manager.
review_cons: Long hours standing around doing absolutely nothing. On days when store traffic is low, they normally schedule too many employees. They have "fixing" tables and walls that are perfect for no reason at all. You have to get there extremely early to clean the store that people who closed, stay late have already done.
review_advice_mgmt: Appreciate the sales reps and don't talk down to them. Most of us are college kids just trying to get by. Don't schedule too many people, that way we don't end up standing around for 6 hours doing absolutely nothing.

review_pros: It was a flexible and laid back job atmosphere.
review_cons: The managers were not organized.
review_advice_mgmt: They need to be more organized.

review_title: it was great when it was a college job HORRIBLE when i decided to make it a career
review_pros:
-you move up fast (as long as you have a college degree)
-a pretty decent discount 
- you make some great friends around the U.S.
review_cons:
-busy doing 'busy' work like spraying the store with perfume
-district manager has  no respect for anyone.
-told to put unworthy people in the back and by unworthy i mean looks
-understaffed. would work 7 days a week and some of those days started at nine and didn't end till eleven at night.
review_advice_mgmt: I think you should really consider treating your managers with respect. I think you should think about not expecting them to work LONG HORRIBLE HOURS.

review_pros: The people that work at A&F are great.  A lot of really talented people that for the most part work hard to do a good job.
review_cons: There is a lot of finger pointing that goes on.  All areas of the company are afraid to accept blame because they are fearful of facing the wrath of Mike.  The work/life balance is awful, and the company isn't taking steps to improve this.
review_advice_mgmt: Listen to the employees and start paying attention to the turnover.  Pointing fingers doesn't solve anything.  People need to start working together, not looking for ways blame another area of the company.

review_title: Its an okay for a part time job
review_pros: Easy, fun, discount on clothes.
review_cons: No recognition, no advancement, not enough hours per week
review_advice_mgmt: Ability to become a manager would be nice, so would being able to work up to and past 20 hours a week regularly

review_title: Great place to work...if it's your first part time job.
review_pros:
Stress-free Job
Discount
Easy Work
Nice People
...The Clothes!
review_cons:
Minimum Wage
Average of 1 shift per week and 4 "call-ins", they said in the in interview that call-ins were 50/50, it is more like never.
review_advice_mgmt: Please hire more competent management, it is not that hard to work in retail.

review_pros: relaxed, casual working environment / atmosphere.
review_cons:
low salary, respect, work/life balance, 
very high turnover, general dissatisfaction among associates
casual atmosphere also invades areas/departments which deem more professionalism, including HR and LP.
review_advice_mgmt: resign

review_title: Zero opportunity for career advancement unless you stick around making terrible money for years and years
review_pros: Pretty laid back and you get some decent training. If you're lucky you can work with some fun people and there's the opportunity to transfer.
review_cons: Poor pay, poor promotion opportunities, illogical promotion metrics. Hours are unsociable, spent months and months in a position that didn't give me a weekend day off and only one full day off a week. Overtime paid at half-normal pay.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more ! Managers are horrible underpaid compared to the rest of the industry. Open up channels for manager feedback to home office.

review_pros: there was a pretty decent employee discount and it was really easy to get the job. didn't have to do a lot of work while on the clock.
review_cons: very anal about dress code - they say it's ok not to wear abercrombie brand clothing but the managers will tell you off if you don't wear abercrombie brands at work. also, no makeup is allowed (at least at my store) and i had an industrial piercing that they made me take off for work. i guess it goes with the store image, but they still didn't leave room for individuality. everybody is supposed to look like the only store they ever shop at is abercrombie.
review_advice_mgmt: be more supportive of the team, also, follow corporate regulations regarding the dress code.

review_pros: really flexible hours, if you worked in back you got to see what was coming out first and also could raid the clearance bays
review_cons: the discount was okay, but i didn't really fit into the styles for the AAA discount. i mainly bought clearance. also i did more work than my moneys worth
review_advice_mgmt: offer raises of even 10 cents to those who work really hard. Broaden the AAA discount to a few more choices. and fire the lazy bums

review_title: Good job for just out of college
review_pros: Easy to get hired, fun environment.
review_cons: Lack of support from upper management
review_advice_mgmt: Treat your employees like people.

review_title: Abercrombie and Fitch is a fun job if you are young but it's not much beyond that
review_pros: I like working at abercrombie because I met alot of other people my age, made new friends, and it overall had a laid back and fun atmosphere.
review_cons: When I worked there we had to buy certain shirts, jeans, colors, etc. It was annoying because I found it hard to save money.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't focus so much on "colors" when choosing what the employees should wear. I think Blue was abercrombies "color" for years, and there should be more variety.

review_title: You don't need a college degree to run a store
review_pros: The store is very laid back, the employees are what make working there worthwhile! Some flexibility in schedules. Able to wear casual clothes.
review_cons: Feels like you're regressing once you leave college to work in a high school type atmosphere. The recruiting goals is what makes the company most vain. Managers should not be graded on recruiting attractive candidates to work in stores. Confidentiality is consistently compromised between district managers and subordinates.
review_advice_mgmt: Think about where you want to be in 5 to 10 years from now. If you can see yourself growing with the company and think that you may enjoy it, then I say go for it!

review_pros: easy job and  pretty mindless, also a variety of tasks, you will be on your feet not just sitting at a desk.
review_cons: horrible hours, incompetent employees, irritating district managers, other managers think that the job is the best job in the world
review_advice_mgmt: no words

review_pros: It is a fun environment to work in depending on the other managers and associates around you, great benefits, and is easy to relocate with this company.
review_cons: Promotions seem a little unfair and not based on performance but based on upper management favorites. The salary is also not great.
review_advice_mgmt: Management at the corporate office needs to keep a closer eye on what is really going on in the stores.

review_pros: Great Discounts, Many new faces
review_cons: Awful pay, loud and obnoxious young managers, all younger, incompetent individuals
review_advice_mgmt: No Leadership

review_title: Fun at first...until you get to know the company.
review_pros: Good insurance, Great people you will learn to multi-task and think on your feet.
review_cons: The company is ran like it is a cult. They are superficial and have no morals.  Run away.
review_advice_mgmt: The company is superficial and has no morals. Home office sits in ohio unaware of what actually goes on in the stores.

review_pros: my coworkers have become some of my best friends. without them, i certainly would not have stayed with this job as long as i did.
review_cons:
terrible pay. 
hiring and promotion based on good looks and kissing ass. 
upper level management is a nightmare to deal with.
discount is terrible.
having to maintain the "look" keeps you as poor as you were before you took the job.
review_advice_mgmt: quit.

review_pros: It is a very simple job that requires little to no previous experience and is generally an enjoyable place to work for the first few months.
review_cons: Work and coworkers can get monotonous, music is overplayed, customers are not always the most enjoyable. The position requires some sacrifice in terms of time as scheduling is poor.
review_advice_mgmt: Ensure managers are not only qualified but are individuals that are fun to work with and interact with. More theft protection.

review_pros: fun working environment, laid back coworkers, discounts, flexible work hours, good job for high school.college student, opportunity to advance in the company
review_cons: management tends to be young fresh out of college that can be difficult to work for over demanding and bad communication skills
review_advice_mgmt: working on management communication skills with subordinates and maintaining consistency in store appearance and  operation, work harder on recruiting process

review_pros: Company allows you to have very flexible hours and makes it easy to work around other jobs and school schedules.
review_cons: The compensation received was low.  It was tough to earn a decent paycheck.  Sometimes the customers can get be aggravating.
review_advice_mgmt: To be a good manager you have to be in touch with all of your employees and make sure that you keep the hard works and reward them best as can.

review_title: Great place to work for a first job.
review_pros: It is a great place to work as a first job or a little spending money. It teaches you your basic skills of working and is a great place to learn customer service. Its a fun place to work and is not difficult at all.
review_cons: The downsides would be that it pays minimum wage and that there are not really any advancements without a 4 year degree. There is also not many opportunities for raises.
review_advice_mgmt: Team work needs to be improved. Make the employees feel like adults and don't treat them as if they are kids.

review_pros: You get to go to job and see good looking people. Discounts are okayyy
review_cons: NO eyeliner. Very rude management. The bosses take there job tooo seriously. the pay is aweful. aweful  headaches from the music. no nail polish. must wear all hollister clothing. the discount is 20 percent considering the fact that you have to wear all of their clothes. They have crazy policies. VERRRYYYY image oriented.
review_advice_mgmt: need to be nicer

review_pros: Great people and great work environment, it's an easy job, fun place to work, discount on clothing, very flexible scheduling
review_cons: Paid minimum wage, very limited opportunities for advancement without a college degree, not enough hours because there are so many employees
review_advice_mgmt: Managers should be hired based on prior experience and the benefits they can bring to the company regardless of whether or not they have a college degree

review_title: Why would you want to work here?
review_pros: I'd say hollister is a good place to work because they hire basically everyone who applies. They had 62 employees at my store, where only 5 or 6 were required to run the store.
review_cons: They don't let you know your schedule, they force you to drive in to know when you work, they also give some employees between 2 and 5 hours of work per week after saying they will give you more. Also: you get one unpaid 15 minute break for lunch only when you work 5 hours or more. At times, you stand in an empty fitting room for 4 hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Go get a job somewhere where employees are measured in quality rather than quantity.

review_pros: Fun and fast paced environment, good growth opportunity, decent discount on the clothing line, pretty flexible on schedule, little to no responsiblity.
review_cons: still some evidence of discrimination, feel like I'm being hired merely to meet a quota and not because of a genuine desire of the skills I can provide.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more hands on with the management team at a store level.  Encourage more diversity training for the staff as a whole.

review_title: management shows no respect for the hourly worker and what it takes to do the job
review_pros: warehouse is a clean place to work,hourly workers are very friendly
review_cons: warehouse workers are considered do be replaceable shown no respect
review_advice_mgmt: should hold regular meetings with hourly workers to discuss problems

review_title: Ok for a couple of years.
review_pros: The people that you work with are young and it's a beautiful campus to work within.  It's a high-fast paced job.
review_cons: The senior management are also your same age and do not have much maturity.  Many times decisions are made based on emotion and not based on sound judgment.
review_advice_mgmt: I would challenge the leadership team to stop making judgments based on favoritism as well as emotions versus sound judgment.

review_pros: Fun people to work with, fun environment, excellent benefits, easy job
review_cons: Although the job is easy, you have to work your butt off for a very low salary.  Managing the employees is more like babysitting a bunch of high school spoiled brats.  The better looking you are, the faster you get promoted.
review_advice_mgmt: Increase salary

review_pros:
Easy job to get right out of college. 
Fair benefits package.
Employee discounts.
Relaxed atmosphere depending on where you're placed in the country
review_cons:
Impossible standards for work performance.
Constant lack of competent associates/pti, focus is put on looks/diversity which leaves no room for real indicators of job performance (ie job experience)
review_advice_mgmt: Focus more on the quality of the employee. Looks and diversity are great but mean nothing if the store can't run.

review_pros: The best part about it was the flexibility.  Since there are a lot of employees working there (most in high school), you can pick and choose when and how much you want to work.  I worked there for 2 years, so I got a lot of hours, but there was no problem with getting time off or having to work around my school schedule.
review_cons: I was very disappointed when I came back from my freshman year of college to work.  They had taken me off the employee list, mainly to deprive me of my raise (employees automatically get a small raise after a year of service).  I had to reapply and start again at minimum wage.  There was also some controversy on the type of employees who received the most hours.  Those who were the best looking were given hours, while those who weren't didn't get a chance to work.  Although it is not technically discrimination against a race, gender, religion, etc, it is still obviously unethical.
review_advice_mgmt: At my time there, I saw many managers come and go.  There was only one manager that was there when I started who is still there.  Some only lasted a month or so.  I would have liked to see better store managers.

review_title: Fun Place to Work Once You Don't Care
review_pros: It seemed like a fun atmosphere and could be if you made it one. Discounts on clothing were also nice.
review_cons:
Terrible hours (100 plus a few weeks)
Common Sense didn't seem to exist
Expected to work at least 6 days a week
DM was an unreasonable and never had anything good to say including saying one "kid" was ugly and needed to be fired in front of the "kid"
review_advice_mgmt: Totally understand keeping the imagine up and have no problem with that but a little tact has to be used when dealing with employees. Also, AF needs to work on getting to know DM's, ours was horribly negative.

review_pros: The discount on clothes and mostly seeing all of my friends walking into the store. It was a good job for a day then after one bad experience it just kept on getting worse.
review_cons: Management was bad. The managers looked at employees as worthless, some managers didn't do this though. It depended on who was the manager on duty that day how good your day was going to be.
review_advice_mgmt: Management needs to kow when to back off employees because making them feel worthless is not a good way to get things done around the store. It just created a bad atmosphere.

review_title: Good place to work as a starting job
review_pros: If you already wear A&F clothes like I do, working here will give you a %30 discount and it's super easy. You get to mingle with customers and fold clothes and meet similar people with common interests. They tell you that you do not have to wear A&F clothes to work there.
review_cons: The only downside is making minimum wage. But the people and the atmosphere makes up for it and it's more like hanging out with your friends, rather than working sometimes.
review_advice_mgmt: I think if Management makes more money, they would be a lot more happier and not complain as much as they do.

review_pros:
flexible working hours and days
although there is an official minimum compulsory number of days which you are expected to work each week (2 days), it is easy to renegotiate if your spare time becomes limited
team leader positions are filled by existing staff, so there is opportunity to work upwards
review_cons:
cannot achieve a higher level than team leader without a degree, even though there is no specific subject or grade requirement, making it questionable how necessary a degree is
serious cutbacks during the recession resulted in less and less employees being called in each day, meaning that those of us there were called in were having to do the work of 2/3 people, that's if we were even called in
the "impact" and "overnight" teams were treated like second class citizens not only by the employees of other teams but also by the management
review_advice_mgmt: Need to ensure that members of the different teams are being treated fairly, also need to reassess how important it is that the department managers have degrees

review_pros: Nice community of people to work with. Depending on where you work, you'll either like it or hate it but I loved it.
review_cons: The store stinks of overwhelming cologne. Store employees need to be checked often for theft. Can never leave the store.
review_advice_mgmt: Management should think about killing the cologne smell in the store although its a staple its making everyone sick.. really

review_pros: good salary, good benefits, cheap to live in ohio, a good place to learn a lot about mass market designing
review_cons: long hours, no creativity, people obsess about things that have little importance in the long run, in terms of design they are more concerned with how the store looks than the product that fills it.  Way too much politics that gets in the way of everything.
review_advice_mgmt: Times change and fashion changes and as a company Abercrombie has not evolved.  They are doing the same things they were doing 10 years ago.

review_pros: Employee discount is ok, you only need to work 1 shift a week to utilize it.  Laid Back direct management
review_cons: Schedule changes are abundant. High turnover, laid back direct management. All the employees are high schoolers/college students, workplace fraternization, awful hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Take a more active roll in eliminating workplace drama, create a uniform schedule for employees, treat employees like they are more valuable.

review_pros: Amazing folks. Young, fun and dynamic place to work. Lots of opportunity for advancement. Overall a great first job out of college.
review_cons: Although the people are great, it is a very demanding position, with lots of stress and looong hours. The learning curvebis steep, but if you are up to the challenge it is rewarding both personally and professionally.
review_advice_mgmt: Design changes are crippling the brand. Last-minute changes to product at the expense of inefficiency and excessive costs is not fiscally responsible. There is the need to maintain brand equity and quality in the product. But frequent minor detail changes for the sake of personal preference or daily whims cause serious long-term development issues.

review_title: Overall an alright place to work. You cannot be manager no matter how long you've been there if you do not have a BA.
review_pros: Impact team members get the chance to listen to different types of music in the stock room instead of listening to the floor play list all day.
review_cons: No chance of being promoted to manager unless you have a Bachelors Degree
review_advice_mgmt: Be more understanding and compassionate toward the employees, they have lives too. STOP writing them up for every single little thing.

review_pros: The people you work with are a lot of fun, there is always someone willing to cover a shift. Taking time off is really easy.
review_cons: Fun place to work with a bunch of fun people, but sometimes it can turn into a lot of drama. Put together a ton of 20 year olds and drama is inevitable.
review_advice_mgmt: Try to respect your employees and realize that we do work hard while having fun.

review_pros: The only positive thing I can say about Abercrombie & Fitch is that I have made some really great friends through the many stores I have worked in. That's pretty much it.
review_cons: Everything from how low your pay is to dealing with angry customers on a daily basis is a con for A&F. There are so many things about this company that I do not agree with and so many things I wish I could change. To work for this place you have to be driven, motivated and willing to work 24/7. Forget enjoying your weekends, because you don't have any. Forget sleeping, because you don't get to. Infact, forget really having any form of a social life while you are here because they work you to death to the point where you're too exhausted to do anything after work besides sleep!
