review_cons: Constant music, too much cologne, and incompetent management.
review_advice_mgmt: Take time to really understand what it takes to work in this environment.

review_title: Great place to learn product development
review_pros: Fast track in learning product management, great systems, vibrant, driven culture, great pay
review_cons: NO work life balance, mediocre middle management, NO work life balance, lack of professionalism
review_advice_mgmt: Appreciate your employees for the work they do and offer positive and negative feedback in a professional, respectful way.

review_title: Good Experience to put on a resume.. Not an ideal place to for a career
review_pros:
Easy Job (Most of the time a fun place to work & Made a lot of friends)
Promotions are easy to obtain
Benefits were OK
review_cons:
Pay is very low compared to other retail companies !!
You work 45+ plus hours every week
High maintenance store very detailed orientated
review_advice_mgmt: None

review_pros: Its a very fair company to work for, the management works with you
review_cons: The job gets kinda boring after awhile
review_advice_mgmt: work on communication skills

review_pros: Mean tons of people, fun and exciting, and not hard work
review_cons: never know when they are going to need you.. Have to be "approved" to get the most hours
review_advice_mgmt: Keep up the good work! Fun place to work and shop!

review_title: Minimal hours, minimal pay, minimal satisfaction.
review_pros:
20% employee discount.
Lots of free time due to low weekly/bi-weekly hours.
review_cons: Low pay, very low hours (4-12 per pay period).
review_advice_mgmt: Train employees better.

review_pros: Great benefits, associates are fun college kids, isn't a hard job
review_cons: Upper Management is awful, they dont teach you or show you had to do things, you learn by your mistakes and getting your a** reemed. IT is like high school all over again, everyone talks about everyone. It is so superficial it is ridiculous. You are judged daily.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't judge people so much, take a look in the mirror, you aren't attractive.

review_pros: Good Discount but thats about it
review_cons: Very Judgemental about the way ppl are
review_advice_mgmt: Why do you need a BA to be a manager?

review_pros: The company pays well compared to most retailers.  Once you get past being an Assistant Manager (which usually doesn't take more than a year) the pay is very competetive.  The company is expanding internationally extremely rapidly which is opening up thousands of positions and people are moving through the company very quickly.  You can become a District Manager in 3 years or less if you are competent and impress the right people.  Most other companies you are looking at 10-20 years to reach that point.  I did it in 3 years and I know people who have done it even more quickly than me.
review_cons: Its a retail job so when you start out the hours aren't always easy to get used to and it is a fast-paced environment so it can be high stress at times.  Also you are dealing with customers alot, but thats retail in general.
review_advice_mgmt: You could be a bit better at offering up praise for hard work and a job well done.  Give your employees more of an incentive to work hard.

review_title: Depends on the people around you
review_pros: You can apply the discount towards gift cards
review_cons: The music is loud, managers don't care whether you work or not (lots of lazy employees)
review_advice_mgmt: Get people more motivated to work

review_title: A great opportunity for College Graduates to start careers in Retail Management.
review_pros:
-Management opportunities for college graduates
-Good health insurance package
-One Hour lunch breaks
-Clothing discount; 50% off Seasonal/Floorset discounts to employees
-Managerial training and experience that will prepare you to run any retail establishment
review_cons:
-Unprofessional enviroment
-Unsatisfactory work/life balance
-Inconsistant weekly shifts; Occationally working into late hours
-Pressured to work off the clock
review_advice_mgmt: Abercrombie & Fitch is a lifestyle brand, a lifestyle that requires members of the managerial team to constantly have work on their minds.  On your days off, expect a call or text from your Store Manager on work related issues, attending events to recruit more employees and sometimes visiting the store off the clock to ensure that all business operations are completed.  Perhaps Abercrombie & Fitch should consider providing a better work/life balance for in store managerial staff to improve productivity, business and reduce manager turnover.  Also, as a manager of a store that no longer has their Full-Time Stock (Non-FTS Store), has made working in store operations nearly impossible.

review_pros:
Adequate salary for MIT position.
Will not be fired for mistakes.
review_cons:
Paid half time for overtime (opposite of time and a half).
Unpaid Breaks.
Required to work on all weekends. 
Can not vacation during whole month of August.
Can not vacation any time during holiday season.
Do not receive benefits until after three months of employment. 
Will assume responsibilities of assistant manager position half way through training period. 
When promoted to Assistant Manager you will not receive pay increase.
review_advice_mgmt:
Be less misleading when discussing promotional opportunities and hours of work during interviews.  
Be less misleading about transfer opportunities.
Regular pay for overtime.

review_pros:
-Meeting people around your age
-Easy, almost addictingly so
-Flexible scheduling
-20% discount off full priced items, 50% off new items (2 tops and 1 bottom only). As of July 17th, we also get discounts at Abercrombie and Fitch (30%), abercrombie, Gilly Hicks
review_cons:
-No opportunity for advancement without 4 year degree
-Shifts are too short (4 or 5 hours) and combined with minimum wage makes for small paycheques...even if you work 6 or 7 days a week
-Call ins, some people get 4 or 5/week
-Customers complaining about the music, lights (or lack thereof), long lineups, sizing...whatever.
review_advice_mgmt: Offer better training and higher pay to decrease employee turnover, increase employee discount, keep fragrances behind the cashwrap, renovate to make stores more wheelchair/stroller friendly, change floorplans to decrease shrink - too many blindspots

review_title: Good place to start out with if you need management experience with a well-known company.
review_pros:
-40% discount on merchandise and gift cards
-good benefits
-fun people
-you get lots of hours
-management experience
review_cons:
-long days (9 hours)
-working with associates who are very young (first job for some), therefore, sometimes irresponsible
-late nights if closing
-dealing with high maintenance customers
review_advice_mgmt:
-try to hire good associates who have common sense
-motivate your associates to work hard for you
-reward your best workers
-instill a good work ethic in those associates who are new to your store

review_pros: Abercrombie is a great place to work if you are looking to climb a corporate ladder quickly. To do so, however, you MUST be willing to relocate or already live in a large urban area. They have good health benefits, and as a manager you can shape your store by choosing who you hire. Having a good district manager is critical to your success, because whether or not they are liked in the DM group or by your regional manager has a lot to do with whether you are promoted.
review_cons: They require all managers to have a bachelors degree but spoon feed you every bit of information and tell you exactly how they want every thing done. Abercrombie is superficial, even when it comes to management employees. They will want you to get out and "recruit" great looking people, and to staff your store with the "friendliest best looking people", which is a bit hard to get used to. Although they say you don't have to buy the clothes, you really do have to wear them or you are not "in look policy", so basically jeans, flip flops, and a navy/white/gray top. Or whatever style is in for that season.
review_advice_mgmt: Ask assistant managers about store managers performance before promoting them, generally am's know a lot more about what is going on in the stores than the district manager.

review_pros: scheduling is very flexible.  since the hiring process is constant, there are always available employees to cover your shifts.  scheduling is done by computer and only schedules you when you're available.  great part-time job while attending college, and very laid back atmosphere.
review_cons: many co-workers are young and naive, always coming into work with a, "i'm so hot" attitude.  it gets tiring after a while, and since the whole recruiting process is done based on the look policy, co-worker competence is non-existent.  some managers are really friendly and helpful, while others carry a mentality that there is some kind of hierarchy and they're at the top.
review_advice_mgmt: please don't schedule people for 4.98 hours just to avoid legally having to give them a 30-minute break.  if you're over on hours, don't take call-ins and let your staff work a bit harder.

review_title: the job is very boring...but  i need a summer job.
review_pros: I can wear t shirts and flats to work
review_cons: long hours, 50 hours per week
review_advice_mgmt: the hours are too long

review_pros:
-Great Benefits packages
-You get to work with great looking people
review_cons:
- There is an innumerable amount of dust in that place, who knows what future causes this could bring
-you are almost forced to stay an hour after you are scheduled to leave but if you're a minute late, you will hear it from your boss.
- Everything you do, feels like busy work, your rain rots in that place, there is no real problem-solving or thinking involved, a ROBOT can do my job.
- The music is ANNOYING. Same songs play over and over 100 times a day. Just hearing the song you hate most come on the jukebox again makes you want to strangle the closest person to you. 
- I could write so much more, but i've decided halfway through this cons list that i'm going to quit my job. I worked for the company for one year in 2005, when they had a large song selection play list, when all types of people would get hired, when it was actually a fun place to work. Thinks have changed for the worst.
review_advice_mgmt: Allow customers to select their music again and increase the variety. The music is too loud and you can't hear anything outside of a radius of 5 feet. The company is STINGY on hours and thus has one person doing the job of three. This leads to a bad store experience when the register associate has a line of 6 people and is also attending fitting rooms.

review_pros:
Friendly staff, everyone feels like a family.
Managers were a pleasure to work with (minus one in particular)
Flexible schedule
review_cons:
No hours.
Crappy pay.
Forced to pretty much sacrifice individuality and to conform to the "so cal" image
The look policy is ridiculous.
If your a minor, the most your gonna work is 4 to 8 hours a week.
Training wasn't in depth, you pretty much have to figure out things on your own.
review_advice_mgmt: Please don't be so particular about the little things, like a 3rd earring, stop hiring so many people and increase pay or something.

review_title: " I f you are great at standing around and looking good- and can use the tag line- you are money!"
review_pros: Fun Atmosphere, no sales quotas, consistent rules and guidelines, if you can't work a schedule someone is willing to trade
review_cons: minimum wage, required to wear their clothing, high emphasis on 'the looks' of employees, loud music
review_advice_mgmt: Give associates sales or item goals to increase in store sales and give associates a way to earn more money.

review_pros: Great discount on the clothes, fun working  atmosphere with music and people with all common interests, great place to make friends
review_cons: Not many promotion opportunities,..they promise they promote within then hire people from outside the company, no work/life balance. impossible standards
review_advice_mgmt: give people a weekend off once in awhile like many other retail companies, pay people more for the insane hours and crazy tasks

review_title: If you are really smart, you would say "no" to this job as a CAREER.
review_pros:
-Pay
-Some Benefits 
-40?discount on A&F clothes if you're a manager
-30% discount if you're a part-timer/ part-timers tend to have fun, great way to meet new "good-looking" people, which is what makes this company. 
-may meet some nice people.
review_cons:
-Pay should be higher due to the long hours and the amount of work.
-if you're ugly you work in the stockroom or you can get the overnight shift. sorry. 
-unhealthy environment
-working with upper managers that are not all informed about the new changes at work
-following orders from managers that don't meet professional expectations.
-be ready to get blamed on and get written up for S*** things that you're not 100% responsible for. 
-working with arrogant, judgmental people that selects quality of people based on looks, no matter how uneducated they are. Those associates will get hired. and you end up managing those uneducated people. 
-Can't be honest
-They encourage you to come up with new ideas that may help the company, but the system is already run by upper managers that are closed-minded. 
-don't care about the associate's safety
-upper managers will treat you like dirt by using profound language.
-In the beginning they are super nice and want to hire you. 
-the intense smell of cologne. 
-The dress code of wearing flip flops even when it's winter, snowing outside. 
-dealing with associate's complaints. 
-putting on a fake smile, people are self-centered.
-Begin to wonder how in the world you ended up there.
review_advice_mgmt:
-Why don't you guys "set good examples." 
-you cannot tell people to do things when people cannot look up to you and has no respect.

review_title: If you are promoted quickly it is fun and you will feel rewarded.
review_pros: The people are the best part.
review_cons: The pay, the hours, it's customer service, the company cares more about recruiting than it's employees.
review_advice_mgmt: Spend more time in store unnounced to see what is actually going on and bring Mike Jefferies along to see.

review_pros: Great positive atmosphere, fun and stress free place to work.
review_cons: You are at the mercy of the company, they will do what is best for them not for you.
review_advice_mgmt: Promote based on performance not tenure.

review_title: Nice as a part-time job, not much more
review_pros: Flexible scheduling, the work is easy, don't have to deal with customers on the sales floor, don't have to listen to the sales floor music.
review_cons: Have to wear certain clothing and the discount is awful, minimum wage, managers may or may not have any idea what they are doing.
review_advice_mgmt: Place some level of emphasis on hiring competent managers - don't just do it based on looks. Do a better job of hiring managers so the bad ones can be fired.

review_pros: They're really flexible with hours, you can basically make your own schedule, at least that's how it was at the flagship store. All of the associates were friendly. Discount was pretty good, 30%.
review_cons: Management is a little incompetent at times. Pay was not great by NYC standards but because they allow you to work overtime for time and a half I stayed.
review_advice_mgmt: Management focuses too much on certain things, and can be extremely nitpicky over things like how many times your sleeves or jeans are rolled up, but this is because they will get ripped apart by corporate if they do not.

review_title: Great place for fast career advancement
review_pros: You can move up and gain managment experience fast if you are willing to work hard. I went from being hired to DM in 3 years.
review_cons: Personal life will take a hit if you want to succeed quickly. It is however, worth it in the end.
review_advice_mgmt: You will meet with your direct manager once a month to review your career goals and what you can do together to achieve them.

review_pros:
Once you get the job, it's easy to do.
Fun people.
review_cons:
No room for growth, if you are not a kiss up.
Lack of communication.
Pay is not worth the job.
It not really managing, it's more like baby sitting kids.
Loud music and now my ears ring for working there for so long.
Crabby customers because the company cares more about how a person looks then creating the customer experience better.
Very stressful and lack of feedback from management.
review_advice_mgmt: Promote people that are hard working and not the ones that suck up.

review_title: If you want a job in the mall.....look somewhere else.
review_pros: Benefits are good. I would say that it is a good transitional job after leaving college, for the fact that you can still act like you are in college (drinking, sleeping with co-workers, gossiping, etc) while getting paid a salary. If you are not ready for a solid career or future it is perfect. If the activities above do not appeal to you then I would strongly advise you to look elsewhere if you want a mall job.
review_cons: If you are looking for a professional work environment this job is NOT for you. On a daily basis most of the conversations you will have with upper management consist of how attractive your staff of teenagers is. If everyone working isn't "model material" you will hear about it endlessly. Also, your co-workers (I'm talking about your management team) is highly unmotivated and are only working for this company because they can't get a job anywhere is. Often times I felt some of our employees were more reliable then the people I was suppose to be working with. Managers show up late, drunk/hungover, high, and resentful that they have to be at such an annoying job everyday. Work life balance is non-existent. You will have to work until 11:00pm and then show up for a 6:00am shift the next morning on some occasions. Also you will hardly ever get a weekend day off and if it is your day off and another manager is sick/doesn't show up you will be expected to come in. If you feel like wasting your college degree at the mall, more power to you. I recommend investing your time at another store though because most people get fired from the company around the age of 30 because they don't "represent the brand" anymore.
review_advice_mgmt: Everyone in the managment positions for this company is so brain-washed that no advice would even matter.

review_title: Help customers with finding items, getting them a fitting room, ringing them up, folding clothes, etc etc.
review_pros: Good first job. Works well with a full time student.
review_cons: Depending on the location, it can get seriously disgusting considering the costumers.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't get so strict with what employee's wear. Sure keep it within the companies lines, but let them have fun with what they wear. I mean you want us to have fun and if we can't feel comfortable in what we wear.... how are we having fun?

review_title: Don't waste your time at this company.
review_pros: The halfway decent reason to work at A&E is the discount.
review_cons: The company is very superficial and doesn't value their employees.  I'm not going to waste my time typing the negative comments but they can be read from others.
review_advice_mgmt: I hope this company closes down forever.

review_title: annoying job, but a jobs a job
review_pros:
-music
-money
-schedule flexible
-coworkers nice
-discount
-good for money if you don't really need money; part time job
-easy
review_cons:
-most days slow
-management AWFUL unfriendly to customers + employees
-minimum wage
-have to clean
-no nailpolish
-flipflops
-rudecustomers
dumbmanagers
review_advice_mgmt:
-care more about customer service, not minutia details
-allow nailpolish & other shoes to work
-dont be mean
-praise goodwork

review_pros: - You meet a great group of part-timers, If your lucky, your co-workers become family.
review_cons: A joke,Upper mgt is atrocious ,Unprofessional, No life,low comp. understaffed, superficial staffing, goodluck with gettin days off.
review_advice_mgmt: HR is useless, upper management is  detached from issues instores and do little  to help solve them. Change is needed

review_pros: Great job for the "reputation" as an intro to the retail industry, however the pay does not compensate for the labor.  Sorry, the pros and the cons intertwine.  Overall, I would say I enjoyed the friendships made with many employees, however I'm sure you can make friendships at many jobs.
review_cons: The pay!  The more requirements a company has for their sales associates,the higher pay it requires. . .end of story!  When the salary you earn is less than equivalent to a single item of clothing in a company, the ratio is off!  7.25 or 7.24 WHICHEVER is NO compensation for the time and work you will invest in A&F.
review_advice_mgmt: It truely depends on the store, for every manager has their own managering style. . .which can also be a reflection of the RM or DM (regional or district manager).  I have had a myriad of managers after working in the once four brands that were in the Freehold, Mall, and each one was different.

review_pros: Cool Clothes to fold, wear, and try on.
review_cons: Lame work to fold clothes all day long.
review_advice_mgmt: Give better work

review_pros: -You get to wear jeans, a casual A and F shirt, and flip flops/converse all stars to work everyday.  You can't beat that.
review_cons: -It's a great place to work if you enjoy working with attractive underaged girls, like reeking like cologne, and enjoy leaving work with ringing ears...aka...permanent hearing loss
review_advice_mgmt: The turnover is crazy...when I was there-only 5 months mind you-in my DMs 5 store district-I saw 6 managers quit.

review_pros: The benfits are ok. We get two weeks of vacation and 3 personal days.
review_cons: Having to work mall hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Do what you think is best, and follow your heart.

review_title: Takes a special kind of person.. if that person is you, then good for you...
review_pros:
Describe some of the best reasons to work at Abercrombie & Fitch

They have really great health insurance - it made me hang around a month longer than I originally thought I could. The fact that it's paying makes it a little better (although, I don't feel they pay us enough for what we do). 

It is a full-time job with great benefits which is, most would agree, hard to find in this economy - you only have to work with them for 30 days until benefits kick in. 

Music and store smells of fragrance (if you like that sort of thing) 

Another plus about being full-time: since I'm often scheduled and have to work 41+ hours a week and I'm in California I actually get time and 1/2 (unlike the other states who's pay gets cut in half once they reach 40 hours! Anyone at 41+ hours a week gets their hourly pay cut in half, usually meaning their working overtime for less than minimum wage - I don't even know how that's legal!) Hey, I guess California actually protects it's citizens in some ways.

Extremely casual - although at times too casual.

Hired based on looks (and the fact that I had experience made it that much better). Yes, I can be shallow, I know, but I think that's part of why I got hired too...

Only requires a Bachelor's degree, no experience needed. Although I did have experience and that made getting the job easier.

It's a really easy job although it can be stressful and/or overwhelming at times, and on the other end extremely boring at other times... not too much in the middle.

It was a really good experience. I have NO regrets - this experience has taught me I would only accept a position with this company again if I were staving to death.

Met some really great people (although unlike the people in the reviews before me, I would never stay there years for "people")

Putting in 2 weeks soon
review_cons:
There is too heavy focus on recruiting!!! Also we have this diversity scorecard to make sure we are hiring enough minorities for front room associates and management... but the biggest thing was don't just hire and minority you have to hire "great looking" minority - they have to be "cast of" meaning so freaking hot we would actually ever consider letting them breathe the same air we breathe. We can hire A FEW of "us" if we're average looking but if the are minorities they better be "cast of". So... in response of the lawsuits, managers must take on the additional tasks of - on top of all the other stuff they already have us doing - having meetings around who's "hot" and where are we going to find "hot" people, taking a valuable asset off sales floor, a fully trained manager, and having them search the streets or local college campuses for more "hot" people, and spending our off time thinking about and actually looking for "hot" young looking people!

The music is SO loud and the fragrance is strong that some days you will walk in and get headaches (if you don't like that sort of thing). Plus customers will complain about it which will only make you feel worse. 

They trick you during your training period thinking things will be a little less stressful - the first three months they have you following the store manager's schedule and you really only work 5 days and really have two full days off. Then I switched to my schedule... I have to go to an 8AM management meeting every Tuesday. I only get one full day off! (Friday) and I wake up at 6/7AM on my other off day (Tuesday) to go to a management meeting when I closed the night before and didn't get off until 11PM. I'm trying to do everything I just learned the past three months except I'm trying to do it sleep deprived - especially since it's nearly impossible to balance work/personal life - even with their two full days a week off, my coworkers barely do it.

Irresponsible Employees

Most employees are really young, naive, and others are just annoying - there are really only a few that are truly wonderful. I had one employee today who complained about how tired HE was.. he was tired of standing or something, Not to mention, this employee is NEW... he works 1 to 2 times a week for 4 or 5 hours. Are you serious kid? Grow up!

Extremely rude customer base, then we get "disciplined" because we're not showing enough customer service. If a customer were to spit in our face they would want us to wipe it off and keep smiling. Some people list the employee discount as a con but it's really not. The redlines/clearance items are generally much cheaper than anything that's full price using our discount, since we can't used our discount on clearance prices. They generally treat the customers better than employees. (Which is why they focus much more heavily on internal loss prevention versus external loss prevention).  Also these people have such lenient return policies that I have to return merchandise from 2008 - I'm not kidding.

You have to be the manager, the janitor, the maintenance man, the merchandiser while being the loss prevention agent, the loss prevention agent, the model, the impacter, and a recruiter. The models and impacters will always complain to you about their minimum wage salary although there is NOTHING you can do about it. They don't even begin to understand that you don't even make 2 times more than they do yet you're expected to do 3 or 4 times more work, meaning the work of 3 or 4 associates at 1 time. We don't want to not tell you our salary because we're afraid you'll get mad at us..we don't want to tell you because it's embarrassing.  A manager does the work of many people. Phone sales employees at cable and phone companies make the same amount of money as we do, if not more - and they get paid to do one thing: sale (plus they get to do it sitting down, not wearing flip flops that are bad for your feet - at least that's what the chiropractor said).

Standing for 8/9 hours a day. 9 hours: if you stand the whole time you're there. 8 hours: if you sit on the office floor, on a box full of receipt paper, or on a step ladder because there isn't a break room and there isn't any chairs. (One of the higher managers actually asked what we needed chairs for.)

After months of working here I was sooo afraid that this is how all jobs were or how all jobs would be. I was SO relieved when my aunt told me that this is far from the truth.
review_advice_mgmt:
CONS CONTINUED:


I had the TERRIBLE experience off switching from one DM to another. My old DM was okay, I could deal with her. This new DM is, oh boy... she's nice but she's so "Abercrombie". While my old DM's focus was running the business well, my new DM's focus is making sure we have "great looking" people and "great looking stores". She will always want you to be in full "look policy" even if the store is closed and it's only your jacket that's not Abercrombie. Truthfully, I don't know if she would have hired me. A few months before the switch, I bought some items (which I ran by the store manager first) and started wearing them to work - it was important because I didn't own any Abercrombie before I started working there. Shortly after meeting my new DM I was informed many of the items I had been wearing were not appropriate - never mind that I had been wearing those items for months and I had confirmed with the store manager it was okay to wear those items to work BEFORE buying them. I'm now left with limited options from my very small Abercrombie wardrobe and non Abercrombie plaid. 

Work/Life balance is really hard. Looking at the other managers who have been there longer than me, I can only assume it will get harder. It's not very flexible and they will change your schedule whenever they need you. They want you to live to work not work to live. I have worked in a 4 manager store for 6 weeks now and only 1 of the weeks have worked a 4 manager scheduled.  Most of the other weeks, one of our managers got borrowed at another store. Yet when we feel we need to borrow someone, there is no one available to do it. 

Vacation Days, sick days, and personal days are rationed out... so don't get too excited about that unless you KNOW you will be able to survive the first 6/7 months. You will be overworked, underpaid, and working with one day off for at least 3 months straight while watching your coworkers take paid days off - meanwhile you're burning out waiting for days to accrue.

It's stressful and getting time off is like a circus trick.. switching that day and taking that one - not to mention... that occasional time... you'll have to work a week in a row, then wake up on your off day at 6am to go to the 8AM meeting after closing at 11pm the night before, and then work two more days before finally getting your full off day.

This job is boring! superficial and sometimes just plain busy work like in high school.

Bag checks - one day another manager dug a little too far in my bag... don't know what they were looking for,. 

The sad part is the best part of this job is supposed to be that it's so cool. Abercrombie prides itself with the fact that people want to be involved with the company because people feel it will make them cool. They should just work for the fact that they work for a cool company and just ignore the mistreatment, being underpaid and notably underpaid. 

ADVICE: 
We're your in store employees, the foundation of this company plus we're customers too, treat us like it!

Keep expanding internationally... that's your best bet.

A break room with chairs would be nice.

It's so sad... how much happier managers could be if Mike Jeffries were not so greedy!

A raise is overdue. I guess I would be out of touch with what it really takes for an average person to live if I could feed 5 countries for 10 years too.

Turn down the music, I like my hearing. Go easy on the fragrances, I like my lungs.

Those management meetings need to alternate seasonally or something. One person being the only one who gets just one day off for MONTHS is just wrong.

Give our associates more than minimum wage it makes them happier, plus sometimes their work truly does deserves it. Plus it would make our job easier if they stayed around longer.

I want to keep my personal life and I will fight you to the death for it! That's why I could never see myself moving up in this company.

I need a challenge not the challenge of trying to figure out stupidity though. 

Give more freedom for time off in first 6 months. Feels like you're trying to break me and you did.

review_pros: The job is organized and there is nothing that is not laid out descriptively for employees to follow in how to run a store.
review_cons: The position focuses more on recruiting acceptable looking people to draw in customers than on any other aspect of business, and promotions are at the District Managers whim without any other requirements regardless of tenure.
review_advice_mgmt: Abercrombie seems to be a step behind on how to get people to buy their clothing. Sex appeal can only go so far, innovation is necessary if the company is going to be revitalized in the eyes of their targeted demographic.

review_title: Great if you're in high school...
review_pros: You get a 30% Employee discount, 50% on certain items everytime the floorset changes.  You work with young, good looking people, very social atmosphere.
review_cons: If you're a good looking person, they will make you stand at the fron of the store for most of your 5 hour shift saying the tagline (Hey, welcome to Abercrombie, check out our ___) to every customer that enters, and saying goodbye to every customer that exits, while re-folding endless piles of clothes.  The pay is very low, not even enough to buy their clothes.
review_advice_mgmt: Rotate employees to different posts, and/or let employees work areas they enjoy... Don't have such a higher-than-thou attitude, you're a MANAGER at ABERCROMBIE

review_pros: The only reason that I would work at Abercrombie and Fintch is the employee discounts that you get when you buy clothes from there.
review_cons: They don't really give you hours, when I was working they only give me about ten hours a week, and also no raise.
review_advice_mgmt: They need to start hiring people who know what they're doing, all the managers who are working there are kids

review_pros: You meet alot of people and they are usually cool even the managers. The job is NOT difficult at all. And their clothes are the uniform.
review_cons: New managers are in and out of there not alot of consistency, at least at the one i was at. Pay is weaaak, minimum wage, as well as hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more consistent with hours.

review_pros: Good and flexible place to work
review_cons: Less hours only work once a week
review_advice_mgmt: Be more productive and get the job done

review_pros: I worked for the childrens store. With that being said--I enjoyed the customers more. It was more reassuring helping out the customers (mostly parents) knowing that you were actually helping them to make an educated purchse. It was also a fun/laid back environment depending on which manager was working and which workers you were working with.
review_cons: Some cons are that you are on your feet all day and the smell of spraying perfume all day is nauseating. You may leave work exhausted and with a headache after even just a 4/5 hour shift. I worked at abercrombie for years and worked my tail off and barely received a promotion--there were young hot shots that were slackers and received promotions shortly after they were hired.
review_advice_mgmt: Be a little more selective--I understand you want beautiful workers, but beautiful doesn't ensure hard work neccesarily. Also, ensure more of a system for promotions and bonuses---brand reps/models may not make much, but you shouldn't treat them like that: they are the face of your store.

review_pros: Great benefits, learn some management experience.
review_cons: Long Hours, horrible pay, loud music, gagging cologne.
review_advice_mgmt: You're not as "cool" as you think you are.

review_pros:
benefits
steady job
promotion from within
manager status right away
review_cons:
retail hours
customers are hard to deal with
review_advice_mgmt: Recruiting

review_title: A&F is fun for a while but it gets old
review_pros:
Meet Cool and Hot People
30% Discount for Models, 40% for Managers
Easy Job
review_cons:
Low Pay
Scheduling Problems at our store
review_advice_mgmt: Treat models with more respect

review_title: Lots of Potential, but definitely fell short
review_pros:
-fast promotion
-cool, young coworkers
-international opportunity
-comfortable clothes, discount
review_cons:
-intellectually incompetent people in high positions
-obvious upper mgmt doesn't care enough about managers
-high school politics
-not transparent, or forthcoming with information that concerns the entire team
-not intellectually stimulating
-salary too low
review_advice_mgmt: -people should seriously be your number one priority. there is no work/life balance. salary in NYC is definitely not enough.

review_pros:
Fun Work Environment
Work with good looking people
review_cons:
No pay advances
Not enough hours too low
review_advice_mgmt: Care more about employees

review_pros: clothes discount was really great
review_cons: always on your feet all day long
review_advice_mgmt: less bosing around and more leadership roles

review_title: OK place for a high school job
review_pros: Get a fair discount on their clothes. Typical retail store experience, well recognizable company. Fairly easy to get the job.
review_cons: Pays minimum wage, has way to many employees, not a great place to grow as a professional and hard to get promoted. Annoying call-in system.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat employees better, offer more opportunities for employee growth, give definite hours instead of a mass amount of call ins.

review_pros:
1. Very easy work, almost requires no thinking whatsoever
2. Hours are good and very flexible
3. Promotion comes pretty fast if you apply yourself
review_cons:
1. Work is so easy, it's boring and feels tedious. 
2. If your a good worker, they will stick you in high traffic areas meaning more tedious work
3. Shaving; they want to project this all american image but seriously, I served in the army and they didn't even make me shave my mustache, here you must be clean shaven every time you clock in or you will be sent home.
review_advice_mgmt: Management does the best they can do. I have no problem with the managment at Abercrombie.

review_pros:
-benefits
-laid back environment
-not too stressful
review_cons:
-too political of a company
-recruting
-mall hours
review_advice_mgmt: -promote the people who have been there a while or they will quit on you

review_pros:
You get to meet fun people to work with
There is a good discount
It's a non stressful job with flexible scheduling
review_cons:
The pay is awful
The managers are not very good leaders
Management changes often
It can be boring at times
review_advice_mgmt:
- Take some time to get to know your employees
- If you are offering a "high" quality product you must have higher salaries

review_title: Recruiting is all that matters to them.
review_pros:
-Good experience straight out of college if you're interested in retail
-Decent Benefits
-Work with a lot of people close to your age
-Easy to transfer between brands/stores since they're all run the same way
review_cons:
-Low pay, and no raise for becoming Assistant Manager after MIT program
-If you work over 40 hours, the extra hours are "half-time pay" which is pretty much working for minimum wage.
-Some managers don't know how to lead/manage, which happens when your company's hiring practices are based almost solely on looks.
-Have to buy their clothes every couple of months. Even though they say you don't have to wear their brand, you really do.
-Revolving door of employees
-Don't allow you to staff enough part-time employees to provide good service and stop theft
-Everything they have written down is just to save them from additional lawsuits 
-Closing shifts normally end at 11:00 pm, but can last much longer during busy days and the holiday season.
review_advice_mgmt: Use more part-time employees to give better service and curb theft. Some stores are dark and loud with lots of areas that managers can't always monitor, so theft is very common. The employees' low additional labor costs would be made up for in lower shrink totals and better customer service.

review_pros: It was an easy job, very laid back.  I didn't get enough hours because they hire high school kids who can only work after school and are willing to work for next to nothing. I got great discounts and really it was easy work.
review_cons: Not enough money and too little pay.
review_advice_mgmt: Turn the music down and pay your employees a little better.

review_pros:
Decent discount (20-30%)
Flexible availability - good for someone looking for a second part-time job
Good job for HS senior/junior or college freshman
Fun Photo Shoots within store
Opportunity to Model for Marketing (Pictures in store, Bags, etc)
review_cons:
Very low hours per week. Most associates receive 4-10 hours per week
I worked in 3 different stores at Clackamas Town Center, I found that there was a lot of gossiping between management team
A&F only hires people who they think are good looking, regardless of their skill and/or work ethic
review_advice_mgmt: Hire smaller team and train more intensively. Be more professional and don't gossip about your fellow co-management in front of models/impact team.

review_pros: Home office "Campus" is one of a kind, great Architecture, and a very comfortable place to work. Have great facilities, love the smell of fire going when walking into work in the mornings, and the gym and cafe are great assets.
review_cons:
Made pretty clear to me early on that if you did not come up from the store you were considered an outsider. They think because they come up through the stores, they have more of advantage then people coming in from the outside with 15 years of experience. The ones who get promoted are the ones that have been lifers and started in the stores. In my three years with the coming, I watched the manger of my department get promoted 3 times over that span while only 5 associates out of 50 in our department got only 1 promotion! 

Also, ANF tries to promote that same style as you see on their stores, so associates were expected to wear current ANF clothing line to work. Since there clothes sizes are so ridiculous, it is hard if not impossible for people with weight issues to wear ANF Clothes. I heard Mangers asking their associates why they were not in ANF clothing even though they knew damn well that person could not fit into ANF Clothes. 

When the lay-offs occurred in 2009 while the CEO was getting over 60 Million dollars in compensation, it was almost a given that a lot of cuts were based upon age. Not surprising that when the lay-offs occurred, that out of 11 people with the same job title, the two that were let go were the two of the oldest and both did not fit the "Abercrombie" look.

the general attitude of the associates that work their is very elitist, their sense of entitlement if very deplorable. I know they are in the Fashion industry, but it was obvious from the start the "pretty people" were the ones going to get ahead in this company. This pretty people mentality is very evident in the higher practices in both the home office and in the stores. As long as you fit the "ANF Look", they could care less how smart you were, especially their store mangers and models.
review_advice_mgmt: Grow up and realize that just because you do not come in a pretty package does not mean you can not be valued assist in the organization. Hold people accountable and change the attitude, not everyone "Aspires" to be like you.

review_pros: the campus is pretty, people are nice
review_cons: the don't believe in family or friends or time off
review_advice_mgmt: Give people raises on how hard they work and the good work they do not bc they have been there for years and years and surf the web all day

review_pros: Amazing benefits. Health, vision and dental insurance for employee and spouse. Ability to work overseas with paid relocation. Fun environment.
review_cons: Lots of politics in the company. People are unprofessional and superficial. Terrible salary! They expect you to be on call 24/7
review_advice_mgmt: Follow up with district and store managers. A lot of rules are broken and the lack of integrity is extremely sad.

review_pros: great atmosphere, fun people, good discount
review_cons: Too many hours per week. Leads to burn out.
review_advice_mgmt: Employees need a life too!

review_pros:
chill atmosphere
everyone is same age and probably also in school
make lots of friends
review_cons:
-no advancement but it is a part time mall job
-some management is incompetent
review_advice_mgmt: Nonw

review_pros:
very chill
make your own hours
cool co-workers
review_cons:
low pay
can be very boring
review_advice_mgmt: none

review_pros:
Flexible Schedule
Meet a lot of people
review_cons:
Not enough of a discount / clothes are still too expensive
Atmosphere
some ridiculous coworkers
review_advice_mgmt: Turn the music down and the smell off

review_pros: meet a lot of people
review_cons: low pay, not a quiet working environment
review_advice_mgmt: they do a very good job at recognition when giving praise to hard working associates and giving more shifts for people who deserve more hours for work

review_pros: Discounts are perks and some fun people to work with. Flexible with school schedules and receiving time off. Pay raise after a few months if you work hard.
review_cons: Constant smell of perfume/cologne being sprayed every 15-20 minutes. Level of music noise is a little over-powering. Divide between impact, models, and management at times.
review_advice_mgmt: Encourage more advancement as impact switching to a model position or overnight. Learn different levels of management after a few good reviews.

review_title: It's a cool environment and an easy job, but no advancement opportunities.
review_pros:
Easy job. 
Fun people to work with.
Laid back enviroment.
review_cons:
Too much pressure to persuade customers to buy things.
Late work hours.
Little appreciation of hard work.
review_advice_mgmt: n/a

review_pros: Abercrombie was an easy job to get.  Managers were very easy to get along with.  I made a lot of friends for life.
review_cons: The dress code sucks. I would wear eyeliner and would be told to wash it off or go home, and even in the winter they expect you to wear flip flops. So wear regular shoes to work and change.
review_advice_mgmt: They made promises of raising the salary but never did. So I say to them: Don't make promises u can't make happen.

review_pros: Being a model at Abercrombie and Fitch entitles you to have some prestige since they hire their models with some genuine good looks.
review_cons: The people who are the best looking get the most hours since Abercrombie and Fitch wants their cast people to have more hours than the un-cast people
review_advice_mgmt: Why attract sales with sex? The company can probably make more money by dimming the sex factor that the store illuminates to the customers (A&F screen test)

review_pros: In some peoples eyes, a "pro" of the job is that you dont have to think or be smart to run a store. A college degree is required to be a Maganger in Training. However, there isnt much thinking that goes into the job. The real pro of the job is the benifits. Heath and dental are extremely afordable. The other manager are cool people but the company is very shallow. When I say shallow i mean, that they hire based on looks. If you fit the companies "Look Policy" you will be hired.
review_cons: The hours are terrible. There have been plenty of night that i have stayed well into the night making sure the store is up to company standards. Which is perfect stacks of cloths
review_advice_mgmt: Make the store more shopable for customers. Its nothing the Store Managers can do but it is up to the people in Home Office.

review_title: A great path is set out for you in order to advance
review_pros:
-promotion is prominent
-Great perks on discounts
-Everyone is friendly, helpful, and great looking
review_cons:
-Hours are long  and hard
-Get out 2am and go back in same day at 8am

review_pros: It's easy. Good discounts on the clothes. First dibs on clearance items!
review_cons: Minimum wage. Call ins all the time.
review_advice_mgmt: Please pay everyone more!

review_pros: Its easy to get hired in
review_cons: low pay, boring tedious work. You aren't given any real responsibility.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat all employees with equality and respect

review_pros:
Great discount if you're into the clothes.  
Can be really fun at times IF....IF... you get all your stuff done.
review_cons:
Sales Associates are hired based on their looks, and not their talent or experience.  The work environment tends to be an immature one, lots of gossiping and nonsense from the employees.
Overwhelming amount of work to do at times, and daily tasks are micromanaged down to the minute by home office, there is zero autonomy to do anything creative.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop micromanaging, listen to the wants of your customers and the grievances of your employees.  AnF has the potential to put out a really great, quality and interesting product, but if they continue to keep their eyes closed employees will keep leaving and customers will keep shopping elsewhere.

review_pros: Some of the customers are kind of snobby but the general overall atmosphere of the place is faboosh and delicious.
review_cons: Some of the employees are very snotty because they think that only gorgeous people get hired so it kind of gets aggravating.
review_advice_mgmt: Better size stickers on the clothing because I can hardly read the stickers on the jeans under the delicious lighting scheme.

review_pros: Relaxed work environment, high interaction with people
review_cons: no meaningful, challenging work, mind-numbing tasks or - sometimes - no tasks assigned at all, lack of respect for the products
review_advice_mgmt: communicate more

review_pros: Employee discount, meet new people, make great friends with some of the associates. If you want to grow within the company, you will advance quickly *as long as you are willing to move wherever necessary*
review_cons: Most of the management will not be wiling to work with you on your schedule. Part time associates generally do not need jobs to support themselves and only work there because they were recruited as being "great looking" and aspirational.
review_advice_mgmt: Without a doubt one of the lowest paying "hourly paid-salary" compensations as far as retail management goes. Pay more, less micromanaging, and hire part time associates based on experience.

review_pros: clothing discount, management was nice and helpful
review_cons:
always hot in the store
have to stand the entire time

review_title: Laid back in both good and bad ways: coworkers & even managers tend to be lazy and incompetent.
review_pros:
Laid back
If you're very attractive, they'll never fire you and upper management will adore you
Awesome coworkers
If you have OCD you'll love it and they'll love you
review_cons:
Stuck up coworkers
MINIMUM WAGE with little oppurtunity for a raise (if any--my store gives out two a year max)
Lazy&incompetent coworkers an managers
Advancement is based upon looks alone
review_advice_mgmt: TRAIN THOROUGHLY and HIRE COMPETENT WORKERS not just airheaded beauties. Customers HATE US for these reasons. Offer INCENTIVE for hard working and high-performing managers and store associates or else they will quit because they can make substantially more working for just about any other company.

review_title: Good Money, Good Benefits, not worth it though
review_pros: Abercrombie offers very nice benefits and salary compensation packages. you get lots of vacation, personal and sick days which is far superior compared to other companies. You are paid very well and depending on your department the people are pretty nice to work around. The campus is pretty awesome and it is definitely one of a kind.
review_cons:
While they offer some great packages, it is like working in a fraternity or sorority. If you do not act or look a certain way, you tend to be out casted. It is not this way in every department just some of the more brand image departments such as merchandising, allocation and brand senses. You also have to understand that you are working for a single person's vision. While they try to emphasis team work, it's not really true. This company will be made or broken depending on what one person believes in. It's kind of hard to get on board and follow a company like that.

Promotions are based on who you know and who you can suck up to as well. Unfortunately I was stuck in a department that ostracized you if you did not fit the correct mold. Myself being married, older (28), living in a suburb and not going out to drink every night, did not bode well in my department. Everybody lived in either downtown, short north or German village and with other A&F roommates. Everybody goes out with each other including senior management, if you don't get in with this crowd you will be out for the remaining time you're in the department. This crowd also tends to get favoritism. A slap on the wrist for someone means termination for a different person. This company is a huge clique. It is honestly like high school all over again, except it lasts the length of your career. 

You are also expected to work incredibly long hours. For people who want a life outside of A&F without other A&F associates in it, don't work here. You also aren't thanked for your long hours, and in fact if you actually do leave on time (between 530 and 6) it is severely frowned upon. Don't expect to have much of a home life.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat everybody fairly, that's your job as senior management. You shouldn't be hanging out with only certain lower level associates, giving them better treatment while chastising others. Stop the horrible clique cycle A&F has. Stop treating the CEO like he's a walking God. He doesn't have all the answers, think independently. This is the worst group think place ever, you should be trying to change it.

review_title: Like every job, good and bad days.
review_pros: The employees are pretty cool, and it's pretty high energy
review_cons: The work week is ridiculous, 55-60 hours a week. Never any time for a personal life, and its a total class system from the GM down.
review_advice_mgmt: Calm down, stop being afraid of M.J. no pay in retail is worth that amount of stress.

review_title: A good part time job for someone that isn't in urgent need of money
review_pros: Nice/good looking people, 30% discount at all abercrombie stores and hollister, managers are nice and help you out when you need it, very flexible with your schedule
review_cons: the smell and music get old really really fast, one week they will schedule you everyday the next week you will be working once a week, absolutely no way to get promoted, they hire to many people  so there are less hours, horrible pay (minimum wage)
review_advice_mgmt: Dont treat your employers like another number

review_pros: this job is pretty easy
review_cons: the salary is very low
review_advice_mgmt: you need to help with the register more and folding clothing. We dont need folding boards when we can do it ourselves

review_pros: The job was ok and fit the need at the time.  There was nothing overly great or bad but rather neutral.
review_cons: There were no real or evident downsides for working there.  The job was appropriate for the time being but not as a career.
review_advice_mgmt: The job was ok and fit the need at the time.  There was nothing overly great or bad but rather neutral.

review_pros: Easy job - basically just folding clothes. I've met some great friends while working there. I love the smell that is sprayed around the store every half hour.
review_cons: No room for growth, management doesn't take you seriously since everyone is close in age.Management doesn't even do much. The district managers are very uptight and they don't respect you or commend you when you do a good job. Music is always blaring and there is no sittiing.

review_title: It is for someone looking for a flexible pay.
review_pros: It is extremely flexible and You can choose your own hour. They pay higher than most retailers.
review_cons: It is becoming very strict and The managers keep an eye on you.

review_title: If you really want to, you can do well
review_pros:
Good hours on average
Decent discount
You can wear flip flops (never been able to do that at a job before)
If you put in the effort, you could succeed easily
review_cons:
Loud ass music
Obnoxious spoiled "customers" like to come in and tear everything apart and not buy anything
If you were just there for the paycheck, managers would notice
worst hours ever, 4am-11am, then 6pm-11pm the same day
review_advice_mgmt: Listen to your employees needs when it comes to scheduling, it'd help keep the turnover rate a lot lower than what it is.

review_pros: I enjoyed my time working for Abercrombie and Fitch.  They are a great company to gain retail experience with. I would consider working for them again.
review_cons: They enforced long hours and working on weekends.  Although it was great to gain the experience  the hours were hard to work.
review_advice_mgmt: I wouldn't have much that I would tell them to change.  They are a fun company to work for and their managers have great attitudes.

review_title: Not challenging, bad pay, and no chance for a personal life...
review_pros: I met some really interesting people. Work was easy, benefits was the best part of the company. Sometimes it was fun.
review_cons: I was always so tired that my personal life and relationship took  a large toll. I was not challenged, only physically and mentally tired. My feet ached from the usage of the awful thin flip-flops. I wore the exact same 3 shirts 5 days a week and same jeans just so that my entire paycheck did not go back to A&F. The music, oh the music was what I really could not get past. The fact that the music was on a 40 minute interval on repeat/high for my entire 8-9 hour day for 6 weeks was what my sanity could not stand.  I would hear the music in my head after I got home from work, it was like taking work home with me. HOW AWFUL! The scheduling was a joke. I'm sorry but having Tuesday and Friday off is no way of having a life! Recruiting is shallow, and also a joke. I'm so glad I left this company. I will miss the benefits though... nothing else...!!
review_advice_mgmt: Scheduling for management could be much much better. Conference calls for District Managers is just a reason for them to sit and put their phones on mute. More creativity needs to be given! Music changing, give me satelite music! Anything other than 40 minutes on repeat!

review_pros: It is fun some of the time. I like the laid back atmosphere. There isnt a lot of stress. It's ok.
review_cons: They make you buy the clothes. They only care about how you look and are very creepy about if you've gained or lost weight.
review_advice_mgmt: I think they need to be more reasonable about a lot of things like not making us buy all their clothes.

review_pros:
attractive co workers
fun atmosphere
cute clothes
review_cons:
no pay
rude management 
call in shifts 
had to wear everything they wanted 
headache from perfume
dark
review_advice_mgmt: stop hiring so many people you have wayyy to many

review_pros: If you have another job, with A&F as a side job, I'll recommend it. If your enjoy only working 1-2 6 hour shifts a week this is the job for you.
review_cons: Unless your a manager, there will be months of shifts cut due to the decrease of customers after the typical holiday rush. This job is definitely a seasonal job. Also, I understand you need to wear clothes as close to the brand as possible BUT majority of their styles is only for summer. I winded up not working during Christmas break due to them wanting me to still wear flip flops because of the outfit I was wearing. I quit after that. I had another job so it wasn't a loss but I feel bad for the people who depend on this job.
review_advice_mgmt: Reorganize the company culture, && understand that assistant managers/store managers put too much pressure on employees. They can only do so much & remember majority of them are under 21.

review_pros: Good discount. Good music. Fun people. Fun to talk to customers!
review_cons: if you are a model, you have to stand at the front for like 4 hours and its SO boring, but sometimes they put you in the back which is wayyyyy better!
review_advice_mgmt: Chill out on the recruiting and rules! Not saying a tagline is NOT the end of the world!

review_pros: work with hot girls, discounted clothing, good high school job.
review_cons: Management schedules employees on days they specifically specify "Cannot work"....and when they do not show up for work because of a prior commitment (that was noted ahead of time), they would promptly fire the employee. Even after telling management time and time again....I could not work days X and Y, they scheduled me on those days....and the days I was available they wouldn't give me hours.  Long hours, low pay, slave labor. Several Managers were heterophobic....yes, I said it, heterophobic....they were hellbent on treating the straight/heterosexual employees like trash.
review_advice_mgmt: If you think your company is perfect, think again.  A very cut throat, scab outfit.

review_title: It was a life lesson learning how to manage money being a cashier.
review_pros:
Awesome Discounts
Meet New People
Able to learn and grow
Meet distinc people
review_cons:
Rude Employes or Managers
Music after awhile get a little plain fresh it up a bit
review_advice_mgmt: They should hire a skill worker not base on beauty nor image. A good worker is someone who has years of skills and experince. Clothes is the image hiring based on images will have effect on the job because workers are not skill and capable of doing the task.

review_title: a place where you will always fall short of expectations
review_pros:
Great place to learn and gain retail experience because the amount of responsibilities you'll have here is far beyond most other retailers in the industry. 

Hierarchy on most days is flat (but there are always those that think they're far better than others and make you feel inferior). 

Lots of young people, so on a not-so-stressful day, the environment is fun and lively.
review_cons: I can't speak for other depts but for Planning at A&F, there is never much words of encouragement. People always feel like they're not doing enough or are good enough. Because the hierarchy is so flat, you never know exactly what you are supposed to or expected to do. so if you are an overachiever, you try to do everything but still leave the office at end-of-day feeling like a complete failure. This is why I say this place is good for learning because you are literally trying to reach for the sky everyday, and learn at a much faster speed than you would elsewhere. But you'll get burnt out, and get sick of it very quickly.
review_advice_mgmt: Do what you say, acknowledge people's achievements, and be a good example. Without that, you'll continue to lose talented people that would have been valuable assets to the company.

review_title: A place for some, others not so much
review_pros: It's a fairly easy job, most of what I do is fold and help customers out. Because it's such an easy job for the most part new employees can expect to start off making minimum wage but there are (few) opportunities for a raise. I've made lots of friends here and it's a laid back environment to work in. Also there is a 30% discount.
review_cons: Most people won't get the chance to receive a raise and the hours are few and inconsistent. Also the managers are young so they can be unprofessional. Also because this company recruits "models" a lot of them don't even try to work.

review_pros:
Fun people to work with
VERY flexible with schedule
Hours are very random and work late a lot 
Work outweighs pay
review_cons:
Might schedule you during time off
Some managers are incompetent
review_advice_mgmt: Broaden the colors that the employees are able to wear and shoes

review_pros: easy job, dont have to use your brain; fun/young coworkers; not time consuming because not a lot of hours
review_cons: not a lot of hours; have to stay late to close store;

review_pros: I worked around a ton of great people, we were all in college so connected very well. It is a job that some dont take serious but if you work hard you can move up in the company.
review_cons: The only down side was that its retail.

review_title: My time with A&F was great-- learned tons about management in a very structured company
review_pros: Very structured company with high standards and push employees to perform their best.   Received great management training and how to run a business.
review_cons: There is no sense of freedom for creativity.  The company has 1 way of getting things done and you must comply with this or you will not succeed.  I could not give much creative input with visual aspects of the store because it is only done 1 way.
review_advice_mgmt: There needs to be more focus on all assistant manager development.  The company loses many assistants because the main focus is training and developing MITs, but once they are promoted they are not given nearly as much attention as SMs or MITs.

review_pros: excellent benefits package and opportunities to go overseas
review_cons: low paying, poor work life balance, promotions are base off of appearance rather than merit and overall job performance.

review_title: A&F use to be A Lot of fun! The company lately has become Dull & Mundane.
review_pros: Easy Job. Pretty flexible schedule.Discount.
review_cons:
Boring.
Loud.
No Raises or Upward Mobility.
4-8 Hours a week. If your lucky.
review_advice_mgmt: Value employees, Make it a fun environment to work in, Stop REVERSE racism

review_pros: Clothes and discounts and everything okay
review_cons: loud music and smell and the weird people
review_advice_mgmt: you guys are awesome

review_pros: You are able to gain insight from customers and further your knowledge of providing a better customer experience in the future at Abercrombie or with even with a different company. another positive may be that there are No drug tests, which may explain more about the people who work there.
review_cons: Terrible pay. Terrible benefits. Half Pay for overtime. Based solely on looks. Stuck up people surround you all day. Idiots as your superior. A perpetual future of working late and working hard and never being recognized for any of your work. District Managers are absent and always have their "favorites". Everybody is miserable there. Terrible customer service. Don't ever fall for the "there are so many opportunities" speech, because, let's face it. You will be 35 years old changing light bulbs, dusting fitting rooms, and using folding boards, while making 50k/yr no matter what position you are in, you are a slave to the company and they customers.
review_advice_mgmt: Grow up, you are too old and too fat for skinny jeans and all the makeup that you wear. You do not treat people with respect and you need to realize that the young kids that you are tearing down and calling ugly, are ACTUAL people with feelings! Pay your employees more, and recognize them when a job is done well.

review_pros: discount, the people that worked there were attractive, only 4 hours per shift, people that worked there were pretty young
review_cons: managers were horrible and treated employees terribly, really picky about what you wore and said, perfectionists, kids in the store were obnoxious
review_advice_mgmt: treat your employees with more respect and let them give some feedback, treat them like actual people and dont be so stuck up

review_title: It is a fun environment but it can get really boring at times.
review_pros:
You meet some really cool people. 
Easy job.
review_cons:
Boring.
Rude Customers.
Music is too loud.
review_advice_mgmt: The job is too serious for something that pays minimum. A more fun environment will make workers work harder and be nicer to customers. Clothes will sell regardless. Management takes it too seirous  at times.

review_pros:
Get a raise if you work hard
Flexible hours
Usually get more hours if you request them
review_cons:
Short shifts
Short breaks
Some rude managers

review_pros:
- Young hip environment
- Part time position which works with school
-Can transfer to other stores within the company
review_cons:
-Same salary rate even if one job requires more work than another
-No pay raises
-Power confusion among managers and employees
-Different treatment of Impactors vs. models
review_advice_mgmt: Equal treatment between models and impactors is crucial to job satisfaction. Inclusiveness of both positions is crucial to overall success of store.

review_pros: You get to work in a fun environment with fun people.  You also get a decent discount which is nice.
review_cons: Really not much more than a job for high schoolers or those in college.  It was fun, but the pay was pathetic.
review_advice_mgmt: Higher people that are more competent.  Although there is a certain look that the company looks for in its employers, it would help if management were more intelligent.

review_pros: Gain valuable experience in managing a retail business with (very) limited resources in the way of manpower.  Learn how to recruit, interview, hire, and train employees.  Learn how to create schedules and how to prioritize a litany of tasks to be done in a limited amount of time.
review_cons: Not enough support from upper management.  Consistently in the dark about where your career is going and how to get there.  Limited feedback on performance (both good and poor).  Unsatisfactory compensation in comparison to amount of output expected.
review_advice_mgmt: Give better support to your managers, particularly assistants.  Give more regular feedback on performance and establish and maintain better, more open lines of communication in order to help assistants feel better supported and appreciated.

review_pros: The clothes are nice. The low-level employees seem genuinely enthusiastic about their job, when they initially join the company.
review_cons: There is no room for growth and development at Abercrombie & Fitch. Everyone in upper management seems extremely shallow. Its almost as if promotions are based on looks rather than job performance.
review_advice_mgmt: My advice to management would be to begin focusing less on looks and focusing more on job performance and making the workplace enjoyable. Your employees are miserable. Miserable employees are the hallmark of a failing company.

review_title: It's fun if you're good looking.
review_pros: It's one of the easiest jobs out there. If you don't mind the loud music or stupid customers, it's tolerable.
review_cons: The people are irritating. The music is so so so so so so so so so so so so so so bad.

review_title: Good Job for High Schoolers or College Students
review_pros: Was a good basic job and the discount was cool. Management was friendly and a good experience with co-workers.
review_cons: Management is sometimes oblivious to how hard some people work on the sales floor; they are quick to point fingers but also quick to just slack off in the back.
review_advice_mgmt: You need to be secret shopped too. Honestly people say that working at Abercrombie & Fitch is an easy, dull-brained job but it takes consideration of customers and sales skills like any sales job.

review_title: Shows you the goods and bads of real world work experience. Environment is hip/fun.
review_pros: The environment: music, you hire a lot of young staff so they add to the fun environment.  The opportunities are there, but it really depends on the relationships you have with the senior staff.  Overall good management experience.  You have to learn quickly and I love that.  Great! Should at least give it a try!  Oh, great benefits too!
review_cons: Again, you have to try to develop some relationship with senior management (ex DM) to get more insight into moving up.  There is always that preference you see, but in reality that is everywhere.
review_advice_mgmt: More communication with all the management staff would be great. Hearing things directly and on time makes you feel a part of the company.

review_pros: i enjoyed working with my coworkers and the discounts
review_cons: i worked long hours and could never find a cover
review_advice_mgmt: turn the music down

review_title: Varied and interesting--high level work in an entrepreneurial environment.
review_pros: Exposure to significant international issues and access to the decision making process.
review_cons: Micro-manage everything. Change in mind set and approach is sometimes very difficult or impossible to achieve.
review_advice_mgmt: Open your minds to ideas and solutions rather than assume your impressions or conclusions are correct.

review_pros: The people who work here are great and the look book was a great way to let associates know what was in season and also added on to the advertisement of the company. This let associates be in comfortable clothing while working and walk out of working and still able to go have a social life. The scheduling is very flexible.
review_cons: The overpowering smells of perfumes were to overwhelming, It made me feel like I could no longer smell anything else after being in there for 5 hours. The loud music was also very distracting and made it hard to hear customers. Not enough hours as a part time. Too many models.

review_pros: Challenging, unique culture. Talented personnel.
review_cons: Dysfunctional management style that can stifle creativity.
review_advice_mgmt: Attitude is great, but it doesn't get the job done.

review_pros: fun environment, great discount, fun employees, great stockroom.  i had a great time working there and it was lots of fun
review_cons: absolutely hated doing overnight till 2, 3, even 4 am!!! then having to go in for a meeting at 8 am.  My GM was very strict with the schedule for managers.  Long long long hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Please start telling your managers what you really think they could work on or if they are making progress.  It makes a world of difference.

review_title: Low pay for work that is tiring.
review_pros: Management is very flexible at giving employees time off. It is always fun to work there because the music is playing and at least you are not bored 24/7 like in comparable positions.  Also if there is nothing to be done they allow you to simply hang out instead of making you do unnecessary tasks.
review_cons: The pay is minimal.  While it is possible to advance and the steps to do so are clear, people around you are not motivated, which in turn can cause you to become like them.
review_advice_mgmt: Please stop hiring employees based on their looks.  Its pretty much discrimination.  Also focus on customer service more, as it will help generate sales.

review_title: Not where you want to be as a manager.
review_pros:
Great friendly associates,
Having a degree helps,
Intelligent solutions,
You can kind of do nothing and get away with it but you have redundant tasks you have to do.
review_cons: Management sucks, you have to wear their clothes and if you don't they will harass you until you do. You have to be beautiful to work there.  Its just clothes. NOT WORTH IT/
review_advice_mgmt: Let people wear what they want to wear and not harass people and hire people based on talent and skill not good looks and b.s. smiles

review_title: Be social and it will make it worthwhile, otherwise you are wasting you're time
review_pros: The people you meet make it worth it but I would not highly suggest it outside of that reason.
review_cons: The smell and the music will probably drive you completely insane, and they force you to buy clothes you might not want.

review_pros: Great place to learn and grow into the retail business. Strong company with adoring teens that gives them consistant, quality product.
review_cons: Leave before it makes you mean and jaded. A&F centers around Mike, the 70 yr old CEO, and sometimes he just doesn't understand what an 18 yr old really wants. Too safe and similar and needs to actually give the smart people around him the ability to grow their business.
review_advice_mgmt: Time for new leadership. Mike helped develop the company to greatness but now needs to be taken to a newer, fresher level. It is starting to get stale in the current environment.

review_title: working at a&f is fun but not something i could do forever.
review_pros: if you like their clothes, then getting their 30% discount will save you some money on shopping. plus during christmas, they'll give you the discount to all their brands (abercrombie kids, hollister and A&F). It's a fun atmosphere to work in and everyone is hot and friendly.
review_cons: the call-in shifts are the worst part of working here. this is when YOU call them ahead of time and ask them if they need you or not. Also, the minimum wage pay sucks.
review_advice_mgmt: they should treat the loyal and older associates with more courtesy and respect (by giving hours and not call-in shifts). productivity and sales should also be rewarded.

review_title: great experience for the young in a fast paced yet cool, casual environment
review_pros: benefit package, people, environment, discount
review_cons: salary, amount of worked hours

review_title: It's a toxic environment with very little concern for your personal life/well being.
review_pros: The pay is good, you get opportunities to do things that might take more seniority to do at other companies.
review_cons: The hours and expectations are horrendous with very little concern for ones well being or personal life and getting burned out is common.  The environment is stress inducing from playing loud dance music on a track that repeats all day long to unrealistic expectations to finish a job after you've already completed it because they've changed their mind for the 10th time.  It seems that one always falls short of their expectations regardless of how hard or long you work and in turn, confidence in yourself is slowly diminished.

review_title: Good job if you're in High School
review_pros:
- easy to get a job here while in high school 
- young "cool" staff
- see friends while working there
review_cons:
- unfair management
- management is too young / not mature enough to handle adult situations 
- crude and inappropriate comments of other co-workers by managers

review_pros: Overall working here was pretty neutral.  I went in, did my thing and got paid at the end of the day.  It was a pretty chill work environment.
review_cons: Although I mentioned that it was mostly pretty chill, some people do get pretty uptight about their clothes.  I guess that's why they came to this store.

review_title: very good, with great people to work with
review_pros: great upbeat place to work at. great people to work with and a super fun environment. the job is easy, mostly consisting of folding clothing.
