review_cons: one big downside is the pay. it's not negotiable and you never get raises. the music is sometimes way too loud and the cologne is VERY strong.

review_pros: Fun co-workers, seasonal discounts on clothing, simple tasks such as greeting, folding, cashier, cleaning. . .nothing too hard or confusing to do.
review_cons: The music being so loud and on repeat for weeks on end can be very annoying. Also, customers can be rude.

review_title: This company is a dead end job.
review_pros: Flexibility, comfortable clothing, young staff, and medical benefits.
review_cons: Salary, low raises, and limited advancement.

review_pros: This place was fun, easy, and predictable.
review_cons: They play terrible music. Management and company treats its employees terribly.

review_title: One of the greatest things to happen in my life.
review_pros: Everyone is friendly. Flexible schedule, very neat, clean, and fun enviroment!
review_cons: When u do want the hours sometimes there not there. Sometimes seeing your clothes get destroyed its a little disapointing.

review_title: Overall good...but they work you too much.
review_pros: Environment was great especially in summer.
review_cons: They run far too lean in some areas which leads to having more work and longer hours.

review_pros:
Easy hours
work was a joke
discount not that bad for such a large company
good looking people to work with
review_cons:
it was smelly
the pay sucked
the management was awful 
too many floorsets
too many emplyees
standards to high for the hours given
review_advice_mgmt: The management at ANF was always incompetent. They barely did any work and forced everything upon the associates. very unfair

review_pros: Environment cannot be beat with the dress code or parties and events it is a very fun and relaxed place to work
review_cons: Compensation is not always the most fair and for being very stressful sometimes you feel very underpaid at certain times
review_advice_mgmt: Compensate based on competitors since many people go to other pllaces to get paid a lot more to do half the work

review_pros: fun and frolic, like spending time here
review_cons: timings are very strict and no compromise on that
review_advice_mgmt: be kind to entry level hires, they are still new and have a long way to go before they get experience

review_title: It was fun AT FIRST but i quickly realized I was going to need a new job.
review_pros: Its a fun place to work for a young adult. You see a lot of new people and get hands on experience. The managers are easy to work with and are helpful. The discount.
review_cons: The payment is horrible and you barely get enough hours a week to earn any real kind of salary. They expect you to wear their clothes (you might be sent to the back room if you fail to meet their clothes requirements), and even with their great discount, because of your salary, you can't afford their clothes. There's no room to move up, it seemed like I was working hard for nothing.

review_pros: You work with an amazing group of people who are educated. You have to have your four-year degree to work for A&F and they promote within, so you will have the opportunity to grow with your co-workers and know that you will always be working with educated people. In order to work at A&F, you have to be beautiful, so it is a very fun work environment. The health benefits are some of the best in the industry and the District Managers make a good salary as well as get a company car to drive, gas card, iPhone 4 and car insurance.
review_cons: The starting pay for a Manager In Training is $28,000. The company has a high turnover rate, which was at 97% in 2008. It is retail, so all managers work weekends, but the work schedule is extremely inconsistent. You cannot count on having set days off unless you are a Store Manager. If you can hire great looking part-time associates and managers, you will move up fast.
review_advice_mgmt: $28,000 starting salary is not competitive! International expansion is great, but only at a rate that the domestic stores can afford to yield high performing managers. Too many stores with 2 managers or less when the company continues to pull managers from domestic stores and send them international.

review_pros:
Great atmosphere
Fun people
Flexible schedule (mainly because of seniority)
review_cons:
Very few raises
My management team was involved with time fraud, which caused me to leave
Little pay unless you've worked there a while
Strict dress code

review_title: It's a fun and exciting work area but, the pay is low.
review_pros: Discounts, meeting new people for different backrounds.
review_cons: The problem with this job is the pay.
review_advice_mgmt: The managers are awsome, and well oganized

review_title: It was a fun experience because I was introduced to a diverse group of people!
review_pros: they're laid back, it's fun if you just need a job and the discount is really nice. you also are guaranteed to be rehired if you go off to school and come back and need a job
review_cons: they hire so many people that you don't get as many hours as you would like. sometimes you would go an entire week without working
review_advice_mgmt: their are leadership opportunities at Abercrombie, the manager would let you train new employees if they see that you do a great job at what you do.

review_pros: Coworkers were fun meet alot of new people
review_cons: Terrible Pay Management was very immature
review_advice_mgmt: Hire better management.

review_pros: I enjoyed working with people who were intelligent and attractive people like myself. I enjoyed the diversity at my store in my region.
review_cons: Not enough hours and employees not showing up causing other employees to stay longer, discounts were not enough percentage off.
review_advice_mgmt: My manager was a good manager, but some other managers would steal clothing, or would have favorite employees that got all of the hours

review_title: Annoying loud music playing, overwhelming smell of cologne, and forced to say embarrassing phrases when people walk in.
review_pros:
Flexible schedule
Chance to work in fashion industry
Cash register is fast-paced and more fun than other parts of the store
review_cons:
The music is blasting and you have a headache by the end of every shift
you must keep all clothes perfectly folded at all times 
you must say these terrible "tag lines" to every person that walks in (phrases like "have you checked out our sexy new jeans?")
the smell of cologne is way too strong - they make you spray more on mannequins every hour or so
never really praised for good work - more ridiculed for not having clothes folded properly or not saying the tag line to every customer
never really saw much opportunity for growth
review_advice_mgmt:
Give chance to long time associates to move up to a better position.
Don't give more negative feedback than positive
Music and smell too overwhelming for a comfortable work environment

review_title: Overall, the company does give you good leadership skills and buisness skills you can use in the future.
review_pros: If you actually take an interest in your job and show the managers that you care, they'll suprisingly train you properly and they might even care back. If you work hard, especially having the impact or stock lead position, you gain a hard work ethic and learn some great stockroom skills you can use at other companies. I've done all three positions, I loved Impact and Stock Lead beacuse you actually feel like you're doing something and acutally making a difference. It makes the time go by fast and you actually feel like you earn your money. A great thing about this job is that you really do meet awesome people. It's a fun job and if you're there everyday (like me), that is your social life.
review_cons: The salary is non negotionable. If you live in the middle of nowhere (like I do) good luck getting promoted. The only time a DM from a small district actually promotes someone is when someone gets fired or they're forced to by their RM. It's hard to get a promotion, unless you're in the Louisville/Lexington district (again, you have to be in a bigger city to get noticed and promoted). Our DM never allows transfers for managers unless you're going to school somewhere else. If you're stuck in a small city, you're stuck. Since I work at the Hollister Co. branch, our store has a bunch of drama and more drama than the other brands would have due to the high schoolers, which is the bad side of the company.
review_advice_mgmt: If the salary was a little higher and a limit on overtime was given to managers, I could see managers working harder and giving the brand more of a shine. Until that happens, you're going to see managers leave after their training.

review_pros:
- Very cool atmosphere, there is no other store in the mall like, or any other store outside of the mall for that matter.
- When your picture is submitted to management and they feel you meet the "look", you have the possibility of be coming an actual model; as you see on the posters around the store/website/bags/web/etc.
-Discounts, especially when the (I think it's called triple A??) And that's when there is a new season/floor set arrives and you get to have the "newest" looks for I think, maybe 50%?? (Not to sure as I had never used it.
- Your associates, not all of them but most of them are really cool. Same goes with management.
- The ability to move up the Abercrombie "ladder", if that's your intentions.
review_cons:
- Pay, wow, really bad. But the crazy thing about it is, your job is so easy and you get distracted by the people and music, you forget about everything.....until you get your check.
- Hours, you never to seem to get enough, because.. EVERYONE WANTS TO WORK. Now, that doesn't apply to all stores.
-Sad to say, but you almost feel privileged to work here; and to some people who work here, tend to take that aspect and run with it.
- When your about to close and customers come in and JACK UP the jean wall, canoe room and clearance, after you have just prepped the areas. (It is retail, so what you you expect, right?)
- Closing late, sometimes past 11P.M. Especially, for the stores that are in the mall. 
- The associates who have the "Abercrombie Attitude"which leads to customers being on guard and are instantly crabby. Especially  when they ask for a certain size/item.

review_title: It was a very fun and friendly environment to work in.
review_pros: Friendly employees and co-workers, discounts on merchandise, clean and fun environment.
review_cons: low pay, not a lot of hours
review_advice_mgmt: The employees should get more hours and higher pay than minimum wage at this company.

review_pros: I do not have any pros associated with this position, other than employee discount.
review_cons: Very low pay and terrible work hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Compensation needs to be compensorate with the work that is being performed.

review_title: Working at Abercrombie can be fun, but don't expect to get very many hours and it's only part-time.
review_pros: It can be fun and they are willing to give you time off whenever you need/request it.
review_cons: It's minimum wage, you can only work 15 hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire full-time employees other than just managers.

review_title: My experience with A&F was not a good one from the beginning to end.
review_pros: The associates are the best part of the job. You truly have a good time with the people you work with. The employee discount was okay if you like the clothes. You also got to hit on cute people who come into the store and recruit them!
review_cons: Long hours and low pay.  No communication between managers. No communication between Upper Management and SM's, and MITs.  Lots of grunt work. Lots of tedious work. Annoying can't finds, and SPR's would keep us in the store all night. Annoying "company standards" jean walls, etc. had unrealistic standards that were nearly impossible to keep while customers shop.
review_advice_mgmt: Raise the pay, and communicate with your managers. Reward us when we are doing a good job.

review_pros: The benefits are very good.
review_cons: The pay is horrible, probably lowest end of retail.
review_advice_mgmt: Years of experience in the stock manager position should be enough qualification for advancement to management. Bringing in someone with no experience in retail and giving them a management position because they have a college degree doesn't make for great competency in the role. Reward all the work the full-time stock puts into their job.

review_title: Good job if you aren't in college and don't have a degree
review_pros: Get to wear jeans and flip flops to work every day, made great friends, 40% discount for full time employees. Lead stock is the only full-time supervisory position you can get without a college degree but they have great benefits, paid days off, paid holidays, and 2 weeks vacation per year.  Also, with this position you get weekends off, this position is also the only position with a fixed schedule closing Mon-Fri and get all weekends off.
review_cons: Looks are more important than experience or competency, hire too many people, high turn over rate, close every day, cannot work overtime in this position, everything you do is time dependent so you are working as fast as you can for the entire 8 hour day, only 2 people per store per year get a 10cent raise, the top 8-10 best looking people sales associates (models) are required to work 50% of the shifts even if others have been working in the store for 3+ years, most people only get 1-2 shifts a week.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep a smaller staff of great associates, turn over rate is too high, skills should come before looks, employees should be able to move up in the company without having a college degree

review_pros: it was a great fun place to work where you would get discounts. It was nice to be in the front
review_cons: some of the people that worked there were a little stand offish. Sometimes you are really slow in the morning
review_advice_mgmt: I do not have any advice to the management because I did not have a problem working there what so ever.

review_title: great way to meet new people
review_pros: atmosphere if you enjoy interacting with people
review_cons: the pay is horrible and sometimes the music can get way too loud, even if you LOVE loud music!

review_pros: pretty easy straight forward job. everyone is very social and nice. managers understand that we have a busy lifestyle and can understand when we need time off and that we deal with emergencies as well.
review_cons: often boring at times, theres a lot of side work to do when customers aren't there. annoying music after youve been working there for awhile.
review_advice_mgmt: my advice. the best managers related to us on our level, they were very chill and we diddnt want to disappointed the managers we like the most

review_pros: I get 30% off at Hollister and 40% off at Abercrombie.  Full benefits.
review_cons: They base things mostly on looks. If you don't recruit good looking people then you won't get promoted. It doesn't make sense why a manager has to have a degree. Anyone can be a manager in the company. The turnover rate is horrible. After 40 hours, you get paid supplemental pay not time and a half. The hours are ridiculous. Just drama because everyone who works there has a teenager mentality. Since you work with nothing but 17 year olds it starts to rub off. Its high school drama. Everyone has their clicks, including managers.
review_advice_mgmt: The company was made for you to stay late. Most of the people, if not all, date others within the company because they don't have time for outsiders. It's hard for someone that doesn't work for the company to understand the slave drivers in this company. Mike Jeffries needs to take a closer look at his company. It use to be fun but now everyone is leaving and its just not the same.

review_title: Not enough hours, not enough pay
review_pros: It was very lax because I was cool with the manager. I got to choose what I wanted to do in which room and I was able to choose my hours.
review_cons: I worked overtime and never got paid for it. When the summer time came around, I didn't get enough hours and I was lucky to even work one shift a week.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't take the job if there are better ones available. If you are not close with the managers, they won't give you hours and will give you the jobs that no one else wants to do.

review_title: The company taught me structure but there is little pay for the time invested.
review_pros: To get a hold of the ropes on 5 th Ave. Surrounded by all of retail you can see how its done in real life and have an edge on competition.
review_cons: It sucks you in. One minute your working there in-between jobs the next your working clopenings ( close shift followed by an opening shift) it's tough to keep heard head in the game.

review_title: It was tedious work, at minimum wage; only upside was the cute people working there.
review_pros: The employees must be attractive in order to work there, creating an environment full of pretty people. This boosted morale.
review_cons: Since it was full of pretty people and they all knew it, there was a bad vibe given off, sort of an elitest feel. Soundtrack should be changed more often.
review_advice_mgmt: Loosen up a bit. Selling clothes would be easier with a more relaxed and comfortable environment, especially with a better music selection.

review_pros: (Note: Worked at Home Office) Relatively mindless work. Censor, fold, put away clothes, repeat. Managers rarely pester the Impact Team Members. 40% discount on all A&F merchandise.
review_cons: (Note: Worked at Home Office) Very strict "look policy." Must stand the entire shift. No customer interaction. Both the loud music and scent become overbearing.

review_pros: The people in the stores (i.e. other models and impacters) are the best. I've worked at two different A&Fs in two different states, and the people I've met there have been some of the nicest and outgoing friends I've ever had. They help make for a less dreadful work atmosphere. Some of the asst. managers are pretty cool, and the store manager can be cool if they're not stressed out.
review_cons: Working really hard and not getting any recognition or thanks. Not getting enough hours. The pressure to fit look standards. Favoritism. Disrespect at the hands of upper-level management. Insane tasks and even crazier deadlines. Poor scheduling/ disbursment of hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Please take into account that some of these store employees work really hard and depend on this job. We are not disposable things as it is sometimes portrayed. Many of us work and go to school full-time, so it would be nice to come to work and feel respected as fundamentals in the success of the company. We create store experiences for the customer, and if our hearst are not in it, the customer will feel that. This is not intetional, but it's hard to look forward to coming in and working hard when we feel that our strives and accomplishments will go unappreciated.

review_title: working at A&F was not what I expected it to be.
review_pros: The discounts are decent and the employees are ok
review_cons: Loud obnoxious music, rude managers, horrible hours
review_advice_mgmt: N/A

review_pros: Easy work schedule, good discount, the managers were willing to let you self manage so you did not have them constantly on your back.  I've found that employer don't mind you having a past history with this company.  Mainly because they know you have been worked to the bone and for nothing.  So they know you are resilient and can take a high energy environment.
review_cons: There was really no opportunity for advancement to the corporate level from within the store unless you quit and come back.  It is also very hard to get any communication back from the company.  Be ready to call repeatedly.
review_advice_mgmt: Communicate with the associates and if they are a worthy aspect of the company make the opportunity to advance available

review_pros: Fast promotion rate and huge growth internationally
review_cons: Retail hours and working holidays
review_advice_mgmt: Take this job seriously and it will be very rewarding

review_pros: The associates were really fun to work with along with the managers. Everyone was really welcoming and it's great workplace for a college or high school student. The hours were great and people were always willing to trade shifts.
review_cons: The pay is minimum wage, so sometimes standing for 5 or 4 hours isn't very appealing. Sometimes when the store was slow you had to find something to do.
review_advice_mgmt: Discount on sales for employees or maybe an extra discount a month for employees to afford the AAA.

review_title: Very Organized, management requires a four year degree but most management team members are incompetent
review_pros:
very organized, what they seek in their employees is very clear.  
very standardized company
review_cons: full time staff members are the only ones that do anything besides a few part time staff members, the company is obviously very looks based rather than work ethic when hiring "models"
review_advice_mgmt: get it together, start allowing experience versus a four year degree for management positions and you would start to have retail managers who know how to drive sales versus the idiots you have now

review_title: Management Bootcamp; Effective Training and Will increase your overall skills in how to manage people.
review_pros:
*Skill building
*Become versatile in developing various areas of expertise, from back of house -> front of house
*Will build character and team skills
review_cons:
*Low pay
*Intense work environment due to large footfall of customers
*Areas for growth to cities you may not want to live in.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more to retain great managers. Human resources are your best investment, invest in your staff.

review_pros: Great music, coworkers are laid back and friendly.
review_cons: Not even hours, Managers sometimes suck.

review_pros: The people there are kinda cool and sometimes its fun but its a good amount of work and responsibility.
review_cons: The amount of responsibility that you receive by yourself and the amount of work they expect you to get done in a short amount of time.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop cutting corners and have more people working upstairs at a time.

review_pros:
Lots of young people ( teens and twenties) to work with
Ok discount-50s were great
I liked the clothes
Very easy work
review_cons:
Rules kept changing as far as dress code....it got very limited by the end
Lots of lazy managers/co-workers
Ridiculous tag lines

review_pros: good experience, get decent benefits, might be able to work with cool people if your lucky, entry level position, might be something your looking for
review_cons: overwork you for what you get paid, really stingy about using benefits such as vacation days, company tries to somehow make you work more without compensating, high turnover rate, have to recruit people, favoritism is unavoidable, make promises that don't really happen such as getting promoted etc.
review_advice_mgmt: Corporate offices needs to really start doing something about the company especially career growth, need to value hard workers and reward them instead of putting more work load on them, be professional like they say they are

review_pros:
-The discount is great if you shop at the store
-Some of the people who work there are nice
review_cons:
-I've been hired for one month already and was JUST put on the schedule today. For one day. I worked one day last week, only because an employee allowed me too. 
-They assume that every time they call you last second to work you will be ready and run to the store. Today, for example, I had my sister's graduation and dinner. A manager called asking me to work (when I clearly put on the schedule I could not work today). She seemed very annoyed when I explained why I couldn't. 
-The pay is pretty bad. It's a lot of work for minimum wage... Standing on your feet for hours in the stock room and climbing all the way up to put clothing away. It's not an easy job.
review_advice_mgmt: Learn how to make a schedule and keep to it.

review_title: More downs than ups (aka find a different job)
review_pros:
-the coworkers are chill
-get a lot of hours
-get paid (although not that much)
-work doesn't involve that much brainpower
-supposedly flexible hours (thats why they say to try to reel you in for the job, but its not true, for me at least)
-a couple of the managers are nice
review_cons:
-low pay (minimum wage) that does not make up for the amount of time you spend dealing with difficult customers
-work can get boring at times, especially if you are a model
-after a six/seven hour shift, your legs are dead tired from standing the entire time
-managers do have favorites, although they try to be subtle about it
-music gets very annoying
-dress code is RIDICULOUS & strict (only if you are female though, isn't too bad for the guys)
-hire based on looks 
-hours are so unpredictable (ps. please do away with call-in shifts, they make it impossible to plan)
-managers can get pretty bossy
-its hard to help out customers (for ex. assist them in looking for something) when you can only stay in one room 
-they emphasize so much on customer service yet when the line for the registers or the fitting rooms get really long, they never open any of the other ones we have in the store
review_advice_mgmt: If you can, please try to address each of the cons I've listed above. Good job to some of the hardworking nice managers in my store though, they deserve it :)

review_title: A good job with a few flaws.
review_pros: The company has an awesome discount for employees with floor set changes, hires fun and outgoing employees and casual managers that make coming to work fun.
review_cons: You get paid minimum wage to achieve tasks that are sometimes near impossible within your scheduled time so you're constantly hanging over. They hire people all the time and have ridiculous goals as far as new associates and then do a bad job at training those associates.
review_advice_mgmt: I would suggest the management realize that over hiring associates does nothing positive for the company and that treating your employees like dirt is going to force them to leave.

review_pros: Utilizing customer service, it has helped me to be able to communicate with both customers and other associates for a better experience at the store.
review_cons: There is very minimal interaction with the associates themselves. Secluded to do your own work so it has that cubicle feeling.

review_pros: About the only pro about this job was that I worked with other people that were my age. It was pretty easy to request time off as well since the job is only part time.
review_cons: The major downside for working for A&F was that store managers are almost completely incompetent. Also the managers are always pushing you to wear the newest style of clothing. Since the clothing is so expensive you cannot afford to buy the stuff with the minimum wage salary you are earning.
review_advice_mgmt: A good way to obtain and retain quality employees is by giving them raises if they perform well. In my two years with the company I was never rewarded for any of my work.

review_title: just a way to earn some money
review_pros: good looking people all around
review_cons: management is bossy and demanding
review_advice_mgmt: recognize individual achievements in the work place

review_title: The store environment was cool and fun. That was the only way I survived the slave labor.
review_pros: Upbeat and laid back environment.
review_cons: Few hours.  Minimal concern for employees health, growth or livelihood.  Limited benefits. Very minimal discount on clothes.  They probably made most of their sales off of employees because you were required to wear their clothes.  Flip flops are required an inappropriately supportive considering the labor intensive stocking, re-shelving and standing necessary to complete the tasks.
review_advice_mgmt: Hollister leadership should set goals that directly reflect and  impact an employees growth in the company.

review_title: Great work environment. Co-workers worked great together
review_pros: Great work environment and Opportunities for promotion
review_cons: Repetitive work and wide range of hours

review_title: Ok place to work - not great for long term
review_pros: I've been with this company for almost 4 years now, and I've always felt one of the main pro's is the flexibility of scheduling.  A&F requires so many associates on staff that requesting time off or finding someone to cover a shift at the last minute is very easy to do.  This makes it the perfect place to work if you're a full time student.
review_cons: Pay is not great.  Like most PT retail positions you start out at minimum wage.  To top things off a few years ago they got rid of their "raise" system.  So despite the fact that I've been a diligent and hard worker for almost 4 years, I get paid the same amount as new hires.  The only upside to this (which some could consider a downside as well) is that seniority makes a HUGE difference when getting scheduled.  New hires often times don't get a great amount of hours.

review_pros:
The campus is a great environment and the people can be pleasant to work with 
The initial compensation is comparably good for the industry
The close interaction between senior management provides for a quick exposure to the skills of the industry
review_cons:
The amount of hours that you are expected to work make it extremely difficult to maintain a balance between life and work, especially if you have a family.

Limited and complicated upward mobility
review_advice_mgmt: Encourage employees to cultivate a life outside of A&F so as to avoid stagnation

review_title: Not the worst place to work
review_pros:
-VERY flexible scheduling, can specify times available and not available, can usually get someone to cover a shift you cannot make
-Relatively easy job
review_cons:
-Sometimes cannot get as many hours as you would like
-Menial work, repetitive and sometimes extremely boring
-Smells and music get to be a bit much
review_advice_mgmt:
-Give associates different tasks, rotate them through different responsibilities/positions
-Be more responsive to individuals, try to make work more fun with promotions

review_pros: Surrounded by attractive people, not much work to do.
review_cons: Super strict look policy and constantly being critiqued by upper level management on looks.
review_advice_mgmt: Learn to use positive reinforcement.

review_pros: It has a cool atmosphere, lots of good looking people to work around, fun young staff and you can choose your schedule.
review_cons: they dont pay much at all and you have to work weekends, the store is always really dark and its easy for eyes to get tired.
review_advice_mgmt: i always disliked the strong smell of cologne in the store, the fact that it smells like guys cologne does not help;

review_pros: It is a great environment
review_cons: Only con was that I was paid minimum wage
review_advice_mgmt: you guys did a awesome job

review_pros:
Much to learn
Detailed expectations
Great opportunity to meet people of a common interest
Great atmosphere for young, single, grad
review_cons:
Immpossible to get off for emergency
Company judges EVERYONE based on looks
Teach employees to be materialistic
DO NOT CARE ABOUT EMPLOYEES AS INDIVIDUALS
review_advice_mgmt: Spend more time in the stores. Find a way for managers in 3 manager stores to be off in case of emergency.  Offer fitness incintive.  QUIT RATING INDIVIDUALS ON THEIR LOOKS!

review_pros: Fun place to work.  Challenging amount of work to do in little amount of time.  Good employee discount.
review_cons: Low pay with little chance of increase unless you are promoted.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay sales brand representatives more.

review_title: Insane at times, but great other times.
review_pros:
Great clothes.
Ability to establish relationships with your coworkers that end up as your friends.
You learn how to do things faster and better than people from other clothing stores. (ie. your presentation of the product looks better than just messy stacks of clothing or items)
You learn and realize so much more by seeing and interacting with managers, customers, the impact crew, etc.
review_cons:
Sometimes there were horrible communication channels between managers and workers. 
People not showing up to work when scheduled.
People not calling in when there needs to be a shift covered.
Being over hours and having to close the store down with half the people you really need.
review_advice_mgmt: Definitely work on the communication between managers and workers.

review_title: Fine if you like folding clothes and smelling like perfume for a week
review_pros: Cute clothes and decent discount
review_cons: Strong smell, loud music, complaining customers

review_title: "Been here 8 years? Don't care. No B.S."
review_pros: Great Benefits, Beautiful Campus, Great Job out of college, decent discount, No Degree Required
review_cons: Overnight Manager dictates 6pm-2am shifts typically, and or a marginal variance on that such as 5pm-2am or 4pm-2am. Overnight Managers, or OMG's are required to stay on floorsets until 6am, typically with 1 or 2 other Assistant Managers. Specific Cons: expected to perform at a Store Manager level with Store Manager responsibility nightly, with Assistant Manager pay. Because no degree is required, typically OMG's are years away from a degree, which can and does lead to a real lack of motivation. Also, often times the daytime will not finish, and yet expect the night shift to stay until everything is completed, even if it means staying all night. Some OMG's have been employed for 6 to 7 years, and yet are not eligible for a promotion b/c they don't have a degree; however we are still expected to perform like a Store Manager...who makes $15,000 more a year than I do?
review_advice_mgmt: If there's no treat on the end of the stick, what in the world are we working towards? Would you do the work you're asking others to do, given the same timelines? Stop creating double standards for the daytime and expecting the night-time shift to pick up the slack. Maximize training in all positions - do not expect your OMG's to perform if you're not training them like an MIT. Additionally, it's not entirely fair to continue to keep creating positions if you are not going to follow through - reconsider the degree requirement for AM's and MIT's - especially if the people interviewing have 6 to 7 years with the company, but no degree...doesn't it make more sense to hire the person with company experience over the person with a degree in Engineering? Think about it.

review_pros: Great, well-known, respected and profitable company... with an impeccable sense of style. If appreciate uniformity, appearances and quality, Abercrombie is a job for you.
review_cons: Retail is not an industry for all, you d have to play by the rules. Long hours and tedious work is sometimes required.
review_advice_mgmt: Should offer better perks to employees, it will motivate them to perform better. Also, need more innovative internship opportunities for students.

review_title: Great people & very laid back job.
review_pros: Good music and great people
review_cons: It is pretty slow paced.
review_advice_mgmt: Teach EVERYONE how to fold correctly, back stock fold correctly, and sensor correctly.

review_title: Extremely flexible laid back job sales job.
review_pros: The job is extremely flexible. If you need off that day, you can usually find someone or the store will take a call in. It is amazing for someone in college. It is also extremely laid back. They have sales goals you are supposed to meet, but there was more of a focus on maintaining, at our store at least, then customer service second.
review_cons: The discount, pay, and sometimes the hours. I never had a problem getting hours since I was with the company for a while (sometimes I would work up to 40 hours) while other employees would get one or 2 days. Call ins - you have 1 or 2 a week and you call an hour before to see if they need you. You can never make official plans
review_advice_mgmt: Work on a better discount than the AAA's. Competitors are giving much better discounts and paying more, this could be part of the high turnover each store experiences.

review_title: Take it for what it is
review_pros: nice clothes, good music, fun atmosphere, well lit,
review_cons: not many hours are given to associates, horrible pay and no raises.

review_title: Learned alot, very stressful, company based on poor values and hires based on looks.
review_pros: Meet fun attractive people, get to learn the other side of working retail, learn management and customer service skills, no other job after it will ever seem as stressful and annoying as dealing with the type of people we have to deal with.
review_cons: We hire based on looks, not brains or experience. We are constantly hiring new people which means we constantly have not fully trained people on the sales floor which is an inconvenience for the company.  We don't get paid to do all the work we do.
review_advice_mgmt: Focus on people and recruiting the best looking people, and you will go far.  Always keep your looks up and your spirits high.

review_title: Not a good place to work.
review_pros: it isnt really good place. its only ok if your a kid looking for a part time job during school of over the summer
review_cons: the atmosphere is horrible. the people are fake. the music  is too loud. no one cares if you've worked there for years.
review_advice_mgmt: if your nicer to employees and give them good feed back when they complete a task things would run a lot smoother

review_pros: fun people, good looking clothes
review_cons: recruiting goals, rude district manager, look policy, make you wear the clothes, ridiculous manager in training program, will transfer you without notice, repetitive music, hours
review_advice_mgmt: You once were an MIT, you need to start treating others with respect. They are people too!

review_title: I was there for four years and not one raise! I worked 40 hours a week!
review_pros: Its just cool to work there and I did little work.
review_cons: They expect certain people to work all the hours because we fit the "look" but I never got a pay raise. Overtime hours finally made it worth it.
review_advice_mgmt: Working here isn't a walk in the park. Pay your employees more and take away the need for a bachelors degree for MIT. I worked here for 4 years while pursuing my degree. I finished and now I realized I screwed myself out of better opportunities while in school.

review_pros: Interaction with customers built communication skills.
review_cons: Get payed next to nothing.

review_title: Poor compensation for high brand retailer
review_pros:
Excellent dedication to organization, layout, and product quality.
Impressive methods for ensuring store site compliance and maintaining minimal shrink.
Good management structure.
review_cons:
Unfriendly work environment.
Lack of variability in product design.
Absent willingness for open communication of new ideas from lower management.
Poor training and communication of expectations.
review_advice_mgmt:
Communicate with your staff better on goals and expectations.
Be more open to suggestions and allow free exchange of ideas without judgement.

review_pros:
Flexible schedule
opportunity to meet attractive people
fun environment
chill
review_cons:
very low hours
pay sucks
hard to feel very important

review_title: Mind numbing experience, but made a lot of good friends.
review_pros: Good people who where fun to get to know. Created a great wardrobe for the mindset, until you grow out of it and look from "the other side"
review_cons: Zero customer service. As a shopper I enjoy authentically great customer service. They over work their management (But at the time I really didn't mind)

review_title: Work very long hours, work very hard, hire people based on looks.
review_pros: Fast promotions, bonuses, and cool people to work with. Get a TON of experience in a lot of different areas, including visual, stockroom systems, recruiting, and human resources.
review_cons: Hiring based on looks, poor management by district managers, work very long hours at times (especially during hollidays), some promotions given to people for the wrong reasons, and you have to put in a LOT of work. You do things that you didn't think you would be doing after getting a college degree (like mopping floors and babysitting high school employees who have zero work ethic).
review_advice_mgmt:
Hire people based on knowledge, education, competencies, and experience instead of LOOKS. There have been so many great candidates apply for the MIT (manager in training) program who get passed over simply because the district manager says they "don't have the look."

Pay your managers more. So many other companies pay their managers higher salaries.

Give regular raises to part timers who deserve it. Instead of giving 1-2 part timers a raise each year based on management's preferences, give 10-15 raises a year for part timers who work hard. Kids who work for minimum wage and never get a raise tend to not want to work very hard.

review_pros: Get to work with different people everyday and develop management skills
review_cons: Being a great manager does not always get you ahead. It falls alot on good looks and how many people you can get to enjoy working with you.

review_pros: Lots of hours during seasonal, able to listen to music while working, food provided during mandatory Saturday and Sunday shifts
review_cons: Management is often clueless, department leads often know more than supervisors, little opportunity to move up. It's often unknown what time a person works the following day until after the work day is over.
review_advice_mgmt: Communicate with employees more efficiently and use more time for planning. Don't switch employee jobs mid shift, causing them to leave early or stay late as many people car pool.

review_title: This is not a company one can be proud to be a part of.
review_pros: This company provides a benefit package that is sufficient.  This company also provides an opportunity to advance from MIT to AM in three months.
review_cons: District managers and home office personnel display hubris personalities that become problematic due to their dismal ability to problem solve.
review_advice_mgmt: District managers and home office personnel should stride to be more ethical to their store level management teams and hourly employees.

review_pros: The large campus, young atmosphere, relax work environment, competitive pay, and excellent health benefits are by fare the best in the retail industry.
review_cons: There is a strong lack of accountability amounts peers. Employees are too eager to point fingers than to find a solution to solve any issues.
review_advice_mgmt: Management needs to holding their employees accountable for their actions and comments. Don't assume that that your employees are being truthful!

review_title: Didnt get alot of hours, very low pay and the discount was not very good.
review_pros: There really isnt too many pros to the job, I was liked by my manager so I usually got a decent amount of hours. Liked getting 50 percent off every season.
review_cons: Had to wear what they wanted you to wear, you never got any pay increase, the "look policy" is crazy. Overall there are too many rules, and they hire too many people.

review_title: A great job if all you care about is making sure pretty people are working and are dressed in the company's clothing.
review_pros: It's easy since everything is printed out in the morning for you to do that day. After your tasks are completed, it's smooth sailing for the rest of the shift.
review_cons: Upper management cares little about job performance, customer service, or giving raises to those employees who deserve it. The most important thing is what the associates look like when upper management walks in the door, if they're wearing the company's clothes (which are not provided), and if they're not wearing nail polish, etc.
review_advice_mgmt: The most important thing to companies (normal ones) is sales. This company would rather send a worker home because they aren't wearing a belt or are wearing eyeliner, etc. which means a number of customers have to go without assistance or have to wait longer in line. No customer is going to walk out and refuse to buy something simply because the girl in the front room has nail polish on her fingers (which is not allowed).

review_pros: employees are very helpful and knowledgeable
review_cons: tough customers to deal with
review_advice_mgmt: communicate better

review_pros:
Seeing clothing before the public gets to see them.
Knowing what goes on sale before anyone else.
Not high pressure.
review_cons:
The management teams are not effective.
The other employees could be screened to a higher degree.
The discounts not enough to make you buy their clothing.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire people that want to end up making it to corporate. That way they actually have themselves invested in making sure the store runs well.

review_pros: Some of the reasons why people should work at Abercrombie would be the managers, meeting new people, and schedule flexibility.
review_cons: The cons of working at Abercrombie would be hours, the pay because it is only minimum wage, and some workers just stand there to look pretty instead of doing what they're paid to do.
review_advice_mgmt: Honestly, I think my store manager does a great job of managing the store. The assistant managers should keep a close eye on some of the lazy workers who take half an hour break instead of their 15.

review_title: High school with a 4 year degree
review_pros: Opportunity to go international. Dress code is very casual.
review_cons: Some managers are hired based off of looks because managers are in high demand at the moment and looks are everything with this company. Management turnover is high because of this. Hardworking managers with great work ethics end up having to pick up after the others and it gets to the point where they quit. In some districts it is very high school where every manager is spreading rumors about other managers. You would think that a position that requires a four year degree it would be professional, but every store has it's major flaws no matter which one you work at. Stress level is high due to limited resources given to you.
review_advice_mgmt: Higher standards for management selection is highly recommended. Every store that I have worked at, all managers are very dissatisfied with every aspect of the company it almost seems depressing to have to work for a company where nobody likes their jobs.

review_pros: Discount its fun, people are nice and cool. the smell and the music is great also. i am very please
review_cons: sometimes they dont give you alot of hours to work or many days when you really want to work though
review_advice_mgmt: Keep up the great job, i love working for you guys, it feel its one big family during work

review_title: Do not Work Here Unless you are a Model, or as a last resort
review_pros:
-really young staff
-fun when people are at work
review_cons:
-no consideration for employees/respect for personal life
-they will call you at 9 am asking you to come in 2 hours earlier than your scheduled shift
-they will schedule you for days you are not available to work and threaten to write you up
-no one trains you unless you specifically ask for help
-you most likely will not learn anything, or will be asked to do something you were never trained to do for your entire shift
review_advice_mgmt:
be more organized and have more respect for your employees
understand that abercrombie&fitch is not the center of their lives

review_pros: I love the place, i get discount, i meet cool people. i love their clothing and designs. Its my favorite brand.
review_cons: its tiring, can be dull after a while. you dont get paid very much and u dont get to work very much.
review_advice_mgmt:
motivate all workers constantly
more training for new workers
more activities
more workers from other countries
more job routine makes it more fun

review_title: Learned new things, but I feel like the company doesn't support their employees.
review_pros: They give you free clothes.
review_cons: Every manager is only out to get theirs.
review_advice_mgmt: No "I" in TEAM and the Fraternization policy is in all females favor!

review_title: Dissatisfied with upper management lack of leadership
review_pros: Fast advancement into upper management (depending on your district manager and willing to relocate) great health benefits.
review_cons: Poor pay, and balance between work and personal life.
review_advice_mgmt: Give the managers more responsibility and input.

review_title: No work/life balance. Very time consuming with no light at the end of the tunnel.
review_pros: Great associates, you recruit them.
review_cons: Difficult to balance social life and work. Based on company values, managers are pretentious and egotistical. Career growth is limited if you do not find Ohio appealing.
review_advice_mgmt: Hours allocated to management is poor. Work and life balance does not exist. Managers are difficult to find according to company standards, respect them, they run your business.

review_title: Great Place to Start a Career
review_pros: Smart people, great benefits, and a working environment that matches the brand.
review_cons: Very demanding without a lot of respect for people.  Churn employees after 1-2 years.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat employees better, show respect for other's ideas that may be different than Sr. Management, without using fear as a tactic.

review_title: A&F really treats their employees great, but you HAVE to drink the kool aid...
review_pros: A&F has  the best benefit packages I have ever had, not to mention so many other perks.  The campus is absolutely beautiful, and although some areas require extremely long working hours, mine were 8:30-5:30, no exceptions. My job was low stress, and the pay was on the high end for my industry.
review_cons: It's a little ridiculous-you HAVE to look like an A&F clone to get ahead or even be accepted there. at 32, I was a good decade older than most employees.
review_advice_mgmt: My personal boss was great, but most areas are run by people who have only been working for a few years...very underqualified for their positions were they to move to any other companies.

review_title: Worst experience for my first job.
review_pros:
Easy to get a job here, even if you have no sales experience.
You get a 30% employee discount on their clothes, which is great if you love wearing their clothes like I do.
review_cons:
They don't train you and expect you to know exactly what you are supposed to be doing to the "T" on your very first day (e.g., how to fold the clothes to perfection, where to put the clothes in the sales floor, etc).
Most managers, if they don't like you, will literally treat you like crap and not give you hours.
They definitely pick favorites when it comes to letting people have regular shifts & giving people their call-in hours.
If they don't like you enough to have you around, they will only give you ONE shift each week (if you are lucky) and fill your week up with call-ins that won't let you make any plans for your day because you have to wait to see if they "need" you (in other words, if they like you & want you to come into work), which they more than likely won't; especially if you are new.
If you ask them questions as to how to do something, they will most likely become annoyed & "help" you with a bad attitude.
review_advice_mgmt: When hiring, specifically, impact team members don't assume that they are going to know the ropes of the job from the get go. A person needs to be trained when working in a new environment to be able to perform to the best of their ability. Also, if one gets one measly shift every two to three weeks, then it's even less possible for them to learn how to do their job efficiently since they are not only not getting training but also not gaining any experience.

review_title: Good place to work if you're not worried about making money.
review_pros: Flexible hours, friendly co-workers, decent discount, not very demanding, not that many customers, easy to get time off, fun environment
review_cons: standing for hours, music playing in the store can get too loud to bear for a long time, some managers are clueless as to what is going on.  Get paid minimum wage
review_advice_mgmt: Be more aware of what is going on in the store in order to provide a better customer experience.  Hire more individuals so that there are enough people to assist customers.

review_title: Negative environment, care more about image than people
review_pros:
Running a multimillion dollar store very quickly
knowledge learned of store aspects
promotion within the store
working with inspiring people
review_cons:
long hours
underpaid for job/work done
extremely judgemental company
upper management does not listen to needs of employees

review_pros: It smelt good and you get a discount on really nice clothes
review_cons: The hours sucked, the workers are vapid and the managers are unprofessional
review_advice_mgmt: Maybe you could actually listen to your employees

review_pros: Only possible pro is when you get to work with certain people who make it tolerable. SOmetimes the music is catchy
review_cons: Everything...pay sucks, discount sucks, managers suck,  hours suck..A lot of times they don't let you on your breaks or cut your shift by an hour so you don't have a paid lunch.
review_advice_mgmt: Try to encourage your employees to do better, not berate them and cut down on the favoritism.

review_title: Being an Impact Team Member is a forgettable experience
review_pros: It is not hard to get offered an Impact Team position by Abercrombie and Fitch. There is only one round of interviews, and it is a group interview. Some of my coworkers were friendly and easygoing; it was easy to make friends with them. One of my bosses was also very supportive, especially when I was first hired.
review_cons: When I worked for Abercrombie and Fitch, there was no set schedule. You have to go in the store every Friday to print out your schedule for the following week. Thus, hours were very inconsistent. One week you might be working 15 hours, the next you might not be working at all. I also felt like my boss obviously favored some of my coworkers. As an Impact Team member, I also felt like I was less appreciated than the models of our store.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat all your employees with more respect. I believe the Impact Team members generally work harder than say, the models, but rarely did we get any recognition.

review_pros:
Meet new people
Make new friends
Can time as many days off as you want
review_cons: The pay is not enough

review_title: Can be fun, but not a job for long term.
review_pros: The medical benefits are the best I've seen or heard of! The environment is fun and mostly relaxed.
review_cons: You never get praise for your hard work. Ever. No one recognizes you when you do good, only points out the negative. Raises hardly ever happen. The hours are awful.
review_advice_mgmt: Praise your associates when they are working hard. Make them feel appreciated.

review_pros: You get to learn about diversity plus working with the people there are greats they are always nice and friendly.
review_cons: You must wear their clothes just because they always have good images of their characters and even manager, impact team.
review_advice_mgmt: Learn diversity for the interview it pretty easy but then it's important to give a good hard definition of the word.

review_pros:
Cool People.
Some managers are extremely cool, others are horrible.
Extremely flexible hours
review_cons:
Minimum wage
Music will drive you nuts
Smell can be overwhelming at times
A lot of the people there are very conceited
review_advice_mgmt: Be humble and respectful to your employees so they will do the same to you. Create a comfortable and fun environment. This will make them look forward to coming to work since the pay definitely isn't motivating.

review_title: Good opportunity upon graduating without any other options available
review_pros: Abercrombie and Fitch is a pretty cool environment to work in. Typically managers and associates are entertaining at work and make the day go by fast. If you love the brand you will enjoy the discount.
review_cons: The pay is one of the worse things about the position. Technically an employee will put up with more stress, large amounts of work and over the top expectations when they are being compensated properly, but when your pay rate is one of the lowest among retail assistant manager positions you don't expect to have to deal with too much. Also, very inconsistent scheduling and unclear goals of what it takes to get promoted.
review_advice_mgmt: Definitely should reconsider pay rates. Upper management (i.e. DMs, RMs and higher) blame high turnover rates on store managers not motivating or encouraging assistant managers, but it's more of assistant managers not filling fulfilled at work and not feeling as though they are properly compensated for the workload they do.

review_pros: The best reason to work at abercrombie is if you're a college student or high school student that needs a summer job and that is the only reason why.
review_cons: The management is rather uncaring and only responds to those of personal preference rather than all at an equal level.

review_pros:
- Friendly, great looking people, whom will become your family because you are there so much.
- Ability operate a million dollar business right out of college.
- The ability to basically not be held accountable for anything and still have a "career"
- International expansion means big perks + ability to see the world
- Here and there you run into someone that actually deserved to be promoted.
review_cons:
- Image is the first filter, whether you will be hired, promoted, talked to into the job it will not be because of your internship while in the university or your past retail experience for those applying part time, it will be due to you image. Natural, beautiful without make up etc...

- Hours. 40 + hours with no overtime. Except if you live in California which from what I hear you may never go over 43 hours or you will get warned + written up

- Accountability, there is none. No matter how hard you work at this level it all comes down to staffing your store. If you dont have great looking associates your basically no one no matter how hard and how well your floorsets are done it does not matter.

- Store only mentality only picture. Upper management forgets that this is a public company and that there are more to this company than just cleaning the dust on top of your frames.
review_advice_mgmt: Everyone of you have been at the store level at one point and somewhere along the line you forgot what it was like. The playlist is the same 50 minute songs for 3 straight months, the fragrance is extreme, the naked posters are offensive and the costumers are completely insane, rude and completely disrespectful, so when  did YOU forget that some people may be exhausted and sick of this extreme relentless environment? Werent you?

review_title: I would never recommend anyone to work for Abercrombie & Fitch as a MIT.
review_pros: Fun to work with students and college age demographic
review_cons: Long hours and lots of responsibility for low salary

review_pros:
Flexible hours.

Great Manger in Training Program
review_cons:
Pay is terrible

Stereotypical

Bad reputation

review_pros: Great benefits and lasting friendships are made
review_cons: Extremely low pay, little career growth, long hours

review_pros:
Awesome team members
Flexible schedule
Great clothes
review_cons:
Too much to pay for your uniform
Not enough hourly wage
review_advice_mgmt: Raise the hourly wage and dont require people to wear EXACTLY what the store sells

review_title: Only for Experience on a Resume
review_pros: Salary larger than those of other management positions even in other fields.  Great benefits package. Able to move up in the company with minimum amount of effort.
review_cons: Policies are too strict yet ineffective - loss prevention, look policy.  Company too based on image.  Too many hours put in yet can't ever take a sick day even when desperately needed.  Schedule is awful.

review_pros: Loved everything about it. Home Office is beautiful and has a great vibe. Only quit the job because my husband got relocated overseas
review_cons: The massive parking lot makes the walks into your building 10-20 mins.

review_title: A&F was a diverse workplace bound by the brand that is A&F
review_pros: Diversity, the brand name, the campus environment, exposure to senior executives on-campus
review_cons: Repetitive work in some positions

review_title: Not the best job, not the worst job
review_pros:
- Discount is good if you really like the brand (if you work here, you probably do)
- Flexible hours
review_cons:
- Minimum wage
- You get tired easily
- The perfume might kill you
- The music is repetitive and makes you want to die

review_title: learned a lot, meet great people, not much room to move up.
review_pros: learned a lot overall, did a lot of different things
review_cons: not much room to grow, poor managing skills from bosses

review_title: It was a great place to work, but it depends completely on the store's management.
review_pros:
-Extremely flexible hours
-Fun work environment
-No extremely demanding tasks
-AAA Discount is good
-Regular employee discount is fair
-Never have to buy cologne...you can't work there without smelling like the store
-You get to say you got past the look filter used during the hiring process
review_cons:
-Sometimes you have to fight for hours
-Minimum wage (expected)
-Limited/no opportunities to advance into management
-No benefits/stock options for non-management positions
-They hire too many employees
-There's no set training program
-If you have a store manager that's not fun...you won't have a good experience.
review_advice_mgmt: Must give store managers more hours to work with per week. Must be more flexible with look policy concerning dress code. Store managers need to learn to make good working relationships with employees.

review_pros: cool kids, discount, funtimes overall abercrombie and fitch is a fun cool place to work i really enjoyed my time there
review_cons: Dress codes was a little annoying along with the fragrance headaches and only worsened with the loud bumping music woah
review_advice_mgmt: Take time to acknowledge your employees and give credit where credit it do lots of kids working hard they deserve apreciation

review_pros: being able to work with people my age
review_cons: unfair hours, unpredictable closing shifts, attitude of managers and higher authorities that are not sufficient in work force
review_advice_mgmt: give workers the raise that they deserve

review_title: Why Did I Stick Along for so Long?
review_pros:
Health benefits were great
Quick Hire process
review_cons:
Long hours with only 1/2 time overtime. avg of 60 hour weeks.
Working weekends, nights and holidays.
Hire and promote based on looks.

review_pros:
Learn from others who may inspire you
Fun environment
Learn ins and outs of running a business
Valuable experience for recent grads
review_cons:
Favortism hurts you
If disliked you will eventually feel bad about yourself
If you are disliked in any way or if you are struggling with something you will be pushed out and in some circumstances you will not be given help/tools to help you improve
If your stuck in the doghouse as listed above, don't expect positive praise often. Even when you start to feel proud of your accomplishments and want to talk about those positive experiences
review_advice_mgmt: Teach, Coach, Motivate!  Provide balance of feedback. Peple want that praise...a blend of good and bad. Hearing praise/feedback makes you a better leader! (Learned/Shared Experience)

review_title: Good for college students who just want extra cash
review_pros: The discounts are ok if you like the companies clothes, its good for college kids who want some extra money. management will work around your class time just be prepared to give up your weekends.
review_cons: if your good you'll always be working, hours can be very long during the holidays and management can be as lost as you are sometimes.
review_advice_mgmt: Give your associates a little more training and study the product yourself. start promoting the people you want to stick around.

review_pros:
Good looking people
Good benefits
Cool atmosphere
Store discount
review_cons:
Low Salary
Long Hours
Reek of AF cologne everyday
Standing/walking a lot
review_advice_mgmt: Increase salary commensurate to work involved

review_pros: Discounts: you are given 20% normally, and 50% on select items (occassionally). If you are a college or high school student, they will work with your schedule.
review_cons: Again- the discounts. How can this be both a good and bad thing? They expect you to use your paycheck to buy clothes. Although they say you don't have to buy/wear their clothes, the dress code is so exclusive that you pretty much have no choice but to buy/wear their clothes. This might not be an issue if your entire closet is A&F anyway, but I would've preferred to keep my paycheck and use it on other forms of entertainment. Also, management seems a bit overworked and stressed out. Also, if you're looking for a job to pay your bills, then this is not the job for you. They even tell you this during the interview. There are literally 100+ employees and usually only 7-10 workers per shift (including floor and stock room), so you will only work about 15-20 hours per week (unless you're in management).
review_advice_mgmt: You say we don't have to buy/wear A&F clothes as long as what is worn is within the dress code. If that's the case, please stop looking at your employees crazy if they decide they don't want to spend their entire paycheck on a new A&F outfit. Thanks

review_title: Company does not respect its employees
review_pros: Become close with co-workers, can have a good time when working with the right people
review_cons: Horrible upper management (district and regional managers), do not appreciate work done for them, not professional, unnecessary drama, horrible pay.
review_advice_mgmt: Work with your associates rather than against them.

review_title: Great learning opportunity but disappointing growth prospects
review_pros: Casual dress code and atmosphere.
review_cons: Career growth is not well defined. Management does not provide opportunity to undergo training.
review_advice_mgmt: More transparency is required.

review_pros: Promotion happens within the company! They genuinely want to groom and strongly encourage the growth of their management! They actually look forward to the day that your in their shoes! We work our asses off! But lord they really do want to see you succeed. They do not support an individual who is comfortable with staying in the same position and showing no passion for themselves nor the brand.
review_cons: The hours are dreadful at times. But its retail. What do you expect???
review_advice_mgmt: We need raises. The salary should increase if we're able to continue to open so many stores internationally. We really love the brand. That's why we stay. But our compensation sometimes is not enough to get us through one week sometimes. You guys should really think about the little guys. Its really hard down here. Think about us too. Love you tho ;)

review_title: Easy highschool job, can only advance with a degree
review_pros:
The pros are these:
(You are probably a highschool student if you're an associate, and thus keep in mind you are at the bottom of the totem pole.)
you get awesome discounts
you work with beautiful people
you hang out with these people even outside of work
you get to help people through customer service
you develop an understanding of retail, like color classification, shoplifting prevention, upselling, how to manage stock and inventory, how to organize and display clothing, etc.
review_cons:
The cons are these:
you most likely will be making minimum wage
the managers have favorites and will give the favorites better hours
no texting! (this could be a pro)
you are eventually pushed into buying their clothes (and you're *almost* required to wear them for the shift) which are expensive because Abercrombie is higher-end for highschoolers
you can only advance from associate if you get a 4-year degree. you then can become an MIT (manager in training) before becoming an assistant manager.
the music is upbeat but loud, making it hard to communicate on the sales floor.
the perfume they spray is strong but you will get used to it.
review_advice_mgmt: Allowing associates to earn small pay raises could help with recruiting. Beautiful people are not always smart people. Giving the associates small projects to work on will keep them from getting bored and it will help you get your list done for the day. by telling the associates what to work toward, you'll get better store scores and we'll be able to impress secret shoppers. tell us the motifs behind all the things we perceive as 'silly,' like 'hey what's going on? welcome to abercrombie!' or the catchphrases we use at the register. if we understand why it's important to use them then we're more likely yo use them when we get secret shopped, and then you'll get higher scores, which makes you look better as management.

review_pros: Sometimes fun, very easy work
review_cons: Boring, picky, pretty bad management
review_advice_mgmt: Hire different managers.

review_title: A fun group of people to work with.
review_pros: The coworkers were great to work with.  It was nice to be able to wear clothes to work that you would wear on a daily basis.
review_cons: Everything is by the book. You could not even move the furniture if the customers would complain about there not being any couches by the fitting rooms.

review_title: It has its fun moments and its terrible moments.
review_pros:
1. Cross Brand Discount
2. Benifits
3. Promoted easily
4. Some of the kids you work with
5. Very easy
review_cons:
1. Hours
2. Pay
3. No Holidays off except christmas and thanksgiving
4. People higher than you dont give you constructive criticism, they're just mean.
review_advice_mgmt: If you can find a job with better hours, and pay, then take it. You can't call off when the month is blacked out, and you hardly have any time for your family or a social life. Abercrombie is your life.

review_pros: Fun people, cool atmosphere, the management definitely knows what they're doing and its interesting to see changes in the trends
review_cons: The smell of all of the spray is near nauseating, they have a very shallow hiring process, and a lot of the company policies really do not seem very efficient

review_pros: The benefits of working for A&F were great. The team I worked with was knowledgeable and everybody was very respectful. Also, being LGBT, it was great to be a part of a company that had so much respect for the LGBT community. The experience was great and the company was wonderful.
review_cons: There were times when I'd have to work longer hours than usual and wasn't necessarily allowed to clock those hours. Still, it wasn't so bad because the atmosphere and the people I was around were wonderful. The pay, in comparison to other places with similar jobs, was a bit below average.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep up the good work! I think, in all, the company is a great one to work for, but there is a good amount of concern among current employees that they are "stuck" in their positions. Advancement doesn't come around as often as one would hope.

review_pros: There are great medical, dental and vision benefits with the company!
review_cons: Too superficial with people selection, pay is horribile, forces you to purchase clothes, everything is about looks and not what you can contribute as a person. I've been with the company too long time for a change. You get sucked in if you are there more than a year and you feel trapped as if they are any other alternatives!
review_advice_mgmt: I am a SM and I want to advance within the company to apearhead a career at corporate office, but yeah right! You have to be a SM before you can advance to home office, or that's at least what they are telling everyone. It is all about who you know and if they like you or not.

review_title: It was fun, but hard to live off of the salary.
review_pros: Friendly environment. Friendly managers. Nice way to start retail experience.
review_cons: Discount is low. Lot's of hard work. Pay is too low.

review_pros: Great compensation, culture, corporate events, and benefits.
review_cons: Micro managed from the top down. Free thinking discouraged
review_advice_mgmt: Encourage outside the box thinking

review_title: Fun environment, nice discount, low pay, high turn-over
review_pros: Discount is nice for management. Fun environment which is usually laid-back and casual. Overall the job is enjoyable and low stress except during floorsets and high traffic times like back to school or Christmas.
review_cons: Low pay considering a bachelors degree is required for ANY management position. Comparable retailers don't require advanced education, yet pay higher. If you expect the best, the pay should reflect that. Managers also often work more than 40 hours, yet as a salaried manager you receive no overtime.
review_advice_mgmt: Please stop playing favorites. It's incredibly annoying when someone is promoted to store manager, and then district manager after only two years with the company, yet there are individuals who have been there for years longer wanting to move up. Nepotism and politics are more evident at A&F, and it's pretty obvious. Upper management also stresses to have the best looking store associates possible, which is understandable, but the pay is substandard for the quality you expect. Most people work for a paycheck, and naturally people go where they can make the highest income.

review_pros: The people, the experience, the fast pace
review_cons: The pay, the customers, the lac of vacation
review_advice_mgmt: Support each other to get better compensation

review_pros:
-50% discount on "triple A's" which are always in style (30% discount is reasonable)
-super easy tasks (fitting rooms, greeting in front)
-get to wear clothes to work you'd wear to other places
-smell like "fierce" w/o having to buy cologne
-easy to take time off, all through computer system
review_cons:
-minimum wage w/ no opportunity for increase
-greeting in front gets really boring
-don't get praised for good work
-discount doesn't apply to clearance (which is usually only 30%)
-call-in system is kind of annoying (must call 1 hr before then have little time to get ready if they need you)
review_advice_mgmt: Praise employees for good work, consider giving raises to those who have been in the company for years.

review_title: Great atmosphere and good people to work with.
review_pros: The people ere fun to work with, and the discount was great. Flexible schedules and easy going managers made this a great place to work.
review_cons: I understand this company is in the fashion industry, however everyone is extremely superficial and hi standards are expected constantly.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep a professional distance between employees and yourself. Even though you may be close in age, realize that you are in a position of authority.

review_title: Helped me grow as a leader.
review_pros: Great benefits, laid back uniform, cool discount, pretty flexible hours outside of the holidays. Really good on the job work experience.
review_cons: Retail during the holidays leaves no room for family of friends, it becones your life for a few months and consumes you
review_advice_mgmt: Don't put so much pressure on recruiting associates and needing to be perfect. It's retail but needs to be fun also

review_pros: If you like an upbeat environment and outgoing people!
review_cons: No raises for part timers. No chance to move up to manager position without 4year degree.
review_advice_mgmt: Choose your MIT's better because there is a lot of turnover and a lot of horrible managers that end up getting fired soon after being hired. Screen your hires better!!!

review_pros: fun, relax atmosphere, you meet great people
review_cons: have favorites, no growth unfair
review_advice_mgmt: be more open

review_title: Stuck in the same position, little chance at upward movement outside of OH. Immature/unprofessional work atmosphere
review_pros:
-company is attempting to become more corporate & professional 
-great benefits
-excellent 401k program
-easy to get hired
-you can use the position to move to nearly anywhere in the world with a&f's recent expansion overseas - however you must be a store manager
review_cons:
-little to no chance of upwards movement unless you want to work at the corporate headquarters in Columbus, OH
-no pay increase once you graduate from assistant to store manager. technically the hourly assistants make more than salaried store managers who shoulder the burden when things go wrong with a company visit
-no bonus/commission incentives for a job well done
-immature work atmosphere & company culture
-non-inclusive work environments are abundant between stores
-managers stuck in the same position can become very territorial of newcomers, thus making skills training non-existent
-saturated workforce all competing for the same job title of a district manager - which still requires working on weekends, holidays & working WITHIN the actual stores 100% of the time for a pay bump that is less than a 25% increase for a very very low salary
review_advice_mgmt:
-make the salary somewhat competitive to other retail companies. 
-have continual training sessions on management skills that are mandatory for district managers and store managers
-a&f is very outdated in the fashion world and is way over priced for the us market, relying almost solely on its tourist locations. start setting up analytics and reports from the store front requiring managers to actually provide feedback to home office in order to take full advantage of the niche market

review_pros:
You can freely talk with other fellow workers.
you get clothing discount 15% - 50% based on the price of clothing.
You get a certain amount of break based on how long you work. 15 min. minimum. if you work 5 hrs.
Your pay is charged at an hr and a half, even when you work for one hour BUT ONLY if you work at least 40 hours in one week, and that "bonus" must be in that same week.
review_cons:
Pay is terrible.
Some managers speak disrespectfully.
You must wear a certain outfit to work and it'll lead you to spend more money. (cause you have to buy it)
You stand while you're folding clothes.
Sometimes there's other workers who slack off and you're working two times harder, but there's no reward for you.
review_advice_mgmt: Give people who work harder than others a pay raise.

review_title: Not bad for a part-time job.
