review_title: Great place to start, not a place to stay
review_pros: Great entry level salary. After a short training program you're really baptized by fire and have a large amount of responsibility. Young work force but also feels clicks like high school. Get to wear casual clothes.mlots of,opportunities for bonding with co workers outside of work. Beautiful home office campus. Sense of pride with your job.
review_cons: The work life balance is non existent. Promotions are based on popularity not how well you know the business. In fact one of the first questions HR asks you during your review is who do you hang out with. If your five best friends aren't all a and f employees it's a huge negative. The business is driven by its CEO, but his vision does not match the economic environment and decisions based on his wants literally drive the company further in the red. Must wear Abercrombie clothes everyday, but even with the discount that still is a large financial obligation. Very clicks high school environment, the rumor mill has more impact on your career than your production.
review_advice_mgmt: Take notice of an employees skill set and promote based on talent not popularity. Stop focusing on making moves to keep disgruntled, non productive employees and instead focus on the employees that don't complain yet continue to perform. Start making business decisions based on what the consumer what's and the economic environment, not the tunnel vision of the outdated CEO.

review_pros: The discount is a good pro. Flexible availablity is a good pro!
review_cons: No many hrs in a work day. Can't get your nails done. And "have" to purchase the season styles.

review_pros: good management training. You will learn about management and retail management. You follow a strict study guide that really gives you an inside look at the entire company.
review_cons: Working with annoying customers, being thrown into the program and opening and closing the store by myself within a couple of weeks of starting.  Also, the hours suck. you will always work weekends and nights at least some of time. The company is really shallow and it's obvious they won't hire people if they're not up to standard with their appearance. When being trained to interview people you will learn that you basically go in the back room and rate people based on their appearance.
review_advice_mgmt: hire more people so that MIT's arent forced to open and close on their own so soon.

review_title: It is what you expect it to be
review_pros: Really Easy Job, Not Stressful at all, Easy to make friends
review_cons: Low pay, boring, same stuff everyday, don't give raises really
review_advice_mgmt: Hire less people

review_title: Awesome Place to Work for High School and College Students!
review_pros:
1. Great and fun people to work with who are your age! Even our store manager is young and she's very helpful, cool, and understanding!
2. Easy to transfer if you're a college student
3. If you prove to managers that you are reliable and do your job 100%, you'll get so many hours you will be tempted to tell the store manager to stop giving you so many hours! Many weeks I'm scheduled to work 5 to 6 days! During floor sets our store manager told some employees to come in and work whenever they wanted because she needed so many things done. Floor sets are the best opportunities to get some sick hours take advantage of this if you work there. I got almost 40 hours one week just for working during a floor set.
4. 50% off of the new AAA items and 30% discount on regular priced items (but I don't shop there I just work there)
5. No direct sales and no pressure to sell credit cards, service plans, etc. like other retailers I've worked at (like Macy's, Best Buy, Dillard's).
review_cons:
1. Be ready to work overtime on weekends and holidays. Some days I would be scheduled to work 12 to 5 and ended up working 12 to 8. One day I was scheduled to work 6 to 10 pm and ended up working 1 to 10 pm.
2. Raises are rare at this company due to a high turnover rate and the fact that only young people are working there.
3. Call-in shifts are unreliable and suck because they might need you and they might not.
review_advice_mgmt: Retail is retail, but the company should allow more opportunities for employees who have worked there a long time to get raises and then maybe the company's turnover rate won't be so high!

review_title: One of the worst retail environments to work at
review_pros: Cool co-workers, decent discount for management.
review_cons: Low pay for level of work, Low-quality of upper management.
review_advice_mgmt: Take into account that all stores are not the same and should be expected of the same requirements.

review_advice_mgmt: retention!! make it a better work place and offer incentives for your managers/employees and they will stick around longer.

review_title: If your good at kissing butt
review_pros: A&F at the Great Mall in Milpitas California was a cool and diverse place to work, especially if your position is Impact.  Managers are always encouraging employees to apply for manager positions so its not hard to grow within the company. you also get first dibbs on new merchandise and
review_cons: If your buddy buddy with management, it will be your ticket to  get more hours. if you work the hardest and been with the company for 4 years, that wont guarantee you more  hours over the next person who only been there a month and is lazy but has all the managers liking them and giving away your deserved hours. Thats just the name of the game and if your up to playing it, youll be ok. Yes its a  very unfair place to work and they play favorites with employees. If youre a minority, than thats an even bigger disadvantage in the workplace. And if your unattractive, well, youll most likely do the grunt work in the back as impact.  ( impact was the better position as far as being less stressful. Way more fun than model position and you work with down to earth people). btw,   some weeks you are working like 8 hours a week. lucky if you get 12. hours like this was 4 years ago, i hope its not like that now
review_advice_mgmt: Playing favorites brings down employee morale. make all your emplyees feel special and needed. ITS A TEAM! ALso, if you can give employees the benefit of reserving like 2 items for a limited time that would be great

review_pros: - Nice people to work with. at least some of them
review_cons:
- cutting hours, as low as 3 hours a weel

review_cons: Impact does everything including thinking for the mindless models to help determine what the difference is between a small and large or pink and green.

review_cons: Lots of rules and restrictions , time consuming, easy to move up because of high turnover rate, always trying to employ people because of looks
review_advice_mgmt: Pay better!! You can keep a lot if employees who may not actually get to move as fast as they wish but are satisfied because the pay is great and worth the hard work you put in upkeeping a the store

review_title: amazing place to start your first job
review_pros: friendly and relaxed atmosphere, great place to make new friends, flexible in working hours

review_advice_mgmt: more career opportunities

review_title: Tiring and boring, everyone is annoying
review_pros: decent discount? not even, its only 30%
review_cons: there are many employees and most of them don't do anything, yet we all get paid the same amount, minimum wage. were supposed to be making the rooms look perfect even though inconsiderate customers keep messing up piles of clothes and at the same time were supposed to be offering friendly customer service. its too stressful and just not worth it at all. the customers are horrible, the employees are dumb/full of themselves, and if you work till close prepare to be folding until at least midnight. the store is always a disaster by the end of the day despite the constant folding we're suppose to be doing.
review_advice_mgmt: stop expecting us to stay passed our scheduled times, put more clothes on hangers so there isn't as much folding required, hire based on personality and knowledge rather than looks.

review_title: One person doing the job of 5 people. Low morale, high expectations. Superficial, unprofessional environment.
review_pros: Work with attractive people and the young, partying lifestyle is encouraged
review_cons: The company constantly sets us up for failure (ie: misprinted documents, little budgeted hours, impossible time limits given for tasks, high turnover rate, etc.) yet expects nothing less than perfection. Individual strengths are not focused on, you are expected to be perfect at every single aspect of the position. Spend so much time doing tedious, pointless tasks that there is no time for customer service. The company sets up policies that prohibit us from truly providing quality customer service (ie: not opening another register unless 5 or more people in line, not holding merchandise for anyone, the loud music, confusing and misleading marketing, only using one set of fitting rooms, customer service cards that only provide an email address, etc.) then we are the ones having to deal with angry people. Ridiculous secret shops in which you get points deducted for having a light burned out, not being able to smell the cologne enough, a size sticker missing or a clothing item unfolded. The company is more about protecting their image and presentation than retaining quality employees and providing sufficient customer service.
review_advice_mgmt: Remember what it was like when you worked in a store when doing your walk throughs. Treat your employees like people, otherwise they will treat you just like a paycheck and leave at their first opportunity. You don't have to lower your expectations but you could find a way to focus on each individual's strengths. Encourage the people that work hard and care, and discipline those who don't. Stop doing illegal things like making your employees work off the clock. Work on retaining employees rather than wanting to see new faces all the time. Make the work/life balance better for Store Managers, this will reduce the turnover rate and increase productivity.

review_title: fast moving management and fun environment
review_pros: If you have a four year degree you are eligible for a management in training position which is completed in 10 weeks then you are promoted to an assistant manager then after 6mos-1yr you are probably promoted to a store manager and then GM and DM etc.. The company doesn't hire anyone external who can jump your position, it all starts as a MIT which is great! You make great money, its not commission so it doesn't feel competitive. Great place to work.
review_cons: You are not required but its basically frowned upon if you do not purchase an outfit from the current fashion season to wear to work. Although they do offer 50% off of that outfit. You have to wear flip flops on the sales floor and that can sometimes hurt your feet during long shifts.
review_advice_mgmt: Encourage your associates to work hard and give positive feedback when they do well! Provide proper training to new associates on folds and following the document placed at each presentation when fixing up a table. Do constant figure 8 throughout the store to ensure everyone is on task and all customers are greeted and helped. Don't take anything personal, especially complaints from customers, which happens at every customer service establishment.

review_title: Not too bad for a first part-time job.
review_pros: Super flexible scheduling that you can change on a week-by-week basis. Minimal training required, and the work is very easy.
review_cons: It can be boring, it sometimes feels like a waste of time to fold and re-fold clothes. Working in the front room is also extremely boring because there's not much to do.
review_advice_mgmt: Some of the store managers are better than others. The ones who care about employees and customers do the best job running the store.

review_pros:
-great products; good style and selection of clothing for young adults.
-strong brand reputation
review_cons:
- poor management of human resources and employees
- managers are too young and inexperienced in handling simple tasks such as scheduling shifts or managing sales associates during working hours
review_advice_mgmt: - get more experienced managers to run retail stores

review_pros: Easy first job, work with young adults-not to mention attractive, feels like a very chill atmosphere, minimum stress, music is usually the latest popular singles, associates are very friendly and outgoing
review_cons: standing up on your feet in horrible sandals which don't offer foot support, being required to chip in half your paycheck to buy AAA outfits, no opportunities to be promoted unless you have a 4 year degree, stuck at minimum wage FOREVER

review_title: Counting down the minutes until I am off work to get out.
review_pros: Flexible work schedule in the work place
review_cons: Horrible customers, annoying music on full blast, minimum wage, and strict work attire.

review_pros: Lots of flexibility for hours, minimal training needed
review_cons: Hard to get hours, low technology

review_title: Great job if you don't have any morals and want to feel like you're in a sorority....
review_pros:
~The best thing about the company was the fact that they gave their managers pretty good benefits (health, dental, 401k after a year, etc). 
~You get to dress really casually to work- shorts, dresses, skirts, etc. 
~You don't need prior management or retail experience to be a part of the MIT program
~If you work with the right people, you can have fun at work
~ It's really great to get experience if you want to be in retail management. That's why I worked there, so that I could get my management experience and move on to bigger and better things....
review_cons:
The list is endless but here are some of the top cons...

~TERRIBLE PAY, I think they start you off at 27,000 when you enter into the MIT program and once you are promoted to assistant manager there is no raise whatsoever. Most assistant managers at other companies maybe between 33-40,000 some even more, so the pay is a joke. The raises are a joke too... after working there for over a year I finally got a review and got a "doing well" and my raise was about 17 cents per hour... that's less than the part time associates get when they do get a raise which is also a joke because managers have to choose 2 associates ONCE A YEAR to get a 50 cent raise... There are a few bonus opportunities once in a blue moon but the goals are very difficult to reach so the payout is nothing to be thrilled about

~Overtime at the company is another laughing matter. Instead of getting paid time and a half... abercrombie managers get paid HALF time so if you make 14 an hour, overtime would be 7. And you better believe you will work overtime, especially if you are a visual manager or if someone important is coming into town (regional manager,etc). 

~ The company standard is really high so there are ridiculous expectations for managers without any sort incentive asides from looking good on paper. Also, the store isn't given a lot of part time associate hours so its not easy to maintain the standard.  85% of the managers are so lazy that it's usually one manager doing most of the work which can get so frustrating.... that's what happens when you hire managers based on looks rather than skills. But managers are expected to do everything from recruit, interview, hire, thoroughly train associates, to ensure that the store looks PERFECT at all times, including the stockroom, to make sure that anywhere from 10-50+ boxes of shipment (depending on the volume of your store) get done and are put up in the stockroom, to dealing with customers and associates and all the issues that arise, to walk around the store to make sure that no one is stealing, to daily meetings with each associate, etc etc etc..... there really is a lot to it and i could keep going. All of that would be fine if the pay was better. Oh and while you're doing everything, you are also being completely micromanaged because everything you do has a detailed list or description of EXACTLY how they expect you to do it. 

~ That brings me to the next point, the company is SOOOO shallow. Managers and associates are all hired based on looks. The best looking associates reap the greatest benefits which is really unfair. Managers have a recruiting goal where they have to go out and recruit associates and other MITs... aka go up to attractive people and tell them to come work for the company. Interviews are only there for HR purposes because as a manager you can tell if someone will get the job the second they step in the store, it doesn't matter what they say. If you aren't attractive, you can try applying for the part time Impacter position and you MAY be able to get the job, however, it has gotten to the point where the district manager will have an issue even if you hire unattractive impacters. Leave your morals at home if you want to work for this company. If you recruit or hire someone who your DM doesn't think is "abercrombie standard" not only do you get yelled at but he or she will make you "weed them out" by not scheduling them until they quit. It's sad. 

This is getting a little too long, so I will end with this. The company is DRAMA DRAMA DRAMA all the time. The people that get hired for management are generally just out of college (21-22 year olds) who really have no real world experience. Most are ridiculously immature. Abercrombie makes it a point to have managers recruit MITs who are involved with frats, sororities, sports, etc... so as you can imagine, work can sometimes feel like high school. There is always some sort of gossip going around, some kind of drama, and if you're lucky like I was, even your DM will act like a high school drama queen along with the rest of management. Not to say that everyone was bad, we had a lot of cool, chill managers too, but mostly immature, dramatic ones.
review_advice_mgmt:
~First off, make the pay competitive, there definitely would not be that much management and PT associate turnover. No one wants to do THAT much work for so little pay. 
~Stop hiring based on looks alone, if you hired smarter, harder working managers, it would definitely pay off in the end & if you paid more, then you'd have more people willing to actually work there and wouldn't have to resort to hiring the first pretty face that walked in the store.

review_title: Great job to gain management experience if you have no previous
review_pros: 2 weeks paid vacation, personal and sick days and great management coverage.
review_cons: Really low salary for the hard work and high expectations. Super strict non-frat policy.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't forget what it was like to be in stores!

review_title: Awful job. Coworkers make it bearable.
review_pros: - Fun/friendly co-workers and managers
review_cons:
- Just about anyone can do this job. Independent/critical thinking is neither required or encouraged.
- Loud, heavily scented, and an extremely dusty environment.
- Company endorses high turnover rates, which means company loyalty is non-existent.
- Employee appreciation is almost non-existent as well. This contributes to the low job satisfaction.
- Uneven distribution of hours. The "unnattractive" people get less hours because they are not "cast-of". There is absolutely no seniority for the veterans at my store. I feel bad for the people who have been at this store for so long with absolutely nothing to show for it.
- During the interviews, they tell you its optional to buy the AAA seasonal outfits. In reality, if you don't purchase them, you don't get scheduled. I've overheard the DM call our store to tell us our percentage of employees who have bought AAA's, and the percentage we need to achieve. This type of implicit coercion to buy company clothing is ridiculous considering the following point;
- Customers often get better discounts than the associates working for the company. In addition, associates are restricted from taking advantage of customer discounts. Yet the company remains dumbfounded as to why internal theft is so high.
- External theft (regular shoplifting) is ridiculously high due to stupid loss prevention tactics. Meanwhile, significant time, money, and effort is spent suspecting/vilifying employees for theft and associate discount abuse. 
- Violation of work rules (ie. breaks, hiring practices). Not endorsed at a corporate level, but is thoroughly practiced within stores by the implicit don't ask/don't tell understanding.
- Store is always under-staffed in order to cut down on hours available for employees to work.
- This leads to constant complaints about long line ups.
- The Eaton Centre location has 2 sets of cashiers, and 2 fitting rooms, yet even with long line ups, the 2nd set of cashiers are never open and the 2nd set of fitting rooms are not much better.
- This company favours placing all time and effort into meticulous attention to detail (such as lights and forms/mannequins) rather than customer service. (I was given a poor performance note for helping a customer with a pair of jeans near the top shelf in Womens 1, when my DM told me to ignore them/call someone else to help them, forcing them to wait, and remain at the tagline station instead)
- Which leads me to my next point, the company has set up useless rules which do not promote customer service/convenience such as;
-- Misleading/confusing marketing
-- Not able to hold clothing
-- Never/rarely opening more cash registers/fitting rooms
-- Constantly understaffed
- This is all due to ridiculous secret shoppers who spend their efforts picking out useless faults such as a light burned out, not being able to smell the cologne enough, a size sticker missing or a clothing item unfolded. 
- The bottom line is the company is more about protecting their presentation and outdated image rather than retaining quality employees and providing sufficient customer service.
review_advice_mgmt:
- You guys are doing a horrible job, its no wonder why the company is sinking fast. From approximiately $80/share in the market to now approximately $30/share.

Source: http://ca.advfn.com/p.php?pid=qkquote&symbol=NY^ANF

review_pros: The people are great at the store I work at. You can always get a shift covered...and easily at that.
review_cons: Too many people working means less hour for you. A bit strict on how their store is to be maintained.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire less people! Ease up on the stores strict procedures.

review_title: Great part-time job for students; fun environment; some very cool people!
review_pros: Cool co-workers; cashiers get to keep their uniforms, which is nice, the atmosphere is great. If you don't mind the fairly low lighting and loud music, then it's really quite fun. You also get to meet cool customers, or at least slightly crazy ones.
review_cons: Some rules about dress are very strict (i.e. no cardigans allowed to be worn inside unless the outside temperature is below 11c, even if it's only 15c inside and freezing cold). Some managers take themselves a tad bit too seriously, but that can be kind of amusing.

review_pros:
-well rounded retail experience
-fast paced
-lots of responsibility
review_cons:
-Late hours
-No weekend
-bad pay until you get several promotions, must dedicate your life for 2 yrs minimum to do so
review_advice_mgmt: invest in some hr training

review_pros: Money,paid vacation, discount,fun co-workers,comfy work clothes
review_cons: Recruiting, morals of company -awful! Over Worked
review_advice_mgmt: Need to change company  policies on recruiting, more recognition for assistant managers work

review_pros: Organized, determined to move you up if you want to stay
review_cons: Overworked and have a tendency to go through people rather quickly
review_advice_mgmt: Be nice to lower individuals.

review_title: Decent place to work if you're looking for a job during a school break.
review_pros: A flexible work schedule is one of the best reasons to work here. They work around my school scheule and give me the hours I want. Most people are friendly once you start working with them.
review_cons: 1. I don't think half the people who post on here have actually worked at Abercrombie. It is NOT a requirement to wear/purchase their clothes; it even says so in the handbook. While you do get some good employee discounts, you are not required to use them to purchase clothes to work in. You can wear your own non-Abercrombie clothes as long as they do not have obvious competitors labels on them and as long as they fit the current color scheme for the company. So for the people claiming you have to wear a "uniform" of their clothes, you're extremely wrong.                                    2.The clothes were another con though. The plaid shirts are getting old and worn out, and although we can wear some of the dresses and shorts now, some of them are ugly. Being restricted to certain styles isn't fun.                                                                                                                                        3. Call ins are terrible.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop asking stupid questions during interviews. We know you don't really care about our favorite animal is, so what's the point of asking? Delve deeper and find out more about our work ethic and things that will actually apply to the job that you're considering hiring us for.

review_pros:
- The benefits are excellent
- People
review_cons:
- Horrible hours (until 11pm and weekends)
- Not enough pay for how much work an assistant manager needs to do
- Sick days are rarely able to be used due to the lack of managers at your store

review_title: Abercrombie& Fitch is a easy job to work at but not worth the minimum wage.
review_pros: easy work environment, managers are nice, employees are fun to work with, it is very easy to get the job.
review_cons: boring, deal with unpleasant customers, minimum wage, not treated as important compared to models, no benefits, workers are not cared for
review_advice_mgmt: Management is nice, just as long as you do your job.

review_pros: good environment to work yo
review_cons: boring as hell to work after the first month
review_advice_mgmt: be chill

review_pros: Fun atmosphere and you meet a lot of people.
review_cons: You're over worked and underpaid. Compared to competitors the discount isn't good. People aren't rewarded for their hard work.
review_advice_mgmt: Get to know your associates, people work hard for what you believe in. Recognize those who put forth effort.

review_title: Great coworkers but sub par salary
review_pros: Everyone is outgoing and attractive and athletic.
review_cons: Salary was too low for amount of work and hours expected out of a manager.

review_pros: Very easy job, cool managers that work with your schedule, other employees make the job enjoyable.  You also get 30% off clothes from all A&F brand stores and 4 times a year get 50% off select items.
review_cons: Pretty strict dress code, low pay, basically zero chance to move up in the company.
review_advice_mgmt: It would be nice for employees are reviewed every 3 months or so, and if they are doing good they could receive a small (25 cent) raise.  Just to show that you appreciate what we're doing.

review_title: A&F continues to focus on looks
review_pros: good way to distinguish itself from other life style brands, rarely put their products on discount, even during the recession, good marketing way.
review_cons: most people do not take the work seriously, as their prime asset is their look. Minimum challenge at the job. Poor work ethics.

review_pros:
Meet and work with young, fun, great looking people.
Wear cool clothes all day
Good discount
Fun music and atmosphere
Good benefits
review_cons:
Long hours with no overtime pay 
No work/life balance
Impossible to use sick or personal days
Worst customers ever
Low pay
Minimal budgeted hours to get all tasks completed
review_advice_mgmt: Pay your employees what they are worth.

review_pros:
-Meeting great fun people to work with
-Having the ability to have a great impact on your customers and associates
-Contest bonuses
review_cons:
-Upper management expectations with little to no guidance or assistance
-Some unreasonable expectations set without regard to different store settings
-Getting "thrown under the bus" by upper level supervisors that do not offer help, even when they knew about problems before hand
review_advice_mgmt: -Do more work to develop your lower level associates. Take time to actually get to know them and their weaknesses. Help them out when you can see they need help, don't just criticize.

review_title: Extra Money Not One Job Material
review_pros:
- Flexible scheduling
- When your a Favorite, You work plenty
review_cons:
- Uniform has to be bought for work, before you even actually work
- Everyone [except managers] gets minimum wage ( End of the year, one person is allowed to get a raise)
- Sex Sales
- There are "Favorites" who get more hours

Advice:
[Do not make this your only job unless you don't care about money]
review_advice_mgmt: Everyone should be required to actually do their job.

review_title: Good campus & career opportunity, but expect long hours and limited creative freedom.
review_pros: Great campus - feels like working in the middle of a state park.  It's a good place to start carrer, particularly because lots of responsibility is given to people quickly.  The on-site cafe is good (which is necessary - because other food options are pretty far away).
review_cons: Intense workloads, long hours.  The CEO micro-manages all creative decisions, and that makes for a consistent brand image - but doesn't allow for much creative contribution from designers or strategists.

review_pros: Free outfit once a week, ability to socialize while working
review_cons: Standing for hours in a room sprayed with their perfume
review_advice_mgmt: More opportunities for advancement

review_pros: Fun atmosphere, stylish brand, High energy
review_cons: Poorly Organized, Low pay, high turnover
review_advice_mgmt: Become better organized

review_pros: great healthcare! kind of fun environment if you like working with a lot of young people.
review_cons: extremely long hours (10or more hours a day).  mandatory schedules with whiny assistants that always get there way.  super micromanaged and you waste a ton of your day doing silly tasks like 2 hour long conference calls.  nothing you do will ever be good enough and there is never any positive feedback except to your assistants who are all fresh out of college with no life direction and demand you give them their way making your life completely miserable!
review_advice_mgmt: give some positive feedback every now and then instead of constantly downing the store manager for every single thing.

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch is a so so company
review_pros: Abercrombie & Fitch has relaxed working environment and decent pay
review_cons: Hardly has hours to give to an ever growing staff and they aren't to observant to peoples religious beliefs

review_pros:
fun place to work as your co workers are fun
always busy if you work as an impact
laid back atmosphere. Most management is young and makes for a fun relationship
review_cons:
low pay
sometimes out of season there arent many hours
constantly buying new uniforms and no nail polish (dress code)

review_pros:
Fun easy going people
Cool environment
review_cons:
Lack of organization 
Need to focus on internal coordination
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more attention to the management team

review_pros: Minimum wage pay at least?
review_cons: Hostile work environment. Management treated it like a pain training new employees or asking them why they didn't know how to do something. Brain dead much? If you don't know how to do something, then you don't know how to do something. Asking questions were not encouraged, you were looked upon as stupid. Many employees were told call ins were optional, resulting in mass firing of confused employees. Snooty attitudes and you are expected to do everything with little to no training. Let some employees wear makeup and did not let others.
review_advice_mgmt: There's nothing wrong with being strict, but by treating employees like they're stupid without training them for more than 5 seconds, how can you expect a fantastic employee?

review_pros: Not mentally of physically demanding, just stand around all day.
review_cons: Management take the job too seriously

review_pros:
-Great ten-week Manager-in-Training program that teaches and fine-tunes basic management skills
-Good benefits
-Work with great looking, aspirational associates
review_cons:
-Extremely high management turnover due to lack of proper training and low pay
-Promotions to store manager are very political and not always given to competent assistant managers
-Professional feedback is rare
- Stores are not given enough hours to use to keep clothing presentations maintained throughout the day
- Operational issues are ignored by Home Office and  persist until they are at emergency level
- We are given no extra time to train associates before throwing them out onto the sales floor.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't be so stingy with hours, and actually listen to the suggestions your management staff brings up! Promote managers to Store Manager level only if they have experience managing the same brand and same type of store (i.e. flagship, overnight, non-overnight). Implement a better standard for associate training, and maybe consider promoting sales associates to management even if they do not have their four year degree, because to be honest, the way A&F wants their stores managed does not require much ingenuity or creativity, but merely knowing the company standard.

review_pros: You will work with some of the most amazing people that you have ever met in your life. The discount is good, and the opportunity for extremely fast promotion and leadership opportunities. I started as a Brand Rep part time and rose through the management ranks to run a high volume store.
review_cons: You are managing 17 and 18 year old kids. There is almost ZERO work/life balance, and it is retail. Despite their attempts to pretend to care about about work ethic, you are hired based on your appearance. As a manager you have to be prepared to overlook talented people if they don't fit how the company says they should look. Pay is below average compared to other similar companies.
review_advice_mgmt: Quit hiring managers that lack intellect. Empower them to make their own decisions and give latitude for ways achieving goals.

review_title: Great first job for for high school/college students
review_pros:
- Flexible scheduling: Managers understand that you are currently in school and are willing to work around your schedule
- Decent pay
- Fun working environment
review_cons:
- Sometimes managers play favoritism
- Employees gossip about other employees

review_title: This was a seasonal job. Holiday hire.
review_pros: Employees receive a Discount on clothing.
review_cons: Paycheck goes into clothes to wear for work
review_advice_mgmt: Pay managers more, they work hard & you could retain talent.

review_pros: Hours are extremely flexible, manager and employees are laid back. It's an easy job.
review_cons: The discount isn't much considering how expensive the clothes are. You can't wear nail polish or eyeliner.
review_advice_mgmt: Give employees a better discount if you expect them to wear your clothes and represent the brand.

review_pros: One of the companies main focuses is its image, so you get to work with attractive people. They provide good health, dental, and eye insurance.
review_cons: Its a horrible place to work if you get headaches. You work in the dark for 40 hours a week with a terrible, 45 minute playlist of crappy music blasting all day. Your part-time associates are hired based on their looks, not their brains, so you get to fix a lot of mistakes. Upper level managers live and breath this company and if you don't,  you're the one who has a skewed view on life and are treated like a hot pile.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't treat your store managers like your doormats and don't promise promotions that don't exist.

review_pros: This job is fairly easy and is very flexible with your personal schedule. Shifts are usually 3-5 hours long depending on if it a regular shift or not. Getting shifts covered is easy and dependable in case of emergencies.
review_cons: The call-in system of shifts, not really knowing if you're going to work that day or not is conflicting with schedules.

review_pros: met some great friends who i truly respect and will know for a long long time
review_cons: where do i begin? i was a store manager at a&f and hollister stores for 4 years. horrible salary (underpaid by approximately $10-15k in comparison to the same job in a different company...), immature, irresponsible, demanding and heartless superiors, insane work hours without overtime pay, unrealistic expectations, unprofessional and immature company culture which trickles down through all managers. i ended up doing everything myself with my management team b/c we were not given the appropriate hours budget (but don't worry, you'll be told it's your inability to manage anything in general. just recently one of my old DMs who no longer works there admitted to the poor upper management and unrealistic expectations burning him out.) there is no class or professionalism in the company either. i've been sworn at and yelled at like a child numerous times and had obscene comments and gestures made in front of me. you don't get promoted based on performance despite what they tell you. how hot are you? that, coupled with waiting for others to be burned out and finally quit their job will determine your career path and speed with which you are promoted. ( i was promoted 4 times and STILL can speak to how horrible this place is...) the expectation is that you have no life and will drop everything - the company must be the number one thing in your life at all times. if i could characterize the company with a personality - imagine a 20yr old cocky frat guy.
review_advice_mgmt: grow up.

review_pros: Met my best friend and college roommate at Crombie, great managers, but I know they can vary, good work environment, not stressful, good discounts
review_cons: Annoying to fold with boards and say hey how's it going etc. to every single customer

review_pros:
Good Training Program (except for 3 manager stores).
Fun environment.
Great coworkers.
Decent discount.
review_cons:
Unrealistic company goals on hiring.
Low pay for managers and part-time employees.
Terrible store operations with 3 manager stores and no lead stock
High turnover..
Discriminates based on looks.
Forced to purchase new clothing to keep up with floor sets.
Discount is only off full price merchandise, but because most everything is discounted now, customers sometimes get a better deal.
Stores are performing well below expectations.
Because of the company's plans to close so many stores and slow global expansion, opportunities will shrink fast as many people will get laid off.

review_pros: Wonderful coworkers! Nicest people I've met. Great first job for teenagers. Really fun environment.
review_cons: Minimum wage, take A LOT of money from taxes, hard to get hours sometimes, dark in the store, music is too loud, hard to hear customers.

review_pros: You work with all people around your age. The company requires a bachelor's degree for management so it helps when you graduate college to go apply for a fast job.
review_cons: The pay is terrible. There are manager's quitting daily because it's hard to live off the salary. You can only hire cute people and if you want to hire less attractive people because they gave a good interview they need to work in the back. The discount isn't that great because half the store is always on sale now so the sale price ends up being better than the discount.

review_title: Good way to get your foot in the door
review_pros: Great training, fun people, great operations
review_cons: salary and lack of product

review_pros: Cool, laid-back atmosphere, fun to work with other employees and management, interesting to see today's fashion industry
review_cons: Sometimes customers are grumpy and take it out on retail workers, the job is repetitive (for example: folding clothes for a long time, saying a tagline to customers)

review_title: It is a great second job.
review_pros:
Get to work with great looking people all day.
It's a very chill place to work when you make it that way
Can be fun
Gets you on the road to a new wardrobe look if your trying to change your look
review_cons:
Terrible pay
Managers that don't do any work

review_pros:
You get to work with associates that are interesting sometimes, you have the ability to hire pretty much who you want, so this can create a fun environment, at a cost.

Cool managers and assistants, it is really a "what you make of it" and "what can you put up with" kind of job. 

International Opportunities if you are willing to sacrifice your personal values, or just don't care about people.
review_cons:
Schedule is horrible, the notation of a set schedule is rare in the A&F world these days. 
High turnover with managers and associates, both can be related to compensation, and scheduling. Managers working over 40 hours do not get OT, they get Half Time, so basically its less than national minimum. So this creates a poor environment for people who want to get extra work done because they are not going to be compensated fairly. Then if you are a Salaried Manager, SM, you are that, they will expect you to work in excess of your 45 hours, or even work 6 days! The hours given are bare bones, you can get the basics done, but you are expected to go way beyond that so hours always are a concern. But don't ask for Bank hours from your DM, because they wont give them out, they want to get their bonus check at the end of the year for not using them! COMP days- for working holidays, okay, but not given to all managers. Annual raises are once a year, and range from 3-5-7% but really no one receives a 7% unless you are the most fantastic recruiter in the company,
So that brings up Recruiting, "Staff your stores with beautiful people" that's why customers come and shop at A&F and Hollister. I still find it hard that any one believes that, the only people who come for that reason are young teens, and they don't spend money, its their parents. Who will then complain constantly about the music volume and the vulgarity of the imagines on the marketing and bags. The Obsession with recruiting is astonishing, yes you need to have the staff to run your store, fair. but when your "Beautiful" associates know that is why they got hired it makes it difficult to motivate them, and keep them around for more than a few months. Then at Any Level of the hiring process for Managers, Part time Models or Impacters you are being hired based on your appearance. Don't hold this against the person who is doing the interview, they are only trying to do what they are told. Because if you hire that one associate that will be awesome with customers and work their tail off for you, but is not "like models in the marketing" you ill be questioned and then reprimanded for it. Side note- your budgeted hours for PT Associates is broken down to serve half(50%) to your Cast of Models. Looks, not work ethic will determine the hours you will be able to delegate to your associates.
Your customers are always going to be a pain in retail, so that is expected, but the company doesn't offer much support. Customer Service is an email address that rarely gets a response, so that puts Managers in a bind because we generally want to be helpful and this will cause us to bend the rules to help the customers. So constancy is hard, and then if you help that customer it could cost you your job. 
Culture is a word that is thrown around alot at A&F, its is fabricated more so than anything, because each location is expected to follow and represent the same values and culture, but the company is world wide and you can not realistically respect that. Then the discrimination that is present within the company is where i see the biggest issue. Just remember if you are getting into the company remember two things, BE Beautiful and Recruit (and have the nerve to hire using discrimination as a tool). That will be the formula for success, intelligence or creativity will not be rewarded or acknowledged. 
Your experience is always going to be different based on who you work for, but all direction is coming from the same place, so do not expect much, especially when movement of personnel within the company is often.

review_title: FItch is an easy job with not many benefits.
review_pros:
-flexible shifts
-discounts on clothes
-fun environment
-modeling opportunities if you have "the look"
review_cons:
-managers come and go (monthly)
-look policy can be ridiculous
-set pay with no raise
-minimum wage
-its either super busy or dead
-music is on repeat one playlist

review_pros: easy job, don't have to do anything
review_cons: music awful, smells bad, loud

review_title: store manager at abercrombie and fitch
review_pros: work with fun people and I get to wear flip flops
review_cons: asked to work too many hours and days in one week

review_title: Good experience. Worked here for almost 3 years.
review_pros: Always get really good hours. Overnight pay is worth it.
review_cons: There always seems to be new management.

review_title: Part time experience at WEM as impactor
review_pros:
good colleague, nice atmosphere
nice manager, nice employee discount
review_cons: not enough workers at peak times. like christmas

review_title: Fun place to work temp but not for a career
review_pros: Work 3-10 Monday through Friday, great for college students
review_cons: Working most holidays but that's retail

review_pros: Easy hire if you have the personality and the looks, very flexible schedule hours, get to work with so many nice and cool people. You work in an environment with people of your age or close to it and haven fun talking and relating with each other while working. The work is easy and just have to maintain a good standard and speed. And very importantly you have the experience of having a very culturally diverse clientele.
review_cons: No important benefits for regular associates such as models or impact, bad pay, no commission, only 30% discount on clothing and no opportunity to advance unless you have a bachelor's.
review_advice_mgmt: Increase salary, offer benefits, give incentives and improve work morale.

review_title: It's a great job if you're desperate
review_pros:
-Work with fun people
-Discount 
- Meeting new people
- Cute guys
review_cons:
- Loud music
- Annoying customers
- Pay doesn't compensate for the work load
- Not enough hours
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more attention to the associates and their needs and stop playing favorites.

review_pros: Great for meeting people and extending college lifestyle
review_cons: Not given autonomy to do position. Upper management is reactionary and  talks down to their  frontline leadership.
review_advice_mgmt: Be consistent with your policies.

review_title: Eh, it is what you make of it.
review_pros:
Good cross-brand discount.

Good first job, especially for high-schoolers and college students looking for a part-time job.
review_cons:
Terrible with hours. 

They have such a high turnover rate with associates because they hire so many people and give everyone so few hours save for a select few. 

They also don't give raises despite being with the company for a while. Advancement into a management position requires a bachelor's degree.

review_pros: Everything is handled in the computer, schedule/paperwork etc which made things easy to get started/paperless. It is an easy job if you want to fold shirts over and over and over again and get paid minimum wage to do it while listening to fist pumping-jersey shore-guido music the whole time. There are a lot of people who work at one location which for part-time employees, you could pick up a lot of hours if you wanted to.
review_cons: Company has terrible ethics, they would literally turn the air conditioner down in the store to freeze the employees (who are paid minimum wage) so they would buy the sweaters/blazers. That is ridiculous, you can not FREEZE your employees to make them purchase sweaters that cost more than 2 shifts of working. They are also very disrespectful and rude to employees who put in their two  weeks notice.
review_advice_mgmt: You wonder why sales are dropping? Teach your employees to SELL things not just scream taglines and "hey, hows it goin" to customers.

review_title: Working for A&F you'll get to meet and work with some amazing people! Other than that, the job blows, pays minimum wage.
review_pros:
--> 30% Employee Merchandise Discount
--> Fun work environment and coworkers
--> You get to work with and meet some VERY attractive individuals
--> Coworkers and managers are all nearly the same age
--> Management is fairly corrupt however if you're on the inner circle you will get plenty of hours each week, you will get the best hours for the days you do work, and you usually do not get pesky call-in shifts.
--> Management is very flexible with you if you are flexible with them (you can request as many days off; or even set your availability to one day per week and they'll work with you)
review_cons:
--> No opportunity to advance within the company
--> Low hourly rate of pay (majority of employees don't even get a raise after several years of working for the company.)
--> No commissions
--> Very strict "Look Policy"
--> Corporate basically lets you know that you are disposable and can be easily replaced
--> Corporate would rather let a good/valuable employee quit than give them a raise
--> Most management positions are held by young, inexperienced, stuck up individuals who for the most part seem to be intellectually challenged.
--> You are basically required to wear their clothing and follow a strict dress code; which isn't cheap so you end up spending a good chunk of your paycheck about 5-6 times per year.
--> It's not everyday but there is usually always some sort of stupid drama going on
--> Customers who shop there are typically rude and quick to anger (especially if they are older; bc of the dark atmosphere, the strong scent of cologne, and the music.) 
--> A&F is a targeted store by many shoplifters and shoplifting gangs.
review_advice_mgmt: If A&F's corporate employees would just show even the slightest bit of appreciation and respect for their long term, hardworking employees that make the company what it is, they would be surprised as to how many of those senior employees would stick around and continue promoting the company.

review_title: Not a terrible job, but could be highly stressful
review_pros: Great Benefits, with decent vacation time
review_cons: Little concern for employees, Expect  a lot of work from one person

review_title: Company/Brand has achieved maximum wear-out and is at a downward trend in the US - It has switched its focus to Overseas
review_pros:
-Immediate medical benefits as a manager
-Very young atmosphere perfect for high school and early college-aged students (non-management)
-Only need to work 5 hours a week to maintain employment for non-management
review_cons:
-Unrealistic goals and direction by CEO, company, regional/district managers
-Misguided marketing initiatives (frequent last minute marketing changes too)
-Very little opportunity to actually use said medical benefits (without negative consequences/guilt) ---High swings of consistently changing hours given to operate the business daily and weekly (feast or famine)
 -Company tries to make money by severely limiting hours available to employees in order to operate the business, yet has outrageous expectations of high standard and high quality operations within each store!
-Tries to force hiring of diverse applicants in each store to make up for their past racial hiring mistakes (court ordered) and avoid the suspended lawsuit
review_advice_mgmt: Very confusing and stressful job, but good if you need a job quickly with benefits and a salary, while looking for your professional dream position.

review_title: I hated working at Abercrombie like the majority of their previous employees do.
review_pros: Great way to get a first job.
review_cons: Managers were incompetent, horrible and inconsistent hours. Their stores constantly hire new models which makes getting hours even harder.

review_pros: Generally easy-going environment, easy training, simple tasks
review_cons: Low pay, bad communication between management

review_pros: Relaxed environment, no conflict with co-workers, easy but tedious jobs
review_cons:
-Workplace discrimination: workers judged by how they look not how much effort they put into their work.
-Deal with occasional demanding/unreasonable customers

review_title: I would work someplace different if you can.
review_pros: They are very flexible with your schedule.
review_cons:
You have to purchase your own clothes. 
Two raises are given out to only two people in the entire district once a year.
Not a lot of hours given
Shifts are constantly being cut or added without warning.
Strict dress code

review_pros: Awesome and beautiful people who can become lifelong friends, easy tasks, many opportunities if you remain with the company for more than 5 years
review_cons: Difficult to get raises as a part-time employee, no way to become a manager without a degree, little training (not that it is really necessary)
review_advice_mgmt: Allow those who have worked with the company to become MIT's without already having their degree, the best associates are not always the managers, but the part-time employees who have been there the longest.

review_pros: Fun atmosphere and people. Looks good on resume.
review_cons: You laterally do everything, minimal hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Start taking your jobs seriously.

review_title: Lots of promises, not a lot of delivery.
review_pros: Working in retail definitely has its benefits. You will be in contact with the public daily, which allows you to be social. Also, you're given a fair amount of responsibility, always a nice feeling to be trusted. They also pay you well for the work you will be doing, which is generally pretty mundane.
review_cons: Abercrombie and Fitch will undoubtedly say that there is a ton of room for growth. However, I know manangers that have been in store for upwards of five years and were not promoted any higher. Eventually they quit because they gave up trying to move any higher. If you're looking for limitless job growth this is not the company for you.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep it all in perspective. At the end of the day if there is more money in the till than when you opened you're doing your job.

review_pros: Fun, beyond easy, great part-time high school/college job
review_cons: STRICT dress code, management is uptight
review_advice_mgmt: This is not high fashion, breathe!

review_pros: The work was easy and not too demanding
review_cons: Managers are inexperienced, poor training
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more attention to the associates as they are lazy most of the time.

review_title: Difficult to move up if you don't "fit" their mold
review_pros: Fun environment while in college and good discount!
review_cons: Long hours on hard floors with flip flops..
review_advice_mgmt: reward or at least acknowledge dedicated, hard working and loyal employees rather than just nit picking or pointing out mistakes or negative aspects in the store

review_pros:
Benefits and some of the people
Good place to start (for experience) 
Bad place to stay
review_cons:
Salary, and semi-unrealistic expectations. 
40 hour a week baby sitter
Schedule is terrible
review_advice_mgmt: Lower attrition and keep managers with better pay and better internal audits

review_pros: Great friends, loved the customers!
review_cons: Crazy long hours, working nights and weekends, kids liked to quit because they were only scheduled one shift a week, models are hired pretty much only based on their style and look.

review_pros: 1. Worked with people who are fun and out going.
review_cons:
1. Physically demanding (stand for hours)
2. Deal with other managers who don't care about you
3. Unprofessional work setting (especially if you work at night)
review_advice_mgmt: Train new employees thoroughly. Some of them start working without fully knowing what they're supposed to do.

review_pros: training, international opportunities, and home office opportunities
review_cons: Pay isn't great, no benefits, and career path in stores (domestically) is tough.
review_advice_mgmt: Bonuses would be nice

review_pros:
-50% discount on certain merchandise
-30% off the rest of the store including gift cards
-easy job, "models" get paid to stand there
-great manager & co-workers (i got lucky, apparently most stores aren't like this)
review_cons:
-very, very strict dress code (flip flops or converse only, no make-up, only can wear navy white & grey, only jeans, etc)
-you basically only get hired if you're skinny & attractive
-minimum wage
-overuse of perfume in store
-lame tag lines

review_pros: Dress casually, and easy. Nobody takes it too seriously, and your coworkers will be young and always willing to go out and hit up the town
review_cons: You're job doesn't mean anything substantial. So after a nine hour day you look in the mirror and think...is this what I'm doing with my life. Also, the company puts a heavy emphasis on looks with less attention to probably more important skills

review_pros: -the great people you meet
review_cons:
-being expected to do a million things at once and keeping your room looking 'perfect'
-having two sets of cash and fitting rooms but only keeping one of each open even when it's insanely busy
-being expected to run cash, fitting room AND keep the canoe room looking 'perfect' all at the same time - next to impossible
-always understaffed, so you are forced to do more to make up for the lack of staff
-having to go longer without breaks because of no staff
-the look policy is ridiculously strict and leaves no room for individuality or self expression
-having to constantly board fold everything perfectly and line up size stickers in a straight line
-saying tag lines, 'hey hows it going' 50 times a day is monotonous and in personable 
-there is no room for promotions or raises
-high turn over rate of employees and or managers
-having to close the store in under two hours with only two sales associate on the floor - it's chaotic and stressful and tiring
-not aloud to have any visible go-backs yet there is no where to put them, so you have to essentially run to the back and throw them in a bin and run back to help customers
-there is a set playlist that gets repeated for months, I never want to hear any of those songs ever again
-although they say buying the AAA's is optional, they force it upon you to buy them by always asking if you have bought them yet and don't give you much hours if you don't buy them
-customers are rude and easily angered 
-having to ask customers for their debit/credit twice because the systems don't link up and you have customers getting suspicious and upset
-as well as having to open and clean the entire store with only one associate on staff 
-in the end, for the amount you work and the amount of work you do per shift and the amount you get paid - it just isn't worth it.
review_advice_mgmt: Come spend a day in a store so you can fully understand what is going on in the company and to help make things better. Fix the whole payment transaction system - link them up like most stores so associates don't have to ask customers for their cards twice - most customers don't understand why we have to use their card a second time and get upset. It's honestly the most annoying thing to have to tell every customer - 50 times a day to keep their card inserted in the debit machine and then they take it out and you have to ask them for it again. It takes so much longer for the transaction to be completed which means more time per customer.

review_pros: fun atmosphere, friendly co workers, great discount, great benefits, organized, and respected company, definite career growth potential
review_cons: Long hours with half pay on overtime!  Huge security and theft problem.
review_advice_mgmt: There needs to be better security with high risk theft and something should be done about the half pay after hours.  Especially since the schedule calls for 50 hours per week.

review_pros: Very fun atmosphere, make lots of friends working here. Also I love the clothes. They give you the opportunity to model for the corporation which is exciting. The hours are awesome!
review_cons: The starting pay is terrible but it eventually starts to go up, also the employee discount is only 20% off which I think is a little low, I think something around 30% is a little more appropriate
review_advice_mgmt: Increase the employee discount to 30%

review_title: Good first job for a kid in Highscool
review_pros:
The people you work with can be really cool.
 
You always smell good.
review_cons:
-Grueling hours on your feet

-Employee discount is not that great

-Pressure to badger customers into buying something

review_pros: Casual environment where you get to wear casual clothing - nothing stuffy or uncomfortable. Typically fun coworkers that make your shift time pass by quicker. They adjust your work schedule really well to your availability; they're very flexible in that sense and I really appreciated that because my non-Abercrombie life was very busy.
review_cons: Even though the work wear is casual, the dress code is also pretty strict - you can only wear certain colors and clothing that is from or very similar to their store (and not even anything from their store since you can only wear certain colors and styles). Also, regular photos of me had to be taken and sent to the home office - although I wasn't the least bit worried about my appearance, it's still pretty superficial.

review_pros: Salary, benefits, Be a part of new fashion trends.
review_cons: Overtime, under paid, working with unreliable youth, customers.
review_advice_mgmt: Domestic stores need more resources. Stop sending everything overseas.

review_pros:
Management training program.  Even though I was not interested in retail, I am now able to run a business in various industries using the tools in the MIT program

One of the great things about A&F is their global standard.  As an assistant manager, I was able to go from working one brand in one state to another brand in a new state with different labor laws etc, and run the business seamlessly. 

Lastly its great to be rewarded for being a smart outgoing college graduate with good looks.
review_cons:
One of the biggest regrets is working at a tier three store in my home town.  In a city where there are multiple district managers and stores, its easy to find a mentor to take ownership of your development and truly find your niche/ competitive advantage in this company.  

Low pay is the other con.  After a year of working in the same position, I had the skills to move to another job making twice as much using the tools.  Its a waste of company money and time to train a high potential assistant manager and expect them to make a low salary when they are the face of the business.  They hire aspirational people, no aspirational person who truly knows their worth would be content working the same position with no learning curve for more than a year
review_advice_mgmt: Abercrombie & Fitch needs to dive into stores and identify talent at the assistant manager level.  I feel confident that me and several of my peers would have thrived given the opportunity for development outside of my small town mall

review_title: Easy to get job if you're cute
review_pros:
The discount is good
I enjoyed the clothes I wore to work
You might young, cute, fun people who are like to have fun
review_cons:
Long hours
unfair/bais district manager
ridiculous hours
pay does not compensate for amount of work and stress
review_advice_mgmt: Better communication of praise

review_pros:
Working around beautiful people
Getting looked at by beautiful girls
review_cons:
Salary
Working hours
Management
Small cabins for trying clothes
review_advice_mgmt: More liberty and less hastle!

review_title: Awesome Fun Place For Minimum Pay
review_pros: Management and co-workers are so much fun to work with. Great hours and got the shifts you want. Work is simple, greeting, folding, dressing rooms, cashier.
review_cons: Pay is a little low- around $7.25.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep on being awesome :)

review_pros: Well,..it does offer employment, no matter how humiliating and degrading to the human spirit. Part-time & full-time associates' schedules are extremely flexible. Call out any time claiming a "casting" and you're free to not show up for work. No pros for management positions.
review_cons: This is a notoriously superficial company with highly questionable policies, Management positions do not at all prepare employees for BUSINESS world, in which consideration of analytics is essential in every other work environment. This includes RETAIL of course, as retail is the business of selling fashion. There is only an elementary discussion of money and sales among management. There is MINIMAL use of Excel (and only for few departments, and some upper level managers if they choose to bother). Other than the very simple use of Excel for two operational tasks, Microsoft is not used at all. Minimal data-entry experience for most departments. Again, NO USE OF BUSINESS ANALYSIS. And, one more time: extremely superficial, aesthetic obsessed hiring policies through out all positions. Thoroughly immature & inexperienced management structure, completely nonsensical promotion rubric that cannot be/is not clearly and legitimately explained by upper management. This company prefers ignorant and uncreative management. Shudders are on the windows, after all.
review_advice_mgmt: Get an education. Understand what the words "inclusive" and "diversity" mean by consulting a dictionary, or expert in such terminology and concepts. Not a CORPORATE DOCUMENT written by LAWYERS (who are more educated and gainfully employed) of the Company.

review_pros: Hours were flexible and I could work them in as a student.
review_cons: It's hard to get many hours if you want more than 10 a week.
review_advice_mgmt: Establish better working relationships with associate.

review_pros:
- Really fun
- Get to meet attractive people your age
- Good experience
review_cons:
- GM was a dick
- Overwork you sometimes

review_pros: Experience in retail, time management, and experience dealing with diverse customers.  Management was willing to hire anyone who would show up on time and be an honest employee--and overall I feel they were making a stronger drive to hire a diverse workforce.
review_cons: Management did not make a strong effort to train employees.  They required I buy my own uniform (clothes from their store) instead of providing me with one. You have to use catch-phrases when people enter the store which can get annoying to you and the customers.  Their corporate culture is funky--they showed us a propaganda film for their "screen test" in the back that featured their half naked models making out.   Few work hours. Little team effort--little to no team meetings.  And for some reason, no one could ever find the dressing room keys.
review_advice_mgmt: Sponsor more team effort and invest more faith in employees.  Reform your corporate culture--it was cool a decade a go, and now it has lost its charm.  That propaganda video for the screen test was quite unprofessional and it made many employees feel uncomfortable working in the stock room.

review_pros:
- People are fun to work with
- Customers aren't that bad
- Flexible Scheduling and hours
review_cons:
- Folding clothes takes forever
- District Managers walk around like God
review_advice_mgmt: You should really enroll your DM's in a management course or two.

review_pros: It is a good "first job" for teenagers. pretty easy to get as long as you got the "looks" and the personality they are looking for.
review_cons: Horrible pay for the amount of duties we get. seriously we are not slaves...

review_pros: Best place to start training for a management career. You meet some really nice people.
review_cons: No raises, Senior Management ignores your needs, All training is based off of your manager above you and if they are bad then you will struggle.  Too many meaningless tasks.  Similar stores offer higher pay.  The company does not give you enough hours to handle closes and the amount of foot traffic in the store yet blames you when your shrink/theft is too high.  Once you are at the store management position you make less than your assistants...
review_advice_mgmt: Stop over tasking your managers.  Store Managers should be paid more than their assistant managers (duh).  Stop burning out managers and then wondering why you have such high Management turnover!

review_pros: casual, you get to wear flip flops at work, all associates about the same age, great way to meet new people,
review_cons: not the best pay, almost no pay raises, strict orders from upper management, micro managed, retail schedule

review_pros: Worked here seasonally for a few summers during school.  As far as I can tell, pretty standard retail experience.  Decent hours when they are not overstaffed, and a pretty upbeat work environment
review_cons: The emphasis on looks can be tiring, also the strict control exerted by the corporate headquarters can get tedious, with everything needing to be to exact (sometimes I felt unnecessary) standards
review_advice_mgmt: N/A

review_title: Fun workplace for first/part time job, but they play favorites
review_pros: I met some really nice and attractive people working there, and it was a fun and social environment.  I was lucky that the head manager and MIT were super nice, and what I liked most about working there.  Some of the other managers I could NOT stand.
review_cons: You could tell who were the favorites, and if you weren't one of them, good luck getting hours.  Customers were rude and complained about things you as an associate can't change, like pricing, lighting and music level.  Also when new AAA's came out, most of your paycheck went to buying new outfits to work in.  With managers, it's a hit or miss.  Some are super cool while others I could NOT stand... two of my managers were very stuck up, never said more than two words to me my entire time working there and thought they were too good for me.  um, hello, you're working here because you couldn't get a job doing what you went to school for.

review_pros:
Basically if you are outgoing and energetic you will get the job. The model position is NOT ALWAYS based on looks!! 
Get to socialize and hang around energetic fun loving people
Easy job--folding clothes, greeting (except for women's 1)
Rewarded for working hard includes more hours, managers will respect you and count on you to do tasks
People LOVE it when you say you work at Abercrombie & Fitch; i've literally had people worship the ground I walk on because I've told them I work there
review_cons:
Managers pick favorites
Music and cologne can cause headaches 
Can be a popularity contest based on looks
Poor pay
Poor communication and training ( I was literally learning the job as I went along, had about 10 mins of training)
Incompetent managers
review_advice_mgmt:
Don't be so superficial--there are plenty of people that are not super hot but have fun personalities which make the job easier. 
Managers need to communicate better and ease expectations a tad bit
Definitely need to focus more attention to minorities

review_title: fun loud but everyone is friendly
review_pros: easy, good if you are neat and like people
review_cons: no makeup, no polish. must keep look simple

review_pros:
Diversity within the workplace 
Store Environment was peacefully and easy going
review_cons:
Not enough hrs
Rate of pay did not equal labor 
Lack of Training
review_advice_mgmt: Pay raises should be on a 6 months to a Yearly routine for effective and efficient stock and sales associates .

review_pros:
30% discount
hot guys works there sometimes
review_cons:
have to buy new seasonal outfit every season
too many workers, not enough hours
snobby young managers
review_advice_mgmt:
stop asking like you're a beauty queen. It's just a retail store
more communication to workers

review_pros: A&F allowed me to get a "management" job right after college but quickly turned out to be a dead end job--unless you want to be a salaried store manager that makes less than a hourly Assistant Store Manager.
review_cons: As with any retail job, the pay was poor, the hours fluctuated making it difficult to have a balanced life, and the district management had little knowledge of what was actually occurring in their stores.
review_advice_mgmt: Improve talent identification and management for high performing employees--fast track those that have the motivation and ability quickly

review_title: Great company to jump start retail career
review_pros:
Great training program for managers starting in retail
Awesome benefits (401k, life insurance, PPO health insurance, dental, and vision)
Promotions come quickly if you fit their mold
Most of the managers and associates are fun to work with
Company is international, which opens up opportunities for travel
review_cons:
Don't have two consistent days off in a row
Promotions are mostly based off how many "great looking" associates managers have recruited
Not compensated for traveling to recruiting locations
Too many conference calls that are repetitive
Some upper management enjoy to gossip to one another about their managers while at work and spend very little time doing their actual work.
At a certain point that company will try to make managers move to the Ohio corporate office. If you continuously refuse promotions they will fire you.
review_advice_mgmt: Recruiting shouldn't be as much of a focus because managers who get promoted based on recruiting don't often know how to properly run a store. There are managers who are strictly just recruiters, but they often recruit for a single store or stores where they are friends with managers. Less emphasis on recruiting for in store managers would mean better run stores with happier employees.

review_pros: Cool people for the most part. Work is not very hard at the retail stores. Typical retail clothing job.
review_cons: You will NOT get a raise any time soon. I knew girls who worked there for 3 years without a raise. Managers can be unreasonable
review_advice_mgmt: Give your employees raises once in a while

review_title: One of the easiest interviews I've had
review_pros: I worked as a sales associate/ Main pro was getting to know the staff.
review_cons: Job is too monotonous. You just go around store trying to find something to do. Although the store I worked in closed after I left, so it might be different at other stores.
review_advice_mgmt: No advice.

review_title: don't apply, even if you're in high school
review_pros:
always around young people
discount for employees
cute clothes, thats it
you get to pick your own songs in Hollister
review_cons:
HORRIBLE managers, HORRIBLE management PERIOD
bad pay, 0-4 or 8 hours if you were lucky...perhaps 14+ if you were a FAVORITE
make you constantly work
type of environment that gets your anxiety going
always dark in Hollister and cluttered
review_advice_mgmt: hire less people, it is ridiculous, change EVERYTHING, literally

review_pros: Loved working there and the coworkers were very friendly people all around!  Would definitely recommend this position to anyone!
review_cons: Not much room for advancement--the company looks outside to bring in leaders that are already established.
review_advice_mgmt: N/a

review_title: I Loved Working For This Company
review_pros: Environment, company direction, co-workers, benefits
review_cons: hours, demands, work life balance

review_pros: comfortable clothing, none, none, oh and none
review_cons: poor employee treatment, poor work environment, music is 1, i repeat 1 decibel below OSHA standards for illegal workplace noise. cologne is constantly pumped electrically through the store, burns your throat and is a respiratory concern. LOW PAY

review_pros: the managers where not micro managers and would let you do what you wanted.  you would get great discounts on the merchandise.  the people were fun and friendly
review_cons: elitist culture. people thought they were better then customers

review_title: Fun college job but don't make a career out of it
review_pros: Fun upbeat people, we basically just hung out and got paid to stand and fold.
review_cons: The pay/hrs were not enough to buy the actual clothes they want you to wear.
review_advice_mgmt: Try to get your employees better pay so the turnover rate decreases

review_pros: Working here (the NY flagship) can be fun at first because you're surrounded by young attractive people with catchy music and great cologne spraying through the air every 15 minutes. The employee discount (30%) is nice but can't be used on sale items. Decent pay for a part time sales job, especially if you have no experience.
review_cons: Eventually the music and cologne become nuisances. The customers are pushy and rude because they think there is a sale even though the flagship NEVER has sales. Management has some serious issues. Some get on your back for not folding a shirt properly, others don't care if you stand there staring at the ground. There is a lot of favoritism here. A lot is based on your looks, even if you're not a model. Way too much fraternization between management and models. A lot of employees don't take the job seriously so responsibility is piled up on the ones who do.
review_advice_mgmt: Praise your employees for working hard instead of hanging around with the models. Don't yell at employees for providing good customer service over keeping your area neat.

review_pros:
-You basically pick your own hours.
-You WILL be recognized for your hard work.
-Great flexibility.
-Great music. 
-Fun environment.
-Great job to have while you're in school.
-Cute clothes.
-You get to work with some really fun people.
review_cons: You'll sometimes have to deal with difficult customers, and the pay isn't amazing, but you have to remember that you're working retail.  And, if you aren't happy with the pay, you can always get a second job, because A&F is AMAZING about working with your availability.
review_advice_mgmt: Maybe consider changing some policies, like giving employees their discount on clearance merchandise.  I'm completely fine with buying my AAAs every season, but I feel like I'd be a little happier if I could use my discount on some of the $79.90 outerwear right now :)

review_title: No advancement, but an amazing environment.
review_pros:
This is a great starter for people who have never had a job before. You will get great skills and learn a lot of useful things that will help you later on in life.

Management was nice and work wasn't bad at all, but it did get hectic when the holidays rolled around.
