Discounts are awesome, and it nice to go in the very back of the store and get the sickest clothing for less than 10 dollars.

You make your own schedule.
review_cons:
No advancement, work is the same, low pay (usually spot on with the minimum wage of each state), long hours, and sometimes stupid/ annoying customers.

You're never full-time unless you take other peoples shifts. They don't want sales representative to be full-time so that they don't have to give you benefits (401K, health, etc.)

Everyone quits because of the pay, lack of advancement, and benefits.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay your employees more.

review_pros:
You have a very flexible schedule 
Some managers are really cool and friendly
Love the people
review_cons:
They pay can be better
The discounts aren't good enough
The store can get really messy 
Hate greeting the rude customers

review_title: Not to much to look forward to
review_pros: If you show that you have any type on intelligence and are capable of making organized and neatly folded piles of clothes you'll get all the hours you want.
review_cons: You get paid minimum wage, and should not look forward to a raise... it wont come.
review_advice_mgmt: Let us be a little more aggressive when it comes to shoplifters...

review_title: A great first job out of college
review_pros: My co-workers. I am still close with many of them.
review_cons: The salary and it was extremley hard to ad.vance in the company

review_pros:
Easy job
Fun
Attractive people in store
review_cons:
Have to wear their clothes while working (that you buy out of pocket)
Low pay

review_title: Fun and exciting job to have!
review_pros: Great environment. Not one complaint.
review_cons: Working other shifts and wont return the favor.
review_advice_mgmt: Raises would be greatly appreciated. Triple A's are kinda expensive for minimum wage based workers.

review_pros: If you are good-looking, you can get hired. There is also a system in place to have management members move up fairly quickly.
review_cons: Their odd expectations for appearance is mirrored in their expectations for the set up of their stores. Every last detail is pre-determined. Every person and and everything must fit a specific mold.
review_advice_mgmt: N/A. I believe Abercrombie truly does run the stores exactly how they want to and would take no advice from an outsider or lower-level management person.

review_pros: Good pay, great benefits and friendly atmosphere.  Allowed to wear jeans and flip flops to work.
review_cons: not a great life work balance
review_advice_mgmt: n/a

review_pros:
-Work with attractive people
-very high energy work place
-good pay (for overnight)
-discount on clothes (30% or 50% off on 'the look')
review_cons:
-minimal staffing (currently, not always an issue)
-no advancement unless you have a 4 year degree
-the fierce spraying all the time!
review_advice_mgmt: Hire more people! The store runs on minimal employees and it effects service!

review_pros: you learn a lot about HR and Operations
review_cons: typically 10-12 hours a day if you are working full time.

review_pros:
-Discount on their clothing (if you wear it)
-Really flexible scheduling
review_cons:
-Your shifts are pretty much always 4 or 5 hours no matter what
- They say that they truly care about customer service, however if you are working in the front you are not allowed to leave that area under any circumstances. So if a customer asks for your assistance in another room, you have to decline and tell them to go ask someone else.
-Low pay
-Ridiculous expectations (e.g. Wearing flip flops all the time, hair has to be a certain way, no nail polish, etc.)
-Too much emphasis on looks rather than brains
review_advice_mgmt: To hire smarter people and to really consider how much they care about customer service.

review_title: Ok Place While in High School
review_pros: Easy work, Works good with school
review_cons: Too many employees not enough hours
review_advice_mgmt: Give employees more hours

review_pros: extraordinarily flexible schedule, work with college age kids, laid back dress policy.
review_cons: do not get paid very much.  The job is tedious and only a viable option if you have a second job.

review_pros: Friendly co-workers, some chicks you get to hit on.
review_cons: The money you spend on clothes > Money you make, AAA's should be free I mean, y'all are a multi-billion dollar company, quit being greedy.
review_advice_mgmt: Better pay, free AAA's, 50% all clothes no BS or shortcuts.

review_pros: make cool friends, learn a lot about merchandising
review_cons: low pay, only gives raises to 2 people a year, no chance of promotion, judged based on looks
review_advice_mgmt: Don't take you personal feelings out on associates. Don't show favoritism. Be fair with the distribution of hours. You wouldn't have to hire a bunch of people if you gave the ones you already have decent hours.

review_pros:
-Fun work environment
-Anyone attractive can work here
-Great for first job and to put retail experience under your belt
review_cons:
-Minimum wage
-No raises, no bonuses
-No opportunities for advancemant unless you have a 4yr degree
review_advice_mgmt: Its ok to give yor employees a little more money. Raises keep us going. LOLz Thats why no one ever stay at this job. Its unrealistic.

review_pros: Fairly easy job. Just greet the customers and keep the store organized.
review_cons: Maxium days you would work a week  was two and the rest was call ins. Although I know of some people who only worked once every two weeks. I worked at a outlet and they are always hiring. There must have been about 70-80 employees all together. I wish rather than hiring new employees all the time they would give their current employees more hours.

review_title: Enjoyable job with good benefits, but not very high pay.
review_pros: As a manager, you selectively hire the most friendly, outgoing, and attractive people.  Hand picking a great staff makes work more enjoyable.  The casual dress code is comfortable.
review_cons: The quotas required for recruiting new models can get old.
review_advice_mgmt: Management deserves a more competitive salary and will result in a slower rate of turnover.

review_pros: Fun atmosphere. Great discount. Great opportunity for work experience.
review_cons: Management definitely plays favorites. Unless you are favored, not a lot of opportunity for hours.

review_pros: Meeting great people and making new friends
review_cons: The type of customers the store attracts, management,district managers are unprofessional, not a professional environment, constantly short staffed,a lot of the company stores are "Target" stores meaning their are high levels of theft,managers or MITs(managers in training.) quit all the time with little or no notice,  and minimum wage.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay raises MIGHT convince your associates to stay, and by pay raises I don't me 10-35cent raises.

review_title: The people are great but the noise level and lighting make it difficult
review_pros: The company is very consistent with their policies and management always "has your back"
review_cons: turn the music down and more lights on!
review_advice_mgmt: I don't think its a very smart idea to have an MIT that has never worked with the company before, they should have to go through the Model and impact position for 4 months each. That way they get a better handle on how to do their job. Also, the fact that I couldn't move up in the company because I didn't have a degree was very frustrating, i felt i could have done the mangers job better than they were doing it.

review_pros: A decent place to work.
review_cons: low pay, long hours. loud music

review_title: Fun atmosphere, good first job, but very little pay
review_pros: Fun, social work that can be a lot of fun at times
review_cons: sometimes monotonous, little pay minimum wage, sometimes strict, forces you to buy their clothing

review_pros: Fun people to work with.  Very relaxed environment. Easy work.
review_cons: Minimum wage pay. short hours.

review_pros: Fast vertical growth, comfortable work clothes
review_cons: High turnover, terrible hours, inflexible, poor management, LOW LOW pay.
review_advice_mgmt: GFY

review_pros:
-PPO Medical and Dental plan
-Stand and be on your feet rather than sitting in front of a computer all day
-Discounts!!
review_cons:
-Never get two consecutive days off
-Managers and 'models' hiding clothes in the back room, waiting for the item to drop in price
-No promotions and if you finally get one, it's not significant enough to notice a change on your pay check
-Very bad moral, while I was there, every since manager wanted to quit so bad, but couldn't because they couldn't find a job elsewhere
-Too much focus on recruiting, not enough focus on training the people who are actually there
-Bad attitudes. The people who worked here really thought they were better than the customers
-It's like a high school environment. There is usually the mean girl, the gossip, the one who's too scared to speak up for themselves and the rest of us that are in shock that this sort of behavior happens at work!
-Too many clicks. The regional managers hang out with selected store managers. And if you are not in that group, you can kiss promotions good bye!
review_advice_mgmt: I am not sure it's worth writing anything here. A&F will continue to be successful even though their customer service is poor. Unless the whole company culture changes, there is no use giving management advice.

review_pros: It is a fun work environment. You meet a lot of people.
review_cons: You will be over worked and underpaid

review_pros: Good environment to work in. Everyone is friendly.
review_cons: Pay is minimum wage, low amount of hours given per week

review_pros: flexible schedule, relaxed atmosphere, no uniform
review_cons: horrible values and morals, terrible hours between seasons

review_title: Great easy job, but not for people wanting a steady flow of money
review_pros: Pretty easy going managers. Great people to work with, makes the work atmosphere feel fun and simple. You Will make friends here. Not a complicated job at all. Absolutely best first job, because its so flexible. You can change your schedule online at home, within a 2 week period before you want it to be changed. Everything is flexible, and I love that!
review_cons: Only get paid minimum wage. And most shifts aren't longer than 5 hours. Good for some side money if you get an allowance, but not good if you have a car and go out to eat often, hangout with friends, are in college, etc, unless your going to work every single day. And its pointless to work everyday for only 4 hours, you'd get tired of the job quick. Most of the employees work another job as well.
review_advice_mgmt: At least for employee's that have been with the company for over a year should get a quarter raise, or something.

review_title: A nice part-time job if you have free time
review_pros: Very casual environment. Love the music and the smell. There's not a lot of expectations on you as a part-time. I loved the brand, so it was nice for me to see the latest collection and have the discount. Have breaks for long-hour shift.
review_cons: Schedules are set at the end of each week, which made it very hard for me to make plans ahead of time. Paid minimum wage. After tax, didn't earn much... May need to work long hours during holiday season.

review_title: Its a very fun company to work for, I'd recommend working for them at least once.
review_pros: It's a decent pay and it's a very laid back work environment.
review_cons: The company is focussed completely on it's image. So, if your store is not up to the standard, which most never are, its constant complaining from your district manager or regional manager. They have very unrealistic expectations for all of the stores.
review_advice_mgmt: Be friends with as many people as possible, including all of your associates. Don't just treat them like the little workers that they are.

review_pros: People and great atmosphere to work in. You'll definitely make great friends and these are the people that makes you want to come to work everyday. Moving up in the company is definitely faster than other companies. I love that this company gives new college grads a chance to prove themselves and shine. :)
review_cons: Hours are not that great. You are suppose to have set days off, but that rarely happens. You're days off usually change. Pay is not that great especially as a starting management salary. Bulk buyers sucks and good MIT's are hard to get.
review_advice_mgmt: Instead of spending your money on giving District Managers an Audi as a company car. Please raise management salary. DM's can survive with Honda's and Toyotas. Just saying.

review_pros: benefits are really good, include dental visual
review_cons: Unprofessioinal environment, descrimination, work on holidays, extended hours of work with no extra hours paid

review_pros:
Casual wear everyday, music, and great clothes
Excellent insurance and time off
review_cons: Casual wear everyday, inconsistent work schedule, possibly will not be granted the days off that you want-must work around their schedule.  Retention rate is ridiculous for associates and management, sometimes will have to cover another associate/manager's shift.  Managers may work twelve hour days or more(i cant even recall the amount of times i worked ridiculous amount of hours-too many times).  It is frown upon those furthering education-no need to have more than a bachelor degree to have a career with company.   Not all managers are fit for their position, due to the fact they where hired strictly by looks and not qualifications.  You can be the most dedicated person and follow everything by the books, but still may not get promoted up. Stress stress stress
review_advice_mgmt: Great for first job out of college, gaining experience and getting your career started, but i wouldn't recommend anything more than that.

review_pros: Met a lot of great people, still best friends with many of them, very chill environment, super easy job, relatively easy to get a shift covered due to the number of associates, managers are practically the same age as associates
review_cons: The music is ridiculously loud, extremely appearance focused, felt like the associates were competing with each other as to who was the most attractive, very high turnover for both associates and managers, lots of secretive photo shoots and events, the customers expect sales all the time and will constantly ask if there is an additional discount

review_pros: Great resume builder for the future
review_cons: The pay isnt so great for the amount of work.

review_pros: Management was really chill. Didn't care about much except if you came to your shift on time. Folding techniques had to be perfect.
review_cons: Hard to get hours and paid minimum wage.

review_title: Nice vibe but too much work for minimum wage
review_pros: Nice people. Good Atmosphere.you would want to hang out with your co workers
review_cons: Low pay. Minimum wage. Weird hours till late night.

review_pros: flexible, easy--just fold clothes and greet
review_cons: not many hours because they have so many employees
review_advice_mgmt: no words to share with management.

review_title: Working for Abercrombie was very boring
review_pros: you get a discount on their clothes
review_cons: you only get minimum wage, the job is extremely boring, the music is very loud and played on a continuous loop, the perfume they spray in the store is very strong
review_advice_mgmt: turn down the music

review_title: Improvements that will reduce the turnover rate.
review_pros: Casual dress code made it easy to get ready for work.
review_cons: Too many hours doing remedial tasks.
review_advice_mgmt: All stores should allow a clothing allowance, not just flagship stores.

review_title: Only work here if you are a teen just looking for spending money
review_pros:
the discount
smelling good after leaving
review_cons:
make you say silly things
management doesn't care about anything
hire so many people it is impossible to make money

review_pros: Great looking employees who make the time spent at work fun and great.
review_cons: Too much work, responsibilities for the pay and recognition. The company only promotes great looking people that fit the "positive brand image", and also seems to promote manager who are struggling to higher paying positions to have more supervision on them. Depending on your relationship with your store manager, your schedule will be whatever is better and more convenient for the store manager.
review_advice_mgmt: look for a better job while you work there.

review_pros: Nice culture with nice managers
review_cons: I seen no cons in working for this company
review_advice_mgmt: Continue to do what you have been doing.

review_pros: Easy Job, There are many people who can cover your shift, Interview is easy, everyone gets an interview
review_cons: Unstable hours, there is no training whatsoever, coworkers are very caddy, minimum wage.

review_pros:
-I have met some of my best friends and amazing people working for this company
-Laid back environment --jeans and flip flops to work
-Great benefits package
review_cons:
-Low pay, especially compared to other similar retailers
-Terrible work/life balance
-Overworked and underpaid
-Huge focus on recruiting beautiful people and that is what will get you promoted, not the effort and hard work you put into all other aspects of the store
-Wrong people in upper management
-Retail hours and no weekends or consecutive days off
review_advice_mgmt:
-Hire management for the right reasons, not just because they are beautiful
-Be hands on all the time, not just when you have to be negative
-Let us have a life

review_title: Decent place to work (not during floor sets), they definitely discriminate.
review_pros: Minimal discount but it's there, will hire you if you are attractive, before/after opening/closing can be fun. I was able to become a visual assistant manager while in college.
review_cons: Obvious physical discrimination, low pay, small discount, the smell of Fierce on top of blaring music will make you a bit crazy. Typical brand reps are not the most intelligent people to work with.

review_title: Good starter job in retail if you're a minority.
review_pros:
Friendly managers & asst. mangers (Stanford Shopping center).
20% discount on overpriced good quality clothes (excludes sale and clearance items)..
Smelling like "FIERCE" at the end of the day.
review_cons:
Low pay.
Bad music when working on sales floor.
Smelling like "FIERCE" at the end of the day.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep up your fair and innovative hiring practice.

review_pros: No previous retail experience required
review_cons: Long hours, little direction, increasing expectations coupled with decreasing management support, unpredictable schedule, poor work/life balance, highly stressful environment, no vacations allowed during the holiday season,

review_pros:
Great coworkers/ friends that help each other constantly

Great discount (40% at abercrombie and 30% at hollister if you are the full time stock) (30% at   abercrombie and 20% at hollister if you are pti or model)

Good pay/benefits for full time stock

People generally have a lot of respect for the full time stock in abercrombie stores.

I was pti. then got promoted to full time stock, then went back to pti. It was an amazing job that i will love and miss and remember forever. Unfortunately I had to go back to pti due to stress and school.
review_cons:
Stress stress stress. All I would do is go home and be stressed. Part time impact, and model is great for college students, but I do not recommend the full time stock job for students. I did it for two months before I became completely overwhelmed with stress and work, although if you need to work full time and don't have a degree, it would be a good job.

If you work at the kids store, you may not get a lot of pti hours, so you barely have anybody helping you.
review_advice_mgmt: Be realistic

review_pros: As an agent you are given a lot of freedom, make your own schedule, paid vacations after a certain amount of time, medical benefits.
review_cons: Lack of communication with upper management, sometimes you are put in dangerous situations

review_title: hard work, rewarding, and stressful all at the same time
review_pros: working with great people, great benefits, opportunities for upwards movement
review_cons: low salary for the hard work
review_advice_mgmt: pay the associates and management more who work in stores

review_title: OCD at it's best and at it's worst.
review_pros: Highly organized brand senses team, great benefits, top notch point of sale and inventory systems, and positions that emphasize both task and customer-service skills.
review_cons: Work isn't meaningful, fulfilling, or very rewarding. Not many challenges or decisions have to be made; they are made by people unseen and are often irrational. District managers offer very little support to stores.

review_pros: The people are the best part of the job. Not always, but in my case, they made that awful job bearable and even fun at times.
review_cons: So many cons...besides complaints about the music, the marketing, the prices, the smell, and the company policies. Managers are required to recruit "great looking, aspirational, outgoing" kids to work there which is easier said than done. Visual expectations are unbelievably high-if you're not OCD going into the job you will be when you leave. A truly draining company to work for...
review_advice_mgmt: Get rid of the 4 year college degree requirement for managers. I really don't understand why it's needed since it's no different than any other retail management job, but with less pay.

review_title: Fun atmosphere, easy tasks, horrible hours
review_pros: Easy tasks, work with friends, nice discounts on cloths, flexible hours, only good for part-time
review_cons: music will drive u insane at some point, terrible hours
review_advice_mgmt: MORE HOURS

review_pros:
Attractive Coworkers
Fun Environment 
Good Discount
Stable Job
Holiday Pay
Benefits are good, Medical/Dental/Vision...Paid time off, Sick leave
review_cons:
Pay is terrible compared to other retail companies
Not really running a business, just following guidelines
Scent/Music can get annoying
Micromanaging Everything
review_advice_mgmt: Let the people who are actually running the store, run the store; Stop micromanaging from Home Office.

review_pros:
Flexible schedule. You don't need to go through the hassle of telling your manager what days you need off since you can just do it all online. You can also work once a week and no one minds it. 
Lot of workers so finding a cover is not very hard.
review_cons:
Impossible to get a raise
Hearing defects
Bad smell
"models" or sales associates don't really do anything but stand around and talk to each other. So if you are a hard worker, you will be cleaning up the slack everyone else leaves around. Managers have favorites and I've seen people who have stopped getting scheduled or get scheduled only call-ins because the managers simply wanted that worker to quit. 
Having to buy the associate clothes. It seems that the CEO always likes to pick the ugliest (full-priced) clothes and make their associates buy them with a discount that will save you about 40$ but you still end up paying 40$ for a darn sweater that you will never wear outside of work. The managers also make you buy this stuff, and will go out of their way to harass you to buy them (phone calls, telling workers that you will not be scheduled otherwise). 
Everybody at this store gossips. One rule: Don't share your life unless you want random strangers knowing about it
They hire based on looks. Management has a book filled with what abercrombie workers should look like. You can be as dumb as a rock, but looks will get you in this company. 
No nail polish and you have to wear sandals or converse only.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop being so cheap.

review_pros: Great people to work with, always new and exciting things coming through.
review_cons: Hours are long, time management from Home Office tends to be bad, you do not get enough hours to do everything they want you to do.
review_advice_mgmt: Find a way to manage time and resources a little bit more efficiently.

review_title: Very structured management in a very strict environment.
review_pros: Will be told exactly how to do everything
review_cons: Very little opportunity to be creative, innovative, or stray from the model of management they have.

review_title: A great place to work if you are young, hot, fun, and enjoy techno music.
review_pros: Listening to good music while working, getting a good discounts on clothing, getting the chance to meet new people, being able to work side by side with good looking people.
review_cons: Dealing with crazy mall hours, being extremely busy during holidays, not being able to wear piercings or having facial hair, clothing presentation constantly changing.
review_advice_mgmt: Higher wages for associates would be highly appreciated.

review_title: A very unreliable job...never would even consider working for them again...
review_pros: I have had no positive experience working here except for getting a paycheck.
review_cons: They Just keep hiring new people to replace other people for no reason...They are the reason I will never EVER want to work retail ever again.
review_advice_mgmt: If your going to hire new people don't keep them for only a few months and then stop calling them or stop giving them hours & then call 2 months later to COVER some ELSES shift that called out sick for last minute AFTER the fact that they havn't worked cuz you wont put them on the schedule cuz you keep hiring new & more people...

review_title: Fun for a high school summer job.
review_pros: Easy job and if the management is good in that store, it's actually fun.
review_cons: Pay is really low.  Some of the management is not great.

review_pros: If you are young and love a fun environment, A&F is the place for you. I have been with the company for 3 years at Home Office and in real stores and I have never had a bad experience in any of the positions I have been in.
review_cons: Floorset have become more and more hectic through the years and somewhat unorganized.
review_advice_mgmt: For as organized of a company that we are, corporate needs to get there things together because it's causing the stores to get set back in changing presentations.

review_pros: Allowed for the interaction with people, through customer support. Great management who desired to teach and elevate employee skills.
review_cons: Employee turn over, seemed like a gateway job. Employees and management changed fairly often.

review_pros: Nice environment to work after college
review_cons: Hours are bad.....its retail
review_advice_mgmt: Pay Models more in compensation

review_pros: The job was quite easy to pick up and allowed for flexible hours as shifts were normally 4-6 hours.
review_cons: Management is much more concerned with sales figures and the appearance of the store than providing a positive working environment for its associates.

review_title: A pretty boring stand still job.
review_pros: flexible hours and meets lots of people
review_cons: Lots of standing around and pretending to be busy

review_pros: People were the only thing that was good
review_cons: Everything else. Company values and mission statement is horrible. Pay is horrible. Folding clothes all day is horrible. Everything is horrible.
review_advice_mgmt: Change everything about the company

review_pros: It's a really friendly and laid back place to work, the managers are friendly and really open, the environment is pretty cool, if you like loud music and dark places. They provide good opportunity for growth within the company.
review_cons: Not really good pay, very few hours between 5-10 a week. The hire just if you are good looking and fit the company's culture.
review_advice_mgmt: Try to allow employees to provide ideas, more diversity and do not worry to much in the way people look.

review_title: Good people held back by poor project management and senior IT management that's out of touch
review_pros:
- Smart IT people
- Savvy business users who get e-commerce
- Your work will be seen by millions of people
review_cons:
- Senior IT management acts interested in suggestions, but real change is rare
- Super political atmosphere at the management level, no matter what they tell you during the interview
- Task estimates are ignored in favor of arbitrary deadlines, resulting in rushed delivery and mediocre quality
review_advice_mgmt: Listen to the experts you hire. They're there to help you build a great product. Your fear of trying new things and lack of real responses to criticisms have stifled innovation and made A&F a pretty uncomfortable place for IT people to work.

review_pros:
Employee discount is 40%, and for seasonal wear, 50%
Good-looking co-workers
review_cons:
Terrible management
Zero training
Always feel "watched": the managers always think their employees are trying to steal the clothes, they are completely paranoid about it
The managers, MITS and co-workers are catty, cliquey and bossy
The same music track is played over and over
The smell of cologne/perfume actually gave me a serious migraine
You're always "on-call"
My particular store broke tones of labor laws
review_advice_mgmt: Train management to treat workers and costumers with RESPECT

review_title: A great 1st job to learn apparel product development and merchandising
review_pros: As a first opportunity, A&F provides a great learning ground in apparel retail. It provides a great introduction to product development, planning, design and allocation.
review_cons: After a few years of experience, A&F becomes a difficult place to apply your knowledge to drive strategy.
review_advice_mgmt: Focus on developing great managers

review_pros: You get to wear shorts and flip flops, work with hot girls, recruiting aka go to the beach
review_cons: low pay, not nearly enough time off, company is VERY strict, work schedule not flexible, hours, home office management is clueless and does not listen to store managers, home office not concerned with needs and lives of people working in the stores. District Managers will often time make employees work on Christmas. I worked here for 3 years and I saw this every year.
review_advice_mgmt: Give more flexibilty to store managers. Let store managers actually manage and run the store and not enforce The Program so strictly. Better benefits.

review_pros: Flexible hours and understanding management
review_cons: Not the most intellectually stimulating form of employment

review_title: I'm a lead and I love working here; i feel appreciated and valued although my co workers may not feel the same as I do.
review_pros: Extremely flexible. Can pick up and give away shifts easily. Good pay for the amount of work required.
review_cons: Easily replaceable when just a sales associate. Greeter models make obscene amount of money.
review_advice_mgmt: Management needs to be more understanding/accommodating towards full timers. And they need to stop acting so stuck up. We all work for the same company- chill out.

review_pros:
-Discount can be great.
-Often get to work with fun, outgoing, and often funny individuals.
-The music can be great.
-Regular customers make it fun.
-Managers, associates, and rarely DMs that actually take pride in their work and their job.
-Insurance and benefits are some of the best a retail company can offer.
-Can have a flexible schedule, depending on if your SM/GM doesn't care JUST about themselves.
-On the computer "training" is just basically powerpoint presentations. 
-No experience needed. 
-Every once and a while you'll see that one article that you really like because it reminds you of what AnF and Hco used to be like.
review_cons:
-EXTREMELY under appreciated.
-The amount of work expected is work more than minimum wage.
-In a round about way you actually are expected to wear the clothes, but they get around it by saying the current cut style, fit and colors as long as its not any other brand..which no one else makes muscle fit clothes for guys. 
-Expected to do a lot of physical work in attire that isnt physical work friendly. Like having to wear skinny jeans a tucked in tee and a button up while having to move 50 boxes.
-The required look doesn't always fit with the weather. For instance its 105 degrees outside and once again having to wear skinny jeans, a tucked in tee and a button up.
-While some of the music is great, you sometime are stuck with an awful soundtrack for up to 3 months which plays over and over and over.
-Unless you're really good at sucking up or your DM likes you, don't count on being promoted unless a time of desperation happens. Like store managers all quitting at many stores at once.
-Too many rules for selling "jeans and Tshirts"
-Not supposed to bring outside of work problems to work which is fine, but required to do work outside of work..like recruiting kids who no longer wear AnF or Hco and definitely will not do it for minimum wage. 
-The company does not listen to store associates feed back. Basically if you have an opinion about something keep it to yourself.
-It's never the company's fault. What happened is all tied back to you and what you should have done. 
-The company takes itself too seriously. 
-Stores are being shut down left and right in the US while over seas they're being open every week. I think someone has'nt learned a lesson. Trends are just that..
-Not very keen on trends. More so for guys. The guys clothes have been basically the same since I was in high school in the early 2000's.
-You can not live alone, and have a social life with what the company pays managers. 
-Home Office associates more often than not,haven't worked in stores in so long they can't relate or understand to help with the problem you're having in the store.
-Micro-managing does not work with everyone and the company calls it "follow up" 
-No differences in the brands. What you see in AnF you will find at Hollister and Gilly Hicks with a different logo. 
-Very promotional sales based. The clothes show it. IE.. 2 tees for 20 and so on.
-Incentives for certain things are candy boxes for associates. 
- You get 50% off on two tops and a bottom with each major floorset. Including managers who have to wear it 40-50 hours a week. A month in your current "look" is faded and stretched out from washing it so much. The flip flops break often and you only get 50% off on those one a year. 
-It's your fault recruits always say no.
review_advice_mgmt: Listen, take care of  and show some respect to store associates. Increase the pay for part timers 1.50 and 2-4 dollars for managers. If time and effort is put into your people, the outcome will be much better. Don't preach consistency when the company itself isn't consistent.

review_title: Fun part-time work but wouldn't do it full-time.
review_pros:
- young atmosphere
- flexible hours
review_cons: - distinct groups (re models/cashiers and the rest).
review_advice_mgmt: - integrate the different groups more.

review_title: A lot of responsibility from day 1
review_pros:
-Laid back yet very productive atmosphere
-Fun, good looking, smart, outgoing coworkers
-Never the same thing every day
-very social work environment 
-awesome benefits 
-discounts and first choice of clothes when they come out of the box
-great exposure to higher-ups when you're in management 
-details for every task so you never really have to question what you're doing or why; there's always an explanation 
-Management requires a Bachelor's, which keeps standards pretty high
review_cons:
-sometimes the younger models/impacters are a little "entitled". The no call/no shows every day are ridiculous! Never in my working years would I ever be a NC/NS, and if I were I would be kissing ass right after! Associates will always come late, not help customers, or not even show up, yet wonder why they only got 5 hours in a week. 
-Having to juggle "mall hours" vs payroll expectations and what corporate gives us 
-Sometimes AAAs can be a little strict, but it's just like any other job with dress expectations (shirt & time or uniform, etc)
-Pay is a little on the low side for everyone, but very livable.
review_advice_mgmt:
-Give us a little more over-time pay
-Please give us a little more flexibility with the music. The "low" is too low, and the "medium" is deafening. It doesn't bother most workers but customers constantly complain
-help us reward our better models and impactors with a few raises.

review_pros:
- You can easily give away and pick up shifts
- Free clothes, the jeans are amazing
- Everyone is extremely helpful
review_cons:
-TOO STICT --- No makeup ( only foundation ), only studs, no nail polish on fingers, but for your toe nails, you're only allowed to wear 3 colors 
- You'll get a write up for no reason
- When you get fired, they NEVER notify you, you find out when you're not able to clock in.

review_pros: Social life within the work environment and ability to click with customers in a friendly and helpful manner.
review_cons: Terrible lower level management. Managers were not qualified,  no understanding their job and responsibilities within the work place.
review_advice_mgmt: Re-evaluate lower level management or institute new guidelines and policies to ease the pressure the unqualified managers go through daily.

review_title: Hard work for little pay and little recognition.
review_pros: Work with cool people. Clothing discount. Quick career advancement if you fit the company image (great looking).
review_cons: As a store manager, you are expected to work until the job is perfect. This could mean putting in 60 hours a week and you don't get paid for over time at all. Even after this your DM and RM will have hardly ever have any positive things to say about you. After being a store manager for 3.5 years I threw in the towel after a senior manager made up a lie about me and told other upper management. This comment was believed as fact and was even put on my review. I was never asked about it and was shocked to see a complete lie factoring into my performance review. I would never work for this company again. The upper management see lower level employees as easily replacable and they do not treat them fairly. You would think that they would realize this attitude is costing the company a lot of money because the turnover rate is outrageous! In addition to this the recruiting and hiring processes are 100% based on looks. If a person is not great looking you can not hire them. The company devotes a majority of their managers times to outside recruing and seeking the best looking people. I personally feel this is a disgusting practice. Turning down highly qualified, smart people because they are not attractive enough does not fit in with my personal morals.

review_pros: Your the boss on a daily basis, and it's your store
review_cons: Corporate rules, you can't make your own

review_pros: Fairly easy work, get to interact with international customers, get to work with attractive coworkers and customers (usually), loud and fun music playing while working, a cool store with very trendy clothing.
review_cons: The pay rate, the scheduling issues (make sure you give your schedule way ahead of time to avoid any chance of not showing up), your skin may dry out (due to lots of Fierce Fragrance being sprayed in the store constantly), short shifts and not many hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Increase hourly rate for employees marginally, so the employees will feel more motivated to work harder and the turnover rate will decrease.

review_pros: - Work with young attractive people, easy entry level job, flexible with hours if you are a part timer and they tend to promote from the inside that's if you match the requirements though, easy going young managers, a great place to network and meet people, Fast promotions, Great place to build your resume.
review_cons: - Horrible Pay all around, HS mentality all the way up to upper management ,unprofessional environment, lack of respect for customers and employees,  there is no pleasing upper management, the more attractive you or the special favors  you do for your DM/RM the faster you move up, more focused on presentation than on the actual customers,  Some manager are ill trained yet they get off since they are cut out copy of the posters, high turnover rate but it's retail, Your workload does not match your schedule yet you are expected to meet those requirements,  not a deep enough discount for work related clothing especially since the look changes quite often.
review_advice_mgmt: They know everyone complains yet they choose to ignore it but I will say it anyways pay more competitively with competing stores and become  more customer focused. A&F and it's stores are not longer the "IT" brands. Time to build strong loyalty from the inside out.

review_pros: Generally easy to work for.
review_cons: Make sure you work at a store with an overnight staff or you'll do a lot of tedious work.

review_pros: You get to work with young, fun people; I worked overnight so most managers were quite lax when it came to mistakes or rules; easy to learn what you need to do (i.e. folds and junk like that); If you didn't like folding clothes before, you learn to like it...maybe not like it BUT it becomes less of a chore since the motions get committed to muscle memory.
review_cons: When it comes to working with high-school aged people or young adults, it can tend to feel a bit like high school; the job at the HQ is a bit monotonous; the music...ugh. It is annoying but it stops between the hours of 7 to 10 and doesn't come back on until 6 or 7 in the morning
review_advice_mgmt: Don't be so strict when it comes to clothing at the HQ (at least in New Albany)...some of us can't afford Abecrombie & Fitch clothing, not to mention that we have no actual customers so we don't have to sell the look. The fact that I when most of the associates are hired under the impression that we dont have to wear A&F clothing is something that makes the job at the HQ much more attractive than working at actual stores.

review_title: OK but there is better out there.
review_pros: Good college job. Meet cool people and everyone usually gets along. Flexible with computer system and the ability to transfer from store to store if you go to college on place and go to school another is a great option.
review_cons: Pointless tasks. Everything is extremely tedious. Dress code, they say you don't "have" to buy the clothes but you basically get yelled at until you do. No chance to get a raise and there really isn't a motivation being stuck at minimum wage. Expect to much for to little. CALL IN SHIFTS.
review_advice_mgmt: Get rid of the pointless tasks. Loosen up the "look policy". Don't hire just anyone that wants a job that looks good but has no common sense. Give an opportunity to earn more than just minimum wage and they would notice a major increase in employee motivation.

review_title: Great for an introduction to running a business and managing others
review_pros: A&F provides great training for entry level associates looking for management and business experience. The culture is also very engaging. The job translates well into other careers. The company has career opportunities abroad.
review_cons: There's a lot of blacked out vacation time. Compensation is low becuase turnover is high. You still feel bad about taking vacation even when during ideal vacation times. Christmas in retial is tough no matter what retailer you work for, A&F is the same. Most of the company's growth and therefore career opportunities are overseas,
review_advice_mgmt: Encourage use of vacation time to deter turn over. Allow some weekends off for Store Managers and General Managers

review_title: Good place to start, but you can't stay very long.
review_pros: High energy, fast- paced, entrepreneurial environment.  Good place to get your foot in the door.
review_cons: Very inexperienced management can lead to uncomfortable and awkward reviews because your manager hasn't learned how to give constructive criticism.  A lot of managers are more concerned with being your friend than an effective manager.
review_advice_mgmt: More training for management on how to effectively lead team.

review_title: Good days and bad days, but the bad days outweigh the good days
review_pros: Very few managers respect the employees and really care about business running smoothly.
review_cons: Favoritism, A lot of the managers text on the sales floor or chat and dance with other models and managers when they need to work. Additionally, there are models who hide out in the break out area so they don't have to work.
review_advice_mgmt: Managers need to be more professional and respectful of employees. Also, employees need better training to make the best customer service possible. Finally, the placement of the store items need to be more organized and size checks need to be conducted better.

review_title: Good for those with busy schedules
review_pros:
-Very flexible scheduling and taking time off
-friendly co-workers and managers
-comfortable and cute clothing to wear
review_cons:
-Pay (minimum wage)
-Usually need to pay for work outfits (which cost more than what you're paid)
-loose structure, little to no strictness (this can be a pro for some but for me i found it irritating that people could freely choose to not show up  or leave early, rules were rarely enforced, and little training or encouragement to improve or grow)
-music (same set of songs on repeat for several months)

review_pros:
fun atmosphere
good colleagues 
easy work
review_cons:
lacks intellectual stimulation
high turn over off staff
review_advice_mgmt: learn people's names

review_pros:
Work experience 
Friendly co workers some of the time
review_cons:
pay is little for work
sometimes under staffed

review_pros: Work with some great people full environment sometimes
review_cons: Low Pay, very micromanaged company stands for vanity
review_advice_mgmt: Pay management more, they are the one's runnning the store

review_pros: Everything is chill. You can get days off whenever you want to as long as you make sure someone else can cover your shift. I worked in the back, so we don't have to be as formal back there.
review_cons: You don't get many hours. Everyone will always ask you for your shift because everyone wants more hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing.

review_title: Great at first (especially if you're in your early twenties), but the novelty wears off very quickly
review_pros:
-extremely flexible hours
-not too difficult to get more shifts if needed (or to get someone to cover yours)
review_cons:
-the pay is not enough!
-customers are rude
-terrible environment to work in
review_advice_mgmt: N/A

review_title: Overall, I have had a pleasant experience working at the Abercrombie home office.
review_pros: Fun environment, excellent benefits, onsite cafeteria and workout facility, good chance for growth. The employees and the overall atmosphere  make it a satisfactory place for employment.
review_cons: You must have a college degree to obtain  the majority of the positions. there are ways to progress without a degree, but it takes a while.

review_title: Hope you like living in the mall!
review_pros: Great people, lots of new faces, really teaches you how to manage a store and a bunch of people. If you can be a store manager at A&F, any other store would be a piece of cake.
review_cons:
It is exhausting - this job physically and mentally drains you. When you're an SM depending on your management situation/store/season, you can average 60 hour workweeks...but you get paid zero overtime. Even when you're not physically AT work you still have to work on the schedule, or field phone calls/txts from associates or other managers, or attend your own management meetings on your DAY OFF which you do not get paid for.
Rarely - maybe 3 times a year - do you get two consecutive days off in a week. Poor work/life balance, and it's very easy to feel defeated because there isn't much constructive criticism. If you can be charming AND good looking, you've got potential. But be prepared to spend your days off too tired to do anything, and every other day at work too busy to even take the "hour"  break you're "required" to take.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay a fair salary. Reward more often to increase positive results. If people don't feel valued, they'll work just hard enough not to get fired. Look at your own turnover rates and DO something about it! Help us help you.

review_title: Perfect Entry-Level Position for Recent College Grad
review_pros:
-They provide all the training you need
-They promote from within
-You get to wear jeans, t-shirts and flip-flops to work everyday
-You get to listen to cool music at work
-You work with young people
-You get a BIG discount on the clothes
review_cons:
-Must be willing to relocate in order to move up
-Must be willing to work most holidays... watch out for Black Friday!!
review_advice_mgmt: Give your employees praise for the good work they do. It will let them know that their hard work is being noticed and encourage them to keep it up / do more.

review_title: Good for part-time during school, but not much else
review_pros:
Discounts at A&F, Hollister Co., and Gilly Hicks
Flexible scheduling
review_cons:
Poor and constantly changing management
Poor layout of the Hollister Co. store; it was cramped, dark, and loud, which led to a lot of stealing
Few hours, which seem to depend on whether you bought the most recent triple A's (clothes) or not
Too many employees

I worked at the Hollister Co. in Augusta during the summer and ended up having to leave for a bit because of school and marching band.  While I was gone, the manager told me she would keep me in the system because I said I'd come back for the holiday season.  When I finally came back, management had changed.  They told me that they had recently cleared the system of summer employees and to apply online.  I went home, attempted to apply for my original job as a floor model, only to find that it said I was still in the system.  As soon as we got that figured out, I finally started working again, but they gave very few hours to me because they didn't know how long I had worked there before.  Around January, my hours dropped significantly.  Apparently, they had put me back in the system as a seasonal employee without letting me know.  I didn't bother reapplying after that.

review_title: Extremely superficial company. You have to look good to be there!
review_pros:
Hanging out with young people.
Discount on clothes.
At least the store is clean and with good beats
review_cons:
Superficial
Low-paying
The same design every year
review_advice_mgmt: Change the design

review_pros: Among the highest starting salaries in the corporate retail industry.
review_cons:
- No diversity, and no efforts to improve
- Frequently claim that "titles are left at the door" and that everyone is treated equally regardless of level of experience - this is not true.
- Diverse opinions are not respected or even acknowledged.
- People in leadership are passive-agressive.
- This company puts a lot of effort into hiring new talent, but does nothing to keep them.
- ZERO work-life balance
review_advice_mgmt:
- Make an effort to keep employees. 
- Diversity is extremely lacking. You need to work on this.

review_title: Relentless, tiresome work with no positive reinforcement.
review_pros: If you have a bachelor's degree and look pretty they will hire you as a manager no doubt.  You will learn managerial skills and tactics.
review_cons: Upper management don't care about you.  Most other managers are aggressive, ignorant and fail to support you.  Work load is substantially high.  Wages are not competitive.  They discriminate.
review_advice_mgmt: There is a reason why A&F has more negative responses from employees and customers than good ones.  Why do you think the company is closing dozens of locations all over the U.S.?  Learn to adjust and welcome paradigm shifts.  If you even know what that means...

review_title: Model and Camera Girl at Hollister Co.
review_pros: The discount on clothes at Hollister Co. and Abercrombie and Fitch. Very flexible with working hours/availability and provides other opportunities to work outside of the store such as recruiting with the managers, working with greeters and participating with insider company competitions etc. Overall it's a great and fun working environment for young staff, meeting new people, plus a tonne of social interaction.
review_cons: Sometimes it's very difficult to get someone to cover your shift if for some reason you can't make it because you're sick or forgot about a previous engagement. So you have to be organized with your time.

review_pros: Great people to work with, make lots of new friends, flexible schedules, short hours (4-5 hours per shift), there is no formality - you can definitely be friends with the managers.
review_cons: deafening, repetitive music.. minimum wage

review_title: Great to work for, lots of fun, but a bit expensive
review_pros:
fun workplace environment
easy work
nice managers
great coworkers
very flexible
review_cons:
expensive uniform (updated seasonally)
low base pay

review_title: Not my favorite place to work
review_pros: flexible hours, good friends, Sometimes a relaxed environment
review_cons: no one cares about you, you'll never get a raise, you'll be written up for ridiculous reasons, bad work conditions, outrageous expectations, not enough employee discount, and you're required to spend a large majority of your paycheck on the uniforms that they change every month or so-- which you are required to buy or they stop giving you hours.. EVEN if you work in the back.
review_advice_mgmt: please pay more attention to workers who work hard and do exceptional work, rather than picking favorites and giving them raises because you are friends with them. Also- read my cons

review_pros: Young environment, decent discount, flexible schedule
review_cons: music, smell, rude managers, quick employee turnover
review_advice_mgmt: lighten up to lessen employee turnover

review_pros: Very flexible hours, easy to pick up shifts or have them covered. Fun people. Cute "uniforms".
review_cons: Low pay. Call in shifts (being "on call") prevent lots of other activities and almost never result in paid hours.

review_pros:
Fun coworkers
if the store isn't busy, relatively lax and chill job
review_cons:
lots of walking, moving stuff
sometimes managers are hard to please/cranky
They always extend hours or call in when you're not scheduled
rude/ungrateful customers
no chance for raises
review_advice_mgmt: be more friendly/considerate

review_pros: great discount and laid back environment...wear jeans and flip-flops to work. Hires from within so a great opportunities for advancement.
review_cons: Somewhat of a dictatorship and employees are not well compensated.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay employees what they are worth.

review_title: Good if you just need a few hours and a little money
review_pros: people you work with and the job is super easy
review_cons: can't get more than 15 hours usually and it's pretty much minimum wage
review_advice_mgmt: hire less people, reward those who actually work and you may see your customer service reviews impr

review_pros: Very relaxed atmosphere, low stress, the staff is very nice and easy to get to know. I love organizing things and so working at Abercrombie as a "model" (aka customer service) was perfect.
review_cons: When I told my manager that I couldn't work at certain times well ahead of time, they still scheduled me during those times and said getting someone to cover my shift was my responsibility. Sometimes customers come in angry and ready to rant and talk about the cons of the company. Just try to stay positive and not take it personally.

review_pros: Fun work environment, and flexible schedule
review_cons: Limited hours, minimum wage job
review_advice_mgmt: Take the time to get to know all your employees and let them know they are valued

review_pros: Young, fun people and nice five-hour shifts
review_cons: monotome, boring tasks, counting minutes. No own iniciatives whatsoever

review_title: good flexibility with schedules and other
review_pros: flexibility with schedule and nice environment
review_cons: very little hours a week unless

review_pros:
easy job
 no hard work
 if you have a college degree you can move up to manager with ease
scholarship giveaways
 very student friendly
 flexible with schedule
review_cons:
no raise
 employee discount is only 30%
review_advice_mgmt: none. you guys are great.

review_title: Working for this company was a waste of time and money
review_pros: It is a reputable brand and I enjoyed the 20 percent discount.
review_cons: Horrible pay and they  make you buy new clothes multiple times a season. Most of your paycheck goes to that.

review_pros: Every day you have the opportunity as a manager to lead and inspire subordinates as well as fellow managers. It's great to work for a company that truly has a standard of excellence! The health and insurance benefits are awesome. The career outlook, if you're willing to move and motivated, is amazing.
review_cons: At times, I feel a little underpaid for what I do. If you have a supervisor that is not doing their job or is inadequate, it is impossible for their boss to truly know. In other words, upper management and home office does not ask for evaluations of managers from people that work for them.
review_advice_mgmt: I think the evaluation system could be a little better as well as compensation for their managers that put so much effort on the ground level to make everything come together.

review_title: Average retailer experience from an employee standpoint.
review_pros: The scheduling is a joke, there are so many people on staff that no one is full time except for the managers which usually are 2-3 people.  THe rest are highschool-college kids who dont mind picking up shifts usually.
review_cons: no real since of employee worth.  Triple A's require employees to spend their minimum wage money on new expesive outfits every few months which is annoying.
review_advice_mgmt: invest in your employees more.  Doing this creates a better work environment and as such a stronger brand.

review_pros: Fun people, learn customer service skills
review_cons: Customers don't care how the merchandise looks
review_advice_mgmt: Be more realistic

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch review from former employee
review_pros: Relaxed environment, friendly staff, good discount on products
review_cons: Not enough hours, very dusty environment
review_advice_mgmt: Don't over hire!

review_title: It's the type of job where if you live with your parents/ or a in college and parents still send you money and stuff.
review_pros:
It's a job to do if you're in high school and still live with parents. Because so, you'll get your paycheck and save up/ have money to say buy a Playstation or money for girlfriend or such :)

Could meet a girlfriend (if you're a boy), or a Boyfriend (if you're a girl).  I had 3 chances ;) 

Choose your hours
review_cons:
You have to buy clothing to model it like $70 a shirt only to get a 30% or 10% discount (i forgot). 

No way in heck should you make it a full time job. Even my store manager drove suckie cars (unless they have significant others to who help them or so).

Minimum wage. 

Not a job you want to make a career out of. Again though it might be ok if you're living with parents and going working full time.

If you wana make it a career, no go to College and study to be an Accountant, of a Business major....don't do that dumb shht of saying "well oh, I'm working my way up the corporation...B.S!! Get your degree then make a career with the Corporation straight with them fresh out of college.
review_advice_mgmt: IT REALLY depends on the type of person they are!! If they are a**holes your shift will be kind of not cool... I had a really Good manager who treats everyone really nice and others who Make people work and they just sit in the Back room not not help out... especially during closing.

review_title: An OK Experience at Abercrombie Outlet
review_pros:
-Meet many different people
-Good High School job
-flexible hours
-Surprisingly a workout
review_cons:
-Underpaid for the work actually done
-"call-ins" become a hassle
-Not many hours according to how many employees
-Checks can be wrong; less pay.
-Not given a check at the end of employment, simply a "card"

review_title: Good part-time job while in college.
review_pros: Getting discounts on the clothing.
review_cons: Having to go by all the rules for proper display and marking of merchandise.

review_pros: The cons I experienced at this job are pretty few. If you like their clothes, they do offer an employee discount.
review_cons: For the most part the pay was awful for what this job entails. There was plenty of drama between all the young employees and an unreliable management.
review_advice_mgmt: Start being more considered about customer serviere than being apart of the  drama and gossiping in the store.

review_pros: Image of being a "Abercrombie Model"
review_cons: Lame boring job of greeting people

review_title: Good job but not enough money
review_pros:
-Fun atmosphere 
-Pretty laid back
-Meet new friends
review_cons:
-Pay is not good
-Strict Dress Code

review_title: Very exhausting, demanding and limitedly rewarding company to work for.
review_pros: There is a 40% Discount. That's about it, other than getting some experience for a better job at a better company.
review_cons: Part time employees can be very unreliable due to the age demographic you are required to hire within. Some dogs just don't want to learn. Your employees are either in high school or in college. Most of the time you are a glorified babysitter. It can be very exhausting. The higher ups are incredibly superficial. They come into your store and tell you who to fire based solely on their appearance. It's pretty shameless.
review_advice_mgmt: Get a clue.

review_pros: Great place to develop a strong high pace customer service skills. The chain of command and a systematic work environment.
review_cons: Lack of understanding to individual from senior management.
review_advice_mgmt: You Move up the ladder pretty quickly. Often a Little to quickly in some cases. Not giving enough time to develop management skills. resulting in a lot of manager leaving the company or getting termed for simple reasons.

review_pros:
Management: simple people who are fun and not such sticklers
Coworkers: simple young adults/teenagers, not always the brightest but most likely attractive
review_cons: Awful job, you're on your feet the entire shift folding clothes. You're more like a robot at times having to re-fold and find where to put this specific one article of clothing
review_advice_mgmt: The company is too robotic and stale and the upper management is too far removed from the actual store

review_pros:
Hands on experience
Young atmosphere
Thriving business
review_cons:
NO work life balance
10- 12 hour days (with no lunch break)
Hard to have an opinion (higher ups do not listen to ideas)
Everything depends on what Jeffries thinks (if he hates it, there is NO chance you will go forward with the idea).

review_pros:
- It is easy to gain hours from shifts associates want to give up, additional hours gained if business was good that day, and associates not showing up.

- Call-Ins. After working for companies that doesn't have a call in system (you call in one hour before your shift and if business is good/it's busy they will ask you to come in), it's comforting to know when business picks up you have the help you need and associates aren't there long after close. 

- Your work atmosphere is fun! As long as your doing something you can have fun doing it. For example, you can run from room to room dancing if you're putting items away. The playlist may not be your favorite music but I guarantee you can't go a shift without to a song. The majority of managers I've had are nice too.

- There is a three month long MIT (Manager in Training) program that helps coach new managers on running the store. 

- More on hours. Like all aspects of life (including work) favorites are played. If you work hard or are "liked" by managers you will get more hours. If I was running a store I would like to schedule the people who are constantly moving and doing something rather the ones who stand around and chit chat. I'd also like to schedule those who are pleasant to work with. Being nice and friendly doesn't hurt :)
review_cons: - Work/Life Balance is rough

review_pros: Up beat and lively. Training covers all areas that will be met in the working environment. Everyone is friendly and they cater to their demographic very well.
review_cons: Monotonous. The tasks and jobs that the majority are doing seem to get in the way of shoppers rather than offering an attentive service which is what they feel like they are doing.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more in touch with what the clients want and less concerned with image

review_pros: Learned to be Organized, work fast
review_cons: No social life, company is not caring
review_advice_mgmt: Treat empolyees better

review_pros: able to dictate your availability whenever you wanted, uptight managers,
review_cons: overstaffed, strict look policy, managers play favorites when clearly the store would fall apart without the impacters, no raises unless you are a kiss up,

review_pros: I got hands on experience organizing inventory and learning how the company deals with returns and shipments of new inventory.
review_cons: Very strict dress code and image the company is trying to build.  Training wasn't very helpful in learning the new job.
review_advice_mgmt: Develop more hands on training with new employees and better prepare them for their shifts.  Also hire less employees so that there's more of a personal relationship between management and the rest of the team.

review_pros:
Building great relationships
Tons of hands on experience
Great learning experience
review_cons:
Inconsistent communication 
Inefficient communication
Character flaws
review_advice_mgmt: Develop tough skin, immediately

review_pros: Cool people, mostly laidback, good managers at my location. Atmoshphere was laidback and as long as work got done than everyone was happy
review_cons: They hire so many people so you are not able to work alot, only 10-15 hours at most if your lucky. Usually only 6-10. Also refolding clothes after a mom rummages through a whole pile
review_advice_mgmt: Listen to the managers at the store more

review_title: Chill, good for a part-time job but has it's drawbacks that you must learn to deal with
review_pros: Lots of interesting people that will be around your age if you're a college aged student.  Most of the time they will be cool with you, it definitely helps if you're attractive and outgoing.  I've definitely made a lot of friends working here, and at least my store being the smallest tier it is really laid back and if you are on the managers good side you can pretty much get away with anything minus stealing from the store.
review_cons:
The pay is awful, and raises only happen like once a year and in my experience they weren't really given to ones who deserved it.  It seems they favor models over impact for raises even though impact definitely does much more work.  Girls usually non-stop talk/gossip which should be expected but just be careful of what you do when it comes to going out, meeting up, or doing anything outside of work with co-workers especially those of the other sex.

I'm about to blow up the terrible pay also:

I know of no store manager within my region that gets paid more than $40k annually.  Assistant managers get paid about $28k, while head store managers seem to make about $35k.  Was offered a position as a manager but after I had talked to mine I realized it was totally not worth the hassle and stress.  Management positions within actual stores seem to be the worst positions you can work in.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop giving regional positions to unqualified personnel.  My DM went to school for fashion or some garbage, and thus is terrible at actually managing the people that work under her.  She has little to no people skills and is viewed as extremely fake because she doesn't know how to manage people, ends up criticizing everyone's work while never explaining why what they did was wrong, the importance of why that needed to be done right and generally treats everyone below her as a stepping stone for her performance to move further up within corporate.  Actually, it seems that is a general procedure of corporate: taking advantage of everyone within the retail side to maximize profits and your employees on this side notice that and genuinely feel used, and disenfranchised because of it.

review_pros:
-You work alongside several attractive, nice people
-friendships, casual romances
-Managers are really nice at least at my location
-lots of things to do: cash wrap, greet, fold clothes, fitting rooms
-no competition among co-workers because everyone is paid the same
-lots of minorities in my store
review_cons:
-horrible discount
-horrible pay
-if a manager doesn't like you (for mostly arbitrary reasons), you can have a horrible experience
-the managers adamantly seek attractive recruits which is awkward...
-sometimes you do the same thing forever without being switched (i.e. greeting your entire shift-4hrs)
-only 3 people get raises each year and they are EXTREMELY low (model, impacter, manager). 
-they hire so many people that you can't really work as much as you'd like unless you're extremely attractive (model) or extremely efficient/independent (impacter)

review_title: The hours can sometimes be long if you are there to work can can learn a lot about retail
review_pros: Working with great people and learning a lot about management
review_cons: Sometime you work late hours  which affects your work life balance

review_pros:
Good discounts!
People are great!
Flexible with hours!
Managers are nice!
review_cons:
Minimum Wage
Standing for hours straight at a time

review_pros: Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The nature of the culture means that you will always be very well-supported as anyone is more than happy to stop and help you out.
review_cons: It might not be seen as a negative but you really have to buy in to the way the company operates in order to be successful. There is just no room to be negative or cynical and still succeed.

review_title: High stress work environment, excellent benefits however
review_pros: The company has excellent benefits and decent compensation.
review_cons: At times it can feel a little like being in high school. Poor work/life  balance.

review_title: Do not work here unless you are absolutly desperate for a job. Worst experience ever. DISCRIMINATORY.
review_pros: Looks good on a resume, managerial experience helped me get my current corporate job.
review_cons: Poor work life balance, office politics and management play favorites, IMAGE BASED company (I was told I needed to lose ten pounds oh and i'm a size 6...). No room for growth, unprofessional work environment. Company is going down fast, stores closing, lack of creative and corporate growth. In order to succeed at this company you have to recruit associates based 100% upon their appearances. Associates that are not as attractive are encouraged to be members of the Impact Team this team does most of it's work in the back stock room. The company is not doing well domestically however they are doing well internationally. Lots of empty promises, don't believe anything upper management tells you, their only goal is to keep you at the store level, promises of home offices and promotions are a joke.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop playing office politics and favorites. Be professional, this is not high school it is suppose to be a work environment. Promote staff that deserves it instead of keeping them in stores because you are too lazy and complacent to bring in new management. Stop lying to your staff about things you plan on doing when in fact you have no intentions of doing it. Oh and of course stop judging people based on their appearances.

review_pros: overall, really great employees and great benefits
review_cons: treat employees like cattle and pay them far less than they are worth. non-salaried managers get paid half-time for over-time in most states.

review_pros: Lovely campus, casual dress code. It feels more like a college campus than anything. The compensation and benefits are substantial, especially as a starter job, but honestly aren't enough for the BS they ask of you. I have a great rapport with my coworkers, but upper level management is a joke. If you can stand the place and fake your way long enough, you move up fairly quickly.
review_cons: Very low work/life balance, zero to none creative freedom, ridiculous office politics and a "big brother" type HR department. You feel as if every move is being scrutinized, which is a joke considering how asinine the company has become in recent years. They BLAST the god-awful soundtrack in work spaces, and you hear the same 30 songs, multiple times, all day, every day, for months on end. You are required to buy the clothes, and look and act the part of an Abercrombie employee (which is to say, young, attractive, popular, etc). You are not allowed to wear black or purple, and the CEO is honestly delusional. The company will spend itself to death if it doesn't kick him out soon and replace him with someone with a fresher vision. The chain of command is inefficient- too many non-creatives have a say in the finished product and doesn't allow for any creative growth. Literally every season looks the exact same as the last. They require you to sign a 3 year contract upon being hired that, if you leave prior, kills you with penalty fees (paying back something like $9000 in bonuses and relocation costs).
review_advice_mgmt: Ditch the CEO, allow the departments to work independently of each other.

review_title: Working as a part-time impact and floor model
review_pros:
Got lots of useful customer service experience
fun environment 
good discounts
review_cons:
Not pushed to try to improve or move up in the company
Shifts were sporadic and not many hours were available because of too many floor employees
review_advice_mgmt:
Add incentives to help employees try harder and want to advance in the company
Work on keeping a few people for more than a few months so that they can be familiar with the way the company works and even get used to regulars. The more they know about the company the more helpful they will be and better business will be.

review_title: I got the job while I was still in high school but I didn't realize I would be working in one.
review_pros: You get to wear the clothes! That's a bonus. They say you don't have to wear their clothes but you can't work without them. It's the uniform, however, you do get 50% off the uniform other than that it's just 30% at A&F and 20% at Hollister. Another pro is that the playlist they have on loop isn't that bad to listen to. Also - at the beginning of 2013, they gave every associate a chance to get 7 full price items for 50% off. That's a plus.
review_cons: I had a few friends that worked there, but other than that, the people are unbearable. The management is horrible. Any model on the sales floor could run that place better than some managers. The upper managers (district, regional) are sharks. Customers aren't that great either. It's just like high school.
review_advice_mgmt: Act like your managers and not high schoolers. This is my job. My life does not revolve around a job that gives me less than 20 hours a week.

review_pros: learn many aspects about running a business
review_cons: late hours around holidays. No traveling or vacation during holidays as well.

review_pros: 10% discount on gift cards and certain non sale clothes. flexible hours and dress is casual, not much effort required
review_cons: loud music playing all the time, co-workers not so intelligent. lots of times you will be required to do work that will be undone in 10 seconds by an unaware customer. It is similar to cleaning up something that is constantly getting messed up
review_advice_mgmt: they need to learn how to listen and to optimize themselves better

review_title: great experience for a high school job
review_pros: young atmosphere and close with many employees
review_cons: some unprofessional behavior, and hectic atmosphere

review_pros: Co - workers are the largest pro, fun people to work with make all the difference. Easily make friends with something in common
review_cons: People don't stay very long, especially managers. You build a relationship with your managers only to see them leave. Hours, tough to get large amounts.

review_pros: Low-key, good discount, mostly friendly atmosphere, attained experience in a wide variety of tasks, always on the schedule for as many day of the week I requested.
review_cons: The managers didn't always handle stress well, there was some discrimination involved, training wasn't adequate - I basically just got a tour but wasn't taught how to properly fold clothes or how to handle certain types of customers. Learn as you go.
review_advice_mgmt: Ease-up.

review_pros: good environment, easy job, had fun
review_cons: too dark, awful when you went into work with a headache, boring at times.
review_advice_mgmt: none, they did the best with what they had

review_pros:
A lot of responsibility in an entry level career. 
Discount is good for management
Flexible Scheduling
review_cons:
Stressful atmosphere
rude upper management
unprofessional in every way
review_advice_mgmt: Need to be more aware of hiring and firing practices, treat your associates like human beings, stop firing people who are good and keeping people who suck

review_title: Great company with potential if they would only INVEST in their talented employees.
review_pros:
A very casual, upbeat atmosphere.  You can wear jeans and converse shoes everyday to work.  
Company has a great image and has a firm grasp on their point of view.  A great company to grow with if they allow you to do so.  Opportunities to travel globally and to work at Home Office are available.
review_cons: No growth potential if you don't have your bachelors degree.  Seriously, in my opinion,  you do NOT need a degree to succeed in this industry.  I worked for 5 years as a Brand Rep/Model/Stock Manager in which I fully supported the store, and on occasion surrounding store's, visual standards and truly had high standards for my work.  My DM and SM supported me but without a bachelors degree there is nowhere to advance.
review_advice_mgmt: Allow talented associates to grow with the company whether or not they have a bachelors degree.  Start hiring employees based on their previous work experience.  I have witnessed too many awful management hires working for A&F who have no clue what they are doing nor do they care for their career.  Lastly,  PLEASE ELEVATE YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE.  SERIOUSLY.

review_pros: flexible schedule, upbeat co-worker, nice environment, great employee discount. cash bonus during holiday season.
