review_cons: The store is  busy during holidays which means more hours
review_advice_mgmt: Take notice of the employees who are working vs. goofing around

review_title: A very laid back job, the people you work with are mostly very laid back
review_pros:
Very flexible hours! I can call and say I'll be an hour late to work at short notice and you will only have to stay an hour later. 
30% and 50% off discounts
Not a comision based company.
review_cons:
$7.25 an hour
Most of your shift is folding.
You might have to work on holidays
If you work in the morning you are expected to clean a large store by yourself.

review_pros:
Nice and young people 
Not really busy (kids store)
review_cons: Too many employees = less hours

review_pros: Young People, Fun Job, Easy Tasks
review_cons:
Sometimes dumb tasks
Low Pay
Sucky Hours At Times
review_advice_mgmt: Sometimes hard to get hours, be fair with everyone!

review_pros: The hiring process was pretty easy, not hard work at all.
review_cons: Barely get any hours and a lot of favoritism.

review_title: make one bad move and youre gone
review_pros:
- loved the people I worked with
- discount
-great growth within the company.
review_cons: I was with the company for years and because of favoritism and unprofessionalism left.  worst dm ever.  long stressful hours, terrible salary and countless times I was required to go in on my day off.  no work life balance...that's laughable to even think that's an option with A&F.
review_advice_mgmt: careful who you hire as a District manager cause some are beyond incompetent.

review_pros: long term opportunities available, fun people to work with, easy to transfer locations, high confidence position, a diverse workplace
review_cons: not enough hours (less than 15 per week usually), inconsistent times to report to work, inflexibility in management due to corporate restrictions, low pay and expensive mandatory wardrobe.
review_advice_mgmt: Train Impact members to do more customer service and models to be able to manage the inventory.

review_pros: At A&F you meet some of the best people who could potentially be life time friends. You also get experience with retail really easily. This job has gave me alot of confidence & it also teaches you how to speak to people, even people from another country. Another pro for working for this company is as soon as you get a degree they immediately want to promote you into a Manager In Training position. This job may positively help you start an amazing retail career.
review_cons: Some downsides is definitely the constant competition with your managers. Some of the managers are just down right disgusting. If you do their job better than them they will automatically hate you. Also when you're new in our store they completely make you feel un welcomed. I luckily was blessed enough to have been recruited therefore they all made me feel welcomed because they wanted me to work for them. Also whats annoying is the walk out procedure. Depending on the manager  you will feel like its a bother to follow companies policies.
review_advice_mgmt: I feel like you guys should be more aware. If there are constant complaints about a certain manage r I think you should look into it or even try to find someone new. A&F is suppose to be an outgoing fun environment. We can't have fun if a manager is just disgusting. We all want to be around people with good vibes at all times! And also low down our music priority. If the customers are complaining thats bad customer service.

review_title: Not for those with self respect
review_pros:
-wear jeans to work
-talk about looks all day
-sleep in if you're closing
-potential for promotions (if you can survive 3 years of working in a mall and being treated like your life is meaningless)
review_cons:
-you conribute $$ towards clothes that only high schoolers should wear
-the training in the MIT binder isn't followed whatsoever
-your supervisor probably was promoted based on no skills/running a retail store or leadership
-you always work weekends if you aren't the SM
-a friend of mine still works for the store and says her pay is lower than it was a year ago
review_advice_mgmt: Track assistant managers more thoroughly than through SMs and DMs.  Your turnover is so high because the SMs and DMs have no leadership/management skills.  Just because they take phone calls all day doesn't mean they know what's going on in their stores.

review_pros: The staff at all of the stores that I worked at was very friendly and work was always fun because the people who worked there were great.
review_cons: It can be a little bit loud and dark at times, and just like in any retail position the holiday season or during big sales can be stressful.

review_title: I have a positive experience at A&F. Even though it is not a difficult job I still learned a lot.
review_pros: Nice environment and people, mostly young, energetic and friendly.
review_cons: Lack of hours and music is too loud. You have to scream to the customers to be heard.

review_pros:
easy to give/get shifts through a fb group page
very flexible as long as you make preparations
short 5 hour shifts are pretty common if you don't like normal 7-8 hour ones
review_cons:
environment is hectic (dark, loud, smelly)
may not get scheduled for a long time due to too much coverage or something
- this leads to having to get shifts from other employees through fb
uniform is annoying
review_advice_mgmt: Don't hire as many workers if you have too many

review_pros: The staff is fun and mostly good looking people which is a plus if you are single. Most of the tasks on the job are very easy.
review_cons: Loud music, obnoxious cologne smell. Nagging managers. Busy hours. Repetitive folding after close. Have to constantly be doing something even if there isn't anything left to do.
review_advice_mgmt: make standing at the front of the store not be so annoying

review_pros: Awesome challenge to master customer service skills and resilience.
review_cons: Schedule and expectation demands unreasonable. Mostly due to the lack of managers on staff.
review_advice_mgmt: Better Human Resources and bite out the fluffy facade of "diversity and great people" ... First get people in that can support the company, then weed out to fit the company's ridiculous expectations. That is why nobody stays.

review_pros:
Benefits
Associates Discount 
Learning experience
review_cons:
Stressful during holiday seasons
Under staff most of the time
Company gave little resources due to budget cut 
Upper management visits with comments on tedious details
review_advice_mgmt: Upper management only promote good looking and outgoing person

review_title: Abercrombie only cares about itself, not the people that make it work.
review_pros: The pay is worth it at first.
review_cons:
No work/life balance. 
No advancement.
Upper Management.

review_title: Great summer job but try to move on after that
review_pros: Fun work environment, friendly coworkers, always busy, discounts on clothes
review_cons: The music loop gets old very fast, folding clothes on a daily basis is extremely boring and some of the greetings you're forced to say can be awkward
review_advice_mgmt: Get rid of call-in shifts, give employees an equal number of shifts

review_title: Work with great people, but company is too superficial
review_pros: I've met a lot of my best friends through working with the company. Pretty good discount. Easy job to move up if you do well and you are good looking. (no joke). International opportunities.
review_cons: Required to judge people. Only hire good looking people even if they would be a great worker. Overworked and underpaid. Too many customers complain about music/smell/marketing.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay us more!!! we work hard.

review_title: PT Impact Team Member at A&F
review_pros: 30% off of clothes. You can change your schedule at any time. You have over 60+ coworkers, so it's not difficult finding someone to cover your shift last minute or ahead of time. The stockroom (where you spend most of your time) is like a hangout spot.  You'll have at least two cool managers. Coworkers are pretty nice for the most part, you'll always leave the store with a few new friends.
review_cons: Short breaks. Workload and pay rate don't match. Your bag must be checked by management before you leave. No jewelry. Pretty strict on looks (i.e. no facial hair; hairstyles: no braids, tight ponytails, etc.) Girls can only wear polish if it's red, pink, clear or nude. Go-backs.

review_pros: Great time  with co workers
review_cons: Bad managers, most of them not smart at all
review_advice_mgmt: don't be bad managers

review_pros: Great Co workers , Very easy work , Extremely flexible hours, Great For students
review_cons: Low pay, poor management, no room for advancement
review_advice_mgmt: Keep up the good work

review_pros: The atmosphere was great, both the new and old offices, and people make it fun.
review_cons: music during work, vendor treatment, executive leadership
review_advice_mgmt: keep good people, don't toss away over age

review_title: A terrible company to work for.
review_pros: The people you meet. The benefits
review_cons: The pay. The hours. Terrible management.
review_advice_mgmt: Promote people who actually know what they're doing.

review_title: Overall, pretty enjoyable if you like the brands.
review_pros: Great experience, good benefits, nice discount.
review_cons: Fake people especially higher management. You need to be great looking to get promoted.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more honest with people.

review_title: a place for a high school part-time
review_pros: It was a flexible and casual work place. Managers are usually strict enough but not too strict so as to make the experience too stringent for a part-time job. Co-workers can be a lot of fun but this is dependent on the store.
review_cons: Managers can be too lax. Constant rotation or manager turnover, so employees don't feel that their job is very stable or constantly don't feel comfortable with working with managers.

review_title: Very annoying job, run back and forth for no reason, pass.
review_pros: Good looking co-workers, flexible shifts.
review_cons: Annoying managers, strict dress code,amongst other things

review_pros:
Flexible hours
A lot of employees, easy to find coverage
review_cons:
Horrible company to work for - make you wear the clothes even though the employee handbook says that that isn't required
make minimum wage - lower than every other store in the mall
folding is more important than customer service

review_pros: You get to have fun while being a Model at Abercormbie & FItch. If you're highly energetic and lively you can dance to the music and help serve the customers with great customer service.
review_cons: The hours are not always the best, and sometimes you have to stay later to cover shifts for people who do not show up.

review_pros: It is good experience for retail and has opportunity if you want to be a model and what not.  Good high school job and good place to work for a time being.
review_cons: You do the ame stuff and deal with the same things everyday on a daily basis so it is difficult to really do more.

review_pros: Great team environment. You'll have an enjoyable experience if you love the brand and the clothes. They ask pretty easy questions during the interview, and you receive decent discounts on apparel.
review_cons: Pretty simple tasks, really no challenges or opportunities to move up. It's hard to stick around when you don't believe in the company. The company's look policy is ridiculous, I once was forced to wash my face because my mascara made me look too "made up."

review_title: Great people to work for, little pay and awful upper management
review_pros:
Great young outgoing staff and managers
Great work environment
review_cons:
Not paid enough compared to all the other retailers in the mall
Upper management not productive and no communication
Wouldn't hire qualified employees because of their looks

review_title: Great very fun environment  to be in
review_pros: Friendly environment, very enthusiastic and comfortable
review_cons: too high of expectation at times

review_pros: If you shop there, you get pretty good discounts. Good hours. Great for students. A lot of added shifts.
review_cons: Basic pay, bad management, really boring on slow days, loud music is very annoying, and the folding and phrases can be so repetitive.

review_pros: can be a pretty fun easy job and you do meet a lot of great people.  Pay is competitive.  Transfering between stores is very painless and easy.
review_cons: First off google "abercrombie lawsuits". The work environment is terrible.  Loud music makes communication w customers and employees impossible, super dark "lighting" to which you have to strain your eyes to see size stickers, tags, count money, etc.  Have to wear flip flops with no support.  Same 5 songs are played over and over and over for months at a time.  Companies morals and values are extremely low as well.  Career opportunities in the united states are very limited do to all the stores being shut down.  If you like lining up size stickers and using boards and spending 3 hours to make every clothing stack look perfect just to watch a customer 3 seconds later destroy it you'll like this job.  Normal retailers get out at 930 if store closes at 9 A&F you'll get out at 11pm.  The less attractive you are the less hours you'll get. Call in shifts are sweet too.

review_pros: people who work there, flexibility in schedule, discount, pretty easy job
review_cons: HOURS- they hire too many people and give too little hours
review_advice_mgmt: give more hours! more associates= better customer service= less shrinks!

review_pros:
-Good employees and managers
-Good learning experience for a first time manager
review_cons:
-Severely underpaid
-Poor work-like balance 
-Shallow company values
-high turnover for managers
review_advice_mgmt:
-To be honest to employees
-Compensate managers better to reduce high turnover rates

review_title: Hired, but rarely put on, and little work.
review_pros: The people I worked with were really great! And if you love abercrombie you get a 30% off discount on all full price stores and frequently get 50% new items.
review_cons: The store I worked in mainly had me on 'Call-In' but I would call in and they wouldn't need me, then when I did go in there was little to do except wander and refold folded clothes. You would think that they wouldn't need more employees with how little I was worked, I did have a large availability range, but they hired new people every week. Also they are very off on their sizing it is ridiculous! Also the daily earnings goals were always a couple thousand below last year's income.
review_advice_mgmt: Should look at each stores individual need and become more efficient and better utilize employees, if you had the number you needed and used them to what they ask you could drastically cut unneeded expenses and boost your rating.

review_pros:
Fun environment
Schedule
Management without experience
Young staff
review_cons:
Pay
Lack of advancement
High school gossip
review_advice_mgmt: Out of touch

review_title: Good when you don't need to rely on money.
review_pros: Flexible schedule, not held accountable for too much.
review_cons: Terrible managing, treated terrible by management and customers automatically by reputation. Severely damages future opportunity by which other employers discredit your experience because they don't take A&F seriously.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire based on actual intelligence, not just by having a degree.

review_title: They need to need treat their employees like dirt
review_pros: I really don't think there were any pros besides my co workers and the half naked guys downstairs. They were hot hot hot hot!
review_cons: Terrible atmosphere of techno music and overly sprayed cologne if that's your thing.

review_pros: Working for Abercrombie & Fitch was great for a first job. The managers were lenient, coworkers fun & friendly, and was perfect for high school or college students.
review_cons: Minimum wage, no raises, lack of hours, the "image" policy was a bit extreme. We weren't allowed to have painted fingernails, make-up, or jewerly.

review_title: Good for resume, bad for work-life balance
review_pros:
- great salaries
- great learning experience
- fun, young atmosphere
review_cons:
- no work-life balance, especially holiday months
- no management training
- review process could be bettered

review_title: It's ok most of the times
review_pros:
- very flexible hours
- friendly co-workers, most managers are very nice
- relatively easy work that require no skill set, excellent for a first job
- easy to get hired, and I don't think they expect a lot from you
review_cons:
- sometimes the managers can be mean (expect to clean the men's toilet if you get on the manager's bad side, and no one will be allowed to help you :P just kidding, it doesn't happen often but it did happen once)
- the store gets very busy sometimes, and wearing slippers when others are wearing boots isn't all that advantageous if you don't want to get stepped on
- occasionally rude customers
- when the rooms that have all the sales article gets too busy, there's no way to tell which clothing article is on sale
review_advice_mgmt:
- allow the stores to adjust their music volume. I've heard a lot of complaints about the music being too loud, but apparently the only button there is on/off
- make bigger sizes, a lot of our customers get angry due to the sizes

review_pros: Flexibility. You get to set your own availability and based on it you get scheduled. A fun place to work in. 30% discount and 20% in hollister.
review_cons: Its more like a side job. Not a job to rely on entirely because you dibt get guaranteed hours. Get paid every other week.

review_title: The A&F Home Office is a perfect place to start a career!
review_pros:
- working with brilliant associates and very talented management

- a lot of latitude and trust in the responsibilities given to associates (fun/cool opportunities)

- the campus is state of the art.  beautiful.  

- team environment

- great PTO structure if you are salary... especially if you are there 5+ years!

- managers who invest in developing you professionally

- recognized for my contributions and promoted multiple times
review_cons: While I heard associates grumble about working too much, I think that is an individual's decision to leave/not leave at the end of the work day.  I never had a manager approach me and tell me that I needed to stay later...
review_advice_mgmt: Kudos for making a fantastic work environment and handling the growth gracefully!

review_pros:
Flexible working hours and a laid back environment is good
Plus the discount of the clothes isn't bad
review_cons: The breaks and shifts can be Abit frustrating, I.e if you have a shift from 12-5 in this time scale then You probably aren't gonna be eating lunch.  But other than that great place to work
review_advice_mgmt: Longer shifts and longer breaks

review_pros:
Flexible Scheduling, Casual Dress, Fun Atmosphere, Decent Music.

For me, it was a great college job, because it's a super social job, which allowed me to work a ton, and not feel like I was missing out on a social life.
review_cons: Terrible pay.  Like....god awful.  And higher level management is not friendly at all.  They try to be scary in fact.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay all your people better, and treat your managers better.

review_pros: cool environment, worked at mall
review_cons: they expect you to wear their clothing which is pretty pricey, even after the discounts, part time, little pay

review_title: A terrible job I did for a summer.
review_pros: I got paid a little. There weren't many upsides.  It was a pleasant temperature to work inside during the summer.
review_cons: I was part time which could at best be described as sporadic. Worked 4 hours one week and none for two weeks and the 20 the last week in the month.  They have a call in system to see if you are working which makes it impossible to plan things around.  Cologne sprays down from the ceiling while you're working.  You are required to wear their clothes (including flip flops) and your discount isn't that great.  They pay minimum wage and no incentives to do better. Overall a terrible place to work.

review_pros: Get to work with some great people.
review_cons: Abercrombie idolizes looks. They hire and fire people based on how attractive they are! The company will put blame on anyone to get out of trouble. It's an absurdly strict, condescending, shallow company to work for.
review_advice_mgmt: Value  your employees skills and hard work! Not their looks! Stop hiring clueless people from outside the company and promote from within.

review_title: Working at Abercrombie and Fitch was unpleasant with low pay and long hours
review_pros:
-Some managers are very disciplined and can teach you on sight all the different jobs necessary as an impacter or model. 
-You get experience on how to interact with customers as well as understand the organizational details that go into sorting shipments and storing them.
-You can quit any time you want.
review_cons:
The store is dark and cold, the music is loud and obnoxiously repeats every 15 minutes. 
There are automatic perfume dispensers that make the whole store smell intoxicating with heavy perfume
The pay is hourly minimal wage with no benefits and there is no corporate philosophy/goal/drive to give one the incentive to work longer and harder.
review_advice_mgmt:
Respect the customers as well as the employees 
Increase the wage or offer over time compensation as an incentive 
Play music from the radio instead of from a short 15 minute track that is annoying to both employees and customers
Turn up the lights in the store more and decrease the amount of perfume used throughout the store
Ingrain upon the employees corporate values that will give them more desire to work harder

review_title: It's loud, smelly, the music isn't great, you get paid dirt cheap.
review_pros: You don't have to where a suit and tie every day.
review_cons: It's loud, smelly, the music isn't great, you get paid dirt cheap. Pretty sure the people in corporate are racist. Just my observation, but you can see it in there ads. You cannot ever advance unless you have a 4 year degree, meaning you cannot become a manager unless you have a bachelors. Seriously?! An obvious menuvour to keep people from earning more than 8 dollars an hour.
review_advice_mgmt: Need stronger leaders. Not all of them are bad at the job, just some.

review_title: This company is only appropriate for teenagers
review_pros: Attractive co-workers, that's about it.
review_cons: Pretty much everything else. Low pay, bad hours, disorganized leadership, management unable to setup schedules ahead of time often leading to conflicting hours with any other jobs you might have or other parts of your life, not assigned enough hours to justify working there. I was hardly given more than 1 or 2 shifts at the most in the first 4 months of working there and even afterwards it was never even close to averaging what a part-time job should expect. Basically, you won't make a lot of money there at all. The title pretty much sums it all, you should only work here if you're a teenager.
review_advice_mgmt: change everything

review_title: Fun in the beginning, downhill from there.
review_pros: Working at A&F is a fun and relatively easy job. Everyone is within the same age range so you meet some awesome and outgoing people. Hours are decent as long as you are a hard worker. (They give hours based on performance). The discount is okay, but the clothes are still pretty expensive nonetheless (5 full-priced items @ 50% off each season, 30% off all other times).
review_cons: Part-time employees are hired based primarily on looks and personality. I've worked as both a model and impacter and models definitely have it easier. Impacters have more responsibilities and at times, model work is put on the impacters. In my experience, most managers are taught to delegate tasks but not to actually contribute; rather, they complete paperwork, watch over the sales floor and their employees, and often tell them to work faster or that they are not doing their job correctly.
review_advice_mgmt: Attention to detail is important, but micromanagement can hinder performance.

review_title: Great for management experience..but not a long term career
review_pros:
*only requirement for management position is a Bachelors degree
*the staff is usually fun and friendly
*company only promotes from within
*global expansion opportunities
*great insurance (covers domestic partners)
review_cons:
*long hours once you complete the management training program
*low compensation compared to other retail companies
*(sometimes) ridiculous job requirements
*questionable hiring practices for part time positions
*micromanagement from higher ups and HO

review_pros:
Working with fun and lively people

50% discount on "uniforms" (AAA's)

Laid- back environment 

EVERYONE IS TREATED EQUALLY- the old rumor that A & F only hired "hot" american people has long been thrown out the window. I have assisted in interviews and everyone is given a fair chance regardless of ethnicity, gender, or religion. And as a matter of fact, A & F is the most diverse place i have ever worked in.
review_cons:
Managers switch out every few months which makes it hard to have anything "set in stone" for long

You have to purchase clothes (AAA's) every few months, and clothes there are not cheap although you receive a 50% discount on 3 top, 2 bottoms, and 1 pair of shoes

Constantly hiring new people and giving them more hours and the older employees- this was why i quit. 

Only receive 30% discount on items that aren't part of AAA's

They only way to move up in pay is if you have a degree (and become a manager) or if you literally work 24/7

review_title: Awful management structure. All decisions made through a computer.
review_pros: Ability to choose when to work and when to take time off
review_cons: Very repetitive work, no change in tasks during the day. Very hard to get work. Company structure is poor. All decisions controlled through computer.

review_pros: let me know if you find one
review_cons: everything, pay, uniform, management. just stay away from this store when it come to working
review_advice_mgmt: its time for a new makeover

review_pros: It's a job. Flexible hours are a plus, and the basic experience of working in retail is invaluable. A very laid back job.
review_cons: Minimum wage, low hours, no benefits, employees and sometimes managers fraternize, store clothing is strongly suggested to be worn, if not required.
review_advice_mgmt: Provide your best employees with opportunities to advance, even without a bachelors degree. Many capable adults under the age of 21 are suited to assistant or even store management much more so than some of the people I have seen with a bachelor's degree.

review_title: The job is grueling, and the employees are underpaid.
review_pros: The employees are great people to work with. I continued my relationships with them after quitting.
review_cons: The shifts are much longer than 8 hours. Your schedule changes constantly throughout the week, making it extremely hard to know how to plan activities after work. You are paid nothing, but worked to the bone. They force you to buy new clothing from the store constantly, and those individuals who do not keep up with the trends are not scheduled for shifts.
review_advice_mgmt: Respect the employees by lessening the workload and increasing the pay.

review_pros: Fun environment for college age people seeking part-time employment. You will meet a lot of people with similar interests. Also, will receive a great discount on their clothes
review_cons: The pay is minimum wage and you will get minimal hours per week. Must abide by a very strict dress code which is basically only wearing their brand of clothes.

review_pros: The discount on clothing was nice, but other than that there was hardly any job satisfaction.
review_cons: You will constantly be picking up shifts, you cannot think straight with how loud the music was, and you MUST wear their jeans. Their "colors" dictated your outfit and if you didn't wear them you'd be in trouble. They obviously hired people based on looks. My job was to fold clothes. When I was done folding clothes, I actually had to unfold them and refold it just to look busy.
review_advice_mgmt: Work for a different company, because nobody could honestly be happy working in one of these retail stores.

review_pros: Although i only worked for six months, I have to say this company is a lot better than I thought. Co workers are cool, and work hours are very flexible.
review_cons: Nasty customers, and can get boring

review_title: Had Fun working there. Everyday was a great day with an aesome staff
review_pros: great discount for each season
review_cons: not many hours were given out
review_advice_mgmt: lissen to your staff. they have some great ideas

review_title: A fun, laid back place to work
review_pros: The people are great, both managers and associates are super friendly and great to work with. When I first started I felt really welcomed and everyone seemed more than happy to help me out when I needed it. The discount is also really good, you get 50% off of five items every season and the rest of the time you get 30% off. The work isn't hard, usually doesn't get too stressful, and once you get used to standing on your feet for hours on end time passes pretty quickly and it can even be enjoyable and fun at times. It's a really laid back place to work (where else can you wear denim shorts and flip flops to work everyday?) and they are really flexible with scheduling. If you're in school or have other commitments A&F is a great company to work for because it's super easy to change your availability and also give away/trade shifts with other models.
review_cons:
The environment isn't the greatest to be working in for long hours. It reeks of cologne and the music is really loud (during the first week I left every shift with a headache). You do get used to it to a point where you can tune out the music and don't really notice the cologne, but it's still not the most 
enjoyable environment to be in. 
Also, the store can get insanely busy sometimes (I've seen the line to cash almost reach the front door) and that means dealing with a lot of angry customers. It gets really frustrating sometimes, and while most of the managers are great, I have had a few managers who seemed really bad at managing the store properly when it got too busy and it almost seemed like they didn't care. Those particular managers have actually left the store by now but I do still get complaints quite often about the lines and crowdedness.
review_advice_mgmt: I don't know what the root of the problem is, whether the store is constantly understaffed or the layout of the store is just poor and doesn't allow for proper traffic flow, but the store almost always seems way too crowded and the lines can be ridiculous. I know people who won't shop there just because they don't have the patience to deal with the long lines. I would say that's the worst part of the job for those of us working on the floor because we constantly have to deal with angry customers complaining about things we truly have no control over.

review_pros: Good for someone right out of college
review_cons: Horrible pay, unprofessional work environment, shallow company, unrealistic expectations, business is run inefficiently
review_advice_mgmt: Need better pay, be more realistic, run business more efficiently.  Try to keep up with and be more concerned about the unprofessionalism in the stores, also be more concerned with the advancement of their staff.

review_title: A terrible company with a great training program and opportunity for advancement.
review_pros: Training and professional development is excellent. Most companies don't give their new hires the tools they need to be successful and I felt I did.
review_cons: Customers hate the brand and take it out on you on a daily basis. High staff turnover.
review_advice_mgmt: Get back in touch with your customers. Is the store experience they are after a nightclub? Cater to the parents more. They are the ones who spend the money on clothes for their kids

review_pros: Easy tasks. Easy to get covers.
review_cons: Hard to get a lot of hours

review_title: My time here has been full of stress, but has been rewarded with wonderful learning and advancement opportunities.
review_pros: If you are someone who takes pride in their work, this is a great place to showcase your talents and commitment. It's great for detail and result driven people. There are also many to advance in the company, whether that be the management route, or the home office route, and lots of opportunities for everyone to learn.
review_cons: Most positions require someone who is very detail oriented, so be prepared for that.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing, because it seems to be working!

review_pros: flexible schedule, discount on clothes, great coworkers, could be a very fun environment
review_cons: terrible pay, discrimination, favoritism, no appreciation for employees

review_title: I have been a model and also an impact member combined for over 3 years
review_pros:
-You get to meet and become friends with a lot of cool people (especially if you're younger)
-If you're outgoing you can have a lot of fun at work
-Flexible hours; set your own availability 
-The job is EXTREMELY easy
-If you get a good manager(s) working there can be really enjoyable
-Overall, a pretty relaxed work environment
review_cons:
-No opportunities for pay raises (Yes they give out two $.25 raises per year but let's be real...no pay raises)
-Minimum wage
-Not good for dependable hours (some weeks you work every day some you only get a shift) 
-Can become tedious 
-Music and smell can be nauseatingly obnoxious (your body adjusts after a while)
- Buying AAAs (uniform) is usually the majority of your paycheck
-If manager(s) don't like you...you won't get scheduled 
-Some people are extremely lazy and do sloppy/incomplete work that screw you over
-Working there too long makes you more judgmental and potentially racist 
-If you don't get lucky with good managers or experienced employees that like to teach, you won't be very good at your job
review_advice_mgmt: Put more emphasis on customer service rather than standards. Teach DMs and managers how to properly train employees and provide better customer service. Provide a more welcoming atmosphere for customers. Become a less self centered company and put all the focus on providing excellent customer service. Make scheduling guidelines for a better distribution of hours. Allow impact members to cover model shifts OR stop allowing models to take impact shifts.

review_title: Great career starter for entry level position
review_pros: Flexible work hours to promote work life balance in most departments. Open door policy helped with job performance. Upper lever management is very approachable
review_cons: New Albany, Ohio is not the best location for someone my age. For someone more settled in their personal life and career this would be a better match

review_pros: Easy job, low stress, and easy to enter the company as a MIT
review_cons: Little to no growth in the company. Discounts are awful and no give-aways

review_pros: Cool social feel, and you can play your own usic
review_cons: they reduce hours based on sales perforances

review_title: Favors minorities to keep up with the quota
review_pros: coworkers are nice, and you get a nice discount. you really dont have to do much but stand there and look pretty.
review_cons: whenever they ask to take your picture, is to keep up with the diversity quota.

review_pros: The store discount is pretty good.
review_cons: You fold piles of clothes, greet customers, and have to manage/tidy up an entire room alone (after floor set-ups). Being alone in the front for hours at a time, on top of managing a room alone, is draining.
review_advice_mgmt: Assign more than one model to a room at a time. This will also reduce theft.

review_title: This was a great place to work in high school.
review_pros: The people you work with are great and becomes friends for life. There's also a great discount for employees if you wear their clothes.
review_cons: It is a very repetitive job so unless you like folding clothes for five hours straight you will get bored. The constant fragrance also gives you a headache.
review_advice_mgmt: No advice.

review_pros:
discount
great coworkers
actually have a life after work
review_cons: managers...the whole nazi idea of trying to be perfect, some sales associates think they are all that and MINIMUM WAGE
review_advice_mgmt: GET BETTER MANAGERS.

review_pros: Cost of living, competitive salary, cool people.
review_cons: Long hours, Columbus (OH), high turnover.

review_title: Good job for 6 months to a year.
review_pros: You get to wear casual clothes everyday.
review_cons: All the company cares about is how well you recruit versus how well you run the business.

review_title: Fun and energetic work environment, great first job out of college, immediate management experience opportunity.
review_pros: Opportunity for advancement, the people you work with and the relationships you can build.
review_cons: Low pay, extreme expectations with somewhat limited resources at times
review_advice_mgmt: Fire those not pulling their weight and make room for those who do

review_title: pretty enjoyable, easy to handle while in school
review_pros: Worked with ppl my age
review_cons: not many hours a week until you have worked there a while; also you are highly encouraged to buy the new season's clothing (but they can't force you) which can get expensive
review_advice_mgmt: its better to have an extra employee scheduled and be able to send someone home early than to give someone a call in because many employees will not call-in and then you will be short

review_pros: You work with a lot of really good looking people. I met a significant other there. 99% of everyone you interact with at any level will be extremely cool and easy to get along with. Most managers are recent college graduates so you're talking about 23-25 year old managing 18 and 19 year olds. The whole environment is very "college-like". It's not super demanding. Most people think that AF is horrible because they only hire good looking people, but when you work there you see that it really is a genius marketing strategy.
review_cons: As a manager, the hours and expectations suck. You work either 9-6 or 2-11, mid-shifts are rare. Just like any specialty retail store the sales goals are unrealistic, there is high pressure to perform, and you must always be recruiting good looking people to work in the stores. If your store manager sucks, your whole store will suck in a trickle down way. I once closed every Friday and Saturday for two months and never realized my store manager was off every weekend (not allowed by any stretch) so just be cautious of the people that take advantage of good workers. The company isn't horrible, but poor managers will take its toll. Oh, and the pay isn't competitive or good by any regard.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more stringent on who you hire to run the stores, allow more flexibility in scheduling by hiring more managers per location. Also increase hourly pay for store employees. AF is one of the lowest paying retail stores for all levels of employees.

review_title: It was a fun experience to have
review_pros: I met a lot of great and fun people. The managers were great and understanding. The employee discount is also great.
review_cons: The job consisted of very menial tasks like folding, greeting, cleaning, etc. The pay was really low too. More monitoring of employees would be beneficial too.
review_advice_mgmt: A lot of workers are on their phones--more careful monitoring should be done.

review_title: Great first job that's it, and I made great friends working there.
review_pros: Quick hiring process, doesn't require experiences that all, discount is satisfying but could be better, very easy job.
review_cons: Doesn't pay well, no overtime pay, no raises or promotion, not allow to dress how you want to, no make-up, no toenail or fingernail polish, hire pretty and skinny people (unless you apply for impact), ect. To many to type
review_advice_mgmt: Please start communicating to each other, and lighting up and pretend you enjoy your job

review_title: Sales rep position at Abercrombie Kids. I worked there for four years on and off. It was a great job for students.
review_pros: Easy, good people, discount, reasonable hours.  It was a great position while in high school. Management was nice and helpful, also respectful of school schedules.
review_cons: The pay was obviously not great. The job was not stimulating or challenging in anyway.  A lot of monotonous activity such as folding clothes, greeting customers.
review_advice_mgmt: I thought that the management was great. I really had no complaints and thought that they did a great job with what they had and always helped employees.

review_title: Get some experience then get out!
review_pros: No pervious experience required, they'll teach you everything you need to know about running a multimillion business. Fun environment to work in while you're training.
review_cons: Once you advance to a higher management position your supervisors no longer care how many hours over 40 you work without overtime pay. It's looked down upon if you leave on time, when your scheduled shift is over. You must have tough skin to work here: the negative feedback is cutting and you'll get no positive feedback.
review_advice_mgmt: Want to keep those positive managers you spent so much time developing? Be nice, be thankful for their hard work, and pay them for their time! You're selling clothing to teenagers, not saving lives. Relax and provide the cool, fun environment you promised in the interview.

review_title: It was great overall but no sense of direction
review_pros: flexible schedule, networking, great location
review_cons: low pay, no advancement opportunities
review_advice_mgmt: Actually do some managing

review_pros: 30 percent off clothes, sometime 50
review_cons: Minimum wage and have to wear there clothes

review_pros: Great discount, amazing visuals and love the clothes
review_cons: Salary, and policy about hiring only good looking people. While being store manager i was asked to work miracles with out the support of my DM. Manager turnover is so bad. I lost a lot of time training managers and the never came back after the 3 months.
review_advice_mgmt: Start hiring people for their talent not for their looks and raise the salaries

review_title: Is there a raing lower than 1?
review_pros: You get a relatively small discount on some items.
review_cons:
Shallow work environment. 
Employess are hired many times, based solely on physical appearance.
Good employees always pick up the slack for bad ones.
Due to the quality of many lower to higher managers, scheduling and recognition are a joke.
Managers of every level seem to have a power complex of some kind. 
High levels of illicit practices (in my time there).
Rules are rarely followed and vary from person to person. 
The list is endless.
review_advice_mgmt: Get better. Literally, start anywhere and improve.  Company ethics is probably a good place to start.

review_pros: Working around attractive people and the pay was legit for a fresh graduate
review_cons: So many flaws in the system but people are too blind to see. Zero diversity as it is run by autocrats. Skills developed (if any) in this company can not be applied else where.
review_advice_mgmt: Listen.

review_title: Met a lot of superficial people
review_pros: It was an easy job
review_cons: You'll never get a raise, they schedule you without telling you, then call you and yell at you for not coming in
review_advice_mgmt: Stop favoring the few blonde sales associates

review_title: If you're a simple person this is the place for you
review_pros: Extremely flexible hours, ability to switch and give away shifts at any time, good pay, fun music, very busy (makes your shift go by incredibly fast), uniform is free
review_cons: EXTREMELY strict look policy, nails MUST be short and unpolished, toes must be clear,pink or red but no hot pinks or "firey" reds, very quick to give you a write up for things as small as not having your pants double cuffed, not for the fashionable person AT ALL
review_advice_mgmt: Loosen up a bit. Not everyone is a size 2 and 5'10. Not everyone likes their natural hair colour, or the colors pink or red. The look policy is WAY too strict. Telling people how to look, down to their toe nails, is very uncomfortable. Besides, what does our toe nail polish have to do with ones ability to sell ?

review_title: Very intense sales experience.  Pushy Managers who force you say cheesy lines to customers to grab their attention.
review_pros: The people you work with hate it as much as you do, so you can find some comfort in that.
review_cons: They make you buy their clothes to wear at work and the clothes aren't even flattering.

review_pros: friendly co-workers, easy job for college
review_cons: too strict about what to wear and say to customers the made you say "tag lines" which were uncomfortable

review_title: Extremely superficial and gives little feedback for growth
review_pros: Gives you experience as a manager and for running a business.
review_cons: I have been with the company for two years and have literally done everything they've asked of me (I have 6 "trackers" and 1 MIT currently at the MOA, along with having graduated stores from Concern Store and Target Store lists), but have watched multiple managers with less results and experience get promoted before me. I'm absolutely convinced the company only cares about how good you look- I can't come up with any other reason as to why they treat great managers so poorly and idealize the pretty but idiotic managers.
review_advice_mgmt: Own up to what you preach. "We promote based on results" is not what you do.

review_title: For a job in high school it was ok.
review_pros: The discounts were good but you still had to buy the clothes from them. The people were great to work with and some of the manager were great, others not so much. The location was nice.
review_cons: The smell of the place can get pretty bad after woking there for more than a week. The management didn't treat the employees very well, there was exceptions . The pay was minimum wage and you had to buy clothing from them.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat employees like there not disposable.

review_pros: Fun job when I was young
review_cons: low pay, poor management, young people
review_advice_mgmt: Be mature!

review_pros: Scheduling is flexible, easy to get shifts covered
review_cons: Expectations are above minimum wage, retail hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep the stress level down

review_title: I worked at Abercrombie & Fitch part-time as a model
review_pros: Discounts, easy work, some nice co-workers
review_cons: Rude managers, look policy, min wage, long hours, little direction, increasing expectations coupled with decreasing management support, unpredictable schedule, poor work/life balance, highly stressful environment
review_advice_mgmt: Humble yourselves. You are all on a power trip and need to offer support.

review_pros:
decent discount
store visual experience 
flexible scheduling
review_cons:
short shifts 
low hourly wages
high priced clothes

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch is the best place to work if you in high school and looking for a job.
review_pros: Great retail experience, diverse work environment, fun and carefree nature in store, you get discounts at all four stores (A&F, a&f, Hollister, & Gilly Hicks),
review_cons: If you live in California, taxes; sometimes managers are not easy to work with, certain stores don't get the best hours

review_pros:
Flexible / Works with your schedule 
Easy
Nice people
review_cons:
Getting enough hours
Holiday shifts can be crazy

review_pros: Decent work environment depending on the management.
review_cons: Limited opportunities for advancement when you work as a part time employee.
review_advice_mgmt: Reduce employee turnover and invest more hours into store associates so they can learn the job.

review_title: Learning experience when it came to retail
review_pros: Flexible Schedule, Discount on Clothes, Learning experience
review_cons:
Salary raises are hard to achieve and my fellow co-workers who have been there for a couple of years were still at minimum wage. It did not matter if you worked really hard and someone else did not work as hard. Was not recognized for effort.
Had to wear clothes that were in season and often times forced to buy clothes or else would not be scheduled for hours.

review_pros: meet new people, able to get sale clothes first
review_cons: judged on looks, horrible pay!
review_advice_mgmt: practice what you preach.

review_pros:
Super flexible
Half the managers don't care what you do.
A lot of the managers are awesome people
Your co-workers are awesome.
The pay was okay if you're in high school 
The 30% discount at A&F and 20% discount at Hollister and Gilly Hicks
review_cons:
The manager who took EVERYTHING too seriously that even the other managers hated her.
The customers are annoying and a lot of them, (this is really more of a problem in NYC), don't speak good enough English. So with the loud, deafening music and the fact that they don't speak English, a lot of them won't listen to you.
The smell
The fact that they would fire people who aren't "sexy" and will find every excuse to fire them (so if you're curvy, tread carefully or make nice to the managers)

review_title: Not a bad place to work.
review_pros: I love my coworkers! We all get a long really well and our managers are super easy to get a long with
review_cons: Th only con I can think of is the pay. You will not make more then Minimum wage.
review_advice_mgmt: Offer commission, you will get better customer service out of your employees.

review_pros: They pay minimum wage but you get paid lunch breaks and depending on how many hours you're working your lunch break can range from 15 minutes to 30 minutes.
review_cons: You get your pay check after every two weeks instead of every friday, so you have to wait longer to get paid.

review_pros: Liked who I worked with, never the same thing all the time.
review_cons: Not enough hours, felt unappreciated, lots of call-in shifts, constantly being told to watch for theft, store playlist and the smell (as you could've guessed).

review_pros: its easy but can be hard, and things are expected
review_cons: hours are shitty and they're dishonest
review_advice_mgmt: PLEASE KEEP YOUR WORDS! AND DON"T FORGET YOUR EMPLOYEES.

review_pros:
-good start to an entry level management position
-pay is decent
- you get to meet great associates to manage/train
review_cons:
-very stressful during peak season (Christmas and back to school) 
-long hours ( sometimes you don't get out till 1 am ) 
-leading the floor set/ updates (which are every other week)
review_advice_mgmt: Sometimes upper management forget how hard it is to manage a store during the floor set/updates. Try to realize that the given time restrictions to complete some task as not always realistic and be able to empathize with that.

review_pros: Nice discounts for clothing and you get to pick your own hours
review_cons: The long-term employees were rude, snooty, and not welcoming for new comers, you have to work a minimum of 3-5 hours each shift, the managers were not helpful during training or your first days there so I basically had to figure things out myself and get in trouble if i did it wrong, and it gets boring during the slow hours
review_advice_mgmt: Be more aware of worker-worker interaction and don't play favorites

review_title: I learned a lot but the company doesn't value it's employees and is a very shallow company!
review_pros: It's a good entry level job because you are forced to learn a lot very quickly due to the company's high turnover rate.  Also, being a manager here teaches you leadership skills.
review_cons: The company doesn't care about it's employees.  Very shallow company.  Has very high & unrealistic expectations for it's managers.

review_pros: Fast paced environment with focus on growth and promotion. Fun lifestyle built by brands.
review_cons: Entry level salary starts low but there is a lot of opportunity for growth.
review_advice_mgmt: Have confidence and live the lifestyle.

review_pros: Flexible hours, really awesome staff (management completely terrible)
review_cons: superficial managers, one shift per week most of the times, hard workers are set aside because they arent as good looking, management disorganized

review_pros: The work environment is great, the people I work with are awesome and you get to make great relationships. The managers are really nice and they really care about you.
review_cons: A downside would be the pay, you get paid minimum wage and if you ever get a raise its only $.25

review_title: loud music, no raise, lots of drama
review_pros: Well for starters, everyone is so good looking. It's nice to stare at attractive people your whole shift. Everyone who works for the company is young, so everyone seems to understand eachother. Easy job, you aren't expected to do much of anything.
review_cons: Growing up I thought this would be my dream job but it wasn't. Every shift usually drags on and you're stuck in the same spot for hours bc managers often forget about you. It's the worst place to work when you're in a bad mood and the customers are usually always freaking out about the music and pricing. You will never get a raise. Even though everyone is young, the managers often think they're above everyone even though they are probably the same age as you. A lot of high school drama.
review_advice_mgmt: Better structure, don't leave people zoned in the same place for a whole shift!!!

review_title: Fun, young working environment, but doesn't have consistent training and isn't very productive.
review_pros: Fun to work with people your age. Casual environment. Music to listen to while working (though it is debatable whether this is a pro or con..). Young managers that can relate to and have fun with employees, who tend to be high school- or college-aged.
review_cons: Poor training, which leads to poor skills while working. There have been many times where employees (part-time, not managers) have been asked to train new employees despite the fact that they weren't given training on what or how to teach others. This poor training means that standards aren't always where they should be in terms of cleanliness or customer service. Thus the customer experience and satisfaction varies greatly. Little chance of getting a raise.
review_advice_mgmt: Create more consistency in employee training. Convey the importance of customer service and other standards while maintaining the fun, casual environment where employees can still converse with customers and other employees. Reduce employee turnover by stressing the importance of a fair and fun, yet still productive work environment throughout the entire organization-managers and part-time employees alike.

review_pros:
I have met the most amazing people at this company. 
Get to pick hours.
Ability to transfer if needed. 
50% off during seasons. 
Strick and orderly!
review_cons:
A lot of pressure when someone important comes to visit. 
Only one pay raise allowed per year, which is 7 cents. 
The company needs to realize when a manager just isn't cut out to be one. 
Spending a lot of money on clothes that we wear.
review_advice_mgmt: Reward us for busting our butts for you, instead of finding one thing wrong and giving us hell for it.

review_pros: Working with the team is fun, the environment is nice, and you have a potential outlet to model for the company.
review_cons: The pay, the drama, the discounts suck, and so forth.

review_pros: Its good for meeting people
review_cons: I hardly got any hours for them.

review_pros: flexible hours, laid back environment
review_cons: tons of racism, lots of micromanagement

review_pros: Great if you're a student, as you can literally pick up only the hours you want
review_cons:
Management doesn't really care much for their people as so many quit/get fired 
Don't expect much pay-wise, but the flexibility with hours is worth it I think 
Not at all a good job if you're always availiable 
Shallow, must be good looking to work there

review_title: For the salary and treatment of employees, it's an okay beginner job.
review_pros: Even though the employee discount was low (about 20 or 30%), I gained some experience with customer service, handling the cash register, pricing merchandise, and inventory.
review_cons: Very few hours, low salary, superficial people
review_advice_mgmt: Please treat employees better, compensate for the lack of decent salary for the work required from the employees

review_title: Fun but low paying and unrewarding
review_pros: Easy job and a relaxed atmosphere. I really enjoyed working with both managers and coworkers.
review_cons:
Raises are rare.
No noteworthy career experience

review_pros: Prolific opportunities for advancement within the company and amazing opportunities for global placements. Company culture is young, fun and relaxed.
review_cons: Everything bad that you've heard about A&F is true. Although senior management should be trying to rid the company of issues such as sexualization of young models, an emphasis on a narrow idea of beauty over actual performance and a lack of real diversity, they actually seem to be proud of them. Only if you can ignore the lack of any values or morality in this company will you be able to enjoy the pros of working there. Oh, and try to work here if you're not what they consider attractive...
review_advice_mgmt: Completely scrap the vision and direction of Mike Jeffries if you want you sales in the US to stop declining. Your current marketing style may still attract shoppers in some countries, but take it from someone in your key demographic, we find the whole atmosphere of the stores overwhelming (the music, the fragrance) and the whole culture unsettling. It's time for another overhaul, this time without Mr. Jeffries at the helm.

review_pros: good, learned alot, was fun
review_cons: none it was really great
review_advice_mgmt: none

review_title: High Energy, Motivated, People Oriented, Results Driven, Detail Oriented
review_pros: The People: You basically pick who you want to surround yourself with. A large portion of the job deals with recruiting and hiring the best people available:
review_cons: Retail hours, pay, company expectations vs resources allotted
review_advice_mgmt: Compensate staff better to help retain and develop strong leaders (both management and part-time).

review_pros:
-the people were nice
-flexible schedule (will be covered in a con)
-got good hours when they were "low" on staff
review_cons:
-management is a joke
-minimum wage 
-they hire on too many people so each person gets one or two shifts a week - so you could take weeks off if you wanted to and no one would care
-my paycheck was probably less than the amount of my gas to get there 
-shift ranges from 4-6 hours, this can be the only time you get something
review_advice_mgmt: Get your stuff together or this company will fail completely...the stores closed down for a reason..

review_pros: The best part of working for Abercrombie & Fitch is the initial discount you get when you start the Job, 50% off, if I remember right, and  25% off after that. If you really like Abercrombie clothes, then this is the job for you.
review_cons: Minimum wage. The management, usually college grads, do not know what they are doing. Most people who work there are superficial. You only get one 15 minutes break if you work below 6 hrs and a 30 minute break if you work longer than 6 hours.
review_advice_mgmt: Up the pay. Treat your employees better. Stop being superficial.

review_pros: Part-time work, flexible schedule, no previous experienced required. A pretty social and upbeat working environment, which is fun and helps pass the time
review_cons: Sometimes there is a lack of professionalism; the culture favors socialization. Making friends helps, but can be disadvantageous if you are looking for straightforward part time work. Brand image (and aspects of work environment that pertain to it) gets old if you are not really into it
review_advice_mgmt: A little more professionalism, too much focus on socialization

review_title: Fast Paced, Constant Change, Quick to Promote
review_pros: Fast-paced, young, and energetic environment; Positive and enthusiastic people will succeed; Granted a lot of responsibility very early in your career, and if you show you're interested in staying and succeeding as a team, management will continue to foster your career development (satellite teams, projects, task forces, testing groups); Training experience and leadership / management opportunities are also given earlier than it seems at other companies; Typically quick to promote most new additions to the team within the first year or so or starting, and then again after about 18 months, so long as the economy and state of the business allows; The benefits are honestly the best I've seen in the industry thus far.
review_cons: Known to "swing the pendulum," often without data to back up split-second decisions; Only easy to changes to processes occur on satellite teams; Failure to lay out clear and concise expectations for employees; If you want to excel, long hours are often necessary.
review_advice_mgmt: Strive to provide clear expectations for employees; Work on being straightforward and honest about career development plans and opportunities for associates; Focus less on internship programs and more on retaining current employees.

review_pros:
flexible and chill job
cool coworkers
review_cons:
not many hours
managers play favorites
review_advice_mgmt: get out of the high school mentality

review_pros: Honestly, I can't think of too many pros.  Most of the kids that I managed were great.
review_cons: Pressured to recruit great looking people, you have to be shallow minded, most days are the same, you feel like a robot working there
review_advice_mgmt: Don't treat your employees like crap.

review_pros: Awesome co-workers, really flexible schedule, cool managers, really relaxed environment.
review_cons: Terrible hours, I would get less than 10-15 a paycheck. And a paycheck is every two weeks so that should tell ya something. Boring boring boring, so much time wasted just standing around greeting, or folding. Having to spend half your paycheck on new uniforms AAA that come out every other month or so. Also super little pay! $8 an hour but after taxes I got a little bit less than $7.

review_pros: The Impact team members are people that you want to be around after work. The 30%-40% discount is nice althought my style doesn't fall into their 'uniform look.'
review_cons: The Managers are sometimes extremely rude to the impact team when their the people that physically keep the store on track. And if you're an Impact Worker you CAN NOT get any promotions no matter how good of a worker you are...
review_advice_mgmt: Please make obtaining payroll easier then what is it, I should be able to walk into the store and get it from a Manager just by asking.

review_title: Terrible pay for the amount of work.
review_pros: I have no pros at all
review_cons: Work Schedule is awful work 2-11 pm 3 days.  Work weekends.  They say your salary in the interviews, but you are not your actually hourly.  They say you have paid holidays, but you do not.  They use the holiday as one of your days off for the week.  And overtime is half of your hourly pay, not time and a half.  Half.  $7.50.

review_pros: The people I have met at work are awesome. You are guaranteed to get along with your co-workers and even make a few close friends from working here. The scheduling is really flexible, which is awesome for full time students. Also, if you're working impact, you almost always have something to do, so you're not bored standing around greeting people all day.
review_cons: Wow. If it weren't for the HORRIBLE hours (I'm talking 4 hrs/week. Yes, you read it right. FOUR HOURS PER WEEK) and "call-in" shifts, I would not be looking for another job right now. Typically you will only get one "real" shift and two call-in shifts per week (anywhere from 4-8 hours each). Call-in shifts are where you have to call the store an hour before your scheduled shift and ask if they need you to work. 99% of the time they don't need you. Why is this bad? Well it completely ruins your day because you wait around all day wondering if you'll have to work or not and you have to plan your whole day around the possible shift you may or may not have to go to.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop hiring so many people.

review_title: After almost a decade with the company
review_pros: Meet some great people who I can still call friends to this day!
review_cons: They don't value hard work.Expect you to work on your day off. Upper management pushes you on developing and inspiring those below you, yet they don't have time to do the same.
review_advice_mgmt: Take your own advice and focus on the success & developement of those below you, without us you will struggle!!

review_title: great coworkers that are always in happy mood.
review_pros: Great environment to work in your teen ages, you meet a lot of people the work is not hard.
review_cons: Minimal hours, schedules are random
review_advice_mgmt: Should get to know the needs of the employees such asking them how much hours that they need Etc.

review_pros: Great management training program, fun atmosphere
review_cons: High expectations with minimal staffing, Large focus on employee appearance-promotions almost seem based on this
review_advice_mgmt: Understaffing in the stores is a huge issue. Also if you continue to hire based solely on appearance you will not be successful-there needs to be more of a balance

review_pros: I worked as a part timer for four years and transitioned to the MIT program after graduating from college
review_cons: Higher management prefer surprise visits and set high expectations. Sometimes these expectations are a little unrealistic.
review_advice_mgmt: Setting up success for all employees to lower turnover rates

review_pros:
I got paid... (minimum wage)
Fair discount
review_cons:
VERY obsessed with appearance. Cannot wear makeup, nail polish, etc.
You have to be attractive to work in the front of the store, unattractive (to them) cannot leave back of store. 
No room for growth.
Rude customers.
Management is rude until they believe you have "Cast of" potential.
review_advice_mgmt: Be nice to your emlpoyees, do not judge on appearances, and increase pay.

review_pros: Great coworkers, relaxed/laid back work environment
review_cons: undesirable work schedule, poor upper management, lack of incentives, noncompetitive salaries, brand values lack emphasis on hard work and intelligence, poor performance received little to no consequences.
review_advice_mgmt: Reward high performing assistant/store managers, provide sales incentives, make management salaries more competitive with competing brands

review_title: It was just an easy way to get money
review_pros: Discounts, easy, feeling cool or accomplished
review_cons: Very restricting, not enough pay
review_advice_mgmt: Ease up

review_pros: great experience and easy job
review_cons: low pay and not alot of hours.

review_title: Surprise. It's a lot more work than you'd think.
review_pros: Good order. Good standard operating procedures. Good starting salary for twenty-somethings.
review_cons: Management skills are lost to employees. "Conform or get out" mentality.  Hiring most "qualified" candidates.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep your head up. Get on the phones, ask for help because it's all around you.

review_pros: Young fun workers and good music
review_cons: music too loud - judgy managers

review_pros: Friendly, outgoing staff, enjoyable atmosphere
review_cons: Saying taglines and standing for 4-5 hours

review_pros: I worked Impact initially. It was fun back there. Back stock to me was really easy but other seemed to have trouble with it. I had the chance to be a model during Christmas for that I received an extra $100 every day I worked on top of clocking in.
review_cons: minimum wage. only 2 raises per year to two people, mostly went to seniority. strict dress code. long hours if there is a floor set.
review_advice_mgmt: Hire dependable workers not based on looks and there will be improvement all around.

review_title: Fun co-workers, huge variety amongst the quality of associate/store managers
review_pros: Fun co-workers, flexible working with student schedules
review_cons: If you're not attractive, you will hate yourself while working there. Home Office micromanages down to what temperature the store is, what number the music volume level must be set to, and what asinine things to have to say to everyone who walks into the story.
review_advice_mgmt: Calm down with the Secret Shoppers.

review_title: High expectations with a pay that doesn't match
review_pros: No two days are the same
review_cons:
The pay sucks
Dealing with high school kids getting paid minimum wage
review_advice_mgmt: Increase the pay if you want everything to be perfect.

review_title: Had a great time working there.
review_pros: Lots of hours as associate employee.
review_cons:
Saw most associates leave. 
High turnover rate.
review_advice_mgmt: Try keeping employees around. Young kids need to make money too.

review_pros: good for school they don't over work you.
review_cons: inventory is horrible, but other than that the job is okay

review_pros: the smell is so strong you know when to turn around.
review_cons: smells like a bunch of pigeons in there
review_advice_mgmt: also state the IQ of the models

review_pros: Working with primarily youngish, energetic, and friendly people. They will hire pretty much anybody. You will most likely have a good if you don't have a horrible attitude. I had a blast
review_cons: Pay is minimum wage. Very high turnover rate. I had four managers in a year period at one store. The clothes.

review_title: Super easy and relaxed environment with a chance to participate in fun casting opportunites.
review_pros: Fun employers, Relaxed environment, became a professional clothes folder, flexible schedule, discount on clothing, first access to sales items.
review_cons: Unreliable coworkers, strong fragrance sprayed through out store that takes awhile to get used to, listen to the same 10 songs all day for weeks straight

review_pros: Fun people great environment. Very good benefits.
review_cons: salary is pretty low for the expectations

review_pros: Develop great leadership competences. the freedom to recruit, hire, develop your own staff. Fast pace environment in tier1 or flagship stores. The opportunity to work at stores all over the world. The opportunity to be promoted quickly.
review_cons: Challenging work life balance. Getting moved from store to store without establishing any long-term tenure at one store. Top to bottom communication with upper management.

review_title: Amazing clothes and enviroment. Horrible hours, felt like I was paying to work there.
review_pros: Amazing clothes, discount, music, enviroment for young adults.
review_cons: Minimum wage. Slightly boring if you're store is not busy. Call ins were pointless and a waste of time.
review_advice_mgmt: Associates work much to hard to be earning minimum wage. Expand sizes larger. We are not all 5'4. Some of us are 5'8- dresses and skirts and shorts are much to short. Im not trying to flash the world. You're welcome.

review_pros: discount on clothes, fun environment
review_cons: very few hours given to employees
review_advice_mgmt: give employees more hours

review_pros:
People are nice. 
The work is easy.
review_cons:
Minimum wage
Low Pay
Shifts are usually 4-5 hours
I ended up working once a week because they overhire
review_advice_mgmt: Stop hiring so many people, let us get more hours. Stop hiring dumb people who just stand around and do nothing

review_title: Good Entry Level Retail Mgt Experience, Poor Long-Term Outlook
review_pros:
1. (some of) The People you work with  
2. Health Benefits package
review_cons:
1. Corporate associates' genuine lack of concern for general interest & welfare of associates/ management teams who work at store level. There's a complete disconnect. 
2. Lack of work/ life balance. 
3. Favoritism & politics (on occasion high turnover in a short amount of time) 100% of the time determines who gets promoted & when. 
4. Dealing with with (justifying to your family) the foolish comments of CEO Mike Jeffries.
review_advice_mgmt: To attract highly qualified candidates & retain the best (current) associates, offer a highly attractive salary that equates to the absurdly high expectations that this company has, given the lack of support that is offered/ given.

review_pros: I guess it's a self esteem boost if they pick you to work as a model, since they only pick attractive people? Lets you know that retail isn't for you? Good first job for the resume?
review_cons: The smell. Not considerate with your schedule if you are a student. Having to read those tag lines.
review_advice_mgmt: Look at the cons.

review_pros: FLEXIBILITY, employees helping employees, quality in clothes
review_cons: uneducated immature managers, so much work so little pay, no reviews/no promotion, sweat shop operated company, managers talk about other managers n co workers within the company, highest overturn rate in employees co always hiring cuz employees leaves within 2 to 3 months, building closets and doing floor moves in 100 degree temp in store, NO BENEFITS,so much to list...
review_advice_mgmt: hire mature educated adults and secretly monitor those young managers that works in your store, decrease work load for minimum wage employees an increase work load for salaried managers cuz their not doing anything but chitchatting bout their personal life

review_pros:
You'll bet maybe 0-3 4 hour shifts a week.
Flexible scheduling, easy to find other shifts.
Might be a social job. I never built strong relationships there but maybe you will.
Opportunity for stepping into the modeling industry (rare chance though)
Manager In Training post-grad program looks pretty good.
review_cons:
You will not make any money here. Minimum wage, no raises, no promotions. Will spend a paycheck or two every season for new mandatory outfits to wear on the floor. 
Unreliable, stuck up coworkers.
Having a bad reputation - I was at risk for not being hired at another retail job because they said that Abercrombie "has no customer service values." Also many people think you just stand around like a prude and look good. 
Poor management.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop hiring managers based on looks, I am surprised that doesn't break your "anti-discriminatory" laws.

review_pros: Co-workers are pretty good-looking but super dramatic and annoying.
review_cons: Many rules and regulations for a store that sells clothes.
review_advice_mgmt: Chill. It is a clothing store.

review_title: A&F was a lot of fun but not very serious work.
review_pros: Good discount on certain items. Very social atmosphere. Lots of people apply and work for a few months so you get to meet a lot of people. Not much is asked or expected of you when you work in one of the front rooms or fitting rooms. It's an extremely easy job. Treated like gold if you're attractive.
review_cons: Very rare that you get a shift longer than 4 hours. No opportunity for full time work. When a floor set happens there's always a problem with the product. Managers can be really high strung. No real responsibility for associates. Lots of time when the store is slow you can get trapped in a front room with nothing to do. Very shallow work place where physically attractive people benefit from favoritism. Need a 4 year degree to be a manager even though some employees are much more qualified for responsibility.
review_advice_mgmt: Give more responsibility to associates. Managers are always overworked while associates are under-utilized. Take the hiring process more seriously so that employee turnover isn't so high.

review_pros: laid back atmosphere, got to meet a lot of great people
review_cons: expectations are unrealistic, promotions are based on what you look like and not merit
review_advice_mgmt: hire qualified candidates, not based on looks

review_pros: The people I've meet at the sore lever are awesome, friendly and great to be around
review_cons: Low compensation. Promotions are often based appearances not experience or proformance

review_pros: It's easy, they work with your schedule
review_cons: The pay is minimum, there's no raises, the smell is overpowering, the music is on a repetitive one-hour track, no benefits
review_advice_mgmt: Train the best staff to be supervisors, and MoDs.

review_title: Overall it is a nice company but super busy.
review_pros:
seasonal discount
employee discount is high
review_cons:
poor management 
low salary
busy schedule
review_advice_mgmt: Staff turnover rate is High, better improve salary to keep people working there

review_pros: Good employee discount, fun environment
review_cons: Pay rate not enough, not enough hours
review_advice_mgmt: Raise the pay rate

review_pros:
Fun work environment. 
Fairly easy and stress free work.
review_cons:
Getting a raise was uncommon. I worked as a sales associate for 4 years and received minimum wage the whole duration. 
There was often alot of drama among the employees. 
Management didn't always take their jobs seriously.
review_advice_mgmt: Offer more incentives to work hard such as monthly gratises when a sales goal is met or more upward mobility within the company.

review_title: Get paid minimum wage to fold shirts for 5 hours.
review_pros: Work is easy and it's pretty difficult to get fired. I would miss plenty of shifts and they really wouldn't care, they are desperate for associates.
review_cons: Your managers are only going to be a couple of years older then you, and they sh!t on you constantly. You have to deal with disrespectful bosses at most retail stores, but my god this was terrible. Every manager steals coupons and sells them to re-sellers. You also get the trashiest and most ignorant customers walking into the store, so if you love eating sh!t this really is the job for. Oh yeah, only 30% employee discount.
review_advice_mgmt: It doesn't matter what I write here because A&F doesn't care at all about their employees.

review_title: Started program to learn, left without uppoer management
review_pros: Easy job. They just hand you the keys and say, here run this store
review_cons: turn over is ridiculous. I've only been around for a few months and we've lost 4 store managers as well as our DM.
review_advice_mgmt: Pay more and be better organized

review_pros: Fun people, good exercise doing figure 8s all day and running around 12 hours straight
