review_cons: The salary is on the low range but I was hired right out of college so can't complain too much.

review_pros: Meeting new people, gaining customer service experience, lasting friendships, 401k that vests 20% a year. So if you start working at 17 and make it til 22, you're 100% vested. Even part-timers have a 401k
review_cons:
Corporate terrorizes management who terrorize the employees. Requires a degree to be management (except Overnight Manager). In my experience in retail, having a degree doesn't make you a better manager. Most of the time its a popularity contest. 

I've known managers who had to quit working there because A&F wouldn't give them the time to complete their Masters.
review_advice_mgmt: Stop thinking about your profit margin and start taking better care of your employees

review_title: Not a lot of intelligent people here, it is run by the people who get too old to work the floor..
review_pros: Cheap clothing, good recognition.  It is an interesting place to meet good looking people who like to party on their time off.  Good for early college students, I guess.
review_cons: No enrichment, closed minded employees, almost zero advancement, etc... The list goes on.
review_advice_mgmt: Make work more fun and less drone work.

review_pros:
- Great hours (flexible)
- Quick-to-pay and full-time opportunities available
- Attractive employees, fun times

Abercrombie & Fitch is a dynamic workplace that can be very fun as well as boring. This is because it depends entirely on models interacting with customers and basically selling the image; but part of the fun is in the pretension.
review_cons:
- Strict look policy
- Customer experience and handling can be hit or miss

review_pros: Easy money and you can text during work
review_cons: Bad managers they never seem to give enough hours
review_advice_mgmt: Hire more mature people

review_title: Great atmosphere and environment but poor upper management and CEO
review_pros: Discount, no sales goals, easy going, laid back dress code
review_cons: PAY !!! , Hours of Work, No commission or bonuses, Promotions according to favoritism, Appearance based promotions
review_advice_mgmt: Increase the pay, be friendly

review_pros: 40% employee discount, thats about it
review_cons: lack of hours, bad scheduling, low pay, evil supervisors...everything else!
review_advice_mgmt: Incentivize your employees!

review_pros: Cool environment, flexible schedule, friendly coworkers
review_cons: Very few hours, rude customers

review_title: Not the best company to work for, but an overall exciting place to have your first job while in high school/college
review_pros: Made lifelong friends and got to interact with outgoing and attractive people every day.
review_cons: Long work hours, low pay, and poor management. The managers never seemed to be on the same page and it was hard to please everyone since the expectations of the job weren't that clear from each person.
review_advice_mgmt: Don't implement getting a new store manager every 3 months. It's difficult for employees to adhere to all the expectations of the different managers when there are varied expectations

review_title: good place to work and kill time
review_pros: work is not hard at all
review_cons: during holiday, schedule can be weird

review_title: The people you meet are great.
review_pros: You get to meet awesome people and a lot of upward movement available.
review_cons: Retail hours are sometimes rough, and managing 17-20 year olds can get very stressful.
review_advice_mgmt: Keep very open communication and be very concrete with potential promotions.

review_title: Retail- Good job for a student
review_pros: Has a very flexible schedule.
review_cons:
Opportunity for growth is limited.
Minimum Pay

review_pros: Fresh aroma of Fierce around the clock
review_cons: Just about everything else was terrible
review_advice_mgmt: stop employing people based on looks. If Abercrombie spent more time employing competent, friendly people, multiple areas of their stores would become more efficient and inviting to customers. I can only imagine sales would increase if the company spent less time setting up soft core porn shoots and more time on staffing and focusing on consumers.

review_pros: good pay - work environment interesting
review_cons: long hours - unpredictable hours - no job security

review_title: Easy part time job to have
review_pros:
- A lot of opportunities for promotion.
- Easy work 
- Friendly management
review_cons:
- Lack of hours
- Management will unnecessarily write people up if the heat is coming down on them
review_advice_mgmt: Learn how to schedule hours properly

review_pros:
great experience if your fresh out of college
management experience
discount on cloths
review_cons:
horrible pay
long hours
because they have a look policy, all their store/DM's are under 30 and act under 18
horrible work environment

review_title: It's as though you stepped into a scene from the movie Mean Girls. Don't let those fake smiles fool you for one second
review_pros: The discount is the only "pro" I can think of
review_cons:
Superficiality, no morality, low income, gossip, back stabbing
Be prepared to work your butt off and receive no recognition or appreciation.
Half of your pay check goes towards the clothes that you have to wear. Because if you're not in the current look then you're not one of the "cool" kids or should I say "grown ups".
review_advice_mgmt: Human Resources are not what they seem. Take a harder look at what is really happening within those four walls and do something about it. If you can't even speak to them in fear of information being shared or being the butt of their joke that day, then who can you talk to? Changes need to be made and fast.

review_title: Not s great company terrible culture
review_pros: Good discount, employees are fun
review_cons: No morals low pay long hours

review_pros: You get to work with a lot of great, fun, young, and energetic people. The job is quite easy and a great place to start out of university for work experience.
review_cons: Micro-Managed. Want their managers to follow strict rules and not think even if it would help the customer. Home office is constantly "coming for a visit." Managers have to work extremely hard to make sure everything in the store is up to standard and half the time home office doesn't even come.
review_advice_mgmt: Let your managers use their brains. Hire people based on qualifications not just looks.

review_title: I enjoyed working with the people, but the management could have been  WAY better
review_pros: The people are nice, the job is easy, you don't need a lot of experience, they are understanding with requesting off, emergency call offs.
review_cons:
Minimum wage.

The company enforces stuff that go AGAINST customer service. For example, we are not allowed to hold items for customers, we are STRICT as hell in the fitting rooms (granted that comes from an extensive history of stealing in our district), management is strict with how many items can be tried on and purchased. As far as customer service goes, there's not much you can do besides find an item in the back, suggest additional items, and look pretty.

Also the management (at my store) was kinda biased between impacts and models. Even if a model was new and UNEXPERIENCED they'd have them in the fitting room or doing other floor tasks that would LATER HAVE TO BE CORRECTED.

Hours are also always scarce since they hire every WEEK.
review_advice_mgmt:
The reputation of a retail company starts with the company and ends with the store. I don't think that you're doing enough to change people's minds about the company. Speaking as a former employee, you guys could have the retail associates do A LOT more. Customer service wise.

Real quick: improve customer service and employee training.

review_title: It is a fun and exciting environment with something new to do everyday!
review_pros: Good hours (make your own schedule)!
review_cons: coworkers do not always work

review_title: Learned a lot about management of a large retail store.
review_pros: Enjoyed working with the crew that I managed and staying constantly busy all day, every day.  Great way to make friends and if you have the right district manager then you can move up the ladder quickly.
review_cons: Insurance and pay is horrible for the hours you work.  Retail hours are horrible and you have no life.  Suggestion is to use this as a stepping stone in your career, but don't stay forever.
review_advice_mgmt: Make your employees and managers learn about company policies, equality and being ethical when hiring people into the company.

review_title: Loved working with the people but hated the obsession over how neat the store had to look 24/7 and size stickers
review_pros: The easy going coworkers,its a job,the hours are really flexible and you go home smelling like anf
review_cons: on call, minimum wage, excessive perfume can give headaches, shared hours
review_advice_mgmt: Give out more hours to those that need it instead of hiring new people.

review_title: Job for High School kids...not a real job
review_pros: You get to know a lot o people
review_cons: NO Hours No real job

review_pros: I really enjoyed some of my coworkers and got to work with a lot of hot guys. That was seriously all the pros I can think of.
review_cons: Management was horrible and only cared about themselves. Horrible discount on clothes that your manager picked out for you and you HAD to buy every few weeks. Scheduling absolutely sucked.
review_advice_mgmt: Treat your employees better.

review_pros: Really great coworkers. Most will become really good friends.
review_cons: Managers are very young and don't know what they're doing. Company policy's are horrendous.

review_pros: The working hours are extremely flexible and one can pass on shifts to others if necessary and pick up others' last minute if wanted.
review_cons: The working environment is fairly unpleasent, with loud music, no natural light, darkness, and the constant (great) perfume in the air, which however dries out your mouth constantly.

review_pros: The part-time employees are generally pretty cool.
review_cons: The associate discount only works on full price items, which is practically nothing as the store cheapens just about everything with constant sales. You will work terrible hours (6:00 A.M.-7:00 P.M. during updates and floorsets) and often go months without a weekend day off; all for very little chance at advancement (stores are closing left and right, substantially decreasing available positions) and no performance based compensation. Oh, and don't forget the fact that you will be required to seek out attractive individuals to work in the store. Advancement is often based on one's ability to recruit people that once hired, corporate leaders deem "good-looking" enough to work in the store  (these "chosen" associates will get more hours and special treatment).
review_advice_mgmt: This brand needs a complete revamp. Mike Jeffries is no longer an asset to the brand and must be replaced by someone with a new vision. Store leadership needs to have a much closer and more positive connection with the Home Office as the current inequality and pretentiousness of the HO "visitors" is palpable.

review_title: If you want a headache and hardly any hours work here.
review_pros: You get to meet people (your coworkers) and possibly become friends with them. You will learn a few things.
review_cons: The smell of the store which is caused by in store cologne sprayers which cause headaches. If you work hard you will get more hours but you would be lucky to get at least 15 hours a week part time. You have to deal with difficult customers sometimes.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more open and give encouragement to your employees, don't go behind there backs and not communicate with them directly. Stop becoming friends with impact members or models as it violates the work code. Stop hiring based off looks.

review_pros:
really flexible scheduling. you can change it from week to week and do temporary scheduling. 
amazing associates to work with. they are generally very enjoyable and make the boring (however, very easy and simple) work that you have to do while folding clothes and taking care of customers somewhat enjoyable.
review_cons:
Awful work environment
The way cal ins work. you have to call an hour in advance to the time of your scheduled "call in" shift to see if they need you. its about 50/50 whether they will use you or not so you always have to keep that time open, although you may not end up working.
review_advice_mgmt: please change how Call-ins work

review_title: Great experience but too many cons overall
review_pros: Gain great management experience. Work with a fun and energetic staff.
review_cons: No room for growth and opportunity. Very superficial which leaves some of the staff members to behave unprofessionally.
review_advice_mgmt: Learn to balance professionalism in the workplace with fun.

review_pros: Cool image, pretty colleagues, nice music nice dance floor , friendly environment, pretty clothes, amazing style, nice ass, nice smiles, smells good
review_cons: bad management team, cheap paid, long working hours, dark and loud music, crap boss, the clothes are too many
review_advice_mgmt: improve please

review_title: Company treats their employees horribly and unethically
review_pros: You will likely make some good friends with other managers.
review_cons:
-Promotions are based ONLY on looks.  As a store manager, I have had DM's tell me that an Assistant Manager wasn't handsome enough to get promoted, even though he was a great manager.  The company does not value hard work, only how you look.  Also, you can only hire people who meet company "image" or you will get yelled at by your DM.

-Healthcare benefits getting worse every year.  Co-pays for doctors visits are now $30, they used to be $20.  Deductibles have gone up as well.

-Forced to buy new clothes every 3 months.  You get 3 items 50% off which is still expensive.  The rest of your discount is laughable.  40% off FULL priced items only.  Customers get better deals than you 99% of the time with sales.  Other retail stores give their employees 75% off or free clothes every season.

-Horrible hours.  You will work weekends, weeknights, holidays, etc.  The time you are allowed to use vacation days is very limited due to blackout periods.  Calling in sick can be impossible due to staffing shortages.  

- Horrible pay:  Assistant manager make around 30k a year, and store managers around 36-40k depending on how large the store is.  Very non-competitve with other similar companies.  Long overtime is routine and you will not get paid overtime.  Overtime is HALF pay, i.e. minimum wage anything over 40 hours a week.  No bonuses, no commisions.

- Horrible upper management.  Impossible expectations with limited resources.  Budget hours keep getting cut, you never have enough people to meet the store standards.  Regional Managers are usually rude and have adversarial attitude with store management.  And you better not complain!!  Everything, no matter what, will somehow be your fault.  DM's are hit or miss.  Some are better than others.

-Irresponsible employees - it goes without saying that working with teenagers who tend to be unreliable can be stressful.  Many no-shows for shifts and bad attitudes (they are only making minimum wage).  Some great employees however.

- Management in-fighting.  Due to the stress placed on managers by DM's and RM's, there tends to be a lot of blame shifting that goes on.  This is not always the case, but I have seen a lot of managers throwing other managers under the bus.  Some fellow managers are awesome, however.

- Should I go on?  Most managers will quit within 6 months.  Turnover is extremely high.  Given the above list, is that any surprise?  There is a poster in the office which reads, "Remember, there is always someone waiting in the wings to do your job better!"  Basically, you are disposable and replaceable.  The company does not care about store-level employees.

- Thankfully, I got a much better job, as most managers here do.
review_advice_mgmt: Start acting like human-beings for once.  Develop some ethics and a conscience.  People should not be systematically exploited.

review_title: The practices of this company seem very shallow
review_pros: A lot of the people who work there were students like me, just trying to make a little money while in school, and were very friendly and nice to work with.
review_cons: Company policies seemed shallow and the focus on keeping up appearances and looking attractive enough overshadowed work ethic
review_advice_mgmt: Hire people because they work hard and would help your company, not solely because they are "hot"

review_pros: You get discounts on the clothes and essentially it is a very easy job. You literally just stand in the dark folding clothes and greeting people and occasionally working on the till. You get to chat to the other employees whilst the managers aren't around.
review_cons: The same music is played every day, it stinks of the perfume and you could be left on the same station for all 4 hours of your shift

review_title: Good for a day job but terrible company culture
review_pros: Decent people to work with, no prior experience needed
review_cons: Managers micro-manage employees, many routines and phrases hammered into your head
review_advice_mgmt: Make the employees under you like you.

review_pros: Flexible hours, good discount, nice employees
review_cons: Have to wear the clothes to get scheduled, loud music, values tidiness over customer service, high turnover

review_title: worst place to start a career; they'll suck your soul out of you in the 1st 6 months
review_pros: they manage to trick awesome people into taking the job
review_cons:
all the awesome people get fed up and leave
upper management is rude and mean
no vision; no conviction behind strategy -> always chasing and changing plans, which makes for awful hours (8-7, no lunch break) and repetitive work
review_advice_mgmt: abide by the "core values" you set for the company - yeah, you hire "nice, smart, optimistic people", then make no effort to keep them around. and diva free zone?! give me a break...Mike (CEO) is the biggest diva of them all. and you better believe that trickles down

review_pros: employee discounts, coworkers, easy task
review_cons: minimum wage, not very knowledgeable managers
review_advice_mgmt: train your managers better

review_pros: Really laid-back environment, easy, flexible schedule, decent high school job/first job, always hiring
review_cons: The pay, managers/DMs who take their job too seriously, look policy

review_title: Arrogant, understaffed and very short-sighted company.
review_pros: Energetic and young vibe, amazing cafe, good benefits, beautiful home office campus. A place where you are pushed to do more and expand what you are capable of doing.
review_cons:
There're is such an arrogance to this company from top to bottom. You must buy in to it to have success there but it really isn't based on much if you look at the performance and press over the past 5 years or so.

Management is paid well and increasingly embraced politics over substance because that approach is rewarded, thus protecting their jobs.

Expect to work a lot; very long hours (even if it's just because that looks good), very high workload with tight timelines, at home, weekends, etc. but do not expect to be rewarded for it. It is rare to find a management chain who will acknowledge this level of commitment; usually you will only hear a lot of negative feedback if you are slipping.

There is absolutely zero long term vision for this company. More stores in Asia and more online sales...wow...genius! Same crappy, too small clothes and flip flops marketed using under-clothed models and sex that no one really reacts to anymore.
review_advice_mgmt: Grow a pair, support the hard hard work of those who give so much effort and time. Actually practice the transparency you preach and do not encourage CYA behaviors and politics.

review_title: Relaxed and fun, if you fit in
review_pros: Relaxed, no responsibilities, easy, can be fun, half off clothes
review_cons: boring, low pay (with no raises)

review_pros:
Free clothes - best perk
Trendy job - it seems soooo
Friendly colleagues - due to 'stringent' interview
review_cons:
Managers - some of them simply pretend to be nice.....that's the working world uh,
Shift issues - forced to take up weekends or face termination
review_advice_mgmt: Even the managers themselves are unhappy.....and i know the CEO needs to boost sales now

review_pros: Hot co-workers, very easy job, good job for college students
review_cons: Boring at times, compensation could be better
review_advice_mgmt: Stop putting the logo on every piece of clothing

review_title: Considering they require a bachelor's degree they severely underpay.
review_pros: Good benefits and sometimes entertaining
review_cons: Hours especially during the holidays
review_advice_mgmt: Be more creative

review_pros:
- Easy
- Fun
- Customers are polite
- Discounts on clothes
review_cons: - Low Pay, hard to get a lot of hours

review_pros: there was nothing good about this job.
review_cons: Short hours standing all day, while feet are killing you.
review_advice_mgmt: Be more considerate to your emplyees

review_pros: flexible hours of operations and schedule changing
review_cons: low pay, night shifts, work

review_title: Mediocre job experience as expected, mostly due to the environment (lighting, smell, music, hollisters target consumers)
review_pros: A lot of the clothes that don't sell get put in the back at extremely low prices after a new season, I was able to buy a couple pieces of clothing for very cheap prices. The shifts are short and there are a lot of people working so they can be very flexible with your schedule. If you get along well with your co-workers, working
review_cons: There is a lot of standing and never any sitting. The teenager girls that come in can be very difficult to deal with. Overweight people have gotten upset over lack of larger sizes. The smell and having to spritz the signature cologne every so often gave me a headache along with the one hour repeating soundtrack.

review_title: Great place to work! Flexible hours and awesome managers.
review_pros: Awesome place to work. Smells good, nice music, cool people, great clothes, and pretty fair discounts.
review_cons: The music could be a little bit better. It's a company for young people, therefore young and fist-pumping  music should be played.
review_advice_mgmt: Maybe add some recent music to the playlist.

review_title: This place is pretty fun to work at for college student who needs a flexible schedule with a small flow of cash.
review_pros: You work with people just like you by age, interests. etc.  EASIEST JOB YOU'LL EVER HAVE!
review_cons: Minimum wage. Minimum  wage. Minimum wage.

review_title: Fun, aspiration, complete waste of time and energy.
review_pros:
The people at the A&F store where I served as an MIT (Assistant-Manager-in-Training) were the best part of the experience. The District Manager, my fellow AMs, and the Associates were fun, cool, and great people to work with.
For a college grad whose priority is a steady job with a career ladder and good benefits, A&F is a good choice for you. Granted, this assumes you're ok making $14 an hour and having no time or energy for a social life due to ridiculous overtime they don't tell you about or pay your for. But, if you work hard and stay with the company for probably 5 years, you can work your way up to District Manager, which offers good pay and great benefits.
review_cons:
1. $14.00/hour is not acceptable for college graduates, given the amount of work and responsibility required.
2. The work environment is INCREDIBLY, deliberately stressful, between the incessant loud music and the omnipresent fragrances. However, this would be fine if we weren't instructed to be stressed out and to keep our associates stressed out. They literally told us that we should be dissatisfied with our performance and that we should be stressed if we were doing our jobs properly.
3. There is zero meaning attached to this job. The vast majority of your time is spent focusing on anal-retentive details that are utterly irrelevant. You literally measure piles of clothes with a ruler to make sure they line up to the centimeter. You spend a significant portion of your time doing things that make no difference.
4. Store Managers are taught to be manipulative. They do this a little bit to the assistant managers, but primarily to the Associates. They manipulate them into working extra hours, coming in on off days, etc. when the Associates do not want to and feel pushed into it.
review_advice_mgmt: Start caring about your people and your sales more than the exact measurement of stacks of clothes.

review_title: Great place to work. . . if you're attractive.
review_pros: A&F is fun, always exciting, and the people you meet are great.  This is a great place to work if you're attractive and are willing to buy their clothes.
review_cons: The pay is minimum wage, the customers are often really demanding, and you're almost always understaffed.  The turnover rate his very high and the number of hours you get varies wildly (and is totally biased).  You are also required to buy the clothes (not legally, but if you don't, you don't get hours).
review_advice_mgmt: Need more hours per store!  Also you should have some incentivized structure.

review_title: Not a good place to work.
review_pros: Get to me some nice people.
review_cons: The lack of leadership, upper management doesn't give enough employee hours to successfully run the stores, theft is easier at A&F stores, and turnover rate is horrible.

review_title: Exhilarating highs and the lowest lows, sometimes in the same day.
review_pros: The people you can meet are amongst the most friendliest, inspiring, and high performing individuals you could find. Often, managers are results driven and can push you to perform at your absolute highest.
review_cons: The work/life balance can be very frustrating and the pay is on the low side for the expectations the company has. Dealing with awful customers is very difficult day in and day out.
review_advice_mgmt: Please be more competitive with your pay and provide some sort of outlet for high performing managers that are getting overworked and burnt out.

review_title: can be good a good intro job for business majors, but don't stay long.
review_pros: good for quick management experience
review_cons: Entire business model based on internal politics.

review_pros: Great opportunity for recent college grads, as well as a great opportunity for advancement within the company.
review_cons: Very strict standard and high expectations and not enough time to complete tasks.

review_pros: - You can schedule your shifts to work with your friends.
review_cons: - Hard to find shifts and pay is terrible
review_advice_mgmt: - Management should not hire so much, makes it difficult for older employees to schedule work opportunities.

review_pros: Great Discounts, flexible hours, fun enviornment, new styles
review_cons: pay is too low, unfriendly upper management, high theft

review_title: Part of the Impact replenishment team
review_pros: Meeting really cool, good looking fun people ; fun atmosphere ; not very hard ; getting to dress casually and comfortably.
review_cons: The company is not moving forward when it comes to fashion ; some jobs such as shipment are awful ; you may work a lot harder than other people around you who are getting paid the exact same ; can't move up in the company unless you have a 4 year college degree

review_pros: Great experience for learning how to replenish merchandise on the floor while maintaining an organized stock room. You meet a lot of great people in a diverse atmosphere. This is a great job to get retail experience in, they teach you how to meet customers needs and keep the flow merchandise moving onto the sales floor.
review_cons: There are many cons working at Abercrombie. You put a lot of effort and time into this job and don't receive much recognition for it. The pay is awful and you end up working crazy hours, many times after midnight. You can complain all you want about how awful you are treated and how it sometimes feels like slave labor, yet the upper management doesn't care because they know there are plenty of more people out there that want to work for this brand, well at least think they want to work here.
review_advice_mgmt: Take time to appreciate your staff. From the outside everyone wants to work for this company but once you're in everyone hates. Make it an environment everyone wants to work in.

review_title: Was an Assistant Manager here for a little over a year and had a horrible experience.
review_pros: Get to go recruiting and depending on the store you work in, the other people you work with might be fun.
review_cons: Pay isn't equivalent to the amount of work you might be doing.
review_advice_mgmt: If you aren't okay with obvious internal politics, this isn't the company for you.

review_pros: Learned the ins and outs of retail management. Was a good place to start a retail career. Nice people.
review_cons: Had to work over night shifts sometimes during floor sets. If you have a manger that knows what they are doing then you should be OK otherwise its going to be a late night.

review_title: It was a great company to work for but the pay was terrible.
review_pros: You work with amazing people, i like the clothes at the time.
review_cons: You don't make very much, retail hours are tough for long sustained periods of time.

review_title: Most boring job I've ever had
review_pros: very flexible with shifts and workers are friendly
review_cons: only make minimum wage (7.25/hr)
review_advice_mgmt: give employees the option to move up in the company

review_pros: Great people, great environment and awesome opportunity for young adults to start in the workforce.
review_cons: Bonuses would be nice to have

review_title: Rocky ladder on the way up
review_pros: High turnover opens alot of positions ahead of you
review_cons: Most of the retail workers are young and immature

review_pros: Flexible hours, coworkers are nice.
review_cons: Pay, hours and rude customers.

review_title: Abercrombie and Fitch provides a laid back experience for people busy with school, but the ambience is terrible.
review_pros: Friendly coworkers, friendly managers, an okay discount on clothing. Good hours, can pull 4 hour shifts once a week if you wanted to.
review_cons: The smell of the store will get to your head. Boring work throughout, pay is minimal, and standards are incredibly difficult to reach and maintain. No training, other than watching a 4 minute video
review_advice_mgmt: Don't overwork and underpay. Impact team members do much, much more work than models, yet still receive the same pay.

review_pros: Easy work, discounts on clothes was awesome
review_cons: Greeting was the worst! Just standing there, waiting for time to pass by was brutal. Also, didn't like how I was not allowed to wear any make-up or any nail polish.

review_pros: Flexible hours, managers are cool, goos starting job if you're in high school or college and need extra cash. Learned about retail and its disadvantages.
review_cons: Horrible hours, rude customers, horrible pay, strict dress code. Hardly give any raises, and they can also take them away.
review_advice_mgmt: Dont be such a stickler on the dress code! Its says in our contract that we signed that we have to be in the current look policy and at the bottom it says we dont have to but clothes from there.

review_pros: you get paid that's it
review_cons: everything, you only get promoted if you look good
review_advice_mgmt: you suck

review_pros: had a positive response just after the interview
review_cons: look is most important on your competence; managed by young people who don't have any experience,transportation fee are not paid; difficulty to have your wished shift so you can hardly combine with another part time job.
review_advice_mgmt: hire people on their competence not only their look or origin ( in Japan all the managers were mix japanese, most of time american japanese) DIVERSITY!!

review_title: Good for first job in retail
review_pros: It is good for getting retail experience if you have never worked in retail before. You get to learn all about customer service and how to work the POS systems. If your shy or uncomfortable with walking up to people it can help you become more comfortable with that. You get a 30% discount but only on full priced clothing that isn't already at least 30% off.
review_cons: You'll only get hired if you have the "look" the company wants. They give no hours and unobtainable time expectations. Most of the time during floor sets and updates you're there all day long trying to get it finished. Sometimes managers don't give you overtime, they just put the hours you  worked over on the next weeks time card. They also hire people off of looks and not work experience so many people don't work hard, don't show up for work on time, or just quit without notice. Half the time the shame people reapply and get hired again like nothing ever happened. Management plays favorites a lot.
review_advice_mgmt: Start hiring people who fit the job, not the look.

review_pros: Great people, Friendly atmosphere, good and steady customers. Only good for a first-time job. If you are looking to get hired here, it is pretty easy.

review_advice_mgmt: Place people on the schedule to have equal hours.

review_title:
Senior district manager(2007-2013)
Worked for Abercrombie from 2005-2013
Manager in training - senior district manager
review_pros: Working with great looking cool people. It's more of a place to work to make friends to party with out side the job. The vaca/ healthcare benefits are good compared to others in the retail industry.
review_cons:
What the CEO says goes. CEO Mike Jefferies micro manages this whole  company. When mike comes to visit a store in the field a total make over is done to the store he is visiting( costing a ton of payroll hours). Mike has never seen how a real store runs and operates. I'm talking fake workers are gathered from local modeling agencies and the entire store gets refolded every night before he comes. If only CEO mike knew what a store really looked like with the limited payroll hours they are budgeted to use and how bad the part time staff is when they get paid $8 an hour but have to buy very expensive outfits to wear to work. Often workers are sent home because they can't afford to buy the clothes to wear and you have to in order to get scheduled shifts. 

Managers are salaried employes who work well over 50 hours a week( and don't get good pay for it). 

If you want to work with great looking, cool, fun people this is your dream job. If you like to get paid fairly for the long hours and hard work you put into the job this is not the place.
review_advice_mgmt:
Advice to senior mgmt:
Let the CEO  see what a real store runs like daily not after you dump a ton of payroll hours into it to fix the issues.

Stop requiring a 4 year degree to work for $30,000 as a retail manager. 

Stop promoting managers based on how great looking they are instead of how smart and hard working they are, promote based off results.

review_pros: Great looking Coworkers, easy interview
review_cons: The job and it's low pay

review_title: Abercrombie & Fitch was fun but boring

review_cons: Lots of tedius work which can be stressful. Dealing with customers who steal is a huge pain.

The CEO was a big hinderance in progress because one minute he would love something, and the next minute he'd hate it and you would be left with nothing and having to somehow find the drive to even attempt redoing it. It wasn't very appreciated work. Also, it was in Ohio. Not the most exciting destination.
review_advice_mgmt: Realize that design takes time. It's not like we can just type in a formula and voila! Perfect Design!

review_title: Aspirational? More like apathetic! Diversity and inclusion? Pull the other one!
review_pros:
A&F provides the opportunity to tie down a graduate job in management on degree graduation. Securing a position at one of the top brands in retail provides a strong base for career development. Opening a new store with A&F is a great experience in management, particularly when dealing with foreign contracts and a variety of languages around the site.
The facile interview process is both a pro and a con due to questionable recruitment policies.
review_cons:
The culture of diversity and inclusion at A&F tops off a farcical, and frankly laughable, attempt at shrouding their reputed controversial recruiting policies. Whilst fitting the criteria may ensure a fast-track through the interview process, this often leads to under-qualified managers and trivial, mundane daily tasks as a result of having to train everyone on an equal level.
The working hours & time-off policies are antisocial, with a working week invariably including at least one 5am start and one 10.30pm finish. A review of working hours resulting in a weekly rota would be beneficial.
The target-based assessment is often flawed in countries outside the US due to disrespect for foreign culture and trends. Little research into national holidays, buying trends and customs leads to daily/weekly targets being often miscalculated, meaning targets are often vastly incongruous with actual business.
The lack of challenge is directly related to the rigid management structure. A prohibition on use of initiative leads to stagnant progress and a lack of motivation.
A huge employee turnover is a result of poor micro-management and the implication of strict rules that do not necessarily translate from the US system.
Incredulous outsourcing of store maintenance; with European technicians coming solely from the UK, and standard parts ordered exclusively from the US, the response time, and general severity of common problems is exacerbated. 
Lack of trust and respect towards non-English speakers goes directly against the A&F policy of diversity and inclusion. The attitude of various members of senior management is questionable in the slightest.
review_advice_mgmt:
Allow managers to use some initiative... 
Review working hours - why not allocate the early AM starts and closing shifts on a weekly basis, to allow managers to have a slightly more regular sleeping pattern. 
Drop the anally-retentive 'standards' in place of some basic employee respect. If the same amount of time and energy went into ensuring the happiness and professional development of staff, the workplace would be far more pleasant and, in turn, reflect positively on the 'customer experience'; a value at the forefront of the A&F brand. In place of this, the current uninterested, sour and superficial way of dealing with employees is invariably reflected throughout the store. Senior management needs to seriously reconsider its policy of recruiting 'aspirational' managers... or perhaps review their idea of 'aspiration'.

review_title: Not suitable for someone looking for a career

review_cons: Very low pay (even by retail standards), minimal opportunity for advancement, repetitive tasks, irresponsible coworkers. All the managers' tasks print out in the morning and you just follow the paperwork step-by-step.

review_title: Great first job for high school students, or part-time college students
review_pros:
- Laid back, fun work environment
- Super flexible scheduling (you can request off as much as you want as long as its two weeks in advance)
- Always tons of other employees if you need a shift covered
- Get to make a lot of friends generally in the same age range as you
- You get asked to do company casting calls if they like your "look"
- 50% discount for five items of your choice every new season
- If you have a good management team, you will have an awesome experience in the company
- Get more hours based on performance. I would get anywhere from 30-40 hours a week because I actually cared about the work and folded well
review_cons:
- Absolutely no room for advancement unless you have a bachelors degree
- The general discount is pretty awful for how expensive the clothes are, unless its in a specific time frame when they give you a large discount
- HAVE to wear their clothes. They say you don't, but they'd certainly rather schedule people over you who will wear the clothes if you don't
- No visible piercings (except ear lobe), tattoos, or nail polish
- Aren't very picky when they hire MITs, leading to a lot of bad managers circulating in the company
- VERY superficial. Some store locations keep it pretty hidden but others will openly talk about attractiveness levels of co-workers and other employees around you
review_advice_mgmt: Provide more opportunity for advancement for current employees who have worked with the company for 3+ years. It's a little demotivating when a manager in training gets hired over you just because they have a bachelors degree that has absolutely nothing to do with retail/business.

review_title: Unless your in high school, don't waste your time.
review_pros: It's a great job for high school students, because they have very flexible hours and as long as your confident and can fold, you'll do great. Its a super easy job. They also give you a 50% discount once a month and typically the staff tend to be very friendly.
review_cons: They don't pay that much, so if your not in high school it's not really worth it. Plus the fact that they don't really have adult sized clothing... The managers also come off as rude at times and don't seem to care about their employees time at all.

review_title: A good start for your first job.
review_pros: The co-workers and managers were all really nice and outgoing. The work is easy, all you do is fold clothes, assist customers, occasionally work the cash register. If the managers really think your good looking, than they will ask you to take pictures with a few other employees to send it to corporate for a model casting. I'll tell you one thing, this job gets boring really quick.
review_cons: The managers and a few co-workers can be pretty shallow. Even if you work there, you are still be ranked according to your looks from best to mediocre. The better looking you are, the more they'll schedule you to work, and the more you'll come in on the weekends. At my store, when they were cutting down hours, they scheduled me to come in 5 out of 7 days a week, while on the other hand, another girl had no scheduled hours to work for 4 weeks. I honestly didn't even ask for any hours, since I was still in school I only wanted to work 1 or 2 days a week, while the other employee on the other hand was always available. She eventually just quit.
review_advice_mgmt: I had a good really store manager, but for some reason he was fired because your general manager didn't like him. Well good job doing that because after he got fired, me and atleast ten other employees quit too. If you're ever wondering why your always looking for store managers its probably because you pay them too low, and the reason why your stuck with bad store managers is because you accept anyone who is willing to accept such a low pay. Heres another advice, have surveillance cameras in the back of the store so people would stop shop lifting. You loose so much money on clothes and fragrance from shoplifter, so why not just invest that money in something more resourceful.

review_pros:
great atmosphere 
Relaxed managers 
easy to do
review_cons:
poor hours 
under payed

review_title: As a manager, I am fairly independent, highly trusted, and have a fun work environment.
review_pros:
Fun outgoing people in general.
Laid back environment and attire.
Managerial experience - learn lots about running a business, become store manager in just over a year! Raises accompanied with yearly reviews.
Requires a bachelor for management, not retail experience, so convenient for fresh out of college.
10 week manager-in-training program envelops you into the program.
Soft entrance into the full-time work force, fun job for young grads.
LOVE: the A&F cultures and values. Diversity. Inclusion. We-oriented. Collaborative. Trustworthy. The list goes on but it has some of the best and people are treated quite well within the company. 
I relish the amount of responsibility and trust given to me from the get-go as a manager. LOVE THAT PART and think it rare in starter jobs.
BEST Health Insurance medical/dental/vision of my life. Doctors visits are $20, meds are $5.
Internal promotions, fair amount of mobility.
review_cons:
Less pay than other retailers (because retail experience is not required). (However a job is a job).
Strong fragrance to work with longterm.
Loud music to work with longterm.
Some recent graduates as young managers do not care about quality of work as much as others or are not as ambitious - it is a downer to work with anyone like this.
Fair turnover.
Both these last two however make your job mobility prospects better if you stay - as long as you are on the right track and putting in reasonable effort.
review_advice_mgmt:
Pay more to give the best talent incentive to stay.
Turn the fragrance and music down.
Don't put so many graphics on the clothing, make it more classic and diversify styles and colors, use less primary. Make the logo small and blended. I LOVE pieces like this like gorgeous off-the-shoulder knit sweaters, but dislike too many graphics and too many polos in orange and green. 
More boutique style and less standardized.

review_pros: Most of the model and impact crews were really fun to work with and easy to get along with both in and out of the work environment. The labor was never too intensive. I was personally able to make a connection with my immediate management to gain the trust to get things done on my own and was often asked to lead others. Schedules were also really flexible.
review_cons: Very low pay with no other incentives besides a discount which still required you to use your entire paycheck in order to buy one outfit. The fact that a Bachelors Degree is required in order to be a store manager is obsurd.
review_advice_mgmt: Make the Store Manager or at least the Assistant Manager position available to those with an Associates Degree. Those with Bachelors Degree have such high hopes of landing the dream job making a lot of money and we all know that your store managers and their assistants do not make a lot of money at all. So they tend not to perform as well since they are not being paid as expected. But those with their Associates are usually of the working class and are okay with lower wages because they are commonly still working their ways through school, so they understand they have to put in hard work to earn little now but potentially more later.

review_pros: Relaxed environment, pretty easy job
review_cons: Terrible management, unfair pay, would rather work in the fast food industry.
review_advice_mgmt: Increase wages

review_title: not a bad company to work for
review_pros: the pro would be attractive co-workers
review_cons: the con is that the company has image problems
review_advice_mgmt: hire more people who care about the job

review_pros: The people are great. You have the opportunity to foster relationships with a diverse group.
review_cons: Company standards (visual, operational, recruiting) are overwhelming. Managers are overworked- they do everything but cut and sew the merchandise. Pay is not competitve
review_advice_mgmt: Adopt a less intricate business model and increase compensation.

review_pros: Very little expected of you.. I worked at both Hollister and Aberombie, Hollister as a model, abercrombie as impact. Very little pros to this job, pretty much just the discount.
review_cons:
Cliques, feels like youre back in high school
Very immature management 
Little to no hours
Drama
Impact team members are treated as lesser, in my opinon after experiencing both jobs

review_pros: it is fast paced environment
review_cons: it is a stressful job with not much upward grwoth

review_pros: fun challenge full of learning personal growth
review_cons: too intense low salary not much  benefits no promotion work over time
review_advice_mgmt: promotion promotion salary salary

review_pros: Easy job, flexible schedule. Introductory experience for retail is a plus. Training was short, and simple.
review_cons: Had to purchase a ton of Abercrombie clothing on no salary, fellow workers were unwelcoming and catty. The culture of Abercrombie as a brand is on the decline, as it is averse to change, and has sexist undertones.

review_pros: Did not have to do much work and when I did it was not hard
review_cons: You don't get that many shifts. There's always new people every day

review_pros: Relaxed environment, nice clothes/discount, easy (so long as you aren't dumb), room for growth, competitive pay, travel opportunities.
review_cons: Poor management, promotions can be a little political, unprofessional, high stress, no overtime pay and you'll likely work more than 40 hours a week.
review_advice_mgmt: No one is held accountable for their work, which means the few hard workers do everything in the store with little to no recognition.

review_title: Cliche,Stuckup for no reason,dividers in social habits.
review_pros: Dude it's abercrombie.the girls.Nice outfits on the ladies,cannot really say anything else it is too cliche and horrible
review_cons: People think they are better than you,no hours to work,36 dollar paycheck,rude people,theft is high management looks like ken and Barbie,when they are horrible,terrible public image,immoral,folding clothes the pay.Music plays over and over smells terrible.
review_advice_mgmt: Give people more hours so the can make a decent living,make a jigglypuff store females also a wigglytuff store males so the (bigger)crowd will not complain about a xxxxl shirts shorts joking,seriously that place is terrible you have to be shallow to wear abercrombie hollister.

review_pros: There is absolutely nothing good to say about this company. Everyone that works there is conceited and rude to one another.
review_cons:
Although it doesn't say it in the employment contract, you are forced to buy their (overpriced) clothes. If you don't you don't get out on the schedule. 

Extremely cliquey. 

Upper management discriminates based on looks, personality, etc. 

We are verbally told to not recruit the "ugly people".
review_advice_mgmt: Revise your company policy so other brand doesn't continue to crash and burn.

review_pros: Its a great company to work for as in they teach you a lot of valuable and interesting things. And you get to meet a lot of fun and like minded people. I've never had a job where I've made so many friends and so quickly.
review_cons: The work can be a little much sometimes. The company is cutting back and still expecting the namesake stores to be perfect at all times.
review_advice_mgmt: Advice to the top level guys at Home Office: if you're going to pay so little, start treating us a little better. Or pay us more to justify what you're expecting out of us
